xiiii generaciōs frō dauid vnto ye trāſmigraciō babilon xiiii generaciōs frō trāſmigraciō babilō vnto chriſt xiiii generaciōs ✚ truly luc • 1· b ye generaciō chriſt wyſe whā mary ye mother ieſu ſpouſed vnto ioſeph afore came together ſhe foūde wt chyld thorowe ye holy gooſt ſeyng ioſeph hyr huſbāde ryghteous wolde bryng ſhame mynded put awaye preuely whyle thus thought ✚ behold angell ye lorde appeared vnto hym ſlepes ſayeng ioſephl • ce • • thou ſonne dauid feare yu take mary thy wife ye borne holy gooſt ſhall truly brynge forth ſōne • ctu 4 • pilip 2 yu ſhalte cal hys name ieſus ſhal ſaue people frō theyr ſynnes ⊢ al thys done yt myght fulfylled ſpokē ye lord ye prophete eſay ſayenge eſay 7 c behold virgin ſhalbe wt chyld ſhal bryng forth ſōne hys name ſhalbe called emanuel whyche interpreted god wt v ⊢ ioſeph truly aryſynge ſlepe dyd angell lorde cōmaunded hym toke hys wyſe knewe tyl ſhe luc 2 • brought forth hyr fyrſtborne ſōne called hys name ieſus ii chapter ✚ whan ieſus therfore borne bethleē iewry dayes herode kynge beholde ther came wyſe men eaſt ieruſalem ſayenge borne kynge iewes haue ſene hys ſtarre eaſt come worſhippe hym herode kynge hearyng vexed al ieruſalem wyth gatherynge together prince preſtes ſcrybes people enquired thē chriſt ſhulde borne ſayd vnto hym bethleem iewrye ſo wrytten prophete mich 5 thou bethleem lande iewry art leaſt amonge prince iewry ioh 7 ye ſhal ther come forth captayn whych ſhal gouerne people iſrael herode wyſe mē beynge preuely called learned diligently tyme ye ſtarre appeared vnto thē ſendynge vnto bethleem ſayd go ye inquire diligently chyld whā ye haue foūde brynge worde agayne alſo cōmynge maye worſhippe hym whych whan hadde herde kynge wente theyr waye behold ſtarre ſene eaſt wente tyl cōmyng ſtode aboue ye chyld truly ſeynge ſtarre ioyed wyth exceadynge great gladneſſe entrynge houſe founde chylde wyth mary hys mother pſal 71 b eſa 60 fallynge downe flat worſhipped hym whan opened theyr treaſures offered vnto hym gyftes golde frankyncēce myrre anſwere beynge receaued ſlepes ſhulde go agayne vnto herode returned theyr owne contry another waye ⊢ whych whan departed ✚ angell lorde appeared vnto ioſeph ſlepes ſayenge aryſe take chylde hys mother exodi 4 flye egipte tyll brynge ye worde wyll come paſſe herode ſhal ſeke chylde deſtroye hym whyche ryſynge vp toke chylde hys mother nyght departed egipte vntyll death herode myght fulfylled whych ſpoken lorde ye prophet ſayenge num 24 c oz • e 11 egipt haue called ſōne herode ſeynge mocked ye wyſe men exceadynge wroth ſendyng forth flewe al chyldrē yt bethleem al coaſtes therof age two yeare vnder accordynge ye tyme yt ſought ye wyſe men thā fulfylled ſpokē ieremy prophete ſayenge iere 31 c rama ther voyce herde wepynge greate howlynge rachel bewaylynge hyr chylderen wolde comforted becauſe ⊢ ✚ whan herode dead beholde angell lorde appeared ſlepes vnto ioſeph egipte ſayenge aryſe take chylde hys momother go lande iſrael dead ſoughte lyfe chylde whych ryſyng vp toke chylde hys mother came lande iſrael hearynge ye archelaus raygned iewry ſteade herode hys father beynge admoniſhed ſlepes departed coaſtes galile commynge dwelt cytie whych called nazareth ye myght fulfylled whych ſpokē ye prophetes iude 13 b ſhalbe called nazarite ⊢ iii chapter ✚ thoſe dayes marci 1 luce 3 ioh 3 came ihō baptiſt preachynge wylderneſſe iewry ſayeng math 4 b ye penaūce kyngdom heauēs drawen nye ioh 1 b thys whome ſpoken eſay prophet ſayenge eſay 40 voyce cryer wylderneſſe prepare ye way ye lord make hys pathes ſtrayght 4 reg 1 bbut ihon hymſelfe garmēt camel heer lethrē gyrdell aboute hys loynes hys meate locuſtes wylde hony wente forth vnto hym ieruſalē al iewry contry iordane baptyſed hym iordane cō feſſyng theyr ſynnes luce 3 b ſeyng many ye phariſes saduces cō myng baptyme ſaid vnto thē ye generaciō viper certified flye frō ye wrath come therfor worthy frute penaūce thynke ye ſaye wtin ſelues haue father abrahā ſaye vnto god able theſe ſtones rayſe vp chyldrē vnto abrahā euen put ye roote ye tree math 7 b luce 3 c euery tre therfore yeldeth good frute ſhalbe hewē downe caſt fyre marci 1 luce 3 c ioh 1 c verely baptiſe water vnto penaūce ſhall come ſtronger whoſe ſhues able beare ſhall baptyſe ye holy gooſt fyre luce 3 c whoſe fanne hys hande ſhall clenſe hys floore gather ye wheate hys barne chaffe ſhall burne vnquēcheable fyre ⊢ ✚ marci 1 cam ieſus galile vnto iordane ihō myght baptyſed hym ihon forbad ſayeng ioh 13 ought baptyſed cōmeſt thou vnto ieſus anſwerynge ſayd vnto hym suffre thus becommeth v fulfyll ryghteouſneſſe let hym marci 1 luce 3 c ioh 1 eſay 42 ieſus verely beynge baptyſed came vp immediatly water behold heauēs opened vnto hym ſawe ye ſprete god deſcendynge doue cōmynge vpō hym beholde voyce frō heauen ſayeng math 17 luce 9 • petri 1 thys welbeloued ſōne whō appleaſed ⊢ iiii chapter ✚ marci 1 b luce 4 ieſus led ſprete wylderneſſe myght tempted deuell whā faſted fourty dayes fourty nyghtes afterwarde hungred tempter approchynge nye ſayd vnto hym yf thou ſonne god ſay worde yt theſe ſtones may made bread whych anſweryng ſayd wryttē deute 8 sapi 16 c mā lyueth bread euery worde procedeth mouth god thā deuell toke hym vp holy cytie ſet hym vpon pynacle temple ſayeth vnto hym yf thou ye ſōne god caſt thyſelfe downewarde wryttē pſal 90 • hath geuē hys angel charge cōcernynge ſhall take theyr hā de leſt thou hurt thy foote agaynſt ſtone ieſus ſayd vnto agayn wryttē deute 6 c thou ſhalt tēpte lorde thy god agayne ye deuel toke hym vp exceadyng hye mountayne ſhewed hym ye kyngdomes worlde glorye ſayeth vnto hym theſe wyll geue vnto yf thou fallinge downe wylt worſhippe thā ſayeth ieſus vnto hym auoyd satan wrytten deute 6 c 1 reg 7 thou ſhalt worſhip ye lorde thy god hym ſhalt thou ſerue thā ye deuel left beholde marci 1 b angel came miniſtred vnto hym ⊢ ✚ marci 1 b luce 4 whan ieſus herde yt ihou taken departed galile luce 4 dand cytie nazareth beyng left came dwelt caphernaū cytie ſee coaſt border zabulō nepthalim ye myght fulfylled whych ſpokē eſay ye prophete eſay 9 lāde zabulō lāde nepthalim ye way ſee beyonde iordane galile heythē people ſat darkeneſſe ſaw great light ſat region ſhadow death euen vnto ye lyght ryſen vp ⊢ marci 1 b tyme forth began ieſus preach ſaye math 3 ye penaunce kyngdom heauens drawen nye ✚ marci 1 b luce 5 ieſus walkynge ſee galile ſawe two brother simon whyche called peter andrewe hys brother caſtynge net ſee fyſhers ſayde vnto come ye wyll make become iere 16 c ezec 47 b fyſhers men immediatly nettes beyng left followed hym goynge forth thence▪ ſaw two brethrē iames zebede ihō hys brother ſhip wt zebede theyr father mendynge theyr nettes called math 19 luce 5 b immediatly ye nettes father beynge left followed hym ⊢ ✚ marci 1 • ieſus went aboute galile teachynge theyr ſynagoges preachynge goſpell kyngdome healynge euery diſeaſe euery infirmite people fame hym wente siria preſented vnto hym ſuch vexed wyth ſun • rye diſeaſes taken wyth malady deuels ſuche lunatyke mē diſeaſed palſye healed thē marci 3 luce 6 b • followed greate multytudes galile ten cyties ieruſalem iewry beyonde iordane v chapter ✚ ieſus ſeynge people wente vp mountayne whan ſet diſciples came vnto hym openyng mouth taught ſayenge luce 6 c bleſſed poore ſprete theyrs kyngdome heauens bleſſed meke ſhall poſſeſſe earth eſai 61 60 b bleſſed mourne ſhalbe cōforted iere 31 bleſſed honger thyrſt ryghteouſneſſe ſhalbe ſatiſfied bleſſed mercyfull ſhall optayne mercy bleſſed cleane harte ſhall ſe god bleſſed ye peacemaker ſhalbe called chyldren god bleſſed ſuffre perſecucion righteouſneſſe ſake theyrs ye kyngdome heauens 1 petri 1 c 2 c 4 c bleſſed ye whan men ſhall ſpeake euell perſecute ſaye al euell agaynſte lyenge ſake actu 5 creioyce ye glad plenteous rewarde heauēs ſo perſecuted prophetes marci 9 e luce 14 ye ſalt ye earth yf ſalt vaniſhe away wherin ſhal ſalted▪ thēce forth good vnto nothing ye caſt trodē vnder mē ye lyght world citie ſet vpō hyl may hyd marc 4 b luce 8 b 11 cnether lyght cādle put vnder buſ • hell vpō candelſticke maye geue lyght vnto yt ye houſe math 6 1 petri 2 b let youre lyght ſhyne mē ye may ſe good workes glorifye youre father whiche heauens ye thynke come vndo lawe prophetes come vndo mat 1 c 2 c fulfyll verely ſaye vnto truthe luce 16 c eſay 40 tyll heauen earth paſſe ther ſhal one iote one title eſcape lawe tyll thynges done iaco 2 b ezech 18 b ſo therfore vndoeth one theſe leaſt commaū dementes teacheth men ſo ſhal called leaſt kyngdome heauens doeth teacheth ſhall called greate ye kyngdome heauens ⊢ ✚ ſaye vnto excepte ryghteouſneſſe plenteous thē ryghteouſneſſe scribe phariſes ye ſhal entre kingdome heauēs ye haue herde ſayde olde exod 20 c 21 b leuit 24 deut 5 cthou ſhalt kyll whoſo kylleth ſhalbe gylty iudgemente ſay vnto euery one whiche angrie wyth brother ſhalbe gyltye iudgement whoſo ſayeth hys brother rhaca ſhalbe gyltye councell whoſo ſayeth thou foole ſhalbe gyltye helles fyre iob 42 b malac 1 b yf thou offreſt therfore thy gyft vnto altare remembreſt thy brother hath ſomwhat agaynſt ye leaue thou thy gyft altare go fyrſte reconciled vnto thy brother thā commynge thou ſhalt offre thy preſent ⊢ ✚ prou 25 b luce 12 fbe thou agreable ſoone thyne aduerſary whyle thou art waye wyth hym leſt happely aduerſary deliuer ye iudge iudge delyuer officer thou caſt preſon verely ſaye vnto thou ſhalt go forth thence tyll thou paye vttemooſt farthynge ye haue herde ſayde thē old exodi 20 cthou ſhalt cōmitte lecherie ſaye vnto ecli 41 c iob 31 euery one loketh vpon woman luſt hath already committed lechery wyth hys harte deut 13 mar 9 cyf thy ryght eye ſklaunder plucke caſt ye expedient ye one thy membres periſhe thy body caſt hell fyre yf thy ryghthande ſklaunder cut caſt expedient one thy membres periſhe thy body caſt hel ⊢ ſayd deut 24 ſo euer putteth awaye hys wyfe let hym geue lettre diuorcement math 19 b marc 10 • luc 16 c ſaye vnto euery one putteth awaye wyfe cauſe fornicaciō except cauſeth cōmitte whordome maryeth whiche put awaye committeth aduoutrye ye haue herde agayne ſayde olde exodi 20 b leuit 19 c thou ſhalt forſweare thy ſelfe deu 10▪ ſhalt perfourme thyne othes vnto lord ſaye vnto iaco 5 cnot ſweare nether heauen 2 pa 6 f eſa 66 math 23 • trone god nether earth feteſtoole nother ieruſalē cytie great kynge nother ſhalt thou ſweare thy heade becauſe thou art able make one heer white black epheſi 4 • let cōmumunicacion yee yee nay nay loke theſe euel ye haue herde yt ſayde exodi 21 • leuit 24 deut 19 dan eye eye tooth tooth luc • c ſaye vnto reſiſt euel yf ony man ſmyte thy ryght cheke profre hym alſo vnto hym yt wyll pleate iudgemente take awaye thy cote hym leaue thou thy cloke alſo ſo euer wyl nedes haue myle go hym twayne alſo ſo axeth geue hym hym wold borowe turne thou away ✚ ye haue herde ſayd leuit 19 c thou ſhalt loue thy neghboure hate thyne enemye ſaye vnto loue youre enemyes rom 12 c good vnto thē haue hated praye alſo perſecute wronge ye maye ye chyldrē father ye heauēs deu 4 c cauſeth sonne ryſe vpon ye good euell rayneth vpon iuſte vniuſt luce 6 yf ye loue thoſe loue rewarde haue ye publicanes alſo yf ye ſalute youre brethrē onely ye heythen alſo leuit 19 ye therfore perfecte youre heauenly father alſo perfecte ⊢ vi chapter ✚ take ye hede leſt ye luc 11 ryghteouſneſſe men ſene el ſhall ye haue rewarde wyth youre father ye heauēs whā thou therfore doeſt almes blowe trompe lyke ypocricrites synagoges ſtretes maye prayſed men verely ſay vnto haue receaued theyr rewarde thou doynge almes let thy left hande knowe thy ryght hande doeth thyne almes maye ſecret thy father whiche ſe ſecrete ſhall recompenſe 3 reg 18 eſay 29 c luc 11 whan ye praye ye ſhal ypocrites loue praye ſtondynge ſynagoges corner ſtretes may ſene mē verely ſay vnto haue receaued theyr rewarde thou whan thou prayeſt 4 reg 4▪ actu 10 aentre thy chambre thy dore beynge ſhut praye thy father ſecrete thy father doth ſe ſecrete ſhal recōpenſe ye ⊢ eſa 1 bbut whan ye praye ſpeake much heythen thynke yt herde theyr much bablyng ye therfore lyke vnto thē rom 8 father knoweth nede ye haue afore ye axe hī thus therfore ſhal ye praye luc 11 father art heauēs halowed thy name let thy kyngdō come nye thy wyl done erth alſo heuē geue v daye bread ouer ſubſtaūce forgeue v dettes alſo forgeue detters lead v tētatiō delyuer v frō euel amē yf ye forgeue mē ſynnes heauēly father alſo ſhal forgeue treſpaſſes math 18 marc 11 cbut yf ye forgeue mē father ſhal forgeue treſpaſſes ✚ eſa 58 math 9 b whan ye faſt become ye ſad ypocrites diſfigure theyr face maye appeare faſtynge vnto men verely ſaye vnto haue deceaued theyr rewarde whan thou faſteſt anoynte thyne heade waſhe thy face thou ſeme faſtynge vnto men vnto thy father ſecrete thy father doth ſe ſecrete ſhall recompenſe eccli 29 b prou 23 iere 17 luc 12 gather treaſures vnto earth ye ruſt moth doth corruppe theues digge vp ſteale gather ye vnto treaſures heauē nother ruſt mothe doth corruppe theues dygge vp ſteale thy treaſure thy harte alſo ⊢ luce 11 cthe lyghte thy body thyne eye yf thyne eye ſyngle thy whole body ſhal ful lyght yf thyn eye wycked al thy whole body ſhalbe full darkneſſe yf lyght therfore darkneſſe howe greate ſhall theſame darkeneſſe ✚ luc 16 bno man maye ſerue two mayſters ether ſhall hate ye one loue el ſhall holde ſtyl one deſpyſe ye maye ſerue god mammon therfore ſaye vnto pſal 54 c luc 12 c 1 petri 5 abe ye carefull youre lyfe ye maye eate nother youre body ye may put lyfe thā meate body rayment beholde foules ayre ſowe nother reepe nother gather barnes youre heauenly father fedeth ye rather worth luce 12 c whych takynge thoughte maye adde one cubyte vnto hys ſtature ye carefull rayment conſydre lylyes felde howe growe laboure nother ſpynne ſay vnto nother salomō al hys glory clothed lyke one theſe yf god ſo clothe graſſe ye felde whyche daye tomorowe caſte fornace muche ye lytle fayth ye therfore carefull ſayeng ſhal eate ſhal drynke wherewythall ſhall clothed theſe thynges heythen ſeke father knoweth ye haue nede theſe thynges 3 reg 3 b seke ye therfore fyrſt kyngdome god ryghteouſneſſe therof theſe thynges ſhalbe miniſtred vnto ⊢ ye therfore carefull tomorowe tomorowe daye ſhalbe carefull ſelfe sufficient vnto daye hys trauayle vii chapter ✚ iudge luc • rom 2 • ye ſhall iudged condemne ye ſhal condemned iudgement ye iudge ye ſhall iudged marc 4 • wt meaſur ye meet ſhal meaſured vnto agayn luce 6 • ſeyſt thou moat thy brother eye ſeyſt beame thyne owne eye howe wylte thou ſay vnto thy brother brother ſuffre wyll caſt forth moat thyne eye beholde ther beame thyne owne eye prou 18 c thou ypocrite caſt forth beame fyrſte thyn owne eye ſhalt yu ſe caſt forthe moat thy brother eye pſal 1 • 6 geue ye holy vnto dogges nother caſt ye perles ſwyne left happely treade thē vnder theyre fete left dogges beynge turned teare iere 29 c ioh • 16 c axe ſhalbe geuen seke ye ſhal fynde knoc ſhalbe opened vnto euery one axeth receaueth ſeketh fyndeth hym knocketh ſhall opened luc • 11 b man yf ſonne ſhall axe bread wyll reach hym ſtone yf axe fiſh wyl reach hym ſerpēt yf ye therfore whan gene 6 ye euell geue youre chyldren good gyftes howe much ſhal youre father heauen geue good thynges vnto axe hym ecclī 31 b tob 4 c luc • 6 c thynges therfore ſo euer ye wyll men vnto ye euen ſo vnto thē alſo luce 1 • c thys lawe prophetes entre ye ye ſtrayte gate wyde gate brode waye yt leadeth vnto deſtruction many ther entre howe ſtrayte ye gate narowe waye leadeth vnto lyfe fewe ther yt fynde ⊢ ✚ deut 1 • 1 iohā 4 beware falſe prophetes come vnto ſhepes clothynges inwardly rauenynge wolues ye ſhall knowe thē theyr frutes luc • 6 • men gather grape thornes fygges thyſtles euen ſo euery good tre yeldeth good frutes euel tre yeldeth euell frutes math 12 good tre yelde euell frutes nother euell tre yeld good frutes iere 11 c math 3 luce 3 b euery tre yt yeldeth good frute ſhalbe hewen downe caſt fyre therfor theyr frutes ſhal ye knowe math 25 • luce • e 13 cnot euery one ſayeth vnto lorde lorde ſhall entre kyngdome heauēs yt doth wyl father heauens ſhall entre kyngdome heauēs ⊢ many ſhall ſaye vnto daye lord lorde actu 19 b haue prophecyed thy name marci 9 • caſt deuels thy name done great actes thy name thā ſhall knowlege vnto neuer knewe pſal 6 b math 25 dget hence fro ye worke iniquite luc 6 e rom 2 b euery one therfore heareth theſe wordes doth ſhalbe lykened vnto wyſe man buylt hys houſe vpō rocke rayne deſcended floudes came wyndes blewe ruſſhed houſe fell groūded vpon rocke euery one heareth theſe wordes iacob 2 b doth thē ſhalbe lyke vnto foolyſhe man buylte hys houſe vpon ſonde ezech 13 band rayne deſcended floudes came wyndes blewe ruſſhed houſe fell fall greate came paſſe marci 1 b luce 4 whan ieſus ended al theſe wordes people maruayled hys doctrine teachynge one hauynge authorite ſcribes phariſes viii chapter ✚ whan marci 4 luce 5 b ieſus hadde come downe mounte greate multitude followed hym beholde leper commynge worſhipped hym ſayenge lord yf thou wylt thou mayeſt clenſe ieſus ſtretchynge hande touched hym ſayenge wyll thou clenſed immediatly hys leproſy clēſed ieſus ſayd vnto hym se thou tell man leuit 14 go ſhewe thy ſelfe preſt offre thy gyfte whych moſes cōmaunded wytneſſe ⊢ ✚ luce 7 ioh 4 f cēturio captayne ouer hū dreth men whan entred capharnaū ❀ centurio prayenge hym ſayenge syr ſeruaunt lyeth ſycke palſye houſe euel vexed ieſus ſayd vnto hym wyll come heale hym centurion anſwerynge ſayd syr worthy thou ſhuldeſt entre vnder roofe pſal 106 • onely ſpeake thou wyth worde ſeruaūt ſhalbe healed alſo man ordeyned vnder authorite hauynge ſouldyers vnder ſaye thys man go goeth another come cōmeth ſeruaūt thys doth ieſus hearynge theſe wordes maruayled ſayd vnto yt followed verelye ſaye vnto haue foūde ſo great fayth iſrael ſaye vnto eſay 41 luce 13 c yt many ſhall come frō eaſt weſt ſhal ſyt wyth adrahā iſaac iacob kyngdome heauens chyldrē ye kyngdome ſhalbe caſt outwarde darkneſſe ſhall wepynge gnaſhyng teth ieſus ſayd vnto centurion go thy waye thou haſt beleued ſo vnto ye ſeruaūt healed frō houre ⊢ mar 1 c luce 4 whā ieſus come peter houſe ſawe hys mother lawe lyenge hauynge feuers touched hir hande feuers left ſhe aroſe miniſtred vnto marci 1 c luce 4 • whā euē come preſēted vnto hym many hauyng deuels ye word caſt ye ſpretes healed al ye diſeaſed yt myght fulfylled whych ſpokē eſay prophete ſayenge eſay 5 • 1 pet 2 c hath takē infirmity borne ſykneſſes ieſus ſeynge much people aboute hym cōmaūded ye diſciples go ouer arme ſee luce 9 f ſcrybe approchynge nye ſayde vnto hym maſter wyll followe ye whether ſo euer thou ſhalte go ieſus ſayeth vnto hym fox haue dēnes byrdes ayre neſtes ye ſōne mā hath wherto laye head luce 9 • another diſciples ſayd vnto syr ſuffre fyrſt go bury father ieſus ſayd vnto hym follow yu let ye dead bury theyr dead ✚ marci 4 luce 8 c whā went vp lytle ſhip diſciples followed hym beholde ther happened great ſtearynge ſee ſo yt lytle ſhippe couered wt wawes hymſelfe ſlept diſciples cam rayſed hym vp ſayeng lorde ſaue thou v peryſh ieſus ſayeth vnto ye fearfull ye lytle fayth ryſynge vp pſal 106 iob 26 b cōmaunded wyndes ſee ther happened greate calme men truly maruayled ſayenge maner one thys wyndes ſee obedient vnto hym ⊢ math 5 luce 8 c whan ieſus come beyonde arme ſee contry geraſens ther met hym two mē hauynge deuels goynge graues beynge exceadyng cruel ſo mā myght go waye behold cryed ſayenge 2 cor 6 c v ieſu thou ſonne god arte thou come hether vexe v tyme marci 5 b farre frō ther herde ſwyne fedynge deuels prayed hym ſayeng yf thou caſt v frō hence ſende v herde ſwyne ſaid vnto go way departynge went ye ſwyne beholde wt great violence went al yt herde headlynge ſee dyed ye water hyrdmen fled cōmynge cytie tolde al theſe thynges thoſe yt ye deuels behold ye whol citie wēt mete ieſu whā ſaw hym ac • u 16 e prayed hym yt wolde departe frō theyr coaſtes ix chapter ieſus goynge vp litle ſhip wēt ouer ye water came cytie marci 2 luce 5 c ioh 5 aand beholde preſē ted vnto hym mā ſicke ye palſye lyenge bed ieſus ſeynge fayth thē ſayd good cōforte ſonne thy ſynnes forgeuen beholde ſome ſcribes ſayd wythin themſelues blaſphemeth whā ieſus ſene theyr thoughtes ſaid ye think euell thynges harte eaſy ſaye thy ſynnes forgeuen ſaye aryſe vp walke ye maye knowe yt ſonne mā hath power earth forgeue ſynnes ſayd vnto man ſycke palſye actu 3 9 f aryſe take vp thy bed go vnto thy houſe aroſe wente hys waye hys houſe people ſeynge afrayed glorifyed god whych gaue ſuch power vnto mē ⊢ ✚ marci 2 b luce 5 15 whan ieſus wente ouer thence ſaw mā mathew name ſyttynge cuſtome houſe ſayd vnto hym followe thou aryſynge followed hym fortuned ſyttynge table houſe beholde many publican ſynners commynge ſat table wyth ieſu hys diſcyples phariſes ſeynge ſayde vnto hys diſciples doth mayſter eate wyth publican ſynners ieſus hearyng ſayd ther nede phiſiciā yt whole ye ſick ye goynge learne oſee 6 b math 12 wyl haue mercy ſacrifice came cal ye ryghteous ſynners penaūce ⊢ ✚ marci 2 b luce 5 • thā cam vnto hym diſciples ihon ſayenge phariſes faſt ofte thy diſciples faſt ieſus ſayd vnto maye chyldren brydegrome mourne longe brydegrome wyth ye dayes ſhall come brydgrome ſhall taken awaye thā ſhall faſt mā putteth pece new cloth olde garmente taketh fulneſſe therof frō garment rente made worſe nother putteth new wyne old bottels el ye bottels burſt wyne ſpylt ye bottels peryſh new wyne put new bottels ſaued ⊢ ✚ mar 5 c luce 8 • ſpeakynge theſe wordes vnto behold prince cam nye worſhipped hym ſayenge syr doughter dead euē come laye thyne hande vpō ſhe ſhall lyue ieſus ryſynge followed hym hys diſciples leui 15 b marci 5 c luce 8 • beholde woman ſuffred yſſue bloude twelfe yeares approched nye behynde touched hemme hys garmēt ſhe ſayd wythin ſelfe yf touch garment ſhalbe ſafe ieſus beynge turned ſeynge ſayde doughter good comforte thy fayth hath made ſafe ye womā made ſafe frō yt houre marci 5 luce 8 f whan ieſus come prince houſe ſene mynſtrels multitude makynge noyſe ſayd get hence dame ſell dead ioh 11 b ſlepeth laughed hym ſcorne whā multitude thruſt entred helde hir hande ſayde dame fell aryſe dameſell aroſe thys noyſe wente lande ⊢ whan ieſus paſſed thence ther followed hym two blynde men cryenge ſayenge thou ſōne dauid haue mercy vpon v whan come home blynde came vnto hym ieſus ſayd vnto beleue ye yt able thys vnto ſayde vnto hym yee lorde touched theyr eye ſayenge math 8 b accordynge fayth vnto theyr eye opened ieſus charged thē ſayenge se man knowe goynge publyſhed lande marci 7 • luce 11 b whan theſe departed preſented vnto hym domme man hauynge deuell whan deuell caſt domme ſpake people maruayled ſayenge neuer thus ſene iſrael math 12 c marci 3 b phariſes ſayde caſteth deuels prince deuels marci 6 luc 13 b ieſus wente aboute cyties townes teachynge theyr sinagoges preachynge goſpell kyngdome healynge euery diſeaſe euery infirmite ezech 34 marci 6 ſeynge people compaſſion vpon becauſe vexed lyenge ſhepe hauynge ſhepherde luce 10 ſayeth vnto hys diſcyples harueſt truely great labourer fewe 2 teſſa 3 praye ye therfore lorde harueſt maye ſende labourer hys harueſt x chapter marci 3 6 luc 6 b 9 710 hys twelfe apoſtles beynge called together gaue power vncleane ſpretes ſhulde caſt heale euery diſeaſe euery infirmite name twelfe apoſtles theſe fyrſt simon whych called peter andrewe hys brother philippe bartylmew iames zebede ihon hys brother thomas mathew publicane iames alſo alphe thadeus simon canaan iudas iſcariot whych alſo betrayed hym theſe twelfe dyd ieſus ſende commaundynge thē ſayeng waye heythen ſhal ye go cyties samaritanes ſhall ye entre go ye rather vnto ſhepe houſe iſrael whych peryſhed marci 6 b goynge preach ſayenge kyngdome heauens hande heale ſycke rayſe dead clēſe leper caſt deuels actu 8 b frely haue ye receaued geue ye frely marci 6 luce 9 10 apoſſeſſe ye golde ſyluer monye youre gyrdels ſcryppe yourneye ſhues rodde phil 2 c • tim 5 c labourer worthy hys meat cytie towne ſo euer ye ſhal entre axe ye worthy remayne tyl ye departe math 6 b luce 9 10 entrynge houſe ſalute ſayenge peace thys houſe yf houſe truly worthy youre peace ſhall come vpon yf worthy youre peace ſhall returne agayne youre ſelfe ſo euer ſhall receaue hear youre wordes ye goynge forth houſe citie act 13 18 ſhake duſt youre fete verely ſaye vnto ſhalbe eaſyer londe sodome gomorre daye iudgemente thā ye citie luc 10 behold ſende forth ſhepe myddes wolues ye therfore wyſe ſerpentes ſymple doues marc 13 b luc 21 b ioh 16 beware men ſhall delyuer vp councels theyr sinagoges ſhall ſcourge vnto debites alſo kynges ſhall ye led ſake teſtimonye vnto thē ye heythen marc 13 b luc 12 b 21 b whā ſhall delyuer vp take ye thought howe ye maye ſpeake ſhalbe geuen houre ye ſhal ſpeake ſpeake ſprete youre father ſpeaketh youmiche 7 brother ſhall delyuer vp brother vnto death father ſonne chylderen alſo ſhal ryſe vp agaynſte theyr parē te ſhall put death ye ſhall hate vnto men name ſake mat 24 ſo ſhall contynue vnto ende ſhalbe ſafe iere 1 math 2 c act 8 14 whan ſhall perſecute citie flye ye another verely ſaye vnto ye ſhal fyniſh ye city iſrael tyl ye ſonne man come luc 6 diſciple aboue maſter ſeruaūt aboue lorde ynough diſciple yt hys maſter ſeruaūt lorde yf haue called good man houſe beelzebub muche houſholde folkes therfore ſhall ye feare marc 4 b luc 8 b 12 ther nothynge hyd ſhall ſhewed ſecrete ſhall knowne tel darkneſſe tell ye ye lyght ye heare eare preach ye vpon ye houſe toppes luc 12 feare ye kyll body maye kyll ſoule rather feare hym able deſtroye bothe ſoule body hell two ſparowes ſolde farthyng one ſhall fall vpon earthe wythout father heeres youre heade nombred alſo feare ye therfore ye better manye ſparowes mac 8 c luce 9 c 12 euery one therfore ſhal knowlege men alſo wyll aknowlege hym father ye heauens ſo ſhal denye men hym alſo wyll denye father ye heauens luc 12 f thynke ye came ſende peace ye earth came ſende peace ſwerde came ſeparate man mich 7 agaynſt father ye water onely ye name diſciple verely ſaye vnto ſhall leſe rewarde xi chapter came paſſe whā ieſus fyniſhed commaundynge diſciples wente thence myghte teach preach theyr city ✚ luce 7 b whan ihon herde bondes workes chriſte ſendynge two hys dyſciples ſayde vnto hym art thou art come loke another ieſus anſwering ſaid vnto thē ye goinge waye tell ihon agayne thynges ye haue herde ſene eſa 53 blynde ſe lame walke leper clenſed deef heare deed ryſe agayne eſa 61 athe poore called goſpell bleſſed ſhall offēded agaynſt luc 7 c goynge theyr waye ieſus began ſaye vnto people concernynge ihon ye gone forthe wylderneſſe ſe rede ſhaken wyth wynde came came ye forth ſe man clothed wyth ſoft clothes beholde clothed wyth ſoft rayment kynges houſes wente ye forth ſe prophet yee ſaye vnto prophet thys whome written mala 3 mar 1 beholde ſende thy face myne aungell ſhal prepare thy waye ⊢ ✚ verely ſaye vnto amonge chyldren womē hath ther ryſen greater ihon baptiſt leſſe kyngdome heauēs greater dayes ihō baptiſt vntyl kyngdome heauens ſuffreth violence violent plucke vnto luc 16 c prophetes lawe haue prophecyed vnto ihō yf ye wyl receaue mala 3 luce 1 elia yt come ye hath eares heare let hym heare ⊢ luc 7 iohā 1 b vnto ſhal lykē thys generaciō lyke vnto chyldren ſyttynge market cryeng theyr fellowes ſay haue ſonge vnto ye haue daunſed haue made lamētaciō ye haue mourned ihō came nother eatyng drynkynge ſaye hath deuell ſonne mā came eatynge drynkyng ſay lo glotonous mā vnmeſurable drynker wyne frende publicanes ſynners wyſedome iuſtifyed hyr chyldren luc 10 b beganne vpbrayde cyties many miracle hys done becauſe done penaūce wo vnto chorozaim wo vnto bethſaida yf miracle haue bene wrought bene done tyre sidon ſomtyme done penaunce heerye cloth aſſhes neuertheleſſe ſaye vnto ſhalbe eaſye vnto tyre sidon daye iudgement vnto thou caphernaum wylt thou exalted vp euen vnto heauen thou ſhalt come downe euen vnto hell yf miracle haue bene done bene wrought sodome peraduenture remayned vnto thys dayes neuertheles ſaye vnto ſhal eaſyer londe sodome daye iudgement vnto ✚ tyme ieſus anſwerynge ſayde pro 11 luc 10 c knowlege vnto father lorde heauen earth thou haſt hyd theſe thynges wyſe prudent haſt ſhewed vnto babe euē ſo father thus well pleaſynge mat 28 c luc 10 c iohā 3 eall thynges geuen ouer vnto father ioh 7 c 8 b 10 cand man hath knowne ye ſonne father nother hath ony mā knowen ye father ſonne whome ſonne wyll ſhewe come vnto ye laboure laden ſhall refreſſhe eccli 6 iere 6 c take yock vpon lerne meke humble hart ye ſhall fynde reſt vnto ſoules 1 ioh 1 yocke ſwete burthen lyght ⊢ xii chapter ✚ tyme marc 2 c luc 6 wente ieſus thorow corne feldes▪ hys diſciples beynge hungrye deute 13 beganne plucke eares corne eate phariſes ſeynge ſayde vnto hym beholde thy diſciples lawfull sabbathes ſayde vnto thē haue ye red dauid dyd 1 reg 21 b whan anhungred wyth hym entred houſe god dyd eate ye ſhewbreads whiche lawfull hym eate nother hym preſtes onely haue ye red law sabbathes preſtes breake ye sabbath without blame ſaye vnto one greater temple yf ye dyd know oſee 6 b math 9 wyll haue mercy ſacrifice ye wolde neuer haue condemned innocentes ſonne man lorde alſo sabbath marc 3 luc 6 whā departed thēce came theyr sinagoge beholde man hauyng wythred hāde axed hym ſayenge luc 14 lawful heale sabbathes myghte accuſe hym ſayde vnto man ſhal whiche hath one ſhepe yf fall pitte ye sabbathes deut 22 wyll take holde lyft vp much man better ſhepe lawfull therfore good ye sabbathes ſayde vnto man hold thy hande helde reſtored vnto health euen ⊢ ✚ marc 3 ioh 10 11 e phariſes goynge forth wrought counſell agaynſte hym howe myght deſtroye hym ieſus knowynge departed thence many followed hym healed commaunded thē ſhulde make hym knowē myghte fulfylled whyche ſpoken eſay prophet ſayeng eſay 41 abeholde chylde haue choſen beloued whome ſoull well pleaſed wyll put ſprete vpon hym ſhall ſhewe iudgement vnto people ſhall ſtryue crye nother ſhal ony man heare voyce ſtretes bruſed rede ſhal breake ſmokynge flax ſhall quenche tyll caſt iudgement vnto victory hys name ſhall people truſte ⊢ luce • 1 c ther preſented vnto hym blynde domme man hauynge deuell healed hym ſo ſpake ſawe people aſtonnyed ſayde thys ſonne dauid mat 9 • 3 b luce 11 b phariſes hearynge ſayde caſteth deuels beelzebub prince deuels ieſus knowynge theyr thoughtes ſayde vnto euery kyngdome diuyded agaynſt ſelfe ſhalbe deſolate euerye cytie houſe diuided agaynſte ſelfe ſhal ſtonde yf satan caſt satan diuyded agaynſte hymſelfe howe ſhall therfore hys kyngdom endure yf caſt deuels beelzebub whome youre chyldren caſt therfore ſhall youre iudges yf caſt deuels ſprete god kyngdome god come luce 11 c maye ony man entre ſtraunge man houſe ſpoyle veſſell excepte fyrſte bynde ſtronge man ſpoyle hys houſe wyth agaynſte gathereth wyth ſcattereth abrode therfore ſaye vnto marc 3 c luc 12 aeuery ſynne blaſphemy ſhall forgeuen vnto mē ye blaſphemy ſprete ſhall forgeuen ſo euer ſayeth worde agaynſte ſonne man ſhalbe forgeuen hym • reg 2 • whoſo euer ſayethe worde agaynſte holy gooſte ſhall forgeuen hym nother thys worlde worlde come math 7 b luc 6 e ether make tre good hys frute good el make tre euell frute euell frute ye tre knowen ye generation viper cā ye ſpeake good thynges whan ye ſelues euell pſal 39 b luc 6 c abundaunce hart mouth ſpeaketh good man good treaſure bryngeth forth good thynges euell man euell treaſure bryngeth forth euell thynges ſaye vnto euery ydle worde mē ſhal haue ſpoken ſhall rendre accomptes daye iudgemēt 2 regū 1 c luc 19 b thy wordes thou ſhalt iuſtifyed thy wordes yu ſhalt condemned ✚ anſwered hym certayne ſcribes phariſes ſayenge mayſter wyll ſe token whych anſwerynge ſayd vnto math 16 marci 8 b luce 11 c euell aduouterous generacion ſeketh token ther ſhall token geuen vnto token ionas prophete ione 2 lyke ionas whale belly thre dayes thre nyghtes ſhal ſonne man harte earth thre dayes thre nyghtes men niniue ſhall ryſe iudgement wyth thys generacion ſhall condemne becauſe ione 3 dyd penaunce preachynge ionas behold one ionas quene ye ſouth ſhal ryſe iudgemēt wt thys generacion ſhall condemne becauſe 3 reg 10 2 para 9 • ſhe came vttemooſt coaſtes earth heare ye wyſedome salomon behold one salomon ⊢ luce 11 c whā vncleane ſprete gone mā walketh thorow drye place ſekynge reſt fyndeth thā ſayeth wyll returne houſe whēce cam forth cō mynge fyndeth voyde ſwepte garnyſhed goeth taketh wyth hym ſeuē ſpretes worſe hymſelfe entrynge dwell 2 petri 2 b hebre 6 ye laſt thynges mā become worſe fyrſt ſhal alſo vnto thys mooſt euell generaciō marci 3 c luce 8 c whyle yet ſpeakynge vnto ye people behold hys mother brethrē ſtode wtout requyryng ſpeake vnto hym certayne mā ſayd vnto hym behold thy mother thy brother ſ • ande without requyryng ſpeake vnto anſwerynge hym tolde hym ſayde mother brother ſtretchynge forth hande vnto hys diſciples ſayde beholde mother brother ioh 15 b ſo euer doth wyll father whyche heauens brother ſyſter mother xiii chapter marci 4 luce 8 daye ieſus goyng forth houſe ſat ſee ſyde ther gathered together vnto hym muche people ſo goynge vp lytle ſhippe ſatte hym downe people ſtode ſhore ſpake many thinges vnto parable ſayenge beholde ſoweth went forth ſowe hys ſede whyle ſoweth ſome fell waye ſyde byrdes ayre came dyd eate vp fell ſtony place hadde much earth immediatly ſprange vp becauſe hadde depth grounde whan ſonne ryſē caught heate becauſe roote wythred awaye fell thornes thornes grewe vp choked thē fel good groūde gaue frute ſome hundreth folde ſome ſyxtyfold thyrty folde ſo hath eares heare let hym hear marci 4 luce 8 b diſciples approchyng nye ſayd vnto hym ſpeakeſt thou vnto parable whych anſwerynge ſayd vnto becauſe vnto geuen knowe miſteryes kyngdome heauens 2 cor 3 c vnto geuē math 25 c marc • c luce 3 b 19 c ſo hath hym ſhal geuen ſhall haue abundaunce ſo hath hym ſhalbe taken awaye euen whych hath therfore ſpeake vnto parable becauſe ſeynge ſe hearynge heare nother vnderſtande may fulfylled prophecy eſaye ſayenge eſa 6 b marci 4 luce 8 b ioh 12 c actu 28 rom 1 • bwyth hearynge ſhal ye heare vnderſtande ſeynge ſhal ye ſe ſe harte thys people made groſſe wyth eares alſo haue herde heuely ſhut theyr eye leſt ony tyme ſe wyth eye heare wyth eares vnderſtande wyth harte turned heale luce 10 e bleſſed eye ſe youre eares heare verely ſaye vnto 1 patr 1 b many prophetes ryghteous men haue longed ſe ye thinges ye ſe haue ſene heare ye thynges whych ye heare haue herde marc 4 b luce 8 b heare ye therfore ye parable ſower euery one heareth worde kyngdome vnderſtandeth euell commeth taketh awaye whych ſowen hys harte thys ſowen waye ſyde ſowen vpon ſtony place ſame heareth worde immediatly receaueth wyth ioye hath roote hymſelfe tyme whan trouble perſecucion commeth paſſe wordes ſake immediatlye offended ſowen thornes ſame heareth worde god carefulneſſe thys worlde deceatfulneſſe ryches choketh vp worde made wythout frute ſowen good grounde ſame heareth vnderſtandeth worde bringeth frute ſome yeldeth truely hundreth folde ſome ſyxtie folde ſome thyrtye folde marci 4 c another parable put forth vnto ſayenge ✚ kyngdō heauēs become lyke vnto man dyd ſowe good ſede hys felde whyle men ſlepe hys enemye came ſowed tare therevpon euen myddes wheate wente hys waye whan blade growen vp yelded frute thā appeared tare alſo ſeruauntes houſeholder commynge nye ſayd vnto hym syr dyd deſt thou ſowe good ſede thy felde whence therfore hath tare ſayd vnto ſame hath enuyous man done ſeruauntes ſayd vnto hym wylt thou go gather vp ſayd leſt happely ye gatherynge tare plucke vp wheate alſo together wyth suffre ye eyther growe vnto harueſt tyme harueſt ſhall ſaye reaper gather ye fyrſte tare bynde together ſheaues burne gather wheat barne ⊢ ✚ another parable put forth vnto ſayenge math 4 c luce 13 b kyngdome heauens lyke vnto grane muſtarde ſede mā takynge ſowed hys felde whych verely leeſt ſedes whan hath growen vp greater thā herbes becommeth tre ſo byrdes ye ayre maye come dwell braunches therof another parable ſpake vnto thē luce 1 • b kyngdome heauens lyke vnto leuen whych taken womā hydeth thre peckes meell tyll al leuended marci 4 theſe thynges ſpake ieſus vnto people parable wythout parable ſpake vnto myghte fulfylled whych ſpoken prophete ſayenge pſal 77 ſhall open mouth parable ſhall tell hyd thynges makyng worlde ✚ people beynge ſente awaye came houſe marci 4 hys diſciples approched nye vnto ſayenge expounde vnto v parable tare felde whych anſwerynge ſayd ſoweth good ſede ſonne man felde worlde good ſede thoſe chylderen kyngdome tare thoſe wycked chylderen enemye ſowed deuell apoca 14 harueſte ende world reaper angel lyke ye tare therfore gathered together brent fyre ſo ſhall ende worlde ſonne man ſhall ſende hys angel ſhall gather hys kyngdome ſklaū ders commytte iniquite ſhall caſt chymney fyre ſhalbe wepynge gnaſſhynge teth daui 12 sapi 3 b • cor 15 e ſhall ryghteous ſhyne ye sonne ye kyngdome theyr father ſo hath eares heare let hym heare ⊢ ✚ agayne▪ kyngdome heauens lyke vnto treaſure hyd felde whych mā fyndeth hydeth ioye therof goeth ſelleth hath byeth felde agayne kyngdome heauens lyke vnto marchaunt man ſekynge good perles philip 3 whā one precious perle foūde wente ſolde bought agayne kyngdome heauēs lyke vnto nette caſt ſee gatherynge together euery kynde fyſſhes whych whan full drawynge ſyttynge ſhore choſe good fyſhes theyr veſſels caſt euell math 2 • b ſhall ende worlde angel ſhall go forth ſeparate euell myddes ye ryghteous ſhall caſte chymney fyre math 25 c ſhalbe pynge gnaſhynge teth haue ye vnderſtande theſe thynges ſaid vnto yee lord ſayd vnto thē euery ſcribe therfore learned kyngdome heauēs lyke vnto man houſholder bryngeth hys treaſure new thynges olde ⊢ marci 6 luce 4 b came paſſe whan ieſus ended theſe parable departed thence commynge cō try taught theyr sinagoges ſo maruayled ſayde whence commeth thys wyſedome vertues vnto hym ioh 6 c thys carpenter ſonne hys mother called mary hys brother iames ioſeph simon iude hys ſyſters wyth v whence hath theſe thynges offended hym ieſus ſayde vnto marci 6 luce 4 c ioh 4 e prophete wythout honoure hys owne contry hys owne houſe dyd many myracles becauſe theyr vnbelefe xiiii chapter marci 6 b luce 9 tetrarcha hath iuriſdiccion ouer fourth part great lordeſhippe tyme herode ❧tetrarcha herde fame ieſu ſayd vnto hys ſeruauntes thys ihon baptiſt ryſen dead therfore myracles worke hym luce • c herode helde ihon bounde hym put hym preſon becauſe herodias hys brother wyfe ihon ſayd vnto hym leuiti 18 b 20 c lawfull haue wyllynge put hym death feared people geneſ 40 c becauſe thy eſtymed hym prophet math 21 b daye herodes byrth dyd doughter herodias daunce myddes marci 6 • pleaſed herode wherfore promyſed wyth oth geue ſo euer ſhe wolde haue axed hym ſhe beynge counſeled afore hyr mother ſayd geue platter head ihon baptiſt kynge ſory becauſe oth ſat together table commaunded geuen ſente beheaded ihon preſon hys heade brought platter geuen vnto dameſell ſhe brought vnto hir mother diſciples alſo approchynge nye toke body buried commynge tolde ieſus marci 6 luce 9 b whych whan ieſus herde departed thence lytle ſhip deſerte place waye ioh 6 aand whan ye people herd followed hym foote cyties departynge thence ſaw great multitude pytie healed theyr ſycke whan euen come hys diſciples came hym ſayeng deſert place ye houre ouerpaſt ſende thou people awaye goynge maye bye meate ieſus ſayd vnto haue nede go geue ye eat anſwered hym haue fyue bread two fyſhes whych ſayd vnto thē brynge hether whā cō maūded people ſyt downe vpō graſſe whan fyue breades two fyſſhes taken lokynge vp heauen bleſſed brake gaue breades vnto hys diſciples diſciples gaue vnto people dyd eate fylled toke remnauntes euen twelfe baſkettes full broken meates nombre eater fyue thouſande men beſyde wemen chylderen marci 6 iohā 6 • immediatly ieſus cauſed diſciples go vp lytle ſhippe go hym ouer water tyll ſent awaye people people beynge ſent awaye luc 6 bhe wante vp mountayne praye hymſelfe alone whan yt euen come pa alone lytle ſhippe toſſed wyth wawes myddes ye ſee wynde contrary ye fourth watch nyght came vnto walkynge vpon ſee ſeynge hym walkynge vpon ſee troubled ſayenge viſion feare cryed immediatly ieſus ſpake vnto ſayeng haue confidence feare peter anſwerynge ſayd lorde yf thou commaunde come vnto vpon water ſayde come peter goyng downe lytle ſhippe walked vpon water yt myght come vnto ieſus ſeynge wynde ſtronge afrayed whan begonne ſynke cryed ſayenge lord ſaue thou immediatly ieſus ſ • rtchynge forth hande toke holde hym ſayde vnto thou lytle fayth haſt thou douted marci 6 • whan come vp lytle ſhyppe wynde ceaſſed ſhyppe came worſhypped hym ſayenge truly yu art ſonne god whan gone ouer ye water came londe geneſar whan mē place knowne hym ſent al contry preſented vnto hym ſuche euell eaſe prayed hym myght touche hēme hys garment whoſoeuer touched ſafe xv chapter ✚ came vnto hym hieruſalē ſcrybes phariſesmarc 7 ſayenge thy diſciples trāſgreſſe tradiciōs elder waſh theyr handes whan eate bread anſwerynge ſayd vnto ye alſo tranſgreſſe commaundement god owne tradicions ſake god hath ſayde exodi 20 b deut 5 c 27 c honoure thou father mother ſo euer curſeth father mother let hym dye death ye ſaye prou 28 ſoeuer ſhall ſay father mother gift ſoeuer ſhall profyt ſhall honoure hys father hys mother commaundement god haue ye made none effecte owne tradicions ſake ye ypocrites well hath eſay prophecied ſayēg eſay 29 c ezech 3 • fthys people honoureth lippes theyr hart farre fro vayne ſerue teachynge doctrynes preceptes men whan people called together vnto hym ſayde vnto heare vnderſtande entreth ye mouth defyleth man whyche procedeth mouthe defyleth man thē diſciples cō mynge nye ſayd vnto hym knoweſt thou phariſes whā herde thys ſayenge offended anſwerynge ſayde actū 5 • euery plant heauenly father hath planted ſhalbe rooted let alone blynd leader blynde yf blynde leade blynde fall diche peter anſwerynge ſayde vnto hym mar 7 b expounde vnto v parable ſayde vnto alſo yet wythout vnderſtondynge ye vnderſtonde thas euery thynge entreth ye mouth goeth belly caſt draught thoſe thynges whiche procede mouth go hart defyle man frō hart go euell thoughtes manſlaughters aduoutries fornicaciōs theftes falſe wytneſſes blaſphemyes theſe defyle man eate vnwaſſhen hādes defyleth mā ⊢ ✚ •• 7 • ieſus beynge departed thence wente forth coaſtes tyre sidon beholde womā canaā beyng come forth thoſe coaſtes cryed ſayenge vnto hym haue mercy lorde thou ſonne dauid doughter euell vexed deuell anſwered word hys diſciples approchyng nye beſought hym ſayenge sende awaye ſhe cryeth v anſwerynge ſayde luc 19 ſent vnto ſhepe iſrael periſhed ſhe came worſhypped hym ſayenge lorde helpe anſwerynge ſayde good take ye chyldrens bread caſt vnto dogges ſhe ſayde yee lord whelpes alſo eate crommes fall theyr lordes table ieſus anſwerynge ſayde vnto woman greate thy fayth vnto euen thou wylt hyr doughter healed houre ⊢ ✚ whan ieſus departed thēce came ſee ſyde galile goynge vp mountayne ſat ther came vnto hym muche people hauynge wyth dōme blynde lame feble many thoſe layed hys fete eſai • 35 healed ſo people maruayled ſeynge domme ſpeakynge lame walkynge ye blynde ſeynge magnified god iſraell marc 8 ieſus whan diſciples called together ſayde haue pytie people ſeynge contynue thre dayes haue maye eate wyll let go awaye faſtynge leſt myſcary ye waye diſciples ſaye vnto hym whence ſhal get v thē ſo much bread wylderneſſe maye ſatiſfye ſo greate multitude ieſus ſayde vnto howe many loaues haue ye ſayde seuen fewe lytle fyſſhes commaunded ye people ſhulde ſyt downe vpon grounde takynge ſeuen loaues fiſſhes geuynge thankes brake gaue diſciples diſciples gaue vnto people dyd eate ſatiſfyed remayned brokē meates toke away euen ſeuen baſkettes ful dyd eate foure thouſande men beſyde chyldren wemē ⊢ whan multitude ſent awaye wente vp lytle ſhyppe came coaſtes magedan xvi chapter marc 8 b ioh 6 phariſes alſo saduces came vnto hym tēptynge requyred hym wolde ſhewe token frō heauen luce 12 f anſwerynge ſayde vnto whan euen come paſſe ye ſaye wyll fayre ſkye reed mornynge wyll foule wether ſkye gloomynge reed ye diſcerne face ſkye diſcerne token tymes math 12 euel aduouterous generacion ſeketh token ther ſhall token geuē vnto ye token prophet ione 2 ionas beyng forſaken wente hys waye marc 8 b whā diſciples come ouer ye water forgat take ye bread ſayd vnto thē luce 12 • take hede beware leuen phariſes saduces thought amonge themſelues becauſe haue takē bread ieſus knowyng ſayd ye thynke amonge youre ſelues ye lytle fayth becauſe ye haue ye bread ye yet vnderſtonde remembre mat 14 c fyue bread fue thouſande men howe many baſkettes toke ye vp math 15 nother ſeuen bread foure thouſande men howe many baſkettes toke ye vp ye vnderſtande howe ſpake vnto bread beware leuen phariſes ye saduces vnderſtode bad beware leuen bread doctryne phariſes saduces ✚ mar 8 luc 9 c ieſus came coaſtes ceſarea philippi axed diſciples ſayenge whome men ſaye ſonne man ſayde ihon baptiſte elia hieremy one prophetes ieſus ſayeth vnto whome ſaye simon peter anſwerynge ſayde luce 9 c ioh 6 gthou art chriſte ſonne lyuynge god ieſus anſwerynge ſayd vnto hym bleſſed art thou simon bar iona fleſhe bloude hath ſhewed vnto ioh 6 ebut father ye heauens ſaye vnto thou art peter vpō thys 1 cor 10 ſtone wyl buylde congregaciō 1 para 18 b eſaie 28 c gate hell ſhall preuayle agaynſt vnto wyll geue keyes kyngdome heauens math 18 b ioh 20 c ſoeuer thou byndeſt vpon earth ſhal bounde alſo heauens ſoeuer thou loweſeſt vpon earthe ſhalbe lowſed heauens alſo ⊢ thē charged hys diſciples ſhuld tell man ieſus chriſte mar 8 luce 9 c tyme forth beganne ieſus ſhew vnto hys diſciples muſt go hieruſalem ſuffre many thynges elder ſcrybes chefe ye preſtes ſlayne ryſe agayne thyrde daye peter takyng beganne rebuke hym ſayenge farre frō lorde ſhal happen vnto beynge turned ſayde vnto peter 2 reg 19 go thou satā thou hyndreſt thou ſauoureſt thynges god thoſe mē math 10 • mar 8 e luce 9 c 14 ioh 12 c ſayde ieſus vnto diſciples yf ony man wyll come let hym denye hymſelfe take vp hys croſſe followe wyll ſaue hys lyfe ſhall loſe loſeth hys lyfe ſake ſhall fynde profiteth man yf wynne ye whole world ſuffre harme vnto hys ſoule exchaūge ſhal mā gyue hys ſoule ye ſonne man ſhal come glory hys father wyth hys angel rom 2 ſhall recompence euery man accordynge hys workes mat 8 • luce 9 c verely ſaye vnto ther ſome thoſe ſtandyng whych ſhal tayſt death tyll ſe ſonne man commynge hys kyngdome xvii chapter ✚ marc 9 luc 9 ſyxe dayes toke ieſus peter iames ihon brother bryngeth vnto hye mountayn waye tranſfigured apoc 1 chys face ſhone sonne hys garmētes whyte ſnow beholde ther appeared vnto thē moſes elia talkynge wyth hym peter anſwerynge ſayde vnto ieſus lorde good beyng v yf yu wylt let v make thre tabernacle one one moſes one elia whyle yet talkyng behold bryght cloude ouerſhadowed holde voyce cloude ſayeng eſa 42 mat 3 b mar 1 beloued ſonne whome well pleaſed heare hym diſciples alſo hearynge fell vpon theyr face ſort afrayed ieſus came touched ſayde vnto ariſe vp feare lyftynge vp theyr eye ſawe noman ieſus onely math 9 cōmynge downe mount ieſus commaunded ſayenge ye ſhal tell viſion man tyll ſonne man aryſe agayne ye dead ⊢ diſciples axed hym ſayeng ſcrybes ſaye elia muſt fyrſt come anſwerynge ſayde vnto mala 3 elia truely ſhall come reſtore thynges agayne ſaye vnto elia come already neuertheleſſe haue done hym ſoeuer wolde euen ſo alſo ſhall ſonne man ſuffre vnderſtode diſciciples ſayd vnto ihon baptiſt marci 9 b luce 9 whan come vnto people ther ſtepte vnto hym man fallynge downe hys knee hym ſayeng lorde haue mercy ſonne lunatyke ſuffreth grefe oftymes falleth fyre ofte water brought hym alſo vnto thy diſciples coulde heale hym ieſus anſwerynge ſayd faythleſſe frowarde generacion longe ſhall wyth longe ſhall ſuffre brynge hym hyther ieſus rebuked hym deuell departed hym chylde healed houre marci 9 c came diſciples vnto ieſus ſecretly ſayenge myght caſt hym ieſus ſayde vnto vnbelefes ſake verely ſay vnto math 21 c luce 17 yf ye haue fayth grane muſtarde ſede ye ſhal ſaye vnto thys mountayne remoue hence ſhall remoue ther ſhall nothynge vnpoſſible vnto thys kynde caſte prayer faſtynge math 16 c 20 b marc 8 9 10 luce 9 c whyle occupyenge galile ieſus ſayd vnto thē ſonne man muſte betrayed handes men ſhall kyll hym thyrde daye ſhall ryſe agayne exceadynge ſory ✚ whan come capernaum yt receaued tribute money came peter ſayd vnto hym doth maſter pay tribute mony ſayd yee whan entred houſe ieſus preuēted hym ſayenge thynkeſt thou simon kynges earth receaue tribute coſtume theyr owne chylderen ſtraungers ſayd ſtraungers ieſus ſayd vnto chyldren fre math 22 c offende go thou vnto ſee caſt hooke take ye fyſh commeth vp fyrſt whan hys mouthe openeda ſtater certayne pece money value aboute xx pen thou ſhalte fynde ❧ stater take geue vnto ⊢ xviii chapter ✚ houre marci 9 luce 9 c came diſciples vnto ieſus ſayenge thynkeſt thou greater kingdom heauens ieſus callynge chylde vnto hym ſet hym myddes ſayd verely ſaye vnto excepte ye turned become 1 petri 2 lytle chyldren ye ſhall entre kyngdom heauens ſo euer humbleth hymſelfe therfore thys lytle chylde greater kyngdome heauens receaueth ſuche one lytle chylde name receaueth marci 9 e luce 7 offēdeth one theſe lytle one whych beleue better hym yt mylſtone aſſes hanged hys necke drowned depe ſee wo vnto worlde ſklaunders 1 cor 11 b luce 17 neceſſary ſklaunders come neuertheleſſe wo vnto mā whō ſklaū der commeth math 5 marci 9 c yf thy hande thy foote ſklaunder cut hym caſt hym good vnto yt entre vnto lyfe feble lame hauynge two hādes two fete caſt euerlaſtynge fyre yf thyne eye ſklaūder pluck hym caſt hym frō good vnto entre lyfe hauynge one eye hauynge two eye caſt hell fyre take hede ye deſpyſe one theſe lytle one ſay vnto theyr angel heauēs alway beholde face father whych heauens ⊢ ſonne man come ſaue whych ben laſt thynke luce 15 • yf ony man haue hundreth ſhepe one gone aſtraye wyl leaue nyne nyenty mountaynes go ſeke yt wente aſtray yf chaunce yt fynde verely ſaye vnto ioyeth ouer thā ouer ye nyne nyenty whych went aſtray euen ſo ye wyl father whyche heauens one theſe lytle one peryſh ✚ leuit 19 ecclī 17 b luce 17 yf thy brother ſynne agaynſte go thy waye reproue hym betwene hym alone yf heare thou haſt wonne thy brother yf heare take wt yet one two nume 35 deute 17 b 19 c 2 cor 13 ye mouth two thre wytneſſes ſentence maye ſtande yf heare tell thou congregaciō yf heare ye cōgregacion let hym vnto heythen publicane verely ſaye vnto math 16 c thynges ſo euer ye bynd vpon earth ſhal bounde alſo heauē thynges ſo euer ye lowſe vpon earth ſhalbe lowſed heauen alſo agayne ſaye vnto yt yf two cōſēt vpō earth cōcernynge euery thynge axe ſhall come paſſe vnto fro father whyche heauēs luce 24 b two thre gathered together name myddes math 6 b marci 11 c luce 17 peter commynge vnto hym ſayde lorde ofte ſhall brother ſynne agaynſt ſhall forgeue hym tyll ſeuen tymes ieſus ſayd vnto hym ſaye vnto tyll ſeuen tymes tyll ſeuenty tymes ſeuen tymes ⊢ ✚ therfore kyngdome heauens lykened vnto man kynge whyche wolde laye accomptes hys ſeruaūtes whan begonne laye ye accomptes ther offered hym one oughte hym ten thouſande talentes whā wher make recompence hys lorde cō maūded hym ſolde hys wyfe chyldren al recōpence made ye ſame ſeruaūt fallynge downe prayed ſayeng haue pacience ſhall paye al lorde ye ſeruaunt hauynge cōpaſſion let hym go forgaue hym ye det ſame ſeruaūt beynge gone forth foūd one hys fellowes ought hundreth pen takynge holde caught hym throte ſayenge paye yt thou oweſt fellow fallynge downe prayed hym ſayeng haue pacience ſhall paye neuertheleſſe wolde wente caſt hym preſō tyll ſhulde paye dette hys companyōs ſeynge thynges done ſory came tolde theyr lorde euery thynge come paſſe thā hys lorde called hym ſayde vnto hym iacob 2 b thou wycked ſeruaūt forgaue ye det becauſe thou pray deſt ſhuldeſt thou haue compaſſion thy fellowe alſo haue compaſſion hys lorde beynge wroth delyuered hym ouer tormentours tyl payed det math 6 b marci 11 c thus ſhall heauēly father alſo vnto yf ye forgeue euery one hys brother euen harte ⊢ xix chapter marc 10 came paſſe whā ieſus ended theſe ſayenges departed galile came ye coaſtes iewry beyonde iordane much people followed hym healed phariſes came vnto temptynge ſayenge whether lawfull man put awaye hys wyfe ony maner cauſe whyche anſwerynge ſayde vnto haue ye red whych made man begynnynge made male female ſayde geneſe 2 thys ſhall man leaue father mother cleue vnto hys wyfe two ſhalbe one fleſh ſo ar two one fleſh wherfore let man put aſunder whych god hath coupled together ſayde vnto hym deute 24 iere 3 mala 2 c dyd moſes commaunde byll deuorcement geuen put awaye ſayd vnto becauſe moſes hardeneſſe harte ſuffred put awaye youre wyues frō begynnynge hath ben ſo ſaye vnto math 5 marci 10 luce 16 c ſo euer putteth away wyfe ſaue fornicacion maryeth another commytteth aduoutrye marieth put awaye cōmytteth aduoutrye hys diſciples ſaye vnto hym yf cauſe man ſo wyth wyfe good mary whych ſayd vnto men comprehende thys ſayenge whome geuen ther gelded borne ſo frō mother wombe ther gelded made men ther gelded haue gelded ſelues kyngdom heauens cōprehēde let hym comprehende marci 10 b luce 18 b ther preſēted vnto hym yonge chylderen myght laye handes praye diſciples reproued neuertheleſſe ieſus ſayd vnto suffre chyldren forbyd ye come vnto vnto ſuche belongeth kyngdō heauēs whā layed handes departed thence marci 10 b luce 18 b beholde one cōmynge nye ſayd vnto hym good mayſter good ſhall maye haue euerlaſtynge lyf • whyche ſayde vnto hym axeſt thou good pſal 118 • god good yf thou wylte entre vnto lyfe kepe exod • 0 • deute 4 • 5 commaundementes ſayeth vnto hym whych ieſus ſayd thou ſhalte commyt mā ſlaughter thou ſhalte aduoutry thou ſhalte commytte thefte thou ſhalte ſpeake falſe wytneſſe honoure thy father mother rom 13 b galat 5 b thou ſhalte loue thy neghboure thy ſelfe yonge man ſayeth vnto hym theſe haue kepte youth lacke yet ieſus ſayd vnto hym luce 12 dyf thou wylte perfecte go ſell thou haſte geue poore thou ſhalte haue math 6 c treaſure heauen come followe whan yonge man herde ſayenge went hys waye heuy hauynge many poſſeſſions marc 10 c luce 18 c ieſus ſayd vnto hys diſciples verely ſaye vnto rych man ſhall hardly entre kyngdome heauens agayne ſaye vnto eaſyer camell go thorowe nedels eye rych entre kyngdome heauens whan theſe thynges herde diſciples maruayled exceadyngly ſayenge may ſaued ieſus lokynge vp ſayde vnto wyth men thys impoſſible • achari 8 wt god al thynges poſſible ✚ peter anſweringe ſayd vnto hym beholde math 4 c marci 10 c luce 18 c haue forſaken thynges followed ſhall haue therfore ieſus ſayd vnto verely ſaye vnto luce 22 b whan ſonne mā ſhal ſyt ye ſeat hys maieſty whych haue followed regeneracion ſhall ſytte alſo vppon twelfe ſeates • api 5 iudgynge twelfe trybes iſraell deute 33 b euery one forſaketh houſe bretheren ſyſters father mother chyldren londes name ſake iob 42 b ſhall receaue hundreth folde poſſeſſe euerlaſtyng lyfe math 20 b luce 13 • many fyrſt ſhalbe laſt ye laſte fyrſte xx chapter ✚ kyngdome heauēs lyke vnto mā houſholder wente forthe early mornynge hyre worke men hys vyneyarde whā bargayne made wyth workemen peny daye ſente hys vyneyarde beynge gone forth thyrde houre ſawe ſtandynge ydle market ſayd vnto go ye alſo vyneyard whych ſhalbe ryght wyll geue wente theyr waye agayne wente forth aboute ſixte nyenth houre dyd lyke wyſe aboute eleuenth houre wente forth▪ founde ſtandynge ſayeth vnto ſtande ye ydle daye ſaye vnto hym becauſe noman hath hyred v ſayeth vnto thē go ye alſo vyneyard whan nyght▪ lorde vyneyard ſayeth vnto hys ſteward call workemen paye thē rewarde begynnynge laſt vnto ye fyrſt whā therfore dyd come yt came ye eleuenth hour receaued pen euery one fyrſt alſo commynge ſuppoſed ſhulde receaue alſo receaued pen euery one receauyng murmured againſt houſholder ſayenge theſe laſt haue wrought one houre haſt thou made thē lyke vnto v whiche haue borne burthen heates daye anſwerynge vnto one ſayde frende wronge diddeſt thou agree wt peny take thyne go thy waye wyll geue vnto thys laſt alſo lyke vnto ye rom 11 c lefull wyll thyn eye wicked becauſe goodmath 19 mar 10 c luce 1 • c laſt ſhalbe fyrſt fyrſt ye laſt ⊢ many called choſen • 22 b ieſus goyng vp ieruſalem toke twolue diſciples ſecrete ſayde vnto marc 10 luc 18 beholde go vp ieruſalem ye ſonne mā ſhalbe delyuered ouer vnto hygh preſtes ſcrybes ſhal condēne hym death alſo ſhall delyuer hym ouer vnto y• heythen mocked ſcourged crucified thyrde daye ſhall ryſe agayne ✚ mar 10 b thē came vnto hym mother ye chyldrē zebede wt hyr ſonnes worſhyppyng axynge ſomwhat hym ſayde vnto wylt thou ſayd vnto hym cō maunde yt theſe two ſōnes may ſytte one thy ryghthand one thy left hand thy kyngdō ieſus anſweryng ſayd ye wot ye axe may ye drynke ye cup yt ſhal drynk ſay vnto hym maye ſayd vnto cuppe truly ſhall ye drynke ſyt ryght left hande myne geue ſuche math 25 c prepared father ⊢ ten hearynge toke indygnacion two brother ieſus called vnto hym ſayde mar 9 10 e • knowe prynces nacions haue domynion greater men execute authorite vpō thē ſhal ſo amōge ſo euer wyl become greater amōge let hym myniſter wylbe chefeſt amonge ſhalbe ſeruaunt lyke ye ſonne man came ſerued ſerue beſtowe hys lyfe redempcion many marci 10 • luce 18 whā departyng hierico much people followed behold two blynd men ſyttyng waye ſyde herde ieſus wente cryed ſayenge lorde thou ſonne dauid haue mercy vpon v people rebuked ſhulde holde theyr peace neuertheleſſe cryed ſayde lord thou ſonne dauid haue mercy vpō v ieſus ſtode called ſayde wyll ye ſhall vnto ſayde vnto hym lorde oure eye maye opened ieſus compaſſion vpon touched theyr eye immediately ſawe followed hym xxi chapter ✚ mac 11 luc 19 c whā drewe nye vnto ieruſalē come bethphage vnto moūt oliuete ſent ieſus two diſciples ſayng vnto thē go towne lyeth ouer agaynſt anone ye ſhal fynde aſſe boūde hyr foale wyth lowſe brynge vnto yf ony man ſaye ought vnto ſaye ye lorde hath nede ſtrayght waye wyll let go thys done myght fulfylled ſpokē prophet ſayenge eſay 62 c • ach 9 b tell doughter sion hold thy kynge cō meth vnto meke ſyttynge vpon aſſe foale ſonne aſſe vſed yock diſciples goyng dyd ieſus cōmaunded thē brought aſſe ye foale layed theyr clothes vpon made hym ſyt theron io • 12 bbut muche people ſpred theyr garmentes way cut downe braunches frō tree ſtrowed waye people wente came cryed ſayenge ſanna vnto ſonne dauid pſal 117 c beſſed commeth name lorde ſanna heyght ⊢ mac 11 b luc 19 whan come ieruſalem cytie moued ſayenge thys people ſayde iohā 7 • thys ieſus prophet nazareth galile ioh 2 b ioh • • ieſus wente ye tēple god caſt yt bought ſolde temple ouerthrewe ye table money chaungers ſeates ſolde doues ſayde vnto wrytten 3 reg 8 eſay 56 iere 7 houſe ſhall called houſe prayer ye haue made denne murthurers blynde lame came vnto hym temple healed whan ye hyghe preſtes ſcrybes ſawe wō ders dyd chylderen cryenge temple ſayenge ſanna vnto ſonne dauid dyſdayned ſayd vnto hym areſte thou theſe ſaye ieſus ſayd vnto yee haue ye neuer red pſal 8 mouth babe ſucklynges haſt thou finiſhed prayſe thē lefte ioh 8 went cytie bethania abode marc 11 c mornyng returnynge cytie hungred ſeynge ye way luce 13 fygge tre came vnto foūde nothyng theron leaues onely ſayde vnto neuer frute growe foreuer immediatlye fygge tre wythered diſciples ſeynge maruayled ſayenge ſhe wythered ſo ſoone ieſus anſwerynge ſayd vnto verely ſay vnto math 17 c luce 17 yf ye haue fayth doute ye ſhal onely thys wyth fyggetre yf ye ſaye vnto mountayne auoyded caſte thy ſelfe ſee ſhall done marc 11 c ioh 14 15 16 c ſo euer ye axe prayer beleuynge ye ſhall receaue ✚ luc 20 mar 11 whan come temple chefe preſtes ye elder people came vnto hym teachyng ſayenge exod 2 b actu 4 7 authoryte doeſt thou theſe thinges gaue yt thys authorite ieſus anſwerynge ſayd vnto wyll axe worde alſo yf ye tell lyke wyſe wyll tell authorite theſe thynges baptyme ihon whence heauen mē thought amonge themſelues ſayenge yf ſaye heauen ſhall ſaye vnto v dyd ye thē beleue yf ſaye men feare ye people mat 14 euery mā holdeth ihon prophet anſweryng ieſu ſayde cā tel ſayde vnto alſo nother tell authoryte theſe thynges ⊢ thynke ye ✚ certayne mā two ſonnes cōmynge fyrſt ſayde go thy way ſonne worke day vyneyard anſweryng ſayd wil afterward repentyng wēt cōmynge alſo vnto ye ſecond ſayd lykewyſe anſweryng ſayde go ſyr went whether twayne dyd▪ ye wil ye father ſayd vnto hym fyrſt ieſus ſayde vnto thē verely ſaye vnto yt publican harlot go ye kyngdō god math 3 ihō cā vnto ye way rightouſnes ye beleued ye publicās harlottes beleued ſeyng yet ye repētaūce afterward yt ye myght haue beleued hī ⊢ ✚ hear another parable ther mā houſholder gene 9 eſay 5 iere 12 b marc 12 luce 20 planted wyneyarde hedged aboute dygged wynepreſſe buylt tower let oute vnto huſbandmē went ſtraunge contry whan tyme frute drawen neare ſent ſeruauntes huſbandmen receaue frutes huſbandmen catchynge ſeruaūtes one bet another kylled another ſtoned agayne ſent ſeruauntes mo fyrſt dyd vnto thē lyke maner laſte ſent ſonne vnto ſayenge wyll perchaūce ſtonde awe ſonne huſbandmen ſeynge ſonne ſayde amonge themſelues thys heyre gene • 7 come let v kyl hym ſhall haue hys enherytaunce catchynge hym thruſt hym vyneyard ſlewe hym nowe whan lord vyneyarde ſhall come wyl vnto thoſe huſbandmē ſayde vnto hym ſhal cruelly deſtroye thoſe euell perſonnes let oute hys vyneyarde vnto huſbandmen ſhall delyuer hym frute hys tymes ieſus ſayde vnto dyd ye neuer reade ſcriptures pſal 117 c actu 4 • pet 2 ſtone buylders refuſed become heade ſtone corner thys done lorde maruaylous eye therfore ſaye vnto ye kyngdome god ſhall taken frō ſhalbe geuen vnto nacion whiche ſhall brynge forth frutes • acha 12 ſo falleth vpon thys ſtone ſhall broken peces dani 2 • vpon falleth ſhall grynde hym whan hyghe preſtes phariſes herde hys parable perceaued ſpake • 11 c luc 19 20 b ſekynge take hym feared people becauſe ioh 7 dthey helde hym prophet ⊢ xxii chapter ✚ ieſus anſweryngeluce 14 b ſpake vnto agayne parable ſayeng kyngedome heauens lyke vnto man kynge whiche made mariage vnto hys ſonne apo 19 band ſent hys ſeruaunt call thē bydden vnto mariage wolde come agayne ſent ſeruaūtes ſayng tel byddē geſtes behold haue prepared dynner myne ox fed cattel kylled al thynges ready come ye mariage made lyghte went theyr wayes one ferme another hys marchaundyſe remnaunt helde hys ſeruauntes beynge ſhamefully intreated ſlew whan kynge herde wroth ſendynge hys hooſtes deſtroyed thoſe murtherers ſet fyre vpō theyr cyti • ſayde vnto hys ſeruaūtes mariage dede prepared bidden worthy go therfore hyghe wayes whome ſo euer ye fynd byd mariage hys ſeruaū te beynge gone hye wayes gathered al fande good bad mariage full eater kynge wente ſe eater ſpyed man clothed wyth weddyng gamente ſayd vnto hym frend howe cameſte thou hauynge weddynge garmente euen ſpechleſſe math 1 • f 15 c thē ſayde kynge vnto ſeruaūtes hys handes fete beynge boūde caſt hym vtter darkneſſe ſhall waylynge gnaſhynge teth mat 20 b many called fewe choſen ⊢ ✚ marci 12 luc 20 c iohā 7 thē phariſes goynge away toke counſell howe myghte take hym wordes ſent vnto theyr diſciples wyth herodes officer ſayenge maſter knowe thou arte true teacheſt waye god truely careſt man thou regardeſte perſon men tell v therfore thynkeſt thou lawfull geue tribute vnto emperoure ieſus knowynge theyr wyckedneſſe ſayde ye ypocrytes tempte ye shewe tribute money offred hym peny ieſus ſayde vnto whoſe thys ymage ſuperſcripcion ſayde vnto hym emperours ſayde vnto mat 17 rom 13 b geue therfore emperours vnto emperoure god vnto god hearynge maruayled leauynge hym wente theyr waye ⊢ mar 12 b luc 20 • actu 23 day came vnto hym saduces ſaye ther reſurreccion axed hym ſayenge maſter moſes ſayd deut 25 yf man dead hauyng chyldren hys brother ſhall mary wyfe rayſe vp ſede vnto hys brother ther wyth v ſeuen brother fyrſt maryeng wyfe dyed hauynge ſede lefte hys wyfe vnto brother lykewyſe ſeconde thyrde vnto ſeuenth laſt woman dyed alſo reſurreccion therfore whoſe wyfe ſhall ſhe ſeuen al ieſus anſweryng ſayd vnto ye erre vnderſtandynge ſcriptures power god reſurreccion ſhall nother mary maryed ye angel god heauen reſurreccion deade haue ye redde ſpoken god ſayenge vnto exodi 5 hebre 11 c god abraham god iſaac god iacob god dead lyuynge people hearynge maruayled hys doctrine ✚ marc 12 c luce • 0 c phariſes hearynge put saduces ſilence gathered together one doctoure lawe temptymge hym aſked mayſter whych great commaūdement lawe ieſus ſayd vnto hym deute 6 b 30 b thou ſhalte loue lord thy god wyth thy harte thy ſoule thy mynde thys principall fyrſt commaundemente ſeconde lyke vnto leuit 19 e rom 13 b thou ſhalte loue thy neghboure thy ſelfe theſe two commaundementes hangeth lawe prophetes marc 12 phariſes beynge gathered ieſus axed ſaynge thynke ye chriſt whoſe ſōne ſaid vnto hym dauids ſayd vnto doth dauid ſprete call hym lorde ſaynge pſal 109 lord ſayd vnto lorde syt thou ryghthādes tyl ſet thyne enemyes ſtoole thy feete yf dauid therfore call hym lord hys ſonne man coulde anſwere hym one word nother durſt ony mā daye forthe axe hym ony mo queſtions ⊢ xxiii chapter ſpake ieſus vnto people hys diſciples ſayenge ſcribes phariſes haue ſytten vpō moſes ſeate therfore euer byd obſerue theyr workes deute 17 ſaye eſay 10 28 b luce 11 bynde heuy intollerable burthen laye thē vpō men ſhulders theyr finger wil ſturre theyr workes ſene mē ſet abrode theyr philacteries wers wryttinges cōmaū dementes writtē philacteries make large hēmes loue ſyt vppermoſt meatetymes haue ye chefe ſeates ſynagoges ſalutacions ye market called men rabbi iaco 3 ye called rabbi one maſter ye brethrē call man father vpon earthe one father ye heauēs nother ye called maſters one youre maſter chriſte greateſt amōge ſhalbe ſeruaūt luce 14 b 18 b ſo exalteth hymſelf ſhal brought lowe yt hūbleth hym ſelfe ſhalbe exalted luc 11 • wo vnto ſcribes phariſes ye ypocrites ye ſhut vp ye kyngdō heauē mē ye entre ſelues nother ſuffre ye thē enter yt enter wo vnto ſcribes phariſes ye ypocrites ye deuour wydowes houſes prayenge lōge prayer therfore ſhal ye receaue greater iudgement wo vnto scribe phariſes ye ypocrites ye cōpaſſe ſee lande yt ye may make one proſelite nouice • conuer • e turned frō belefe hey • vnto iewes proſelite whā becom one ye make hym chylde hell two folde ye wo vnto blynde gydes ye ſay ſo euer ſweareth tēple yt nothynge ſo euer ſweareth golde tē ple gyltye ye fooles blynde whether greater golde temple yt ſanctifyeth golde ſo ſo euer ſweareth ye altare yt nothynge ſo euer ſweareth offerynge yt vpon gylty ye fooles blynde whether greater offerynge altare yt halloweth offerynge therfore ſo ſweareth ye altare ſweareth ſame al thinges theron ſo ſweareth temple ſweareth ſame hym dwelleth therin math 5 ſo euer ſweareth heauen ſweareth trone god hym ſytteth theron luce 11 dwo vnto scribe phariſes ye ypocrites ye tyth mynt anyſe commyn haue lefte wayghtyer matter lawe iudgement mercy fayth theſe oughte haue bene done leaue behynde ye blynde gydes whych ſtrayne gnat ſwalow vp camel luce 11 wo vnto ſcrybes phariſes ye ypocrites ye make cleane outeſyde cuppe platter wythin ye ful robbery vnclenneſſe thou blynde phariſe clenſe fyrſt inſyde ye cuppe platter ye outſyde may cleane alſo wo vnto scribe phariſes ye ypocrites ye lyke vnto paynted sepulcres appeare bewtyfull outwarde vnto men wythin full dead men bone fylthyneſſe euen ſo ye alſo outwarde ye appeare vnto men ryghteous wythin ye full ypocriſye iniquite luce 11 • wo vnto scribe phariſes ye ypocrites ye buyld tombes prophetes garnyſh ſepulcres ryghteous ſaye yf bene oure father tyme wolde haue ben party fellowes wyth thē ye bloude prophetes 1 teſſa 2 c therfore ye wytneſſes vnto ſelues ye chyldrē ſlewe prophetes fulfyll ye alſo ye meaſure father ye ſerpētes ye generacion vypers howe ſhall ye thynge hys houſe let hym whyche felde turne backe fetch hys coate wo vnto wyth childe geue ſucke thoſe dayes praye ye flyght wynter ye sabbath dani 12 ſhall ther great trouble ſuch begynnynge worlde ioel 2 bbut ſoone ye trouble thoſe dayes ſhall sonne darkened moone ſhall geue hyr lyght ſtarres ſhall fall frō heauen power heauen ſhall moued ſhall appeare token ye ſonne mā heauē thā ſhall al
