watch ye therfor ye know houre lorde ſhall come knowe ye thys yf good mā houſe knewe houre apoca 16 c thefe ſhulde come wold ſurely watch ſuffre hys houſe bored therfore ye ready alſo ye houre yt ye know ſhal ſonne man come math 25 b thynke ye faythful wyſe ſeruaunt hys lord hath ſet ouer hys houſholde may geue thē meate ſeaſon apoca 16 c bleſſed ſeruaunt whā hys lorde ſhall come ſhall fynde ſo doynge verely ſaye vnto ſhal ſet ouer hys goodes yf euell ſeruaunt ſhal ſaye hys hart lorde maketh lōge come ſhall begynne ſmyte hys fellowes eate drynke wyth dronken ſame ſeruauntes lorde ſhall come daye hopeth houre knoweth ſhal dyuide hym ſet parte wyth ypocrites ſhall waylynge gnaſſhynge teth xxv chapter ✚ ſhall kyngdome heauens lyke vnto ten virgin whiche takynge theyr lampes wēt forth mete brydegrome bryde fyue foolyſh fyue wyſe foolyſhe lampes taken toke none oyle wyth wyſe toke oyle theyr veſſels wyth theyr lampes brydegrome makynge taryenge ſlombred al ſlept mydnyghte ther crye made beholde brydegrome cō meth go waye mete hym aroſe thoſe virgin dreſſed theyr lāpes foolyſh ſayd vnto wyſe geue v oyle oure lampes go oute anſwered wyſe ſayenge leſt ſuffiſe v go rather vnto ſell bye youre ſelues whan wente bye brydegrome came readye wente wyth hym mariage dore ſhut laſt come virgin alſo ſayenge math 7 • luce 6 • lorde lorde open vnto v anſwerynge ſayde verely ſaye vnto knowe mat 24 marci 13 luce 12 21 bwatch ye therfore ye knowe nother daye houre ⊢ ✚ mar 13 luce 19 c lyke wyſe kynge takynge hys yourney ſtraunge contry called hys ſeruauntes delyuered hys goodes vnto thē vnto one gaue fyue talentes another two another one vnto euerye one hys owne power wente awaye ſtrayghte waye receaued fyue talentes wente wrought theſame wanne fyue lykewiſe receaued two wanne two alſo receaued one goynge dyggeth earthe hydeth hys lordes monye longe ſeaſon came lorde thoſe ſeruaūtes rekened wyth receaued fyue talē te commynge neare broughte fyue talentes ſayenge syr thou delyueredeſt vnto fyue talē te beholde haue wonne aboue thē fyue talētes lord ſayd vnto hym mat 24 well thou good faythfull ſeruaūt becauſe thou haſt bene faythful ouer lytle wyll ſet yt ouer much entre ioye thy lorde commynge nye alſo receaued two talentes ſayde lorde thou delyueredeſt vnto two talē te beholde haue wonne two hys lorde ſayde vnto hym well thou good faythfull ſeruaunt becauſe thou haſt bene faythfull ouer lytle wyl ſet ouer much entre ioye thy lorde ⊢ commynge alſo receaued one talent ſayde syr knowe thou art harde man thou reapeſt haſt ſowen gathereſt thou haſt ſtrowed fearynge wente hyd thy talente earth lo thou haſt thyne hys lorde anſwerynge ſayde vnto hym▪ thou euell ſlowthfull ſeruaūt kneweſt thou reape ſowe gather ſtrowed thou oughteſt therfore haue delyuered money exchaungers commynge ſhulde verely haue receaued myne wyth vauntage therfore take talēt hym geue vnto hym yt hath ten talētes math 13 b marc 4 c luce 8 b 19 c vnto euery one hath ſhalbe geuen ſhall haue abundaunce euery one hath hym ſhall taken alſo ſemeth haue caſt vnprofitable ſeruaunt veter darkneſſe math 13 e luce 13 cthere ſhalbe waylinge gnaſſhynge teth ✚ 2 teſſa 1 b whan ſonne mā ſhall come hys maieſty al angel wyth hym ſhall ſyt vpō ſeate hys maieſty people ſhalbe gathered hym ezech 34 • ſhall ſeparate one frō another ſhepherde doth ſunder ſhepe goates truely ſhall ſet ſhepe hys ryghte handes goates lefte ſhall kynge laye vnto thē ſhalbe hys ryght handes come ye bleſſed father poſſeſſe kyngdome math 20 c prepared begynnyng ye world eſay 58 b ezech 18 afor hongrye ye gaue eate thyrſtye ye gaue drynke ſtraunger ye toke naked ye couered eccli 7 2 tim 1 c sicke ye vyſited preſon ye came vnto ſhall ryghteous anſwere hym ſayenge lorde ſawe hongrye fed thyrſtye gaue ye drynke ſawe ſtraunger toke v naked couered ſawe ſycke preſon came vnto ye kynge anſwerynge ſhall ſaye vnto verely ſaye vnto longe ye haue done vnto one leaſt theſe brethrē ye haue done vnto ſhall ſaye alſo vnto thē ſhalbe lefte handes pſal 6 b mat 7 b luc 23 c departe fro ye curſed eſa 30 f dam 7 b apo 19 20 c euerlaſtynge fyre whych prepared deuel angel hongrye ye gaue eate thyrſtye ye gaue drynke ſtraunger ye toke vnto naked ye clothed sicke preſon ye vyſited ſhall alſo anſwere hym ſayenge lorde ſawe hongrye thyrſty ſtraunger naked ſicke preſon haue myniſtred vnto ſhall anſwere ſayenge prou 14 17 iere 30 c zacha 2 b verely ſaye vnto longe ye haue done vnto one leeſt theſe nother haue ye done vnto ioh 5 c theſe ſhal go euerlaſtyng payne ryghteous euerlaſtyng lyfe ⊢ xxvi chapter came paſſe whan ieſus finiſhed al theſe wordes ſayde vnto diſciples ✚ mar 14 luce 22 iohā • 8 ye knowe two dayes ſhalbe eaſter ſonne man ſhalbe delyuered may crucifyed iohā 11 • thā aſſembled together ye hye preſtes elder people forecourte ye hye preſt called caiphas held coū ſell howe myght take ieſus deceate kyll hym ſayde holy day leſt ther ſhulde vproure people mar 14 luce 7 ioh 12 anowe ieſus bethany houſe symon leper ther came vnto hym woman hauynge alabaſter box precyous oyntment poured vpon hys heade ſyttynge table diſciples ſeynge dyſdayned ſayenge ſerueth thys loſſe thys myght haue bē ſolde much geuen poore ieſus knowenge ſayde vnto ye troublous vnto thys woman ſhe hath wrought good worke vpō deut 15 b ye haue alwaye poore wyth ſhall ye haue alwayes ſhe pourynge thys oyntment vpon body dyd bury verely ſaye vnto ſo euer goſpell ſhalbe preached whole worlde ſhall thys alſo ſhe hath done tolde memory wente one twolue whyche called iudas iſcariotes marc 14 b luce 22 ioh 13 vnto chefe preſtes ſayde vnto wyll ye geue ſhal delyuer hym vnto offred hym thyrtye ſyluer pen thenceforthe ſought oportunite myghte betraye hym mac 14 b luce 22 fyrſte daye ſwete bread came diſciples ieſus ſayeng wylt thou prepare eate eaſter lambe ieſus ſayde go cytie one ſay vnto hym maſter ſayeth tyme honde wyl kepe eaſter wyth diſciples diſciples dyd ieſus appoynted made ready eaſter lambe marc 14 c luc 22 b beyng euen ſat downe table wyth twolue eatynge ſayde verely ſay vnto ioh 13 c one ſhal betray beynge exceadynge ſorowfull beganne euery one ſaye lorde ame anſwerynge ſayd dyppeth hond wyth dyſhe ſame ſhal betraye ſonne man verely goeth forth wryttē hym wo vnto man ye ſōne mā ſhalbe betrayed good vnto hym yf man ben borne iudas betrayed hym anſwerynge ſayde ame rabbi marc 14 c luce 22 b 1 cor 11 c eatynge ieſus toke bread gaue thankes brake gaue hys diſciples ſayde take eate thys body takynge cuppe thanked gaue ſayenge drynke ye therof thys bloude newe teſtamēt ſhalbe ſhed many remiſſiō ſynnes ſaye vnto wyl drynke hence forth thys frute ye vyne tyll daye ſhall drynke new wyth kyngdome father marc 14 grace ſaydeluce 22 c ioh 18 wente forthe mounte oliuete ſayde ieſus vnto thys nyght ſhal ye offended wrytten zach 13 b ſhal ſmyte ſhepherd ye ſhepe flocke ſhalbe ſcattered abrode math 26 f marc 14 ioh 16 dbut ſhall ryſen agayne actu 1 marc 14 ci wyll go galile peter anſwerynge ſayde vnto hym luce 22 c ioh 13 though ſhall offended ye wyl neuer offēded ieſus ſayde vnto hym verely ſay vnto nyght cock ſynge thou ſhalt denye thryſe peter ſayde vnto hym though ſhuld dye wyth yet wil denye lykewyſe alſo ſayd diſciples marc 14 came ieſus wyth village whiche called gethſemani ſayde vnto hys diſciples syt ye whyle go yonder praye peter taken wyth two ſonnes zebede began waxe ſorowfull anguyſhed ſayde vnto ihon 12 c ſoule heuy euē vnto death tary ye watch wyth luce 22 c beynge gone forth lytle fell vpon face prayenge ſayenge father yf poſſible let thys cuppe paſſe fro neuertheleſſe wyll thou came diſciples founde aſlepe ſayde vnto peter coulde ye watch wyth one houre watch praye ye come temptaciō gala 5 c ſpret veryly ready fleſh weake marc 14 • agayne wente ſeconde tyme prayed ſayenge father yf cuppe paſſe excepe drynke thy wyll done came agayne founde aſlepe theyr eye heuy lefte wente agayne prayed ye thyrde tyme ſame wordes ſayenge came hys diſciples ſayeth vnto slepe nowe reſt beholde houre come neare ſonne man ſhalbe delyuered hondes ſynners aryſe let v go beholde come nye ſhall betraye marc 14 c luc 22 ioh 18 yet ſpakynge lo iudas one twolue came wyth hym greate multitude wyth ſweardes ſtaues ſent ye hye preſtes elder people betrayed hym geuen tokē ſayenge ſo euer ſhal kyſſe ſame holde hym ſtrayght waye commynge ieſus ſayd hayle maſter kyſſed ieſus ſayd vnto hym frende wherfore art thou come thē came layed hondes vpon ieſus helde hym beholde one thē wyth ieſus ſtretchynge honde drwe ſwearde ſtrykynge ſeruaunte hye preſtes ſmote eare ſayde ieſus vnto hym turne thy ſwearde place gene 9 ezech 11 b apo 13 b ſhall take ſwearde ſhall peryſhe wyth ſwearde thynkeſt thou yt praye father ſhal delyuer thē twolue legio nombre vi thouſāde vi hūdreth lxvilegions angel howe ſhulde ſcriptures fulfylled luc 22 thus muſt done mar 14 f lu • e 22 ſame houre ſayde ieſus vnto multitude ye come murtherer wt ſweardes ſtaues take ſat dayly wt teachynge temple ye helde eſay 35 pſal 21 69 thys done ſcriptures ye prophetes myght fulfylled mat 26 c thā diſciples hym left fled mar 14 f holdynge ieſus led hym cayphas chefe preſtes ye ſcribes elder come together iohā 18 b peter followed hym afarre vntyll hye preſtes palace beyng gone ſat wt ſeruauntes myght ſe ende marc 14 f actu 6 b ye hye preſt coūcel ſought falſe witneſſe agaynſt ieſus yt myght delyuer hym death foūde whan many falſe wytneſſes come laſt ther came two falſe wytneſſes ſayd thys hath ſayd iohā 2 c breake downe tēple god buylde agayne thre dayes marc 14 g hye preſte ſtandynge vp ſayd vnto hym anſwereſt thou nothynge vnto theſe teſtifye agaynſt ieſus helde hys peace luce 22 • ye chefe ye preſtes ſaid vnto hym charge ye lyuyng god thou tel v yf yu chriſt ſonne god ieſus ſayde vnto hym thou haſt ſayd neuertheleſſe ſaye vnto ioh 6 g act 1 b 7 g thys tyme forth ſhall ye ſe ſonne man ſyttynge ryghte hande power god commynge cloudes heauen marc 14 g luce 22 e thā hye preſt rent hys clothes ſayenge hath blaſphemed nede yet wytneſſes lo 〈◊〉 ye herd blaſphemye thynke ye anſwerynge ſayd leui • 4 c gyltye death eſa 50 b ioh 18 c ſpytted face ſmote wt buffettes gaue hym ſtrokes vpō ye face wyth theyr palmes ſayeng prophecye vnto v thou chriſt yt ſmote marc 14 g luce 22 ioh 18 b peter ſat pallace ther came vnto hym damſell ſayenge thou waſt wt ieſus galile denyed al ſayenge wote yu ſayeſt goynge ye dore another damſel ſawe hym ſayd vnto yt thys alſo wyth ieſus nazareth denyed agayne wt oth yt knowe ye mā lytle whyle ſtode came ſayde vnto peter truly thou arte one alſo thy ſpeche maketh manyfeſt thē began curſe ſweare knowen mā immediatlye cocke crew peter remēbred ye worde ieſu ſayd math 26 c ye cock crow thou ſhalt denye thryſe beynge gone forth wept bytterly xxvii chapter bvt pſa 2 marci 15 luc 23 ioh 18 mornynge beyng come chefe preſtes elder people helde coūſel agaynſt ieſus myght delyuer ouer death brought actu 3 b delyuered hym boūde vnto pontius pilate debite iudas whych betrayed hym ſeynge condemned repentynge brought agayne thyrty ſyluer pen vnto ye chefe preſtes elder ſayeng haue ſynned betrayenge ryghteous bloude ſayd vnto v loke thou therto ſyluer pen caſt tēple auoyded goyng 2 reg 17 actu 1 c hāged hymſelf wt ſnare hygh preſtes ſyluer pen takē ſayd lawfull put corbona cheſt wherin ſuch thinges • halowed offered vp vp vnto god put corbona price bloude coū ſell holden bought wyth potter felde burial ſtraū gers cauſe ſame feld called acheldemach bloude felde vntyl thys daye fulfylled ſpoken ieremy prophet ſayenge iere 32 • zacha 11 c toke thyrty ſyluer pen ye price hym valued bought chyldren iſrael gaue potter felde ye lord appoynted marci 15 luce 23 ioh 18 ieſus ſtode debite debite axed hym ſayenge art thou kynge iewes ieſus ſayeth vnto hym thou ſayeſt whan accuſed hygh preſtes elder anſwered nothynge ſayeth pilate vnto hym heareſt thou many wytneſſes ſaye agaynſt eſay 5 • b anſwered hym neuer worde ſo ye debite maruayled greatly math 15 luce 23 b ioh 18 c ye ſolemne feaſt daye debite vſed let louſe one preſoner vnto ye people wolde yt tyme notable priſoner called barrabas therfore beynge gathered pilate ſayd wyl ye ſhal let louſe vnto barrabas ieſus called chriſt knewe yt betrayed hym thorow enuye whyle ſat iudgemēt ſeate hys wyfe ſent vnto hym ſayenge nothynge ryghteous man haue ſuffered many thynges daye viſion becauſe hym marci 15 ye hygh preſtes elder perſuaded ye people deſyre barrabas ieſu ſhulde deſtroye luce 23 b debite anſwerynge ſayd vnto whether twayne wyll ye haue lowſed vnto actu 3 b ſayd barrabas marci 15 bpilate ſayd vnto thē ſhal thā wt ieſu called chriſt ſayd al let hym crucifyed debite ſayde vnto thē euel hath done cryed ſayeng let hym crucifyed pilate ſeynge profyted yt ther vproure water taken waſſhed hys hā de people ſayenge vngylty bloude thys ryghteous loke ye people anſwerynge ſayd actu 5 hys bloude vpō v vpon chyldren marc 15 b luc 23 c ioh 19 thā let lowſe vnto barrabas ieſus beynge ſcourged toke vnto crucifyed marc 15 b ioh 19 debites ſouldiers takynge ieſus cōmune hal gathered vnto hym al ye company ſtrypynge hym hys clothes put purple robe hym platynge crowne thornes ſet vpon hys heade rede hys ryghte hande knye bowed afore hym mocked hym ſayenge hayle kynge iewes ſpyttyng vpō hym toke rede ſtroke head mocked hym ſtryped hym robe put hys clothes led hym crucified mar 15 c luce 23 cbut goynge forth foūde mā cyrene name simō ſame cōpelled ſhuld bear hys croſſe cam place called golgotha ye place dead mēsſkulles gaue wyne drynke myxte wyth gall taiſted wold drynke marc 15 • ioh 19 c crucifyed hym parted hys garmentes caſtynge lotte yt myght fulfylled yt ſpoken prophet ſayenge pſal 21 b parted garmentes vnto thē caſt lot vpon garmēt ſyttynge kept hym luce 23 ioh 19 b ſet vp ouer hys head hys cauſe wrytten thys ieſus kynge iewes eſay 53 b ther crucifyed wyth hym two murtherers one ye ryght hāde one left marc 15 c luc 23 yt wente blaſphemed hym waggynge theyr heades ſayeng fy yt deſtroyeſt ye tēple god buyldeſt agayn thre dayes ſaue thy ſelfe yf thou art ye ſōne god come downe frō ye croſſe lykewyſe alſo hygh preſtes wt ſcribes elder mockynge ſayde hath ſaued hymſelf ſaue sapi 2 yf ye kynge iſrael let hym come downe frō croſſe beleue hym pſal 21 38 69 truſteth god let delyuer hym yf wyl ſaid ye ſōne god ſame alſo dyd vpbrayde hym yt murtherers yt crucified wyth hym marc 15 luc 23 dfrō ſyxte houre ther darkeneſſe vpon ye whole earth vntyl ye nyenth houre aboute ye nyenth houre dyd ieſus crye wyth loude voyce ſayenge heli heli lammazabachthani yt god god wherto haſt thou forſaken ſome ſtandynge hearynge ſayd thys man calleth helias • 15 ioh 19 cand immediatly one runnynge ſponge taken fylled wyth vynegre put vpō rede gaue hym drynke ſayde let alone let v ſe whether helias ſhal come deleuerynge hym ieſus cryeng agayn wyth loude voyce gaue vp ye gooſt behold ye vayle ye tēple rente two partes frō aboue tyl beneth earth quaked ſtones ryuen ye graues opened many bodyes ſayntes whych ſlepte roſe vp goynge graues hys reſurreccion came ye holy cytie appeared vnto many marci 15 luce 23 ebut cēturio yt wyth kepynge ieſus ſeynge earthquake thoſe thynges done wer greatly afrayed ſayenge verely thys ſonne god marci 15 e ther many woman afarre whych followed ieſus galile miniſtrynge vnto hym amonge whych mary magdalene mary mother iames ioſeph ye mother zebedees chyldren marci 15 c luce 23 e ioh 19 • whan become euē ther cam rych man arimathia name ioſeph whych ſame alſo diſciple ieſu ſame came pilate requyred body ieſu commaunded pilate body geuen body taken ioſeph dyd wrappe clene lynnē cloth layed hys new graue whych hewen rocke rolled great ſtone dore graue wente awaye marci 15 • ther mary magdalene mary ſittynge ouer agaynſt sepulchre nexte daye whych daye preparynge dyd reſorte together vnto pilate chefe preſtes phariſes ſayenge syr haue called remembraunce yt ſame decauer yet lyuynge ſayd math 16 17 c marci 9 luce 18 dafter thre dayes ſhal ryſe agayn cōmaunde therfore graue kepte vntyll thyrde daye leſt per aduenture hys diſciples come ſteale hym ſay vnto people ryſen dead laſt erroure ſhalbe worſe fyrſt pilate ſayd vnto thē ye haue watch go kepe ye goynge awaye made graue ſure ſealynge ſtone wyth watch men ⊢ xxviii chapter ✚ vpon euenynge sabbatmarc 16 luc 24 ioh 20 • whych dawneth fyrſte sabbat holy daye came mary magdalene mary ſe ſepulchre beholde ther made great earthquake ye angell lorde deſcended frō heauen commyng neare rolled awaye ſtone ſat theron hys countenaunce lyghtenynge hys clothyng lyke ſnowe watchman amaſed feare hym become dead marc 16 luce 24 angell anſwerynge ſayd vnto wemen ye afrayed knowe ye ſeke ieſus whych crucifyed ryſen ſaid come ye ſe place lorde layed goynge quyckly ſaye vnto hys diſciples ryſen beholde ſhal go afore galile ye ſhal ſe hym lo haue tolde ⊢ ✚ marc 16 b luce 24 wente ſoone oute graue wyth fear great ioye runnynge ſhewe vnto hys diſciples beholde ieſus met ſayenge hayle came neare helde hys fete worſhipped hym ſayd ieſus vnto feare go ſhewe brother go galile actu • bthere ſhall ſe whyche whan gone beholde ſome watchman came cytie ſhewed chefe preſtes thynges done beynge gathered wyth elder counſell taken gaue large money vnto ſouldyers ſayenge say ye yt hys diſciples came nyght ſlepyng haue ſtolen hym yf herde debite ſhal perſuade hym make ſafe mony taken dyd taught ye worde noiſed iewes vntyll thys daye ⊢ ✚ eleuen diſciples wente galile moūtayne ieſus appoynted ſeynge hym worſhipped ſome douted ieſus commynge neare ſpake vnto ſayenge math 11 • iohā 17 philip 2 power geuen heauen earth mar 16 b goyng therfore teache al naciōs baptyſynge name father ſonne ye holy gooſt teachynge kepe al thynges ſoeuer haue cōmaūded ioh 14 b lo ame euery daye vnto worldes ende ⊢ ¶the ende goſpell mathewe ¶the holy goſpell iesv christe marke fyrſte chapter✚ begynnynge ye goſpel ieſus chriſt ſonne god wryttē eſaye prophet mala 3 b math 11 b luce 7 c beholde ſende myne angell thy face whiche ſhall prepare thy waye eſa 40 math 3 luce 3 ioh 1 b voyce cryer wylderneſſe make ready waye lorde make pathes ſtrayght ioh 3 ihō wylderneſſe baptyſynge preachynge baptyme penaunce remiſſion ſynnes londe iewry wente forth vnto hym ieruſalē baptyſed hym ye floude iordane confeſſynge theyr ſynnes mat 3 • ihō clothed wt heeres camel lethrē gyrdle aboute hys loynes dyd eate wyld hony locuſtes preached ſayeng math 3 b luce 3 c iohā 1 c ther commeth one ſtronger whoſe lachet hys ſhues ſtoupynge ame worthy lowſe haue baptyſed water ſhall baptyſe ye holy gooſt ⊢ math 3 b luce 3 c iohā 1 dand happened thoſe dayes ieſus came nazareth galile baptiſed ihō iordan anone cōmynge vp water ſawe heauēs opened holy gooſt lyke doue deſcendynge abydynge vpon hym ther voyce made frō heauēs thou art beloued ſonne ame pleaſed math 4 luce 4 immediatly ſprete droue hym ye deſert deſerte forty dayes forty nyghtes tempted satan deſerte wt beaſtes angel dyd ſeruyce vnto hym math 4 b luc 4 b ihō mat 6 btaken ieſus came galile preachynge goſpell kyngdome god ſayeng becauſe tyme fulfylled kyngdome god come neare repente beleue ye goſpell math 4 c luce 5 goynge ſee galile ſawe simon andrew hys brother caſtynge nettes ye ſee fyſhers ieſus ſayde vnto follow wyll make become iere 16 c ezec 47 b fyſhers men forthwyth theyr nettes lefte followed hym beyng gone lytle thence ſawe iames ſonne zebede ihon hys brother mendynge theyr nettes ſhyppe anone called theyr father zebede lefte ſhyppe hyred ſeruauntes followed hym math 4 b luce 4 ioh 2 b go capernaū anone ſabbat dayes beynge entred ſynagoge taught math 7 c aſtonnyed vpon hys doctrine teachyng hauyng power ſcribes luce 4 ther theyre ſynagoge man hauynge vncleane ſprete cryed oute ſayenge vnto v ieſu nazareth arte thou come deſtroye v knowe thou arte holy one god ieſus threatened hym ſayeng holde thy peace go mā vncleane ſprete tearynge hym cryeng loude voyce wēte hym men maruayled ſo demaunded amonge thē ſelues ſayeng thyng newe doctrine thys power commaundeth ye foule ſpretes obey hym hys feare wente forth anone al region galile math 8 b luce 4 forthwyth goyng ſynagoge came houſe simon andrew wyth iames ihō simon mother law laye ſycke feuers anone telle hym commyng near hyr hande taken lyfte vp feuer lefte immediatly ſhe miniſtred vnto math 8 b luce 4 • euē beynge come whan sonne ſet broughte vnto hym ſyck poſſeſſed wyth deuels cytie gathered dore healed many diſeaſed diuerſe ſyckneſſes caſt many deuels ſuffered ſpeake knew hym dawnynge early ryſynge vp wente deſerte place prayed simō hym followed hym whan foūde hym ſayde vnto euery man ſeketh ſayde vnto let v go nexte townes cyties maye preach alſo therfore ame come preachynge theyr ſynagoges galile caſtynge deuels math 8 luce 8 b ther came vnto hym leper beſekynge hym knye bowed ſayeth yf thou wylt thou canſt clenſe ieſus pytyenge hym put forthe hys hande touchynge hym ſayde vnto hym wyll thou cleane whā ſayd anone dyd leproſy go awaye hym clenſed mar 7 9 charged hym anone ſente hym forth ſayde vnto hym se thou tell vnto nomā leuit 14 go ſhewe vnto chefe preſtes offer thy clenſyng moſes hath commaunded wytneſſe vnto beynge departed beganne publyſh ſprede forth worde ſomuch coulde go openlye cytie wythoute deſerte place came vnto hym euerye waye ii chapter certayne dayes entred agayne capernaummath 9 • luc 5 c ioh 5 • herd houſe immediatlye ther came many together inſomuch coulde cōteyned nother dore ſpake word vnto thē ther came ſome vnto hym bryngyng one ſycke palſy whych boren foure men whan could brynge theſame vnto hym ye people vncouered thacke openynge let downe bed wherin ſycke palſye laye whan ieſus ſawe theyr fayth ſayde vnto ſycke palſye ſonne thy ſynnes forgeuen ſome ſcribes ſyttynge thynkynge theyr harte ſpeaketh thys thus blaſphemeth eſay 43 44 dwho forgeue ſynnes ſaue god ieſus knowyng anone hys ſprete yt thought ſo wythin themſelues ſayde vnto thynke ye ſo youre harte eaſyer ſaye vnto ſycke palſye thy ſynnes forgeuē ſay ryſe take vp thy bed walke ye may knowe yt ſōne mā hath power earth forgeue ſynnes ſayde vnto ſycke ye palſy ſay vnto yt ryſe take vp thy bed go thy houſe actu 9 • immediatly roſe bed taken vp wente thence inſomuch euery man maruayled dyd honour god ſayenge neuer ſaw ſuche lyke math 9 • luce 5 15 wēte forth agayn vnto ſee people came vnto hym taught whan wente ſawe leui ſonne alpheus ſyttynge receate cuſtome ſayde vnto hym followe ryſynge followed hym befell whan dyd ſyt meate hys houſe many publican ſynners ſat alſo meate ieſu diſciples ther many alſo followed hym ſcribes phariſes ſeynge hy dyd eate wyth ye publicanes ſynners ſayde vnto hys diſciples wherfore doth youre mayſter eate drynke wyth publicanes ſynners ieſus hearynge ſayde vnto thē whole haue nede phiſician ſyck 1 timo 1 cfor ame come cal ye ryghteous ſynners mat 9 b luce 5 e diſciples ihon phariſes faſtynge come ſay vnto hym diſciples ihon phariſes faſte thy diſciples faſt ieſus ſayde vnto chylderen weddynge faſte ſo longe ye brydegrome longe haue brydegrome wyth faſt ye dayes ſhall come whā brydegrome ſhal taken ſhal faſte thoſe dayes noman ſoweth newe pece cloth vnto olde garmente orels taketh away newe pece olde greater rente made nomā putteth newe wyne old bottels orels ſhal wyne burſte bottels wyne ſhalbe ſpylt ye bottels ſhal peryſh newe wyne muſte put newe bottels math 12 • luc 6 befell agayne whan wente vpon ſabbates thorow ye corne feldes diſciples beganne go forth plucke ear corne ye phariſes ſayde vnto hym lo thy diſciples vpon ye ſabbat dayes lawful ſayd vnto thē dyd ye neuer reade dauid dyd whan nede hongry wyth hym 1 reg 21 b entred houſe god vnder abiathar ye chefe preſtes dyd eate ye ſhewbreades lawful nomā eate ſaue ye preſtes gaue alſo vnto thē wyth hym ſayde vnto ſabbat made man man ſabbat therfore sonne man lorde alſo sabbat iii chapter ✚ entred agayne ſynagogemath 12 b luce 6 man hauynge wythered hande watched hym whether dyd heale vpō ſabbat myght accuſe hym ſayde vnto man yt wythered hande ryſe vp myddeſt ſayde vnto thē lawfull good sabbates euell ſaue ſoule loſe helde theyr peace lokynge aboute vpon wyth anger ſory blyndneſſe theyr harte ſayde vnto man stretch forth thy hande ſtretched • reg 13 b hys hand reſtored math • 2 b ioh 10 phariſes goyng forth dyd immediatly holde counſell wyth herodes officer agaynſt hym myght deſtroy hym ieſus wente aſyde ſee wyth hys diſciples math 4 c luce 6 b ther followed hym muche people galile ieruſalem idumea byonde iordane tyre sidon great multitude came vnto hym hearynge thynges dyd ſayd vnto hys diſciples yt ſhulde wayte vpon hym wyth lytle ſhyppe becauſe people leſt ſhulde thronge hym healed many ſomuche preaſſed vpon hym touch hym ſo many plage luce 4 c whan vncleane ſpretes ſawe hym fel downe hym cryed ſayenge thou arte ſonne god charged ſtraytely ſhulde make hym manifeſte math 10 luce 6 b 9 acru 1 b goynge vp mountayne called vnto whome wolde came vnto hym made yt ther ſhulde twolue hym ſhulde ſende preach gaue power heale ſyckneſſes caſt deuels gaue vnto simon name peter iames ſonne zebede ihon brother iames gaue name boanarges ſaye chyldrē thonder andrew philippe bartholomew matthew thomas iames ſonne alpheus thaddeus simon cana iudas iſcarioth ye whych alſo betrayed hym came vnto houſe people came agayne together ſo much yt coulde eate breade whan hys herde wēt forth holde ſayd become mad ſcribes whych come downe frō ieruſalem ſayde math 9 12 c luce 11 b hath beelzebub chefe ye deuels caſteth deuels beynge called together ſayd vnto parable satā dryue satan yf kyngdome ſhalbe diuided wythin ſelfe ſame kyngdome ſtande yf houſe diuided vpō ſelfe ye ſame houſe ſtande yf satan ſhall ryſe agaynſt hymſelfe variaūce ſtande hath ende noman beynge gone houſe ſtronge man take awaye hys veſſels wythout fyrſt ſhall bynde ſtronge man ſhall ſpoyle hys houſe verely ſaye vnto ſynnes ſhal forgeuen vnto chyldrē mē blaſphemy wherwyth ſhall blaſpheme math 12 c luce 12 1 ioh 5 c ſo blaſphemeth agaynſt holy gooſt ſhal neuer haue forgeuenes ſhalbe gyltye eternall ſynne ſayd hath vncleane ſprete math 12 c luce 8 c hys mother hys brother come ſtandynge wythout ſente vnto hym callynge hym people ſat aboute hym ſay • vnto hym beholde thy mother thy bretheren beynge wyth ſeke anſweryng thē ſayde mother brother lokynge aboute vpon thē yt ſat hym ſayd behold mother brother ſo euer doth ye wil god ſame brother ſyſter mother iiii chapter ✚ math 13 luce 8 began agayne teach ſee ther gathered much people vnto hym inſomuche goynge vp ſhip ſat vppon ye ſee ye people ye ſee vpon ye land taught thē many thynges parable ſayd vnto hys doctrine herken beholde one ſowyng went ſowe whan ſoweth ſome fell ye waye ſyde fowles ye heauen came dyd eate ſome fel vpō ſtony groundes hadde much earth dyd ſoone ſprynge vp depeneſſe earth whā sōne ryſē vp caught heate becauſe roote wythered ſome fel among thornes thornes grewe vp choked yelded frute ſome fell good grounde gaue frute cōmynge vp growynge broughte forth one thyrty folde one ſyxty folde one hundreth folde ſaid hath eares heare let hym heare ⊢ math 13 b luce • b whan alone twelfe wyth axed hym parable ſayd vnto vnto geuē know myſtery kyngdom god vnto wythout thynges happen parable eſay 6 b ioh 12 • acru 28 rom 11 b ſeynge may ſe perceaue hearynge maye heare vnderſtande leſt ony tyme turne theyr ſynnes forgeuen ſayd vnto thē knowe ye thys parable wyll ye knowe parable math 1 • che ſoweth ſoweth worde theſe ſowen waye ſyde whan worde ſowen whan heare anone commeth satan taketh awaye worde ſowen theyr harte alſo yt ſowen ſtony groūde thoſe whan heare worde anone receaue wyth ioye haue roote themſelues temporall whan trouble perſecucion wordes ſak • ryſen forthwyth offended ther whych ſowē amonge thornes thoſe heare worde trauaylles thys world deceate ryches luſtes aboute thynges cōmyng choke ye worde ſo made fruteleſſe thoſe ſowen vpon good groūde whych heare receaue ye worde brynge forth frute one thyrty fold another ſixty fold ſome hūdreth folde ſayd vnto math 5 • luce 8 11 c cōmeth candell lyght may put vnder buſhell vnder bedde yt maye ſet vpon cādelſticke math 10 luce 8 b 12 • ther nothynge hyd yt ſhall openlye ſhewed nother ony thyng made preuy yt ſhall come abrode ſo hath eares heare let hym heare ſaid vnto thē beware ye heare math 7 • luce 6 meaſure ye ſhall meete ſhalbe meaſured vnto ſhalbe geuen ouer math 13 b 25 c luce 8 b 19 cfor ſo hath vnto hym ſhalbe geuen ſo hath alſo yt hath ſhalbe takē frō hym ſayd ye kyngdom god yf man caſt ſede grounde ſlepe ryſe vp nyght day math 13 ſede ſprynge vp growe whā knoweth ye earth bryngeth forth frute herſelfe fyrſt graſſe afterward ye eare thā ful corne eare whā ſhe hath brought forth groweth vp waxeth greater herbes getteth greate braunches ſo vnder ſhadow byrdes ayre maye dwell math 13 aand many ſuch parable ſpake worde vnto thē coulde heare wythout parable ſpake nothyng vnto expounded thynges vnto hys diſciples ſeuerally math 8 c luce 8 c ſayd vnto ye ſame daye whā become euē let v paſſe ouer againſt v lettynge people go toke hym thē ſo yt ſhip ther ſhippes wyth hym ther aroſe great ſtorme wynde daſhed waues ſhippe ſo yt ſhippe fylled ſterne ſhippe ſlypynge vpō pelowe wake hym ſay vnto hym maſter doth pertayne vnto ye peryſh ryſynge vp rebuked wynde ſayd vnto ye ſee peace ſtyll wynde ceaſſed ther made great calme ſayd vnto ye fear full haue ye yet fayth diſmade wyth great feare ſayd ech trowe ye thys ye wynde ſee obey v chapter ✚ cam ouer ye arme ſeemath 8 luce 8 c contry geraſenites goynge ſhip dyd immediatly mete graues man vnclene ſprete whyche dwellynge graues man coulde bynde hym nother wyth cheynes ofte boūde wyth fetter cheynes pluckte cheynes aſunder brake fetter peces man coulde tame hym alwaye nyghte daye graues mountaynes cryenge beatynge hymſelfe wyth ſtones ſeynge ieſus afarre ranne worſhipped hym crynge loude voyce ſayd actu 16 c vnto ieſu thou ſonne mooſt hygheſt god charge ye god thou tormēt dyd ſaye vnto hym thou foule ſprete go thys man axed hym thy name ſayde vnto hym myne name legion many prayed hym greatlye wolde dryue hym oute contrye ther moū tayne greate heerde ſwynemath 8 luce 8 c fedynge ye feldes ſpretes ſought hym ſayenge sende v ſwyne may go thē ieſus dyd forthwyth graūt thē vncleane ſpretes goynge wente ſwyne wyth great ruſh heerd caſt head lynges ſee aboute two thouſande drowned ſee fed fled tolde cytie contry wente ſe happened came ieſus ſawe hym vexed wyth deuell ſyttynge clothed whole mynded afrayed ſene tolde thē befallen vnto hym yt deuell ſwyne began praye hym wold depart theyr coaſtes whā wente vp ye ſhippe ben vexed wyth ye deuell beganne praye myght wyth hym wolde ſuffre hym ſayd vnto hym go thy houſe vnto thyne ſhewe thē great thynges lord hath done vnto hath mercye vpon departed begāne publyſh ye ten cyties great thynges ieſus done vnto hym men maruayled ⊢ math 9 c luce 8 e whā ieſus wente ouer arme ſee agayn ye ſhip much people cā together vnto ye ſee ther came one ye chefe ſynagoge name iairus ſeynge fell downe hys fete beſought hym greatly ſayenge doughter departynge come laye thy hande vpon yt ſhe may ſafe lyue went wyth hym much people followed hym thronged hym woman whych bene bloudy yſſue twelfe yeares ſuffred much many phiſiciās ſpente al ſhe profyted nothynge rather worſe caſe whan ſhe herde ieſus ſhe came behynde amonge people touched hys garment ſhe ſayd yf may touch hys garment ſhalbe ſafe immediatly foū tayne hyr bloude dryed vp ſhe felt hyr body ſhe healed ye plage forthwt ieſus knowyng hymſelf ye power yt gone frō beyng turned ye people ſayd touched clothes hys diſciples ſayde vnto hym thou ſeyſt ye people thrōgyng ye thou ſayeſt touched loked ſe yt done womā knowyng done ſhe came fearynge quakyng fel downe hym tolde hym truth ſayd vnto doughter luce 7 • thy fayth hath made ſafe go thy way peace whole thy plage math 9 • luce 8 f whyle yet ſpake ther came meſſaūgers frō chefe ye ſynagoge ſayenge thy doughter dead troubleſt yu maſter ony ieſus worde yt ſpokē beyng herd ſayd vnto ye chefe ye ſynagoge afrayed beleue wrought hym ſayd elia ſome ſayd prophet one ye prophetes whan herode herde ſayd ihō whome beheaded theſame ryſen frō dead ⊢ theſame herode ſent forth held ihō bounde preſon becauſe herodias wyfe hys brother philippe maryed ihō ſayd vnto herode leuit 18 b 20 • lawfull yt haue thy brother wyfe herodias layed wayte hym wolde ſlaye hym could neuertheleſſe herode feared ihon knowynge hym iuſte mā holy kepte el herd dyd many thynges herde hym gladly math 14 whan conuenient daye come herode made gene 40 c hys byrth dayes ſupper vnto hys prynces captaynes chefe galile whā doughter herodias come daunſed pleaſed herode alſo ſat borde wyth hym kynge ſayde vnto ye damſel axe thou wylt ſhall geue ſware vnto whatſoeuer thou ſhalt axe ſhall geue yt though halfe kyngdome whiche whan ſhe gone forth ſayde vnto hyr mother ſhall axe ſayde heade ihon baptiſte whan ſhe hayſtely come vnto kynge ſhe demaunded ſayenge wyl yt thou geue ſtrayght waye platter heade ihon baptiſte kynge ſory oth becauſe thē ſat borde wyth hym wolde make ſory hangeman ſent commaunded brynge ihō baptiſtes heade platter beheaded hym perſon brought hys heade platter gaue vnto damſell damſell gaue vnto hyr mother whyche beynge herde hys diſciples came toke hys body layde graue math 14 b luce 9 b apoſtles commynge together ieſus tolde hym thynges done taught ſayd vnto come aſyde deſerte place reſt whyle ſhepe hauynge ſhepeherde beganne teach many thynges nowe whan waxed late hys diſciples came hym ſayenge thys deſerte place houre gone math 14 b let departe goynge nexte village townes maye bye meates eate anſwerynge ſayde vnto geue ye eate ſayde vnto hym wyll go bye two hundreth pen breades ſhall geue eate▪ ſayde vnto marci 8 ahowe many loues breade haue ye go ſe whan knowen ſaye fyue two fyſhes commaunded thē ſhulde cauſe thē al ſyt downe companyes vpon grene gras ſat downe particiōs hundrethes fyftyes ye fyue loaues taken fyſhes lokyng vp heauen bleſſed brake loaues gaue vnto hys ſhyppe ſhuld go ouer arme ſee bethſaida whyle ſent awaye people whan ſente away wente mountayne praye ✚ whan late ſhyppe middes ſee alone vpon lande ſeynge labourynge rowynge wynde agaynſt thē aboute fourth watch ye night came walkynge vpon ſee wolde haue gone thē whan ſawe hym walkynge vpon ye ſee thought ben ſprete cryed ſaw hym afrayed forthwyth ſpake wyth ſayd vnto thē good cheare ame feare mat 14 wente vp vnto ſhyppe wynde ceaſſed greatly aſtonnyed wythin themſelues remembred marci 6 b loaues becauſe theyr harte blynded whan ſhypped ouer came lande genezareth came neare ye ſhore whan hys garment many touched made whole vii chapter ✚ ther come together vnto hym phariſes certayne scribe cōmyng ieruſalem whan ſene ſome diſciples eate breade commune waſſhen handes blaymed phariſes iewes eate wythout ofte waſhe theyr handes kepyng tradicions elder whan come frō market eate wythout waſh themſelues many thynges ther geuen obſerue waſhynge cuppes cruſes braſen veſſels table phariſes scribe axed walke thy diſciples ye tradicions elder eate breade wyth commune handes anſwerynge ſayde vnto thē wel hath eſaye prophecyed hypocrite wrytten eſay 29 • thys people honoureth theyr lyppes theyr harte farre fro vayne ſerue teachyng doctrine cōmaundementes men leauynge commaundement god ye kepe tradicions mē waſhyng cruſes cuppes many ſuch lyke thynges ye ſayde vnto fulwell haue ye made commaundement god none effect ye ſhulde kepe youre tradiciō moſes ſayde exodi 20 b deu • e 5 honoure thy father thy mother exo 21 b ſo curſeth father mother let hī dye death ye ſaye man ſhall ſaye vnto father mother corban whatſoeuer gyfte commeth frō ſhall profite ye ye ſuffre hym nomore vnto father mother makynge worde god none effecte youre tradicion ye haue ordyned many ſuch lyke thynges ye math 15 b callynge people hym ſayde vnto herken vnto ye al vnderſtande ther nothyng man defyle hym entrynge hym go mā thoſe defyle mā yf ony man haue eares heare let heare whan entred houſe people hys diſciples axed hym parable ſayde vnto thē ye alſo ſo vnwyſe ye vnderſtande thynge entrynge man frō wythout defyle hym entreth hys harte goeth belly voyded draught purgynge meates ſayde thoſe thynges go man defyle man wythin harte men come forth euell thoughtes adulteryes fornication manſlaughters theftes couetouſneſſes wyckedneſſes deceates vnclēneſſes wycked eye blaſphemy pryde foolyſhneſſe theſe euels come forth frō wythin defyle man math 15 cand ryſynge thence went border tyre sidon beynge entred houſe wolde noman knowe could hyd woman whoſe doughter vncleane ſprete anone ſhe herde hym ſhe came fell downe hys fete ſhe gentile kynred syropheniſſa beſought hym wold caſte deuell hyr doughter ſayde vnto let chyldren fyrſt ſatiſfyed good take chyldrēs breade caſte vnto dogges ſhe anſwered ſayde vnto hym yee lorde whelpes alſo eate crommes fall chylderens table ſayde vnto thys ſayenge go thy waye deuell gone thy doughter whan ſhe came home ſhe fande damſel lyenge vpon ye bed deuell gone ✚ math 9 luce 11▪ b goynge forth agayne border tyre came sidon ſee galile betwene mydde endes ten cyties brynge vnto hym one deaf domme beſought hym wolde laye hys hande vpō hym takynge hym aſyde people put hys fyngers hys eares ſpyttynge touched tunge lokynge vp heauen ſyghed ſayd vnto hym ephata yt opened forthwyth hys eares opened ſtryng tunge lowſed ſpake aryght marci • • 9 • cōmaunded ſhuld tell vnto noman forbad ſomuch dyd publyſh maruayled ſo much ye ſayeng gene 1 eccli 39 c hath done al thynges well hath made ye deaffe heare domme ſpeake ⊢ viii chapter ✚ thoſe dayes math 15 whan agayne ther much people nother ony thing eate diſciples called together ſayd vnto thē haue pytie vpō ye people lo forbeare thre dayes haue noughte eate yf ſhall let go faſtynge home theyr houſes ſhall faynte way tobi 13 b eſa 60 ſome came farre hys diſciples anſwered hym whence ſhall ony mā ſatiſfye theſe wyth breades wylderneſſe axed marci 6 e many loaues haue ye ſayde seuen commaunded people ſyt downe vpon grounde takynge ſeuen loaues gaue thankes brake gaue vnto hys diſciples ſet ſet people lytle fyſhes thoſe alſo bleſſed commaunded ſet afore dyd eate ſatiſfyed toke vp lefte broken meate ſeuen baſkettes dyd eate ther aboute foure thouſande let go ⊢ ſtrayghtwaye goynge vp ſhyppe wyth hys diſciples came partyes dalmanutha math 16 ioh 6 phariſes wente oute beganne diſpute wyth hym requyrynge hym token heauen temptynge hym ſyghynge ſprete ſayde math 12 luce 11 cwhat doth thys generacion ſeke token verely ſaye vnto ther ſhall token geuē vnto thys generacion leauynge goynge vp agayne ſhippe went ouer arme ſee math 16 luce 1 • • forgat take breades one loafe ye ſhippe commaunded ſayeng▪ ✚ take hede beware leuen phariſes leuē herode thought ſayeng ech haue breades whych whan ieſus knewe ſayd vnto thē take ye thought becauſe ye haue taken breades ye yet knowe vnderſtande haue ye harte yet blynded hauynge eye ſe ye hauynge eares heare ye remembre ye nother marci • • ioh 6 whā brake fyue loaues among foure thouſande many baſkettes full broken meate toke ye vp ſayde vnto hym twelfe math 15 marci • • whan ſeuen amonge foure thouſande many baſkettes broken meates toke ye vp ſayd seuen ſayd vnto howe ye yet vnderſtande ⊢ ✚ come bethſaida brynge vnto hym blynde man prayed hym wolde touch hym hāde ye blynde takē led towne ſpytting eye hys handes beynge layde theron axed hym whether ſawe ought lokynge vp ſayd ſe men tree walkyng afterward layed hys hādes agayne vpō hys eye began ſe reſtored ſo ſawe thynges clearly ſent hym hys houſe ſayenge go thy houſe yf thou cōmeſt ye town tell vnto noman ⊢ math 16 b luc • 9 • ieſus hys diſciples gone townes ceſaria philippi way axed diſciples ſayeng vnto whome men 20 b began teach ſonne mā muſt ſuffre many thynges reproued elder ye hyghe preſtes ſcribes put death ryſe thre dayes ſpake worde openly peter takynge hym began rebuke hym beynge turned aboute lokynge mayſter good v let v make thre tabernacle one one moſes one elia knew ſayd amaſed great feare ther cā cloude ouerſhadowynge voyce cloude ſayenge math • b marc 1 c luce 3 c thys mooſt beloued ſonne deu 18 cheare hym ſodenly lokyng ſawe man ſaue ieſus wyth math 17 b deſcendynge mounte marc 1 9 commaunded ſhulde tell man ſene ſaue whan ſonne man ſhalbe ryſen dead kepte ſayenge thē ſelues axynge ech whā ſhalbe ryſē agayne frō ye dead axed ſayeng thā ye ſcribes phariſes ſay malach • elia muſt fyrſt come anſwerynge ſayd vnto elia whan ſhall come ſhall fyrſte reſtore al thynges pſa 21 eſay 53 written ſonne man may ſuffre much maye deſpyſed ſaye vnto elia alſo come haue done vnto hym al yt wolde wrytten hym math 17 b luce 9 cōmyng hys diſciples ſawe great people thē ſcrybes diſputynge wt thē anone al ye people ſeyng ieſus aſtonnyed amaſed commyng hym ſaluted hym axed thē diſpute ye among ſelues one people anſwerynge ſayd mayſter haue brought ſonne hauynge dōme ſprete vnto whyche whan ſo euer taketh hym teareth hym fometh gnaſheth wyth teth pyneth awaye haue ſayde vnto thy diſciples ſhulde caſt hym could anſwerynge thē ſayd faythles generacyō lōge ſhall wt lōge ſhal ſuffre bring brought hym whā ſene hī anone ye ſprete troubled hym beynge fallen vpon grounde weltered fomynge axed hys father lōge ſence thys hapned vnto hī ſayd frō hys youth tymes dyd caſt hym water fyre yt ſhuld deſtroye yf yu cāſt hauynge mercy vpō v helpe v ieſus ſayd vnto hym yf yu canſt beleue luce 1 c 18 c thynges poſſible vnto beleuynge father chylde continentlye cryenge wyth teares hym greatly wente hym became dead inſomuch many dyd ſaye dead ieſus holdynge hys hande lyfte hym vp roſe math 17 c whan come houſe hys diſciples axed hym ſecretly wherfore coulde caſt hym ſayde vnto ſonne dauid haue mercy vpō many reproued hym ſhulde holde hys peace cryed much thou ſonne dauid haue mercy vpon ieſus ſtā dynge commaunded hym called call blynde ſayeng good cheare ryſe calleth neyghbour thyſelfe ther none commaundemēt greater theſe scribe ſayd vnto hym mayſter truth thou haſt ſayd well ther one god ther none beſyde hym yt loued wyth ye whole harte wyth whole vnderſtandynge cheſte behelde people caſte mony god cheſt many rych mē caſt much whā poore wedowe come ſhe put two •• te yt farthynge callynge diſciples together ſayd vnto thē verelye ſaye vnto thys poore wedowe hath put god cheſte al haue put abundaunt vnto ſhe hir pou • rte hath put ſhe euen hyr lyuynge ⊢ xiii chapter mat 24 luce 21 whan wente oute temple one hys diſciples ſayd vnto hym mayſter loke ſtones ihon andrewe axed hym ſeuerally tell v whan ſhall theſe done ſhalbe token whan theſe ſhall begyn fulfylled ieſus anſwerynge began ſaye vnto beware nomā miſcary many ſhall come name ſayenge ſhall miſcary many whan ye ſhal heare warres rumores warres afrayed theſe thynges muſt done ende yet eſa 19 afor one nacion ſhal ryſe vp agaynſt another nacion kyngdome vpon kyngdome ther ſhalbe earthquake honger theſe begynnynge ſorowes mat •• b loke ye ſelues ſhall delyuer councels ſynagoges ye ſhalbe beatē ye ſhall ſtande debites kynges ſake wytnes vnto amonge naciōs muſte fyrſt goſpell preached math 10 c luce 12 b 21 b whā ſhal leade delyueryng thynk ye afore ye ſhal ſpeake whatſoeuer ſhalbe geuen yt houre ſpeake ye ſpeakynge holy gooſt brother ſhall delyuer ye brother vnto death father ſōne chyldren ſhall aryſe together agaynſt elder ſhal put death ye ſhalbe hated mē name ſake ſo ſhal endure vntyl ende ſame ſhal ſafe dani 9 • mat 24 b luce 21 c whan ye ſhall ſe abominacion deſolaciō ſtādynge ought ſo readeth let vnderſtande let thē iewry flye vpon hylles ſo vpō thacke let hym come downe y• houſe entre may take ought hys houſe ſo ſhalbe ye felde let hym turne back fetch garmēt wo vnto yt wt chylde geue ſucke thoſe dayes neuertheleſſe praye befal wynter thoſe dayes ſhalbe ſuche tribulacion begynnynge creature god dyd ſhape vntyll nowe ſhalbe wtout lord ſhortened dayes al fleſh ben ſaued ye choſēs ſake yt hath elect hath ſhortened dayes mat 24 b luce 17 c yf ony mā ſhal thā ſay vnto lo chriſte lo beleue ther ſhal aryſe falſe chriſtes falſe prophetes ſhall worke ſignes wonder myſcary yf choſen alſo take therfore hede beholde haue tolde al thynges befor math 24 c luce 21 c ioel 2 b thoſe dayes ſame tribulation ye sōne ſhalbe darkened moone ſhall geue hir light ſtarres heauen ſhalbe fallynge downe power heauen ſhalbe moued dani 7 b ſhall ſe ſōne mā cōmynge cloudes wyth great power glory ſhall ſende forth hys angel ſhall gather hys choſen foure wyndes hygheſt earth vnto hygheſt heauen math 24 c luce 21 learne ſimilitude ye fyggetre whan hys braunche tē der leaues ſpronge ye ſhall knowe ſommer hande euen ſo ye whā ye ſe theſe done ſure nye euen dores verely ſaye vnto thys generacion ſhall paſſe tyll theſe thynges befall heauen earth ſhall paſſe wordes ſhal paſſe actu 1 day houre knoweth noman nother ye angel heauen ſonne ſaue father math 24 25 luce 12 19 take hede watch praye ye knowe whan tyme lyke man wente ſtraunge contrye lefte hys houſe gaue vnto hys ſeruaū te authorite euery worke vnto porter commaunded watche watch ye therfore ye knowe whan lorde houſe wyll come euen mydnyghte cockcrowynge mornynge left whan ſhall come fynde ſlepynge ſay vnto ſaye vnto watch xiiii chapter ✚ math 26 • luce 22 ioh 11 • two dayes eaſter ye dayes ſwete bread ye hygh preſtes ye ſcribes ſoughte myght deceat laye hold hym ſlaye hym ſayd holy daye leſte ther happen rumoure people math 26 luce 7 ioh 12 • whan bethany ſayenge thys waiſte oyntmente made thys oyntment myghte haue ben ſolde thre hū dreth pen geuen poore grudged ieſus ſayd let reſte ye troublous vnto hath wrought good worke vpon ye haue alwayes poore wyth whan ſo euer ye wyll ye maye good vnto ſhall ye haue alwayes ſhe could hath ſhe done ſhe come anoynte body buriall verely ſaye vnto ſo euer thys goſpell ſhall preached whole worlde ſhall alſo tolde remembraunce ſhe hath done math 26 b luce 22 iohā 13 • iudas iſcariot one twelfe wente hyghe preſtes myghte betray hym vnto hearynge glad promyſed geue hym mony ſoughte myght conueniently betray hym exodi 12 c math 26 b luce 22 vpon ye fyrſt day ſwete breade tyme offred eaſter lambe diſciples ſay vnto hym wylt thou yt go prepare eat ye eaſterlābe ſēdeth two diſciples ſayeth vnto go cytie ther ſhall mete man bearynge pytcher water follow hym ſo euer ſhall go ſay vnto maſter houſe mayſter ſayeth place refreſhynge maye eate eaſterlambe wyth diſciples ſhal ſhew great parloure paued 26 • luce 22 iohā 18 yet ſpeakynge iudas iſcariote one twelfe came wyth hym greate multitude wyth ſweardes ſtaues hygh preſtes ſcrybes elder hys traytoure geuen ken ſayenge whome ſo euer ſhal kyſſe goſpell iesv christe luke prologe forasmuch many haue endeuoured ſet order wordes ye actes come paſſe amōge v lyke delyuered vnto v fyrſt ſaw thē theyrſelues miniſtres ye word thought good alſo gotten knowelege begynnynge wryte diligently vnto order good theophile thou mayeſt knowe truth thoſe wordes wherof thou arte enfourmed fyrſte chapter ther dayes herode kynge ye iewes preſte name zachary 1 par 25 b courſe abia wyfe doughters aaron hyr name elizabeth ryghteous god walkynge wythoute blame commaundementes iuſtifications lorde chylde becauſe elizabeth baren well gone forth theyr dayes came paſſe whan zachary executed preſthode god ye order hys courſe ye coſtume preſthode exod 30 b hebr 9 lot wente forth laye incenſe entryng temple lord multitude ye people prayenge wythout houre incēſe angell lorde appeared vnto hym ſtandynge ryght hande altare incēſe zachary ſeynge hym abaſhed feare came vpon hym angel ſayd vnto hym fear zachary thy prayer herd thy wyfe elizabeth ſhall brynge forth vnto ſōne thou ſhalt call hys name ihon thou ſhalte haue ioye gladneſſe many ſhall haue ioye hys natiuite ſhalbe great lorde wyne ſtronge drynke ſhall drynke ſhalbe fylled holy gooſt yet hys mother wōbe ſhal turne many chyldren iſrael vnto lorde theyr god ſhal go ſprete power pſal 131 • malach 3 math 11 b elia may turne harte father vnto chyldrē vnbeleuynge wyſedome ye ryghteous make ready perfecte people vnto lord zachary ſayd vnto ye angel wherby ſhall know gene 17 e 18 b iudi 13 bfor olde wyfe well gone forth hyr dayes ye angel anſweryng ſayd vnto hym gabriel yt ſtande god ſent ſpeake vnto ye ſhew theſe gladtydynges vnto beholde yu ſhalt dōme able ſpeake vntyll theſe thynges ſhall come paſſe becauſe yu 4 reg 7 • dyddeſt beleue wordes yt ſhalbe fulfilled tyme ye people waiting zachary maruayled taryed temple beynge gone could ſpeake vnto thē perceaued ſene viſion beckenyng vnto abode domme chaunced dayes office fynyſhed departed hys houſe thoſe dayes god ye cytie galile whoſe name nazareth vnto virgine ſpouſed vnto mā whoſe name ioſeph houſe dauid name virgine mary angell beynge gone vnto ſayd hayle full grace ye lorde wyth bleſſed arte thou amonge wemen whā ſhe herde ſhe troubled hys worde thought maner ſalutacion thys ſhuld angel ſayd vnto feare mary thou haſt founde grace god eſay 7 • beholde thou ſ • alt conceaue thy wombe ſhalte dani 7 • mech 4 b hebr 1 b ther ſhalbe ende hys raygne mary ſayd vnto angel ſhall thys ſeynge know man ye angell anſweryng ſayd vnto holy gooſt ſhall come frō aboue ye power mooſt higheſt ſhal thyng ſhal impoſſible wt god mary ſayd behold ye hand mayden lorde vnto yu haſt ſayd angel departed frō ⊢ ✚ mary ryſynge thoſe dayes went mountaynes wyth haiſt cytie iewry entred ye houſe zachary ſaluted elizabeth befel elizabeth herde ſalutacion mary ye chylde lept hir wōbe ſhe fylled holy gooſt ſhe cryed wt loude voyce ſayd bleſſed art yu amōge wemen bleſſed frute thy wōbe whence cōmeth vnto mother lord ſhuld come vnto beholde voyce thy ſalutacion happened myne eares babe lepte ioye wombe happy arte thou haſt beleued ye thynges ſhall fulfylled whych tolde lorde mary ſayd eſay 61 b ſoule magnifyeth lorde myſprete reioyceth god ſaue oure ⊢ hath beholdē ye lowe degre hys handemayden beholde hence forth ſhall generaciōs cal bleſſed mighty hath done great thynges vnto holy name mercy endureth progeny progeny vpon feare hym hath wrought ſtrengthe hys arme hath ſcattered proude imaginacion theyr harte 1 reg 2 eccli 10 c hath ſet downe myghty ye ſeate hath exalted lowe degre hath fylled hongry wyth good thynges left rych empty hath taken vp iſrael hys ſeruaunte beynge remembred hys mercy euen hath ſayde vnto father gen • 22 c abraham hys ſede euer mary remayned thre monethes returned agayne hyr houſe ✚ elizabethes tyme brynge forth fulfylled ſhe brought forth ſonne hyr neghboures kynſfolkes herde god dyd magnifye hys mercy wyth reioyced wyth fortuned vpon eyght daye came gen 17 b leui 12 ato circūcyſe chylde called hym ye name hys father zachary hys mother anſwerynge ſayd ſo ſhalbe called ihon ſayd vnto ther noman thy kynred called name made ſygnes vnto hys father howe wolde haue hym called axynge wrytynge table wrote ſayenge ihon hys name dyd maruayle hys mouth forthwyth opened hys tunge ſpake bleſſynge god ther happened feare vpon theyr neyghboures vpon hyll contryes iewry theſe wordes noyſed herde layed vp theyr harte ſayenge trowe ye wyll thys chylde ye hande lorde wyth hym zachary hys father fylled holy gooſt prophecyed ſayeng bleſſed ye lord god iſrael hath viſited made redēpcion hys people ⊢ hath ſet vp vnto v pſal 1 • 1 • horne ſaluaciō ye houſe dauid hys ſeruaūte hath ſpoken ye mouth hys prophetes whych ſence world began namely ſaluacion frō enemyes hande al yt hated v mercy father thynke vpon hys holy gene •• • conuenaunte othe dyd ſweare vnto father abrahā geue v eſay • 8 hebre 9 c delyuered hāde enemy may ſerue hym wythout feare holyneſſe ryghteouſneſſe hym dayes thou chylde ſhalt called prophete mooſt hygheſt yu ſhalt go face lorde prepare hys waye geue ye knowlege ſaluaciō vnto people ye remiſſiō theyr ſinnes thorow ye tender mercy god yt whych ye daye ſprynge frō hygh hath viſited v lyghten thē yt ſyt darkeneſſe ye ſhadow death gyde fete ye waye peace ⊢ ye chylde grewe ſtrengthed ſprete ye wylderneſſe tyl ye tyme ſhewynge iſrael ¶ ii chap ✚ befell thoſe dayes ther wente cō maundement auguſtus emperoure whole worlde ſhulde taxed thys taxynge fyrſt made vnder cyrinus debite syria wente taxed euery one hys cytie ioſeph alſo wente vp galile cytie nazareth iewry citie dauid 1 reg 15 • 6 20 b whych called bethleē becauſe houſe lynage dauid myghte taxed wyth mary hys ſpouſed wyfe beynge wyth chylde math • • fortuned whyle dayes ſhe ſhulde brynge forth fulfilled ſhe brought forth hyr fyrſt begotten ſonne ſhe wrapped hym clothes layd hym maunger ther rowme inne ther ſhepeherdes ye ſame region watchynge kepyng nyghtwatches ouer theyr flocke beholde 1 tim 3 b angell lord ſtode ye bryghtneſſe god dyd ſhyne rounde aboute abaſhed great feare angell ſayd feare beholde brynge glad tydynges greate ioye whych ſhalbe vnto people vnto thys daye borne ſaueoure cytie dauid whych chriſte lorde thys ſhalbe tokē vnto ye ſhall fynde babe wounde clothes layed maunger ſodenly wyth angell multitude heauenly hooſt prayſynge god ſayenge glory vnto god mooſt hygheſt earth peace vnto men good wyll ⊢ fortuned angel wente heauen ✚ ſhepherdes ſpake eche let v go ouer vnto bethleem let v ſe ye thynge happened whych ye lorde hath done hath ſhewed vnto v cam wyth haiſt founde mary ioſeph chylde layed maunger ſeynge remēbred ye thynge tolde thys chylde herde maruayled thynges tolde ſhepeherdes mary kepte theſe ſayenges ponderyng hyr harte ſhepeherdes returned glorifienge prayſynge god herde ſene tolde ⊢ ✚ gene 17 b whan eyghte dayes come chylde ſhulde circū ciſed hys name called ieſus luce 1 cthe whych called angel cōceaued ye wōbe ⊢ ✚ whan dayes theyr purifienge fulfylled le • 1 • b ye law moſes 1 1 brought hym ieruſalem myght preſente hym vnto lorde written lawe lorde exodi 15 • num 8 c euery manchylde ye fyrſt borne ſhalbe called halowed vnto ye lorde myght geue offerynge wrytten lawe lorde pare turtel doues two yonge pygeons beholde ther mā ieruſalem whoſe name simeon thys man ryghteous fearynge god longyng conſolacion iſrael holy gooſt wyth hym receaued anſwere ye holy gooſt yt ſhulde ſe death wythout fyrſte ſene anoynted lorde came temple ſprete whan hys elder brought chylde ieſus ſhulde hym coſtume l • uit 12 b lawe toke hym alſo hys armes bleſſed god ſayd lord letteſt thou thy ſeruaūt departe peace accordynge thy worde myne eyen haue ſene thy ſauynge health yu haſt prepared face people eſay 49 b actu 13 • lyghte lyghtenynge ye heithen prayſe thy people iſrael ⊢ ✚ hys father mother maruaylynge thynges ſayd hym simeon bleſſed ſayd vnto mary hys mother beholde thys chylde ſet fall ryſynge agayne many iſrael ſygne whych ſhalbe ſpokē agaynſt ſwearde ſhal pearſe thorow thyne owne ſoule thoughtes many harte may opened ther prophetiſſe anna ye doughter phanuel tribe aſer ſame well aged lyued ſeuē yeare frō hir virginite wt hyr huſbande ye ſame wedowe vntyl foureſcore foure yeare whych departed frō temple ſeruynge god nyght day faſtinges praiers ye ſame cam forth ſame houre praiſed ye lorde ſpake hym vnto wayted redēption iſrael whan perfourmed al thynges accordynge lawe ye lorde dyd returne agayn galile theyr cytie nazareth chylde grewe waxed ſtronge ſprete full wyſdom grace god wyth hym ⊢ hys elder went euery yeare ieruſalem feaſte daye eaſter ✚ whā twolue year olde wente vp ieruſalē exod 23 b 34 c leui 23 • coſtume feaſte whan dayes finyſhed returned agayne ye chylde ieſus remayned ieruſalē hys elder knew thynkyng hym cōpany came back one dayes iournye ſought hym amonge kynſfolkes acquayntaūces fyndynge hym went agayn hym math 8 b marc 1 c whan sonne gone downe ſycke diuerſe diſeaſes brought hym layeng hys handes vppon euery one thē healed thē marci • b deuels wente many cryenge ſayenge thou arte ſonne god rebukyng ſuffered ſpeake knewe hym chriſte whan become daye beynge gone forth went deſerte place people ſoughte hym came vntyl hym helde hym le • ſhulde go vnto whome ſayde muſte preache goſpell kyngdome vnto cyties alſo ⊢ thereto ſente preachynge ſynagoges galile v chapter ✚ math 4 c marci 1 came paſſe whan ye people preaſſed vpon myght heare worde god ſtode lake geneſareth ſawe two ſhippes ſtandynge lake fyſhers gone downe dyd waſhe theyr nettes goynge vp one ſhippes whych simōs prayed hym thruſt lytle lande ſyttynge taughte people lytle ſhippe lefte ſpeakynge ſayd vnto simon launch oute depe let ſlyppe youre nettes make draught simon anſwerynge ſayd vnto hym mayſter labourynge al ye nyght haue caught nothynge vpon thy worde wyll lowſe nette whan done incloſed great multitude fyſhes theyr net dyd breake made ſygnes theyr fellowes ye ſhippe yt ſhuld come helpe came fylled lytle ſhippes inſomuch ſanke nearehande whych whan simon peter ſaw fell downe ieſus knyes ſayenge go fro lorde ſynfull man aſtonnyed wyth hym draughte fyſhes toke lykewyſe alſo iames ihon chyldren zebede simon fellowes ieſus ſayde vnto simon feare henceforth ſhalte thou takynge men ſhippes beynge broughte lande math 4 • thynges beyng left followed ⊢ math 8 marci • fortuned one cyties beholde man full leproſy ſeynge ieſus fallynge downe vpon hys face beſought hym ſayenge lorde yf thou wylte thou canſt clenſe ſtretchynge hys hande touched hym ſaynge wyll clenſed immediatly leproſy departed hym cōmaūded hym ſhulde tel vnto nomā go ſhewe thyſelfe vnto preſtes offer thy clenſynge leuit 14 • moſes hath commaunded wytneſſe vnto noyſe hym wente farther abrode ther came much people myght heare hym healed theyr diſeaſes wente aſyde wylderneſſe prayed ✚ math 9 marci 2 befell vpon daye ſat waye myght bryng people clymmed vp vpō thacke thorow ye tylynges let hym downe wyth bedde myddes ieſus whoſe fayth dyd ſe ſayd man thy ſynnes forgeuen ye ſcribes phariſes began thynke ſayenge thys ye may knowe ſonne mā hath power earth forgeue ſynnes ſayd vnto ſycke palſye ſaye vnto aryſe take vp thy bed go thy houſe ſtrayghte waye ryſynge afore toke vp hys bedde wherein laye wente hys houſe prayſynge god aſtonnyed prayſed god fylled wyth feare ſayenge haue ſene maruaylous thynges daye ⊢ math • marc 2 b luc • ▪ 15 thys wēte forth ſawe publicane name leui ſyttynge receate cuſtome ſayd diſciples ihon faſt ofte praye diſciples phariſes lykewyſe thyne eate drynke vnto whome ſayde ye make chyldren brydegrome faſt ſo lon • e bryde •• ome wyth them▪ daye • ſhal come whā • brydegrome ſhalbe takē frō thē thā ſhal faſt thoſe dayes ſayde alſo ſimilitude vnto thē nomā putteth pece new garmente olde garment el breaketh new pece new agreeth wyth ye olde noman putteth new wyne olde bottels el ſhal new wyne burſt bottels ſhall runne bottels ſhall peryſh new wyne muſt put new bottels ſaued noman drynkyng olde wyl ſtrayght waye haue new ſayeth olde better vi chapter fortuned vpon principall ſabbatmath 12 • marc 2 • whā wente thorowe ye corne felde hys diſciples plucked vp eares corne dyd eate rubbynge wyth theyr handes ſome phariſes ſayd vnto ye lawfull ſabbates ieſus thē ſonne man lorde alſo ye ſabbat ✚ math 12 b marci 3 fortuned vpon another sabbat daye entred synagoge taught ther man hys ryghthād wythered ye ſcrybese pharyſes watched whethe wold heale hym sabbat yt myght fynde wherof accuſe hym knew theyr thoughtes ſayd vnto man wythered hande aryſe ſtande myddes ryſyng ſtode vp ieſus ſayd vnto axe lawfull good vpō sabbat euell ſaue lyfe deſtroye brother iames ihon philippe bartholomew mathew thomas iames ye ſōne alpheus simon whyche called zelotes iude ſonne iames iudas iſcariot traytoure ✚ cōmynge downe wyth ſtode vpon playne felded place cōpany hys diſciples math 4 c mar 3 great multitude people al iewry ieruſalem ſee coaſt tyre sidon whych come myght heare hym myght healed theyr diſeaſes vexed vncleane ſpr • te healed al people ſought touche hym ther wente power hym healed math 5 hys eye lyfted vpon hys diſciples ſayd bleſſed ye poore youres kyngdome god bleſſed ye hunger ye ſhalbe ſatiſfyed bleſſed ye wepe ye ſhall laugh bleſſed ſhall ye whā men ſhal hate whan ſhall ſeparate reuyle caſt awaye name euell ſonne man ſake reioyce ye glad lo reward plenteous heauen ⊢ thys wyſe dyd theyr father vnto prophetes amos 6 neuertheles wo vnto rych whyche haue conſolacion wo vnto yt ful ye ſhall hunger wo vnto yt laughe ye ſhall wayle wepe wo vnto whan men bleſſe thys wyſe dyd theyr father vnto falſe prophetes ſaye vnto heare loue enemyes well vnto hate bleſſe curſe praye wrongfully trouble ſo ſmyteth one cheke offer hym alſo math 5 • hym taketh awaye thy garment forbyd coate alſo vnto euery one axeth geue yt taketh away ye thynges thyne axe hym thē agayne tobi 4 c ecclī 31 b math 7 • ye wyl men vnto ye ſo vnto lykewyſe mat 5 yf ye loue ye loue thanke haue ye ſynners loue theyr louers alſo yf ye ſhall good vnto good thanke haue ye ſynners alſo yf ye lende vnto whome ye hope receaue agayn thanke haue ye ſynners lēde vnto ſynners yt may receaue ſomuch agayne neuertheleſſe loue ye youre enemyes well lende therfore loue hym mooſt simon anſwerynge ſayde ſuppoſe forgaue moſt ſayde thou haſt iudged ryghte beynge turned woman ſayde vnto simon seyſte thou thys woman entred thy houſe thou gaueſte fete water ſhe hath wetted fete wyth teares dryed wyth hyr heeres thou haſte geuen kyſſe ſhe ſence ſhe came ceaſſed kyſſe fete thou haſt anoynted heade wyth oyle ſhe hath anoynted fete wyth oyntmente wherfore poſſeſſe lyfe euerlaſtynge ſayd vnto hym wrytten lawe doeſt thou reade anſwerynge ſayd deu 6 b thou ſhalt loue lorde thy god wyth thy harte wyth thy ſoule wyth thy ſtrengthe wyth thy mynde leuit 19 e rom • 3 b thy neghboure thy ſelfe ſayd vnto hym thou haſt anſwered ryght thou ſhalte lyue ⊢ wyllynge iuſtifye hymſelfe ſayde vnto ieſus neghboure ieſus lokynge vp ſayde ✚ certayne man wente downe ieruſalem hierico fell amonge murtherers alſo ſpoiled layed ſtrypes hym wente awaye hym beyng lefte halfe dead chaunced preſt wente downe ſame waye ſeynge hym wente lykewyſe alſo leuite whan place ſawe hym wente samaritane nyenge came hym ſeynge hym moued pytie cōmyng neare boūde vp hys woū de pourynge oyle wyne thē layenge hym vpon hys beaſt brought hym ynne prouyded hym nexte daye toke two pen gaue vnto hooſt ſayde take hede hym ſo euer thou layeſt whan come agayne ſhal reſtore whych theſe thre thynkeſt thou haue bene neghboure vnto hym fell amonge murtherers ſayd ſhewed mercy hym ieſus ſayd vnto hym go thy waye thou lykewyſe ⊢ ✚ fortuned wente entred certain towne certayne womā martha name receaued hyr houſe ſhe ſyſter name mary whyche alſo deut 33 ſyttynge lordes fete herde worde martha buſyed ſelfe greatly aboute muche ſeruyng ſtode ſayde▪ lorde careſt thou ſyſter letteth ſerue alone tell therfore ſhe helpe lorde anſwerynge ſayd vnto martha martha thou arte carefull cō bred many thynges pſal 26 one thynge nedefull mary hath choſen beſt part whych ſhal taken ⊢ xi chapter ✚ fortuned place prayenge lefte one hys diſciples ſayd vnto hym lorde teache v praye ihon taught hys diſciples ſayd vnto math 6 whan ye praye ſaye father hallowed thy name thy kyngdome come thy wyl done geue v thys daye dayly bread forgeue v oure ſynnes alſo forgeue vnto euery one oweth v leade v tentacion ⊢ ſayde vnto ✚ whych ſhall haue frēde ſhall go vnto mydnyght ſhall ſaye vnto hym frende lende thre loaues frende myne come vnto oute waye haue may ſet hym wythin anſwerynge ſaye trouble dore ſhut childrē wyth chamber ryſe geue yf continue knockynge ſaye vnto though ryſynge geue hym becauſe hys frende yet ſhall ryſe becauſe hys vnſhamefaſtneſſe ſhall geue hym ſo many hath nede pro 8 b math 7 ioha 14 b 15 b 16 c ſaye vnto axe ſhalbe geuen seke ye ſhal fynde knock vnto ſhalbe opened euery one axeth receaueth ſeketh fyndeth vnto hym ye knocketh ſhalbe opened yf axe hys father bread wyll geue hym ſtone yf ſhall axe fyſh wyll ſteade fyſh geue hym ſerpente yf ſhall axe egge wyll reach hym ſcorpion yf ye whan ye euell geue good gyftes vnto chyldren howe muche ſhall father heauē geue good ſprete vnto axe hym ⊢ ✚ math 9 12 c caſtynge deuell domme whan caſt deuell dōme dyd ſpeake people maruayled marc • bbut ſome ſayd beelzebub prince deuels doth caſt deuels tempting hym requyred tokē heauen whā ſawe ye thoughtes theyr harte ſayd vnto thē euery kyngdome diuided ſelfe ſhalbe deſolate houſe ſhall fall vpō houſe yf satan diuided hymſelfe ſhall hys kingdome ſtande seynge ye ſaye caſt deuels beelzebub yf dryue deuels beelzebub chyldren caſt therfore ſhal iudges moreouer yf caſt deuels ye fynger god thā verely ye kyngdome god come vpō marc 12 c whā ſtrōge mā beyng harneſſed kepeth hys houſe thoſe thynges yt poſſeſſeth reſt collo 2 b yf one ſtrōger thā fallynge vpon ouercōme ſhal take away al weapēs whych truſted ſhal diſtribute hys ſpoyles wyth agaynſt gathereth wyth ſcattereth abrode math 12 c whan vncleane ſprete gone mā walketh thorowe drye place ſekynge reſt fyndynge ſayeth wyll returne agayne houſe whence wente whan cōmeth fyndeth vnto hym bleſſed wombe hath borne breſtes gaue ſuck ſayd yee bleſſed heare ye worde god kepe ⊢ people runnynge together began ſaye math 12 marci 8 b thys generaciō wycked generacion ſeketh token ther ſhall token geuen hym ſaue ye token prophete ionas io •• 2 3 b lyke ionas token vnto niniuites euen ſo ſhall alſo ye ſonne man vnto thys generacion 3 reg 10 2 pa • 9 quene south ſhall ryſe iudgement abundaunce poſſeſſeth tolde ſimilitude ſayeng certayne rych mās felde brought forth plēteous frutes thought hymſelfe ſayeng ſhal haue wherin may gather frutes ſayd thys wyll wyl breake downe barnes xiii chapter ther ſome preſent tyme ſhewynge hym ac •• 5 • galilean whoſe bloude pilate dyd mixe wt theyr ſacrifices anſwerynge ſayd vnto thynke ye yt thoſe galilean ſynners galilean becauſe ſuffred ſuch thynges tell naye excepte ye haue repentaūce ye ſhall peryſh lykewyſe thoſe eyghtene vppon whome tower siloe fel kylled suppoſe ye alſo better al men dwellyng ieruſalem tell yf ye haue repentaunce ye ſhal dye lykewyſe ſayd alſo thys ſimilitude ✚ math 21 b acertayne man hadde fygge tre planted hys vyneyarde came ſekynge frute theron founde none ſayde vnto dreſſer vyneyarde lo thre yeare ago ſence come ſekyng frute thys fygge tre fynde none hew downe therfore doth alſo combre groūde anſwerynge ſayd vnto hym syr let alone alſo thys yeare tyll dygge aboute doūge yf happely wyll brynge frute yf thou ſhalt hewe downe afterwarde teachynge theyr synagoge vpon ſabbattes beholde woman whych ſprete ſyckneſſe eyghtene yeare • roked nother coulde loke vp ony thynge whome whan ieſus 18 b euery one exalteth hymſelfe ſhalbe made lowe hūbleth ſelfe ſhalbe exalted ⊢ ſayd alſo vnto hym bydden hym whan thou makeſt dyner ſupper call thy frendes thy brother thy kynſfolkes nother thy neghboures ryche leſte byd agayne recompence made vnto tobi 4 c whan thou makeſt feaſt call poore feble crepell blynde happy ſhalte thou haue recōpēce ſhalbe recōpē ced ye reſurreccion ryghteous whan one ſat borde herd ſaid vnto hym happy ſhal eate breade kyngdome god ſayd vnto hym ✚ math 22 apoc 19 c certayne mā made great ſupper called many ſente hys ſeruaunt houre ſupper ſaye vnto bydden yt thy ſhulde come thynges ready al began alyke make excuſe fyrſt ſayd vnto hym haue bought farme muſt nedes go forth ſe pray haue excuſed ſayde haue boughte fyue yocke ox go proue pray haue excuſed thyrde ſayd haue maryed wyfe therfore come ye ſeruaūte beynge returned ſhewed thys vnto hys lorde good man ye houſe beynge angrye ſayde vnto hys ſeruaunte go quyckely ye ſtretes quarter cytie brynge nedy crepell blynde halte ſeruaunt ſayd lorde done thou haſt commaunded ther yet rowme ye lorde ſaid vnto ſeruaunt go hygh wayes hedge gene 19 luce 24 c cōpell come houſe may fylled ſaye vnto none thoſe men bydden ſhal tayſt ſupper ⊢ ther wēt much people wyth hym beynge turned ſayd vnto deut 13 • math 10 • 16 dwho ſo commeth vnto doth hate hys father mother wyfe chyldren brother ſyſters yee hys owne lyfe alſo diſciple ſo beareth hys croſſe commeth diſciple whych wyllyng buyld tower ſyttynge downe rekeneth fyrſt coſtes neceſſary whether haue ſufficient perfourme left haue layde fundament able perfourm • ſe begyn mocke hym ſayenge thys man hath begon buylde able perfourme kynge ſhall go make battayll agaynſte another kynge ſyttynge downe caſteth fyrſt hys mynde whether wyth ten thouſande able mete hym cōmeth agaynſt hym wt twenty thouſande el whyle yet farre ſendynge embaſſage doth requyre thynges belōge peace euen ſo therfore euery one doth renounce yt poſſeſſeth diſciple math 5 b mar 9 • salt good yf ſalt vnſauery wherin ſhall ſeaſoned nother profytable vpō ye lande vpon dounge hyll ſhal caſt awaye hath eares heare let hym heare xv chapter ✚ ther math 9 b marci 2 b luce 5 approchynge vnto hym publicanes ſynners myght heare hym ſcribes phariſes murmured ſayeng luce 5 7 • thys man receaueth ſinners eateth wyth tolde parable vnto ſayenge math 18 b man amonge hath hundreth ſhepe yf loſe one doth leaue nyne nynty wylderneſſe goeth loſt vntyll fynde whan hath foūde layeth vpon hys ſhulders reioycynge commynge home calleth together hys frendes neghboures ſayeng vnto reioyce wyth haue foūde ſhepe loſt ſaye vnto lyke ioye ſhalbe heauen ouer one ſynner doynge penaunce ouer nyne nynty ryghteous luce 5 • nede penaunce woman hauynge ten grotes yf ſhe leſe one grote doth ſhe lyght candle ſwepeth ye houſe ſeketh diligētly tyll ſhe haue foūde whan ſhe hath founde ſhe calleth together hyr frendes neghboureſſes ſayeng reioyce haue founde grote loſt euen ſo ſaye vnto ſhall ther ioye angel god vpon one ſynner doynge penaunce ⊢ ✚ ſayd certayne man two ſonnes yonger ſayd vnto hys father father geue porcion goodes belongeth vnto diuided ſubſtaunce vnto longe thereafter thynges beynge gathered together yonger ſonne wente forth farre contry wayſted hys goodes wyth lyuynge ryotouſly ſpente ther happened greate derth region beganne wante wente ioyned hymſelfe vnto one cyteſins contrye ſent hym hys farme ſhuld fede ſwyne coueted fyll hys belly wyth coddes ſwyne dyd eate noman gaue hym beynge come hymſelfe ſayde many hyred ſeruauntes father houſe haue plentye breades peryſhe honger wyll ryſe go father ſhall ſaye vnto hym father haue ſynned heauen nowe worthy called thy ſonne make one thy hyred ſeruauntes ryſynge vp came hys father pſal 31 iob 13 b whan yet farre hys father ſawe hym moued wyth pytie runnyng hym fell aboute hys necke kyſſed hym ſonne ſayde vnto hym father haue ſynned heauen nowe worthy called thy ſonne father ſayd vnto hys ſeruaūtes brynge forth quyckely beſt garment put vpon geue hym rynge vpon hys hāde ſhues hys fete brynge hether fed calfe kyll let v eate let v merye thys ſonne dead reuiued loſte founde began mery hys elder ſonne ye felde whan dyd come approched houſe herde ye minſtrelſye daunſynge called one ſeruauntes axed theſe thynges ſame ſaid vnto thy brother • ome thy father hath ſlayne fed calfe becauſe hath receaued hym ſafe wroth wolde go wherfore hys father beynge gone beganne intreate hym anſwerynge ſayd vnto hys father lo thus many yeares ſerue neuer dyd trāſgreſſe thy commaundemente thou neuer gaueſt kyd myghte mery wyth frendes thys thy ſonne hath deuoured hys ſubſtaunce wyth harlottes come thou haſt ſlayne hym fed calfe ſayd vnto hym ſonne thou arte alwaye wyth myne thyne thou oughteſt haue ben mery reioyced thys thy brother dead reuiued loſte founde ⊢ xvi chapter ✚ ſayd vnto hys diſciples ther certayn rych man whych ſtewarde ſame accuſed vnto hym wayſted hys goodes called hym ſayde vnto hym howe heare geue accompte thy ſtewardſhippe thou mayeſt nomore ſtewarde ſtewarde ſayde wythin hymſelfe ſhall lorde taketh ſtewardſhip fro dygge begge aſhamed know ſhall whan ſhalbe put ſtewardſhip may take theyr houſes euery one therfore hys lordes detters beynge called together ſayd vnto ye fyrſt howe muche oweſt thou vnto lorde ſayd hundreth tō ne oyle ſayd vnto hym take thy byll ſyt downe quyckely wryte fyftye ſayde vnto another muche oweſt thou whych ſayd hundreth quarter wheate ſayd vnto hym take thy byl wryte foureſcore lorde commended vnryghteous ſtewarde becauſe done wyſely chyldrē thys worlde wyſer chyldren lyght theyr generacion ſaye vnto make frendes wyth mammon vnryghteouſneſſe whan ye ſhall haue nede may receaue euerlaſtynge tabernacle ⊢ faythful leeſt alſo faythful greater vnryghteous lytle alſo vnryghteous greater yf ye therfore haue ben faythful vnryghteous mammon wyll truſte true yf ye haue ben faythfull another mās buſyneſſe wyll geue math 6 cno ſeruaunte ſerue two mayſters ether ſhall hate one loue el ſhal cleue vnto one deſpyſe ye ſerue god mammon theſe thinges herde phariſes whych couetous mocked hym ſayd vnto ye whych iuſtifye ſelues men god knoweth harte hyghe men abhominacion god math 11 b lawe prophetes prophecied vntyll ihon frō thence kyngdome god preached euery one preaſſeth vpon violence eſay 40 math 5 b eaſyer heauen earth paſſe awaye one tytle lawe fal math 5 9 b marci 10 euery one leaueth hys wyfe maryeth another commytteth aduoutry maryeth lefte hyr huſbande committeth aduoutry ✚ ther certayne rych man clothed wyth purple fyne lynnen fared euery daye deliciouſly ther certayne poore man name lazarus laye hys dore beynge full ſores deſyrynge ſatiſfyed wyth crommes fell frō rychmās table nomā gaue hym dogges came lycked hys ſores happened poore mā dyed caryed abrahās boſome angel rych man dyed alſo buryed hell whan payne lyftynge vp hys eye ſawe abrahā afarre lazarus hys boſome cryenge ſayd father abraham haue mercy vpon ſēde lazarus dyppe typpe hys fynger water maye coole tunge payned thys flame abraham ſayd vnto hym sonne gala 6 remembre yt thou haſt receaued good thy lyfe lazarus lykewyſe euell comforted thou arte payned beſydes al • thys ther great ſpace ſet betwene v ſo yt wyl go hence vnto cā nother paſſe frō thēce hether ſayd praye thā father yu ſende hym father houſe haue fyue brethrē teſtifye vnto leſt alſo come thys place tormētes abraham ſayd vnto hym haue moſes prophetes let thē heare thoſe ſayd father abraham yf ony ye dead went ſhall penaūce ſayd vnto hym yf hear moſes prophetes ſhall beleue though one roſe frō dead ⊢ xvii chapter ſayd vnto hys diſciples math 18 marci 9 • impoſſible ye offēces ſhuld come wo vnto ye mā whō come better hym yf mylſtone hāged necke caſt ſee thā ſhuld offēde one theſe lytle one take hede ſelues math 18 b yf thy brother ſynne agaynſt rebuke hym yf repente forgeue hym though ſynne ſeuē tymes againſt daye turned ſeuen tymes daye ſaynge repē teth forgeue apoſtles ſaid vnto lorde increace fayth vnto v lord ſayd math 17 c 21 c yf ye ſhall haue fayth grane muſtarde ſede ye ſhall ſaye vnto moulbery tre ro • ted planted ſe ſhal obey hauynge ſeruaunte goynge plough fedynge oxē yt wyl ſay vnto beyng come felde go quyckely ſyt downe meate ſayeth rather make ready yt may ſuppe gyrde vp thy ſelfe ſerue tyl haue eaten dronken thys ſhalte thou eate drynke doth thanke ſeruaunt becauſe hath done hath cōmaūded hym thynke lykewyſe ye whā ye haue done al thynges yt cō maunded ſaye ye vnprofytable ſeruaūtes haue done deuty ✚ fortuned went ieruſalē paſſed thorow myddes samaria galile entred towne ther met hym ten leperous men whyche ſtode afarre lyft vp theyr voyce ſayng ieſu maſter haue mercy vpon v ſawe ſayde go leuit 14 ſhewe ſelues vnto ye preſtes chaūced wēt clenſed one ſaw yt clē ſed returned magnifyenge god wyth loude voyce fell vpon hys face hys fete geuyng thā kes thys samaritane ieſus anſwerynge ſayd ther ten clenſed ye nyne ther none foūde cam agayne gaue prayſe vnto god ſaue thys ſtraunger ſayde vnto hym ryſe go thy waye thy fayth hath ſaued ⊢ whan demaunded ye phariſes wh • n kyngdome god commeth anſwerynge ſaid • kyngdome god ſhall come wyth waytynge mat 24 b mar 13 c nother ſhall ſaye lo lo beholde kyngdome god wythin ſayde vnto hys diſciples dayes ſhall come whan ye ſhall deſyre ſe ought pray • teſſa 5 • alwayes leaue ſayenge ther certayne iudge certayne cytie feared god ſtode awe nomā ther certayn wedowe ye ſame cytie cam hym ſayeng auenge myne aduerſary wolde great ſeaſon thys ſaid wythin hymſelfe though drede god ſtāde awe nomā yet becauſe thys wedowe troublous vnto wyll auenge leſt ſhe commynge laſt reuyle lorde ſayd heare ye vnryghteous iudge ſayeth ſhall god alſo auenge hys choſen cryenge vnto hym daye nyght though haue paciēce wyth tell ſhall ſhortly auenge neuertheleſſe ſonne man cōmyng trowe ye ſhall fynde fayth earth ✚ vnto ſome truſted thē ſelues ryghteous deſpyſed tolde thys parable ſayenge two men wente vp temple praye one phariſe ye publicane phariſe ſtā dynge prayed thys hymſelfe deut 26 c eccli 7 thanke god men ye robber vnryghteous aduouterous ether publican faſt twiſe ye weke geue tethes al yt poſſeſſe ye publicane ſtandynge afarre wolde lyfte vp hys eyen heauē ſmote vpon hys breſt ſayeng god mercyfull vnto ſynner tell thys mā wēt downe houſe iuſtifyed vnlyke ye math 23 b luco 14 b ſoeuer exalteth hymſelfe ſhalbe brought lowe ſo hūbleth hymſelfe ſhalbe exalted ⊢ math 19 b marc 10 b brought yōge chyldrē alſo hym yt ſhulde touch thē whych whan ye diſciples ſawe rebuked thē ieſus callyng thē together ſayde let ye chyldren come vnto forbyd thē vnto ſuch lyke pertayneth ye kyngdome god verely ſaye vnto ſo euer taketh ye kyngdome god chyld ſhal entre math 19 c marc 10 b certayne ruler axed hym ſayenge good mayſter wyth doynge ſhal poſſeſſe lyfe euerlaſtynge ieſus ſayde vnto hym doeſt thou cal good ther noman good ſaue god knoweſt thou commaundemētes exodi 20 c thou ſhalt kyl thou ſhalt commytte aduoutry thou ſhalt ſteale thou ſhalte beare falſe wytneſſe honoure thy father mother whych ſayd theſe haue kepte frō youth vp ieſus hauynge herde ſayde vnto hym one thynge yet wantynge vnto sell thou haſt geue vnto poore thou ſhalte haue treaſure heauē come follow thys beynge herd ſory rych ieſus ſeynge hym made ſorowfull ſayd math 19 c marci 10 c hardly ſhall yt haue mony entre kyngdome god eaſyer camel go thorowe eye nedle rych entre kyngdom god herde ſaid thā ſaued ſayd vnto lu • e 1 • thoſe thynges wer ſpoken math 20 b marc 10 • chaunced whan came neare hierico certayne blynde man ſat beggynge ye waye whan herde ye people goynge axed tolde hym ieſus nazareth dyd go cryed ſayeng ieſu thou ſōne dauid haue mercy vpon wente afore rebuked hym ſhuld hold hys peace cryed much thou ſonne dauid haue mercy vpon ieſus ſtandynge cō maunded hym brought vnto hym whā come neare axed hym ſayenge wylte thou ſhall vnto ſayd lorde maye ſe ieſus ſayd vnto hym se thy fayth hath made ſafe forthwyth ſawe followed hym magnifyenge god people ſawe gaue prayſe vnto god ⊢ xix chapter ✚ beyng gone walked thorowe hierico beholde man name zacheus thys ruler ye publicanes ryche ſought ſe ieſus could ye people lytle ſtature rūnynge afore climmed vpon wylde fyggetre yt myght ſe hym come waye whā come place ieſus lokinge vp ſawe hym ſayd vnto hym zache come downe hayſtyngly daye muſt abyde thy houſe came downe haſtyngly receaued hym actu 16 e ioyfully whan euery man ſawe murmured ſayenge gone vnto ſynner zacheus ſtandyng ſaid vnto ye lord beholde lord halfe goodes geue vnto poore yf haue begyled ony man geue foure double agayne ieſus ſayd vnto hym thys daye health happened vnto thys houſe
