therfore ✚ math 2 • marci 13 certayne noble man wente farre contry receaue hym kyngdome returne agaynt hys ten ſeruaū te beynge called gaue ten pounde ſayd vnto occupye vntyll come hys cyteſins hated hym ſente meſſage hym ſayeng wyl haue thys raygne ouer v fortuned yt came agayne receaued ye kyngdome cōmaūded ſeruaūtes called vnto whō geuen mony myght know muche euery one occupyed fyrſt came ſayenge lord thy poūde hath wōne tē poūde ſaid vnto ey thou good ſeruaūt becauſe yu haſt ben faythfull lytle yu ſhalt hauynge power ouer ten cyties ſeconde cam ſayenge lorde thy poūde hath gayned fyue pounde vnto hym ſayd yu ouer fyue cyties thyrde came ſayenge lorde beholde thy pounde whych layed vp napken afrayed becauſe yu art hard mā thou takeſt vp yu haſt layed downe reapeſt yu haſte ſowen ſayd vnto hym 2 reg 1 • math 12 thyne owne mouth iudge yu wycked ſeruaunte kneweſt yu hard mā takyng vp haue layed reapyng yt haue ſowē wherfore gaueſt yu mony exchaunge bancke cōmynge ſhulde haue requyred myne wyth auauntage ſayde vnto ſtode take poūde frō hym geue hym yt hath ten poūde ſaid vnto lord hath ten poūde ſaye vnto math 13 • 25 c marc 4 c luce 8 bthat vnto yt hath ſhalbe geuē ſhal haue abūdaūce frō hym hath ſhalbe taken alſo yt hath moreouer thoſe myne enemyes wolde haue raygne ouer brynge hether ſlaye theſe wordes beynge ſayd wente afore goynge vp ieruſalem ⊢ math 21 • marci 1 • • fortuned whan cam near bethphage bethany vnto mounte called oliuete ſente two hys diſciples ſayenge go towne ouer agaynſte entrynge whych ye ſhall fynde aſſes foale tyed vpon whyche noman hath euer ſytten lowſe brynge hether yf ony man axe wherfore ye lowſe ſaye ye ſo vnto hym lorde requyreth hys vſe ſente wente theyr waye fande foale ſtā dynge ſayde vnto lowſed foale ye owner therof ſayd vnto ye lowſe foale ſayd becauſe lorde hath nede brought vnto ieſus caſtynge theyr clothes vpon foale ſet ieſus theron iohā 12 b vnder hym goynge ſtrowed theyr garmentes waye whan came neare goyng downe mounte oliuete multitude hys diſciples reioycynge beganne wyth loude voyce prayſe god ouer ye miracle ſene ſayenge luce •• bleſſed cōmeth kynge name lorde ephe 2 c 22 c marc 12 b ther came hym ſome saduces actu 23 whych denye reſurreccion axed hym ſayeng maſter moſes hath wrytten vnto v deu 25 yf ony mās brother dead hauyng wyfe wythout chyldren yt hys brother take wyfe rayſe vp ſede vnto hys brother ther ſeuen brethrē fyrſt toke wyfe dyed chyldleſſe nexte toke alſo dyed wythout chylde thyrde toke lykewyſe alſo ſeuen haue lefte ſede dyed laſt dyed ye woman alſo reſurreccion therfore whoſe wyfe ſhal ſhe ſeuen wyfe ieſus ſayd vnto chyldren thys worlde mary maryed ſhalbe worthye worlde reſurreccion dead ſhal nother mary men mary wyues nother able dye ony equall wyth ye angel 1 ioha 3 chyldren god ſeynge chyldren reſurrecciō dead ryſe agayne hath moſes alſo ſhewed buſh calleth exod 3 lorde god abraham god iſaac god iacob god dead lyuynge lyue vnto hym ſome ſcrybes anſwerynge ſayde vnto hym mayſter yu haſt ſayd well durſt axe hym ony thynge math 22 marc 12 ſaid vnto ſaye chriſt dauids ſōne dauid himſelf ſayeth ye boke pſalmes pſal 109 lord ſayd vnto lord ſyt thou ryghte hande tyll ſet thyne enemyes ſtoole thy fete dauid thā calleth lord hys ſōne math 23 marc 12 luce 11 people geuynge eare ſayd vnto hys diſciples beware ſcrybes whych wyll aduerſaryes ſhal able wtſtāde gaynſay mich 7 ye ſhalbe delyuered vp elder brother kynſfolkes frēdes ſhall put ſome death ye ſhalbe hated euery man name ſake one heere heade ſhall peryſh pacience ſhall ye poſſeſſe ſoules mat 24 b marci 13 b whan ye ſhall ſe ieruſalem beſeged wyth hooſt ſure wayſtynge come neare let iewry flye vnto moūtaynes myddes let auoyde contryes let thē entre theſe dayes vengeaūce thynges maye fulfylled yt wrytten wo vnto wyth chylde geuynge ſucke thoſe dayes ther ſhalbe greate anguyſh vpon earth wrath vnto thys people ſhall fal thorowe edge ſwearde ſhal led preſoners amonge naciōs rom 11 dand ieruſalē ſhalbe troden downe heythen vntyll tymes heythen ſhalbe fulfylled ✚ ezech 38 c • ce 10 b mat 24 c marc 13 c apoc 16 c ther ſhalbe token sonne moone ſtarres vpon earth anguyſh men confuſion ſoūde ſee floudes men pynynge awaye feare waytynge thoſe thynges whych ſhall come vpō al ye world ye power heauen ſhalbe moued eſa 19 luc 17 c iohā 1 e ſhall ſe ſonne man come cloude wyth great power maieſte theſe thynges begynnynge befall loke vp lyft vp heades youre redemption draweth nye tolde ſimilitude mat 24 c mar • 3 beholde fygge tre al tree whā bring forth frute thēſelues ye ſure ye ſōmer hāde euen ſo ye alſo whā ye ſe theſe thynges done ſure yt kyngdō god hāde verely ſaye vnto yt thys generaciō ſhal paſſe tyl al thinges done mayſter ſendeth ye worde geſthouſe wherin may eat eaſterlābe wt diſciples ſhall ſhewe great parloure paued make ready goynge dyd fynde ſayd vnto made ready eaſterlābe whan houre come ſat downe borde praye leſt ye fal temptacion math 26 dand hymſelfe thē ſo much ſtones caſt knelyng prayed ſayng father yf yu wylt remoue thys cup fro neuertheleſſe wyll iohā 6 thyne done ther appeared vnto hym angell frō heauen cōfortyng hym beyng wreſtelyng wt death prayed ye longer hys ſweate became droppes bloude trycklyng downe ye groūd whā ryſen frō ye prayer come hys diſciples fande ſlepynge ſorow ſayde vnto ſlepe ye aryſe praye leſt ye come tētaciō mat 26 c marc 14 c ioha 18 awhyle yet ſpake beholde ye multitude one ye twelfe called iudas went cam neare ieſu myght kyſſe hym ieſus ſayde vnto hym iudas doeſt thou betraye ſonne man kyſſe yt hym ſeynge come ſayd vnto hym lorde ſhall ſmyte wyth ſweard one ſmote hyghe preſtes ſeruaunt cut hys ryght eare ieſus anſweryng ſayd let thē alone wyll therfore let hym lowſe beynge chaſtiſed muſt haue let lowſe one vnto feaſt math 27 marci 15 b whole multitude cryed ſayenge take awaye thys let barrabas lowſe vnto v whyche vproure cytie manſlaughter cōmitted put preſon pilate wyllyng delyuer ieſus ſpake vnto agayn cryed ſaynge crucifye crucifye hym ſayd thyrd tyme vnto euel hath thys done fynde cauſe death hym ſhall therfore whych wepte bewayled hym ieſus beynge turned vnto thē ſayd ye doughters ieruſalem wepe vpon wepe vpon ſelues vpon chyldrē beholde dayes ſhall come ſhall ſaye happy baren wōbes haue brought forth truely ryſen hath appeared vnto simō told thynges done ye waye knewe hym ye breakynge breade ⊢ iohā • 0 c whyle ſpake theſe thynges ✚ ieſus ſtode myddeſt ſayeth peace vnto feare beynge abaſhed afrayed thought ſene ſpret ſayd vnto ye troubled thoughtes ryſe harte loke vpon handes fete ſelfe handle ſe ſprete hath fleſh bone ye ſe haue ſayd ſhewed hys handes fete vnto yet beleuynge wonderynge ioy ſayd iohā 21 b haue ye ony thynge maye eaten brought pece broyled fyſh hony combe whan eaten takyn ye leauynges gaue vnto ſayd vnto math 6 b theſe wordes dyd ſpeake vnto whan yet wyth thynges muſte nedes fulfylled whych wrytten ye law moſes prophetes pſalmes opened vnto theyr vnderſtandyng ſhulde vnderſtande ſcriptures ſayd vnto actu 17 thus wrytten thus behoued chriſt ſuffre ryſe agayne iordane iohā • • 10 b ihon baptyſyng ⊢ ✚ nexte day dyd ihon ſe ieſus cōmynge hym ſayd beholde eſai • 5 b 1 co • 5 b lambe god beholde whyche taketh awaye ſynnes worlde thys dyd ſaye commeth mā whych made yer knewe hym becauſe might made knowen iſrael fore come baptiſynge wyth water math 3 b marc 1 luce 3 c ihon dyd beare recorde ſayenge ſawe ſprete commynge downe heauē lyke doue abode vpon hym knewe hym ſente baptyſe wyth water ſayd vnto upon whome ſo euer thou ſhalte ſe ſprete come downe abydynge vpon hym ſame baptyſeth holy gooſt haue ſene haue borne recorde ſame ſonne god ⊢ ✚ nexte daye agayne ſtode ihon two hys diſciples ſeynge ieſus walkynge ſaid beholde exod 12 eſa 53 blābe god two diſciples herde hym ſpeakynge followed ieſus ieſus beynge turned aboute ſeynge followynge hym ſayeth vnto ſeke ye whych ſayd vnto hym rabbi whyche interpreted ſaye mayſter dwelleſt thou ſayeth vnto come ſe came ſawe dwelled abode wyth hym daye nearehāde tenth houre andrewe ye brother simon peter one tweyne whych herde ihon followed hym ſame dyd fyrſte fynde hys brother simon ſayeth vnto hym haue founde meſſias whiche interpreted anoynted brought hym ieſus whan ieſus dyd beholde hym ſayd thou arte simon ſonne ionas math 16 cthou ſhalte called cephas whyche interpreted petrus morowe wolde haue gone galile fande philippe ieſus ſayeth vnto follow iohā 12 c philippe bethſaida cytie andrew peter philippe fande nathanael ſayeth vnto hym haue founde ieſus ſonne ioſeph nazareth gene • c 22 c 49 b deut 18 cof moſes hath wrytten lawe eſa 7 c 9 b ye prophetes nathanael ſayde vnto hym ioh 7 • ony good thynge nazareth philippe ſayd vnto hym come ſe ieſus ſaw nathanael commynge hym ſayeth hym beholde true iſraelite whome gyle nathanael ſayd vnto whence doeſt thou knowe ieſus anſwered ſayd vnto hym philippe called thou wereſt vnder fygge tre ſawe nathanael anſwered hym ſayde rabbi thou arte ſonne god thou arte kynge iſrael ieſus anſwered ſayd vnto hym becauſe ſayde vnto ſawe vnder fygge tre thou beleueſt thou ſhalte ſe greater thynge theſe ſayd vnto verely verely ſaye vnto ye ſhall ſe henceforth heauen open angel god goynge vp downe vpon ye ſonne man ii chapter ✚ vpon thyrde daye ther weddynge chana galile mother ieſu ieſus alſo called ye weddyng hys diſciples wyne faylynge ieſus mother ſayd vnto haue wine ieſus ſaid vnto luce 2 • woman haue wyth myne houre yet come hys mother ſayd vnto myniſters ſoeuer ſayeth vnto ther ſyxe waterpottes ſtone ſet accordynge purifyenge iewes conteynynge euery one two thre • reca meaſure halfe fyrken ſo euery pot conteyned fyrkē fyrken halfe meaſures ieſus ſayd vnto fyll waterpottes wyth water fylled thē brymme ieſus ſayde vnto drawe nowe brynge mayſter feaſte dyd beare whan mayſter feaſte hadde tayſted water made wyne knewe whence myniſters hadde drawen water knewe mayſter feaſte calleth brydegrome ſayeth vnto hym euery man fyrſte ſetteth good wyne whan dronke worſe thou haſt kepte good wyne hetherto thys begynnynge myracles hath ieſus done chana galile hath ſhewed hys glorye hys diſciples beleued hym ⊢ math 4 b marc 1 b luce 4 thys went downe capernaum hys mother hys brother hys diſciples remayned many dayes ✚ math 21 b marc 11 b luce 19 eaſter iewes hande ieſus wente vp ieruſalē fande ſellers ſhepe ox doues mony chaūgers ſyttynge whā made ſcourge ſmall cordes caſt thē al ye tēple ye ſhepe alſo ox mony mony chaungers poured ouerthrewe table vnto thē ſolde doues ſayd haue theſe thynges hence make father houſe houſe marchaūdiſe hys diſciples remembred wryttē pſal 68 b zele thy houſe hath eaten iewes anſwered ſaid vnto hym math 16 iohā 6 tokē ſheweſt thou v thou doeſt theſe thynges ieſus anſwered ſayd vnto math 26 f lowſe thys temple wythin thre dayes ſhall rayſe agayne ſayd iewes 1 eſd 56syxe forty yeare thys tē ple abuyldynge wylt thou rayſe vp thre dayes ſpake temple hys body whan therfore ryſen agayne deade hys diſciples remembred ſayd beleued ſcripture worde ieſus dydde ſpeake whan ieruſalem eaſter feaſte many beleued hys name ſeſeynge hys token dyd ieſus dyd cōmytte hymſelfe vnto becauſe knewe becauſe neded ony mā ſhulde teſtifye mā iere •• • apoc • • knew man ⊢ iii chapter ✚ ther man ye phariſes name ioha • • 19 nicodemus ruler amonge iewes ſame came vnto ieſus nyght ſayd vnto hym rabbi knowe thou art come teacher god iohā 9 b noman theſe token thou doeſt wythout god wyth hym ieſus anſwered ſayd vnto verely verely ſaye vnto without man borne newe cannot ſe kyngdome god nicodemus ſayd vnto hym howe mā borne agayne whā old entre agayne hys mother wombe borne agayne ieſus anſwered iohā 4 b 7 b titū 3 verely verrely ſaye vnto wythout man borne water holy gooſt entre kyngdome god rom 8 athat whych borne fleſh fleſh whych borne ſprete ſprete maruayle becauſe ſayd vnto ye muſt borne agayne wynde bloweth wyl hys voyce heareſt thou eccles 11 yu knoweſt whence cōmeth goeth euery man yt borne ye ſprete nicodemus anſwered ſaid vnto theſe thynges ieſus anſwered ſayd vnto hym art yu maſter iſrael knoweſt theſe thynges verely verely ſaye vnto ſpeake knowe teſtifye haue ſene ye receaue wytneſſe yf haue tolde earthly thynges ye beleue ſhall ye beleue yf ſhal tel heauenly thynges epheſ 4 noman goeth vp heauen ſaue came downe heauen euen ſōne mā whych heauens nume 21 b iohā 8 c 1 • moſes dyd lyfte vp ſerpent wylderneſſe euen ſo muſt ſonne man lyfted vp euery mā beleueth hym peryſhe haue lyfe euerlaſtynge ⊢ ✚ rom 5 1 ioha 4 b god dyd ſo loue worlde gaue hys begotten ſonne mar 16 b euery one beleueth hym peryſh haue euerlaſtynge lyfe luce 19 afor god ſente hys ſonne worlde iudge ye world worlde ſaued hym beleueth hym ſhal iudged beleueth iudged already becauſe dyd beleue name begotten ſonne god iudgemente ioha 1 12 f lyght come worlde men loued darkeneſſe lyghte theyr workes euel ephe 5 b euery one doth euell hateth lyghte commeth lyght hys workes reproued yt doth truth cōmeth lyght hys workes may opē done god ⊢ afterwarde came ieſus diſciples lande iewrye dwelled wyth ioh 4 baptyſed math 3 marc 1 luce 3 ihon alſo baptyſynge ennō salim wer many water came baptiſed math 4 b ihon yet put preſon ✚ ther aroſe queſtion amonge diſciples ihon wyth iewes purificacion came vnto ihon ſayd vnto hym mayſter wyth beyonde iordane thou dyd deſt beare wytneſſe beholde ye ſame baptyſeth iohā 4 men come vnto hym ihon anſwered ſayd mā receaue nothynge wythout geuen heauen ye ſelues beare recorde iohā 1 b ſayd chriſt ſent hym hath bryde brydegrome brydegromes frende ſtādeth heareth hym reioyceth greatlye becauſe brydegromes voyce thys ioye myne thā fulfylled muſt increace muſt miniſh commeth hygh aboue earth earthye ſpeaketh earthe come heauen aboue teſtifyeth hath ſene herd nomā receaueth hys wytneſſe ſo ſhall receaue hys wytneſſe hath ſet hys hande rom 3 god true whome god hath ſente ſpeaketh ye wordes god eſaie 61 god geueth ye ſprete meaſure father loueth ſonne math 11 luce 10 c hath geuen al thynges hys handes ioh 6 • 1 iohā 5 b beleueth ſonne hath lyfe euerlaſtynge beleueth ye ſōne ſhall ſe lyfe ye wrath god abydeth vpon hym iiii chapter whan ieſus thā dyd know ye phariſes herde ieſus maketh baptyſeth mo diſciples ihon thoughe ieſus baptyſed hys diſciples math 4 b lefte iewry wente agayne galile neded hym go thorowe ye myddes samaria came therfore citie samaria called sycharnye pece lande gene 48 iacob gaue vnto ioſeph hys ſonne well iacob ieſus beynge weery hys yourney ſat thus vpon well nearehande ſyxte houre ther came woman samaria drawe water ieſus ſayde vnto geue drynke diſciples gone cytie myghte bye meates ſayd ſame woman samaria vnto hym howe doeſt thou ſeynge thou arte iewe axe drynke whych woman samaria 4 reg 17 c ioha 8 c iewes medle wyth samaritanes ieſus anſwered ſayd vnto yf thou kneweſt gyfte god ſayeth vnto geue drynke thou woldeſte happely haue requyred hym ſhulde haue geuen iere 2 b iohā 7 lyuynge water woman ſayd vnto hym syr thou haſte wyth thou mayeſt drawe wel depe whence haſte thou lyuynge water arte thou greater father iacob whych gaue v thys well chyldrē hys cattell dyd drynke ieſus anſwered ſayd vnto euery man drynketh thys water ſhall thyrſt agayne ſhall drynke water ſhall geue hym ſhall thyrſt euer ioha 3 titū 3 water ſhall geue hym ſhall become vnto hym foūtayne water ſpryngynge lyfe euerlaſtynge woman ſayeth vnto iohā 6 syr geue water thirſt nother come hether drawe ieſus ſayde vnto go thy waye call thy huſbande come hether woman anſwered ſayde haue huſbād ieſus ſayeth vnto thou haſte ſayd well haue huſbande thou haſte fyue huſbandes thou haſt thy huſbande haſt thou ſayd truely woman ſayd vnto hym syr luce 7 bi ſe thou art prophete oure father haue worſhipped vpon thys mountayne 3 reg 9 2 pat 7 c ye ſaye ieruſalem true place mē muſt worſhippe ieſus ſayeth vnto woman beleue houre ſhall come whan ye ſhall worſhippe father nother ieruſalem vpon thys mountayne ye worſhip ye knowe worſhippe knowe gen 22 c saluacion cō meth iewes houre commeth whā true worſhippers ſhall worſhippe father rom 1 • ſprete truth father requyreth ſuche alſo maye worſhippe hym 2 cori 3 c god ſprete worſhippe muſt worſhippe ſprete truth woman ſayeth vnto hym knowe meſſias whych called chriſt commeth whan therfore ſhall come ſhall ſhewe v thynges ieſus ſayeth vnto • 26 f marc 14 g luc • 22 c iohā 9 10 c ſpeaketh wt forth wyth came hys diſciples maruayled ſpake wyth woman yet ſayd noman axeſt thou ſpeakeſt thou wt lefte woman hyr waterpot wente cytie ſayd vnto thoſe men come ſe ye man hath tolde ſo euer haue done chriſt thā wente cytie came vnto hym meane ſeaſon prayed diſciples hym ſayenge mayſter eate ſayd vnto haue meate eate ye knowe ſayd hys diſciples ech hath ony man brought hym eate ieſus ſayd vnto meate wyll hym ſente yt fulfyll hys worke ye ſay ther yet foure monethes thā cōmeth harueſt beholde ſaye vnto lyft vp youre eye loke vpō ye contries math 9 luce 10 afor whyte vnto ye harueſt yt reapeth receaueth rerewarde gathereth frute vnto lyfe euerlaſtynge ſoweth reapeth may reioyce together ye word true one mā ſoweth another reapeth haue ſente reape vpon ye beſtowed laboure men haue laboured ye entred theyr laboures manye samaritanes cytie beleued hym becauſe womās word bearynge recorde hath tolde haue done whan samaritanes nowe came hym prayed hym wold tary taryed two dayes many mo beleued becauſe hys worde ſayd vnto woman beleue becauſe thy ſayeng iohā 1 • b haue herd hym ſelues know thys truely saueoure ye worlde ⊢ two dayes wente frō thēce wente galile math 13 g marci 6 luce 4 c ieſus hymſelfe teſtifyed prophete hath honoure hys cōtry whā therfore cam galile galilean receaued hym hadde ſene thynges done ieruſalem feaſt alſo come feaſt daye came agayne chana galile iohā 2 • made water wyne ✚ ther certayne ruler whoſe ſonne ſycke capernaum ſame whan herd ieſus dyd come frō iewry galile wente hym beſoughte hym wold come downe hea • e hys ſonne began dye ſayd ieſus vnto hym wythout ye ſe token wonder ye beleue ruler ſayeth vnto hym syr come downe euer chylde dye ieſus ſayeth vnto go thy way thy ſonne lyueth man beleued worde whyche ieſus ſayd vnto hym went away goynge downe hys ſeruaūtes met hym ſhewed hym ſayenge ſōne dyd lyue thā axed houre wherein dyd mende tolde hym yeſterdaye ſeuen clocke dyd ye feuer leaue hym dyd father knowe houre ieſus ſayd thy ſonne lyueth actu 18 aand al hys houſe dyd beleue ⊢ thys ſeconde token dyd ieſus whā came agayne iewry galile v chapter ✚ ther feaſt iewes ieſus wente vp ieruſalem ther ieruſalem ſlaughter houſe poole whyche called bethſeda hauynge fyue porch theſe laye great multytude ſycke blynde lame wythered waytynge ſtearynge water angel lorde came downe certaine tyme poole ye water ſteared fyrſt gone downe poole ſtearyng water made whole ſo euer diſeaſe vexed certayne man hauynge diſeaſe eyght thyrtye yeare whan ieſus ſene ye ſame lyenge dyd anowe ben diſeaſed greate whyle ſayeth vnto hym wylte thou whole ſycke anſwered hym syr haue man water ſteared maye put poole come another gone downe afore ieſus ſayeth vnto hym math 9 marc 12 luce 5 c ryſe take vp thy bed walke forthwyth ſame man made whole toke vp hys bed walked math 12 marci 2 c 3 luce 6 13 b 14 ioh 7 9 ye ſabbat daye therfore ſayd iewes vnto hym made whole ſabbat lawfull cary thy bedde anſwered made whole ſame ſaid vnto take vp thy bed walke axed man ſaid vnto take vp thy bed walke yt made whol knew ieſus iohā 6 b gotten hymſelfe awaye people place afterwarde dyd ieſus fynde hym temple ſayd vnto beholde thou arte made whole ioha 8 ſynne nowe leſt ſome worſe thynge happen vnto ſame man wente ſhewed iewes ieſus healed hym ⊢ therfore dyd iewes perſecute ieſus becauſe dyd theſe thynges ye ſabbat ieſus anſwered thē 1 cori 12 father worketh hetherto worke alſo therfore ſought iewes ſo much ye ſlaye hym brake ye ſabbat math 26 f mar 14 g luce 22 c called god alſo hys father makynge hymſelfe equall wyth god ieſus therfore anſwered ſayd vnto thē verely verely ſaye vnto iohā 9 ſonne nothyng ſelfe ſeyth father thynges ſo euer doth ye ſame doth ſonne lykewyſe father loueth ye ſōne ſheweth hym al thynges doeth ſhal ſhewe hym greater workes theſe ye alſo maye maruayle father rayſeth deade maketh lyue ſo doth ye ſonne alſo make lyue whome wyll nother doth father iudge ony man math 11 e luce 10 c hath geuen al iudgement vnto ſonne al men ſhulde honoure ſonne honoure father honoureth ſonne honoureth father whych ſente ſonne verely verely ſaye vnto iohā 8 • heareth worde beleueth ſente hath lyfe euerlaſtyng luce 23 commeth iudgement gone death lyfe verely verely ſaye vnto marc 5 e iohā 11 e 1 teſſ 4 c houre commeth whan dead ſhall heare voyce ſonne god ſhall heare ſhall lyue iohā 1 14 father hath lyfe himſelf ſo hath alſo geuen vnto ye ſonne haue lyfe hymſelfe hath geuen hym power execute iudgement ſonne man maruayle thys dan 12 math 25 houre commeth wherin graues ſhall heare voyce ſōne god ſhall go forth haue done good vnto reſurreccion lyfe haue done euell reſurreccion iudgement nothynge ſelfe heare ſo iudge iudgement iuſt ſeke wyll hys wyll ſente iohā 8 b • yf therfore beare wytneſſe ſelfe wytneſſe true ther another yt beareth wytneſſe knowe yt wytneſſe true beareth iohā 1 • ye ſente vnto ihon dyd beare wytneſſe truth neuertheleſſe receaue recorde man ſaye theſe thynges ye may ſaued iohā 1 b burnynge ſhynynge lyghte ye wolde haue reioyced lytle whyle hys lyght 1 ioh 5 • haue greater wytneſſe ihon ioh 10 c workes father hath geuē yt ſhulde thē ye ſame workes yt bear wytneſſe father hath ſente math 5 b 17 iohā 8 b ye father yt hath ſent beareth wytneſſe nother haue ye euer herd hys voyce haue ſene hys lykeneſſe deut 5 c iohā 1 b 6 • ye haue hys worde abydynge ye beleue hym whome hath ſente 1 iohā 4 • search ſcriptures ye thynke haue euerlaſtynge lyfe actu 17 b deu 18 c ſame beare wytneſſe ye wyll come vnto ye maye haue lyfe iohā 12 • receaue prayſe men knowe ye haue loue god come father name ye haue receaued 1 iohā 2 c 2 • ſſa 2 • yf another ſhall come hys name ſame ſhall ye receaue ye beleue whych receaue prayſe ech ſeke glory god thynke ſhall accuſe father ther ony accuſeth euē moſes ye truſt yf ye beleued moſes ye wold happely beleue alſo deut 18 • hath wryttē yf ye beleue hys wrytynges ſhal ye beleue wordes ▪vi chapter▪ theſe thynges math 14 b marc 6 luce 9 b went ieſus ouer ſee galile nye ye cytie tyberias great multitude followed hym ſawe token dyd vpon yt ſycke therfore went ieſus vp moūtayne ſat wyth hys diſciples exodi 12 eaſter iewes feaſte hande ✚ whan ieſus lyfted vp hys eye ſene great multitude dyd come vnto hym ſayde vnto philippe whence ſhall bye breades yt theſe may eate thys ſayde temptyng hym knewe ſhuld philippe anſwered two hūdreth penyworthes breades ſuffiſe euery one maye take lytle one hys diſciples ſayd vnto hym andrewe ye brother simon peter lad whych hath fyue barly loaues two fyſhes 4 reg 4 c theſe amonge ſo many ſayd ieſus cauſe men ſyt downe ther much graſſe place thā dyd men ſyt downe nombre near • hande fyue thouſande dyd ieſus take breades geuen thankes toke hys diſciples diſciples gaue vnto thē ſat downe lykewyſe fyſhes ſo muche wolde whan fylled ſayd vnto hys diſciples gather broken peces lefte ouer leſt peryſh gathered fylled twelfe baſkettes broken peces fyue barly loues yt whych lefte ouer vnto eaten thoſe men ſene token ieſus done ſayd luce • b iohā 4 c thys truely prophete ſhulde come worlde ⊢ whan ieſus knewe ſhulde come take hym make hym kynge ioha 5 fled agayne moūtayne alone math 14 c marc 6 e whā become euen hys diſciples wente downe ſee whan gone vp ſhippe came ouer ſee capernaum become darke ieſus come vnto ſee aroſe wyth great wynde whan therfore rowed vpō fyue twenty thyrty furlonges ſe ieſus walkynge vpon ſee come neare afrayed ſayde vnto feare wolde take hym ſhippe forthwyth ſhippe lande whych wente nexte daye people ſtode ſyde ye ſee ſawe ther none ſhippe ſaue one entred ſhippe wyth hys diſciples ye diſciples gone alone neuertheleſſe ſhippes came tyberias neare place eaten bread geuynge thākes god whā people thā ſawe yt ieſus hys diſciples wente vp lytle ſhippes came capernaum▪ ſekynge ieſus whan founde hym beyonde ye ſee ſayde vnto hym mayſter whā cameſt thou ieſus anſwered ſayd verely verely ſay vnto ye ſeke becauſe ye haue ſene myracles becauſe ye haue eatē breades ſatiſfyed ✚ laboure ye breade peryſheth yt abydeth euerlaſtyng lyfe whych ſōne man ſhal geue hym hath god father ſealed ſayde vnto hym ſhall myght worke workes god ieſus anſwered ſayd vnto thys worke god ye beleue hym ſēt ſayd vnto hym math 16 marc 8 b ioh 2 c token doeſt thou may ſe beleue ye workeſt thou father haue eaten breade ye wylderneſſe wrytten exodi 16 pſal 77 c gaue breade heauen eate ſayd ieſus vnto thē verely verely ſaye vnto moſes gaue ſame breade heauen father geueth true breade heauen true breade came downe heauē geueth lyfe vnto worlde ſayd vnto hym ioh 4 b syr geue v alwaye thys breade ieſus ſayd vnto breade lyfe commeth vnto ſhall honger yt beleueth ſhall thyrſt euer ⊢ haue ſayde vnto ye haue ſene haue beleued father geueth vnto commeth vnto hym ſhal come vnto ſhall caſte forth come downe heauen ſhall wyll luce 22 hys wyll ſente ioh 10 c • 8 thys father wyll ſente hath geuen ſhuld leſe ought rayſe vp agayn laſt daye thys father wyll whyche ſente iohā 5 c ſo ſeyth ſonne beleueth hym maye haue lyfe euerlaſtynge ſhall rayſe hym laſt daye murmured iewes becauſe dyd ſay lyuyng breade whyche came downe heauen ſayde math 13 g thys ioſephs ſonne whoſe father mother knowe howe ſayeth thys come downe heauen anſwered ieſus ſayd vnto murmure amonge math 16 c iohā 6 g 2 teſſa 3 noman come vnto wythout father hath ſente ſhal drawe hym ſhall rayſe hym agayne laſt daye wrytten prophetes eſa 54 c iere 31 f math 11 • luce 10 c ſhall apte taught god euery one hath herde father hath learned commeth vnto deu 4 b 5 c becauſe ony man hath ſene father ſaue god ye ſame hath ſene father verely verely ſaye vnto iohā 3 e 1 ioha 5 bhe beleueth hath lyfe euerlaſtynge breade lyfe father haue eaten manna deſert dead thys breade cōmynge downe heauen yf ony man ſhall eate dye lyuynge breade whyche ame come downe heauen yf ony man ſhal eate thys bread ſhall lyue euer breade luce 2 • ſhall geue lyfe worlde fleſh ⊢ ſtroue iewes amonge themſelues ſayenge geue v hys fleſh eate ſayd ieſus vnto thē verely verely ſaye vnto excepte ye ſhall eate fleſhe ſonne man drynke hys bloude ye ſhal haue lyfe eateth fleſhe drynketh bloude hath lyfe euerlaſtyng ſhal rayſe hym vp agayne laſt daye ✚ fleſhe meate dede bloude drynke dede • iohā 4 b eateth fleſhe drynketh bloude abydeth hym lyuynge father hath ſente lyue father ſake eateth ſhall alſo lyue ſake thys breade come downe heauen father dyd eate manna dead eateth thys breade ſhal lyue euer ⊢ theſe thynges ſayd ſynagoge teachynge capernaū many therfore hys diſciples hearyng thys ſayd thys harde ſayenge heare ieſus knowynge hymſelfe hys diſciples dyd murmure ſayd vnto doth thys offende yf ye ſhall ſe ſonne man math 26 f actu 1 b go vp fyrſte ſprete quyckeneth fleſhe profyteth nothynge wordes haue ſpoken vnto ſprete lyfe ther ſome beleue ieſus dyd knowe begynnynge whyche beleuynge ſhulde betraye ſayd therfore ſayde vnto iohā 9 c noman come vnto wythout geuen hym father tyme forth wente many hys diſciples backe dyd walke wyth hym thā ſaid ieſus vnto twelfe wyll ye alſo go awaye anſwered hym simon peter math 16 c lorde whome ſhall go thou haſt wordes euerlaſtynge lyfe beleue haue knowen thou arte chriſt ſonne god ieſus anſwered vnto haue choſē twelfe iohā 13 b one deuell ſpake iudas simon iſcariots ſonne ioha 13 18 ſhulde betraye hym one twelfe vii chapter ✚ thys wente ieſus aboute galile wolde walke iewry becauſe iewes ſoughte ſlaye hym ye iewes leui 23 • feaſt tabernacle hāde ſayd hys brother vnto hym get hence go iewry thy diſciples alſo may ſe thy workes thou doeſt noman doeth ought ſecrete ſeketh hymſelfe knowen openly yf thou doeſt theſe thynges ſhewe thyſelfe vnto worlde hys brethrē dyd beleue hym nother thā ſayd ieſus vnto tyme yet come ſayd iohā 7 prophete dyd iewes beleue hym ben blynde ſawe tyll dyd call elder hym ſawe axed ſayeng ſonne whome ye ſaye borne blynde doth ſe hys elder anſwered ſayd knowe oure ſonne borne blynde doth tell one thynge knowe blynde nowe ſe ſayd vnto hym dyd vnto howe opened thyne eye anſwered told euen ye herde wil ye heare agayne wyll ye alſo become hys diſciples curſed hym ſayd thou hys diſciple god doth hys wyll hym doth heare herde ſence worlde beganne ony man dyd open eye one borne blynde yf god could ought anſwered ſayde vnto hym thou arte altogether borne ſynne doeſt thou teach v caſt go agayne iewry diſciples ſayde vnto hym ioh 7 c • c 10 c mayſter iewes ſought lately ſtone goeſt thou thether agayne ieſus anſwered hath daye twelfe houres yf ony man ſhall walke daye doth ſtomble 20 • whych ſurnamed didymus vnto ye fellowe diſciples let v go alſo let v dye wyth hym came ieſus fande hym hauynge lyen foure dayes graue bethany nye ieruſalem aboute fyfte ne furlonges many iewes come martha mary comforte ouer theyr brother whā martha thā herde ieſus dyd come ſhe met hym mary ſat home thā ſayd martha vnto ieſus ioh 11 lord yf yu haddeſt bē brother ben deade yet know yt ſoeuer yu ſhalt requyre god god ſhal geue yt ieſus ſayeth thy brother ſhall ryſe agayne martha ſayd vnto hym know ſhall ryſe agayne ye reſurreccion laſt daye ieſus ſayeth vnto reſurreccion iohā 14 lyfe ioh 3 b 6 f rom 1 • beleueth though dead ſhal lyue euery one lyueth beleueth ſhal dye euer doeſt thou beleue thys ſayde vnto hym yee lorde haue beleued thou arte chriſt ſōne lyuynge god art come thys worlde ⊢ whā ſayd thys ſhe wente hir waye called hir ſyſter mary ſecretly ſayeng maſter calleth whā ſhe herde ſhe roſe quyckely came vnto hym ieſus yet come towne yet ſame place martha met hym iewes houſe wyth comforted whan ſawe mary ſhe roſe quyckely wente forth followed ſayenge goeth graue ſhe maye wepe whan mary came ieſus ſeynge hym ſhe fell hys fete ſayeth vnto hym iohā 11 e lorde yf thou haddeſt ben brother ſhulde haue dyed whan ieſus dyd ſe wepynge iewes come wyth groned ſprete troubled hymſelfe ſayde haue ye layed hym ſaye vnto hym lorde come ſe luce 19 ieſus wepte ſayde iewes beholde loued hym ſome ſayde coulde ioh 9 awhych opened eye ye blynde borne haue made ſhulde haue dyed came ieſus graue gronyng agayne hymſelf caue ſtone layed theron ieſus ſayd take awaye ſtone martha hys ſyſter yt dead ſayd lorde ſtynketh hath lyen foure dayes ieſus ſayd vnto sayd vnto yf thou beleueſt thou ſhalte ſe ye glorye god toke awaye ſtone ieſus eye beyng lyfte vpwarde ſayd father thāke becauſe thou haſt herde knew thou heareſt alwayes iohā 12 dbut becauſe people whyche ſtandeth aboute haue ſayde maye beleue thou haſt ſente whan ſayde thys cryed wyth loude voyce lazarus come forth ioh 5 c ſtrayght way came forth dead bounde hande foote wyth graue clothes hys face boūde wyth napkyn ieſus ſayd vnto lowſe hym let hym go ioh 7 c many iewes therfore whych came mary martha ſene done beleued hym ſome wente phariſes tolde thynges ieſus done ⊢ ✚ pſal 2 math 26 marc 14 luce 22 thā gathered hygh preſtes phariſes councell ſayd ac • 4 b thys man doth many token yf leaue hym ſo men ſhall beleue hym dani 9 romaynes ſhall come ſhall take awaye oure place people one thē name caiphas hygh preſt yeare ſaid vnto ye knowe nothynge nother conſydre ioh 18 b behoueth one man dye people people peryſh thys ſayde hymſelfe much hygh preſte yeare prophecyed ieſus dye people people ſhulde gather together chyldrē god whyche ſcattered abrode mat 12 b marc 3 ioh 10 dtherfore dyd ymagyne day forth might ſlaye hym thys cauſe walked ieſus openly amonge iewes wente contry ye deſerte ytie called ephrem abode wyth hys diſciples ⊢ iewes eaſter hande many contrye wente vp ieruſalem eaſter purifye themſelues ſoughte ieſus ſpake together ſtandynge temple iohā 7 thynke ye commeth vnto feaſt iohā 19 c hygh preſtes phariſes geuen commaū demente yf ony mā ſhal know ſhulde ſhewe myght take hym xii chapter ✚ syxe math 26 marc 14 luce 22 dayes eaſter came ieſus vnto bethany lazarus whome ieſus rayſed vp agayne ben dead dyd make hym ſupper martha ſerued lazarus one ſat borde wyth hym luce 7 dthan toke mary poūde oyntmente pure coſtly nardus anoynted ieſus fete dryed hys fete wyth hyr heere houſe fylled wyth ſauoure oyntemente ſayde one hys diſciples iudas iſcariot ſhulde betraye hym thys oyntmente ſolde thre hundreth penny geuen poore thys ſayd cared poore becauſe thefe ioha 13 c hauyng purſe caryed geuen ſayde ieſus let alone ſhe maye kepe vntyll daye buryall ye haue alwayes poore wyth haue ye alwaye much people iewes hadde knowlege came onely ieſus ſake ſhulde ſe lazarus ioh 11 cwhome rayſed ye dead hygh preſtes aduyſed put lazarus death alſo becauſe many iewes went beleued ieſus hys ſake ⊢ math 21 marc 11 luce 19 c morowe much people come feaſte whan herde ieſus came ieruſalem toke braunches palmes wente mete hym cryed hoſanna pſal 117 c bleſſed commeth name lorde kynge iſrael ieſus fande yonge aſſe ſat thereon wytten eſaie 62 c zach 9 b feare thou doughter sion behold thy kynge commeth ſyttynge vpon aſſes foale thys knewe hys diſciples fyrſte whan ieſus glorifyed remembred theſe thynges wrytten hym done ſuche thynges vnto hym people wyth hym whan called lazarus ye graue rayſed hym deade teſtifyed hym therfore met people hym becauſe herd hym haue done myracle ſayde phariſes amonge themſelues se ye preuayle nothynge beholde whole world gone hym 3 reg 8 f actu 8 c ther ſome heythen mē amonge ioh 1 e come vp praye feaſte ſame came philippe whych bethſaida galile prayed hym ſayenge syr wolde ſe ieſus philippe came tolde andrewe agayne andrewe philippe tolde vnto ieſus ieſus anſwered ſayeng ioh 13 17 houre come ſonne mā muſt glorifyed ✚ lyfe thys worlde ſhal kepe vnto lyfe euerlaſtyng ſerueth let hym followe ſhall miniſter alſo yf ony man ſhall ſerue father ſhall honoure hym ⊢ math 26 marc 14 luce 22 c nowe ſoule heuy ſhall ſaye father ſaue thys houre therfore ame come thys houre father make thy name gloryous came ther voyce heauen ſayeng haue glorifyed wyll glorifye agayne people ſtode herde ſayd haue thondered ſayd iohā 11 • angell hath ſpoken vnto hym ieſus anſwered ſayde thys voyce come ſake youre ſake ✚ iudgement thys worlde nowe ſhall prince thys worlde caſt ioh 3 b 8 cand whan ſhalbe lyfte vp earth ſhall drawe thynges ſelfe ſayd ſygnifye death ſhuld dye people anſwered hym pſal 109 eſai 9 b deut 7 c math 5 haue herde lawe chriſte abydeth euer ſayeſt thou ſonne man muſte lyfted vp thys ſonne man ſayd ieſus vnto ephe 5 1 teſſa 5 alyght yet lytle whyle walke whyle ye haue ye lyght darkneſſe catch walketh darkneſſe woteth goeth longe ye haue lyght ioh 8 b beleue lyght ye may chyldren lyght ⊢ thys ſayd ieſus went hyd hymſelfe though done ſo great miracle beleued ye worde eſaye myght fulfylled whych ſayd eſaye 53 rom 10 c lorde hath beleued preachynge vnto whō arme lord declared therfore coulde beleue cauſe eſaye ſayde agayne eſa 6 b hath blynded theyr eyen hath hardened theyr harte ſe wt theyr eyen vnderſtande wyth theyr harte turned heale thys ſpake eſaye whan ſawe hys glorye ſpake hym hys worlde loued vntyll ende ſupper beynge done math 26 marc 14 b luce 22 awhan deuel put ye harte iudas iſcariot simon ſonne ſhuld betraye hym knowynge father math 11 • luce 10 c geuen hym al thynges hys hādes ioh 16 come forth god goeth vnto god riſeth ſupper layeth downe hys clothes whā taken towell gyrded hymſelfe put water baſē beganne waſhe hys diſciples fete drye wyth ye towel gyrded aboute came simon peter peter ſayd vnto hym math 3 b lorde doeſt thou waſh fete ieſus anſwered ſayd vnto canſt thou tell nowe thou ſhalte knowe afterwarde peter ſayeth vnto hym thou ſhalte neuer waſh fete ieſus anſwered vnto hym yf ſhall pſal 50 waſh thou ſhalt haue parte wyth simon peter ſayd vnto lorde myfete alſo handes ye head ieſus ſayth vnto hym waſhen nedeth waſhe fete clene euery whytte ye clene ioha 6 g knewe ſhulde trayt hym therfore ſayd ye clene waſhen theyr fete toke hys clothes whan ſet agayne borde ſayd vnto wote ye haue done vnto ye call mayſter lorde ye ſaye well yf lorde mayſter haue waſhen youre fete ye oughte alſo waſhe one anothers fete epheſ 5 1 pet 1 c haue geuen enſample lyke haue done vnto ſo may ye alſo verely verely ſaye vnto math 1 c luce 6 io • 15 • ſeruaunt greater hys lorde meſſaunger greater ſent yf ye knowe theſe thynges math 5 • happye ſhall ye yf ye thē ſpeake knowe whome haue choſen yt ſcripture maye fulfylled pſal 40 b yt eateth breade wt hath lyfte vp hys hele agaynſte iohā 14 c 16 henceforth tel done yt whā done ye maye beleue math 10 marc 9 luce 10 b verely verely ſay y• receaueth whō ſende receaueth yt receaueth receaueth hym yf ye ſhall kepe cō maundementes ye ſhal abyde loue euē alſo haue kepte father commaundementes abyde hys loue theſe thynges haue ſayd vnto ioye maye abyde ioye may perfecte ✚ iohā 13 1 iohā 3 c glorifyed vpō earth haue iohā 19 c 2 tim 4 fynyſhed ye worke thou haſte geuen ſhulde nowe father gloryfye thou thyſelfe wyth glorye hadde worlde made haue declared thy name vnto ye men thou gaueſt frō ye worlde thyne thou gaueſt vnto haue kept word knowe thou haſt geuen iohā 4 • wordes thou gaueſt haue geuē haue receaued knowen truth come forth haue beleued thou haſt ſente praye thē praye 1 ioh 2 c worlde thou gaueſt thyne myne thyne thyn myne glorifyed nowe worlde ye worlde come vnto holy father ſaue thy name whō thou eſaye 8 gaueſt maye one whā wyth kepte thy name thoſe thou gaueſt haue kept ioh 18 none peryſhed ſaue ye ſonne perdiciō pſal 40 b 108 ſcripture myghte fulfylled nowe come vnto thys ſpeake worlde maye haue ioye fulfylled haue geuen thy worde ye world sap 2 c iohā 15 bhated becauſe worlde alſo worlde praye thou take worlde math 6 b yt thou kepe euell world alſo worlde halowe truth thy worde truth ioh 20 c yu haſt ſent worlde ſo haue alſo ſente worlde theyr ſakes ſāctify ſelfe maye alſo ſanctifyed truth neuertheleſſe praye alſo ſhall beleue thorowe theyr worde one thou father alſo gala 3 done v worlde may beleue thou haſt ſent glorye thou gaueſt haue geuen may one alſo one thou maye perfecte one worlde may know thou haſt ſente haue loued thou haſt loued iohā 12 c 14 father wyll whome thou haſt geuē alſo wyth maye ſe glorye thou haſt geuen thou haſt loued creacion worlde ryghteous father math 11 c ioh 15 c 16 worlde hath knowen haue knowē theſe haue knowen thou haſt ſēt haue declared thy name vnto ſhall declare loue wherwyth thou haſt loued ⊢ xviii chapter ✚ whan ieſus hadde ſpoken theſe wordesmath 26 marc 14 l • c • 22 c wente forth wyth hys diſciples beyonde broke cedrō ther garden whych entred hys diſciples iudas whyche betrayed hym knewe place alſo ieſus reſorted thyther ofte wyth hys diſciples math 26 • marc 14 c luce 22 whan iudas hadde taken bende men myniſters ye hygh preſtes phariſes came thyther wyth lanternes creſhettes weapens ieſus knowynge al thynges come vpon hym wente forth ſayd vnto thē ye ſeke anſwered hym ieſus nazareth ieſus ſayeth vnto iudas betrayed hym ſtode alſo wyth whan ſayd vnto wente backwarde fell ye groūde axed agayn ye ſeke ſayd ieſus nazareth ieſus anſwered haue told yf ye therfore ſeke let theſe go ye word might fulfylled ſayd iohā 17 b thē whō yu gaueſt haue loſt none dyd simon peter hauynge aſwearde drawe ſmote hygh preſtes ſeruaunte cut hys ryght eare ſeruaunt called malchus ſayd ieſus vnto peter put vp ſwearde ſheeth cuppe father hath geuen wylt thou yt drynke math 26 c marc 14 f luce 22 • dyd bende men captayne ſeruauntes iewes take ieſus boūde hym brought anna fyrſte father lawe caiphas whyche hygh preſt ye yeare caiphas ioh 1 • e yt geuē iewes ye coūſel behoueth one mā dye ye people simō peter diſciple followed ieſus ye ſame diſciple acquainted wt hygh preſt went wt ieſu ye palace ye hygh preſt peter ſtode wythout dore wente forth diſciple whyche acquaynted wyth ye hygh preſt ſayd vnto dameſel yt kept ye dore brought peter ſayd portereſſe vnto peter art thou thys man diſciples ſayd ſeruaū te officer ſtode fyre made cole colde warmed peter alſo ſtādynge wyth warmynge hym axed hygh preſte ieſus hys diſciples hys doctrine ieſus anſwered hym ioh 7 b haue ſpokē openly vnto worlde haue alwaye taught ſynagoge temple ye iewes come together haue ſpokē nothynge ſecrete axeſt thou axe haue herde haue ſayd vnto beholde knowe haue ſayd iere 20 mat 26 g • ct • 23 whan ſayd theſe thynges one officer ſtandynge ſmote ieſus ye face ſaynge anſwereſt thou ye hygh preſt ſo ieſus anſwered yf haue ſpoken euel beare wytneſſe euel yf haue ſpoken wel ſmyteſt thou anna ſente hym bounde caiphas hygh preſt math 26 g marc 14 g luce 22 dand simon peter ſtādynge warmyng hym ſayd vnto hym art thou alſo one hys diſciples denyed ſayd one hygh preſtes ſeruaūtes ye coſin whoſe eare peter dyd cut ſayd dyd ſe garden wyth hym denyed peter agayne ioh 13 forthwyth dyd cocke crowe math 27 marci 15 luc 23 broughte ieſus caiphas cōmune hall mornyng thēſelues entred cōmune hal yt ſhulde defyled myght eate eaſterlambe therfore wente pilate forth vnto ſayd accuſacion brynge ye agaynſt thys man anſwered ſayd vnto hym yf none euell doer wolde haue delyuered hym vnto ſayd pilate vnto take ye hym iudge hym lawe ſayd iewes vnto hym lawful v put ony mā death worde ieſus myght fulfylled whych ioh 11 ſpake ſignifyeng death ſhuld dye math 27 b marci 15 luce 23 thā entred pilate agayne commune hall called ieſus ſaid vnto hym arte thou kynge ye iewes ieſus anſwered sayſt thou thy ſelf haue told pilate anſwered iewe thy people hygh preſtes haue delyuered vnto haſt thou done ieſus anſwered kyngdome thys worlde yf kyngdome thys worlde myniſters wolde ſurely fyght ſhulde delyuered ye iewes ioh 6 b kyngdome hence ſayd pilate vnto hym arte thou kynge ieſus anſwered thou ſayeſt kyng born therfore therfore came worlde maye beare wytneſſe vnto truthe euerye one truth heareth voyce pilate ſayeth vnto hym truth whan ſayd went forth agayne vnto iewes ſayeth vnto math 27 c marc 15 b luc 23 b fynde cauſe hym mat 27 b ye haue coſtume ſhal let lowſe vnto one eaſtermarc 15 luce 23 wyl ye therfore let louſe vnto kynge iewes cryed agayne ſayenge thys barrabas yet barrabas murtherer xix chapter mat 27 c marci 15 b luce 23 b toke pilate ieſus ſcourged hym ye ſouldyers platyng crowne thornes ſet vpon hys heade put purple garmente aboute hym came hym ſayde hayle kynge iewes ſmote hym face pilate went forth agayne ſayd vnto beholde brynge hym forthe vnto ye maye knowe fynde cauſe went ieſus forth bearynge crowne thornes purple garment ſayeth vnto beholde man whan hyghe preſtes myniſters hadde ſene hym cryed ſayenge crucifye crucifye hym pilate ſayeth vnto take ye hym crucifye hym fynde cauſe hym iewes anſwered haue l • ui 24 c lawe lawe muſte dye ioh 5 b hath made hymſelfe ſonne god whan pilate herde thys ſayeng feared wente agayne commune hall ſayeth vnto ieſu whence arte thou ieſus gaue anſwere ſaid pilate vnto doeſt thou ſpeake vnto knoweſt thou yt haue power crucifye haue power let lowſe ieſus anſwered thou ſhuldeſt haue power agaynſt wythout sap 6 ioh 3 rom 13 geuen aboue therfore delyuered vnto hath ſynne tyme forth ſoughte pilate let hym lowſe ye iewes cryed ſayenge yf thou letteſt thys man lowſe thou arte emperours frende actu 17 b whoſoeuer maketh hymſelfe kynge gaynſayeth ye emperoure math 27 marci 15 c luce 23 b whan pilate herde thoſe wordes brought forth ieſus ſat vpon iudgemente ſeate place called pauemente hebrue gabbatha daye preparynge eaſter nearehande ſyxte houre ſayeth vnto iewes beholde kynge cryed awaye wyth hym away wyth hym crucifye hym pilate ſayeth vnto shall crucify kynge hygh preſtes anſwered haue kyng ye emperour therfore toke hym vnto yt myght crucifyed luce 23 c toke ieſus led hym forth bearyng croſſe hymſelfe hebr 15 c wēt forth vnto place called place dead mēs ſkulles called hebrue golgotha wher crucifyed two wt one ether ſyde ieſus myddes math 27 marci 15 c luce 23 pilate wrote title alſo ſet vpō ye croſſe ther wryttē ieſus nazareth kynge ye iewes wrytten haue wrytten math 27 marc 15 cwhan ſouldyers crucifyed hym toke hys raymentes made foure partes vnto euery ſouldyer parte cote cote vnſowen▪ wrought vpō thorow therfore ſayde eche let v cut let v caſt lotte therevpon ſhal haue ſcripture myght fulfylled ſayeng pſal 21 b haue parted garmentes vnto themſelues vpon raymente haue caſt lotte thys dyd ſouldyers dede ther ſtode ye croſſe ieſus hys mother hys mother ſyſter mary wyfe cleophe mary magdalene whan ieſus ſawe hys mother diſciple whome loued ſtandynge ſayde vnto hys mother woman beholde thy ſonne afterwarde ſayd vnto diſciple beholde thys thy mother frō houre dyd diſciple take hys prouiſion afterwarde ieſus knowynge thynges fulfylled pſal 68 cyt ſcripture myght fulfylled ſayd athyrſt ther ſet veſſell ful vynegre math 27 c mac 15 fylled ſponge vynegre hyſope wyndyng aboute rede put hys mouth whan ieſus taken vynegre ſayd fyniſhed head beynge bowed gaue vp gooſt iewes ſo much daye preparyng bodyes ſhulde remayne croſſe vpon ſabbat ſabbat day great prayed pilate theyr legges myght broken taken downe came ſouldyers brake ye legges fyrſt crucifyed wyth hym whā come ieſus ſawe hym deade dyd breake hys legges one ye ſouldiers opened hys ſyde wt ſpear zach 13 continently ther wente oute bloude water ſawe dyd beare recorde hys record true knoweth yt ſayeth true ye ye alſo may beleue theſe thynges done ye ſcripture myght fulfylled ſayth exo 12 g ye ſhall breake bone hym agayne another ſcripture ſayeth zach 12 c ſhall loke hym whome haue pearſed thorowe mat 27 g marc 15 c luce 23 • thys dyd ioſeph arimathia praye pilate myghte take downe bodye ieſu becauſe diſciple ieſu ſecretly feare iewes pilate graūted hym cam toke downe body ieſu ther came alſo one iohā • 7 • nicodemus whyche afore cam vnto ieſus nyght bryngyng mirrhe aloe mixt together near hande hūdreth poūde toke body ieſu bounde wt lynnen clothes wyth ſpices iewes maner burye place ieſus crucifyed ther garden garden new graue wherin man yet ben layed layde ieſus becauſe iewes day preparynge ſepulchre hande ⊢ xx chapter ✚ math 28 marci 16 luc • 24 fyrſte daye ſabbat came mary magdalene early ſepulchre whā yet dark ſawe ſtone taken awaye frō ſepulchre therfore ranne ſhe came simon peter diſciple ioha 13 c 21 whome ieſus loued ſayeth vnto haue taken awaye lorde ye graue wote haue layd hym luc 24 therfore wente peter ſame diſciple came graue rāne together ſame diſciple ranne afore ſooner peter came fyrſt graue whan ſtouped downe ſawe lynnen clothes layde wente came simon peter followynge hym entred ſepulchre ſawe clothes layde napkē ben vpō hys head layde wyth lynnen clothes place ſeuerally wrapped together wente alſo ſame diſciple came fyrſt graue ſawe beleued yet dyd knowe pſal 15 b actu 2 c 13 17 ſcripture yt ought ryſe agayne frō deade ⊢ thā wente ye diſciples agayne together ✚ luce 24 mary ſtode wythout ſepulchre wepynge whā ſhe wepte ſhe ſtouped loked ſepulchre ſawe two angel ſyttynge whyte one att heade one att fete bodye ieſus layde ſaye vnto woman wepeſt thou ſhe ſayeth vnto haue taken away lorde tell haue layed hym whan ſhe ſayde thys ſhe turned herſelfe aboute ſawe ieſus ſtandyng knewe ieſus ieſus ſayeth vnto woman wepeſt thou whō ſekeſt thou ſhe thynkynge bene gardener ſayd vnto hym syr yf yu haſt taken hym awaye tel thou haſt layd hym wyl fetch ieſus ſaid vnto mary beynge turned ſayd vnto rabboni whych ſaye mayſter ieſus ſayeth vnto touche yet aſcended vp father go vnto pſa • 1 c brethrē ſaye vnto iohā 16 go vp vnto father father god god luce 24 mary magdalene came ſhewynge diſciples haue ſene lorde theſe thynges hath ſayd vnto ⊢ ✚ luce 24 c whan late ſame fyrſte daye ſabbat dores ſhut ye diſciples fear iewes ieſus came ſtode myddeſt ſayd vnto peace vnto whan ſayd y• ſhewed hys handes fete hys ſyde ioha 16 c diſciples glad ſeynge lorde ſayde agayne vnto peace vnto eſaye 61 • marc 16 b luce 4 iohā 17 c lyke ye father hath ſent alſo ſende whan ſayd brethed vpon thē ſayeth vnto thē receaue ye holy gooſt whoſe ſinnes ye ſhall forgeue forgeuē thē whoſe ſynnes ye retayne ar retayned ⊢ ✚ thomas one ye twelfe ioha 1 b whych called didimus wt whan ieſus came ſayd diſciples vnto hym haue ſene lorde ſayd vnto without ſhal ſe hys hādes prynte nayles put fynger ye place nayles put hande hys ſyde wyl beleue eyghte dayes hys diſciples agayne wythin thomas thē ieſus came dores beynge ſhute ſtode ye myddes ſayd vnto thē peace vnto ye ſayde vnto thomas reache hether thy fynger ſe handes reach ther thy hande put ſyde vnbeleuyng beleuyng thomas anſwered ſayde vnto lorde god ieſus ſayeth vnto hym thomas becauſe thou haſt ſene thou haſt beleued bleſſed yt haue ſene haue beleued ⊢ ioh 21 many token dyd ieſus ye ſyght hys diſciples wryttē thys boke theſe thynges wryttē yt ye maye beleue ye ieſus chriſte ſonne god ye beleuyng maye haue lyfe hys name xxi chapter ✚ afterward dyd ieſus ſhew hymſelfe agayne ſee tyberias thys wyſe dyd ſhew hymſelf ther together simon peter thomas whych called didymus ioh • c nathanael cana galile chyldren zebede two hys diſciples simon peter ſayeth vnto thē go fyſhe ſaye vnto hym come alſo wyth wente gat vp ſhip nyght toke nothyng whan become mornyng ieſus ſtode ſhore neuertheleſſe diſciples knewe ieſus ſayeth ieſus vnto chyldren haue ye ony meate anſwered hym ſayde vnto luce 5 caſt net ryghtſyde ſhip ye ſhal fynde caſt able drawe multitude fyſhes thā ye diſciple iohā 1 • c whō ieſus loued ſayde vnto peter lorde whan simon peter herde lorde gyrded hys mātel hym naked lepte ſee diſciples came ſhip farre lande two hūdreth cubites drawynge nette fyſhes whā came downe lande ſaw burnynge cole layde fyſh layde theron breade ieſus ſayeth vnto luce 24 brynge hether fyſhes ye haue taken simō peter wente vp drue nette vpon lande full greate fyſhes hundreth thre fyftye whan ther ſo many yet brake nette ieſus ſayeth vnto come dyne none dyd eate durſt axe arte thou knowynge lorde ieſus came toke breade gaue fyſh lykewyſe nowe thyrde tyme ieſus ſhewed vnto hys diſciples whā ryſen dead ⊢ whā dyned ieſus ſayd vnto simon peter simon iona loueſt thou theſe ſayeth vnto yee lorde thou knoweſt loue ſayeth
