b 2 • b lorde ſayde vnto paule viſion nyght feare ſpeake holde thy peace becauſe wyth noman ſhall ſet vpon maye hurte th • haue much people thys cytie abode yeare ſyxe monethes teachinge worde god amonge whan gallio conſuls debite achia iewes roſe vp agaynſt paule wyth one mynde brought hym iudgemente ſeate ſayenge thys followe doth perſuade men worſhippe god agaynſt lawe paule begynnynge open hys mouthe gallio ſayd vnto iewes actu 25 c verely yf ſome wrongeous dealynge wycked dede ye iewes wold ryght well forbeare yf queſtions worde name lawe loke ye therto ſelues wyl iudge theſe thynges warned iudgement ſeate al takynge 1 cori 1 c soſthenes ruler ſynagoge bet hym iudgement ſeate gallio cared none theſe thynges whan paule taryed yet many dayes byddynge brother fare well ſayled siria wyth hym priſcilla aquila whyche ſhoren hys heade cenchreis nume 6 b vowe came epheſus lefte beynge gone ſynagoge diſputed wyth iewes whan prayed hym wolde abyde longer ſeaſon dydde conſente byddynge farewell ſayenge muſt nedes kepe feaſt hande ieruſalem actu 1 • wyl returne agayn vnto hebre 6 iacob 4 bgod wyllynge wente waye epheſus goynge downe ceſarea wente vp ſaluted congregacion went downe antioche certayne ſeaſon beynge paſt wēte forth walkynge order thorowe regiō gallatia phrigia ſtrēgthynge diſciples certayne iewe name 1 corin 1 b c 16 b apollo alexandria wel ſpoken man came epheſus mighty ſcriptures ſame taught waye lorde beynge whote ſprete ſpake taught diligently thoſe thynges belonge vnto ieſu knowynge onely baptyme ihon ſame therfore begā behaue hymſelfe boldly ye ſynagoge whome whā priſcilla aquila herde toke hym taught hym ye way lorde diligently whan wold go achaia brother exhortynge wrote vnto diſciples ſhuld receaue hym whan come helped muche dyd beleue ouercame iewes myghtely ſhewynge openly ioh 5 • ye ſcriptures ieſus chriſt xix chapter ✚ bvt fortuned whā apollo corinthus paule vpper partes beynge walked thorowe came epheſus dyd fynde certayne diſciples ſayde vnto haue ye beleuynge receaued holy gooſte ſayde vnto hym yee haue herde whether ther holy gooſte ſayde wherewyth ye baptyſed whyche ſayde wyth baptyme ihon paule ſayde math 3 b marc 1 luce 3 c ioh 1 c ihon baptyſed people wyth baptyme repentaunce ſayenge ſhulde beleue hym ſhulde come hym ieſus theſe thynges beynge herde baptyſed name lorde ieſus whan paule layd handes actu 2 4 8 bthe holy gooſte came vpon ſpake wyth tunges prophecyed mē together nearehande twelfe beynge gone ſynagoge ſpake boldely thre monethes diſputynge perſuadynge ye kyngdom god ⊢ whā ſome hardened beleued curſyng waye lorde ye multitude departyng frō thē ſeparated diſciples diſputynge dayly ye ſcole one tyrannus thys done two yeares longe ſo muche al yt dwelt aſia dyd hear worde ye lord iewes heythen marc 16 c god dyd ſmall myracles hande paule ſomuche alſo vpon ye ſycke napkens partlets broughte frō hys body diſeaſes wente wycked ſpretes departed certayne vagabounde iewes coniurers aſſayed call name lorde ieſus vpon euel ſpretes ſayenge charge ieſus whome paule preacheth ſeuen ſonnes iewe name sceua hygh preſt whyche dyd thys wycked ſprete anſwerynge ſayde vnto ieſus knowe paule knowe ye man whome wycked deuell leapynge vppon hauynge gotten power ouercame inſomuch naked wounded dyd flye houſe thys made knowen vnto iewes gentyles whych dyd dwel epheſus ther fell feare thē al ye name ye lord ieſus magnifyed math 3 many alſo beleuynge came confeſſyng ſhewynge theyr dedes many vſed curious craftes iere 36 • brought gether theyr bokes burnt al men price beynge coūted fande mony fyfty thouſande penny myghtely dyd worde god growe ſtablyſhed whā theſe thynges done paule purpoſed ſprete macedonia achia beynge gone thorowe go ieruſalem ſayenge whan ſhal haue ben muſt ſe rome alſo rom 15 ſendynge two yt ſerued hym macedonia timothe eraſtus hymſelfe remayned aſia tyme 2 cori 1 b ther happened ſmall trouble ye tyme waye lord one name demetrius ſyluerſmyth makynge ſyluer ſhrynes diana brought vnto crafteſmen lytle vaūtage callynge together thē ſuch lyke crafteſmen ſayd ye men ye knowe thys crafte haue gaynes ye heare ſe yt paule perſuadynge hath wythdrawē much people epheſus alſo nearehand al aſia ſayeng goddes yt made wt handes thys parte ſhall onely daūger vnto v come reprofe ye tēple alſo great diana ſhal ſet naught yee hyrmaieſte ſhal begyn deſtroyed alſo al aſia worlde doth worſhippe theſe thynges beynge herde fylled wyth wrath cryed ſayenge great diana epheſians al cytie fylled wyth rumore made ruſhynge wyth one mynde opē place rom 16 c gaius ariſtarchus macedonian paules fellowes beynge taken paule wyllynge go people dyd diſciples ſuffre alſo chefe aſia whych hys frendes ſēt vnto hym prayenge wolde put hymſelfe opē place cryed one ſome another thynge congregacion order many knewe cauſe come together people drue forth alexander iewes thruſtynge hym forwarde alexander actu 21 ſilence beyng requyred hande wolde haue geuen people anſwere whome knewe iewe ther aroſe voyce cryenge ye ſpace nearehande two houres greate diana epheſians whan towne clarke hadde ſtylled people ſayde ye men epheſus amonge men knoweth cytie epheſians worſhipper greate diana chylde iupiter seynge therfore theſe thynges gaynſayde ye ought ſtyl nothynge raſhly ye haue brought theſe men nother robber holy thynges nother blaſphemynge goddeſſe yf demetrius crafteſmē wyth hym haue matter agaynſt ony man lawe open ther conſuls debites let accuſe eche yf ye ſeke ony thynge maye diſpatched lawfull congregacion alſo ſtande ieoparde accuſed dayes vproure ſeyng ther noman gylty whome maye geue counte thys vproure whan ſayde theſe thynges let congregacion go xx chapter bvt vproure ceaſſed paule diſciples beyng called thē exhorted farewell went hys waye 1 timo 1 go macedonia whan walked thorowe thoſe party exhorted wyth many wordes cam grekelāde ben thre monethes wayte layde iewes wyllynge ſayle syria counſelled ſhulde returne macedony ther accompanyed hym soſipater pyrrhus ſonne berrhea theſſalonica ariſtarchus secundus gaius derbeus timotheus aſia tychicus actu 2 • • 2 tim 2 c trophimus ſame whan gone afore taryed v troas ſayled frō philippos dayes ſwete breade came vnto troas fyue dayes dyd abyde ſeuen dayes vpon ye fyrſt daye ſabbattes whan come together breake breade paule ready go morowe diſputed wyth continued preachynge vntyll mydnyghte ther lyghtes plenty parloure gathered certayne yonge man name eutichus ſyttynge wyndowe whā ouercome wyth heuy ſlepe paule reaſoned longe beynge ouertaken wyth ſlepe fell thyrde lofte downe takē vp deade vnto whome whan paule come downe • reg 17 c 4 reg 4 leaned vpon hym claſpynge hym aboute ſaid ye troubled ſoule wythin hym goynge vp actu 2 e • cor 11 bbreakyng breade eatynge ſpeakynge ynoughe vntyll lyght wente ſo hys waye brought chylde lyuyng lytle comforted goynge vp ye ſhippe ſayled vnto aſſon wyllynge thence take paule ſo intended hymſelfe wyllynge yourney lande whan come together aſſon hym beynge taken came mitylene ſaylynge thence came daye followynge agaynſt chius ye next daye aryued samos daye followynge came miletus paule purpoſed ſayle epheſus leſt ony taryenge ſhuld happē vnto hym aſia actu 21 haiſted yf ben poſſible haue kept hys feaſt wytſontyde ieruſalē ſendyng fro miletus epheſus called ye elder ye cōgregaciō whyche whan come hym together ſayde vnto ye knowe howe haue ben wyth tyme ſence fyrſt daye actu 19 • entred aſia ſeruynge lorde humblyneſſe teares tēptacions haue happened vnto layenges wayte iewes howe haue wythdrawē nothyng thoſe profitable vnto ſhulde haue ſhewed taught openly houſe houſe teſtifyenge vnto iewes gentyles luce 24 repentaunce godwarde fayth oure lorde ieſus chriſt beholde conſtrayned ſprete go ieruſalem knowynge thynges ſhall happen vnto ſaue actu 21 • b holy gooſt wytneſſeth vnto openly euery cytie ſayenge bandes tribulacions abyde ieruſalem 2 tim 2 • feare none theſe thynges nother coūte lyfe worth myſelfe ſo farre maye fulfyll courſe ſeruice worde haue receaued lorde ieſus namely teſtifye glad tydynges grace god beholde know ye ſhall ſe face nomore whome haue gone preachynge kyngdome god wherfore take recorde thys daye ame 2 regu 3 fvngylty bloude men haue drawen backe ſhulde ſhewe counſell god take hede vnto youre ſelues al flocke amonge whych holy gooſt hath ſet byſhops rule cōgregaciō god whyche hath purchaſed wyth hys bloude knowe 1 tim 4 1 pet 2 departyng ſhal rauenous wolues entre amonge ſparynge flocke iohā 13 c • iohā 2 c frō amōge yourſelues ſhall men ryſe ſpeakynge ouerthwart thynges may drawe diſciples whych cauſe watche ye hauynge mynde haue ceaſſed ye ſpace thre yeare nyght daye admonyſhynge euery one wyth teares commende vnto god vnto worde hys grace whych myghty edify geue inheritaūce amōge al thē yt ſanctifyed • cori 11 b 12 b haue deſyred ſyluer golde cloth nomā ye knowe thoſe thynges yt nedeful vnto thē yt wt gene 3 1 cori 9 b 2 teſſa 3 haue theſe handes holpen haue ſhewed thynges ſo labourynge ought receaue weake remēbre worde lorde ieſu ſayd bleſſed geue take whā ſayd theſe thynges hys knee bowed actu 21 prayed wyth ther happened great wepynge fallynge vpō paules necke kyſſed hym beynge greatlye greued worde ſayde ſhulde ſe hys face nomore broughte hym ſhyppe xxi chapter whā happened ſayled beynge drawen awaye thē came ye ſtrayghte courſe cous nexte daye rhodus frō thence patara whā founde ſhippe ſaylynge ouer vnto phenice goynge vp ſayled whan cypers ſyght leauynge lefte hande ſayled siria came tyre ſhulde ſhippe vnladē diſciples beyng foūde abode ſeuen dayes actu 1 • • ſayd vnto paule ſprete yt ſhuld go vp ieruſalē dayes beyng fulfylled beyng departed wente wayes bryngynge v wt theyr wyues chyldrē vntyll forth cytie knee bowed actu 20 c prayed ſhore whā byddē ech fare wel wēt vp ye ſhip went agayne vnto theyrs ſaylynge frō tyre beynge fyniſhed came downe ptolomais brother beynge ſaluted abode one daye wyth beynge gone forth next daye came ceſarea entrynge houſe actu 6 8 philippe euangeliſte one ſeuen dyd abyde wyth hym ſame ſeuen doughters virgin ioel 2 • prophecied whā dyd abyde certayne dayes ther cam certayn prophete iewry name actu 11 c agabus ſame whan come vnto v toke paul gyrdel byndyng hym hys fete hādes ſayd thys ſayth ye holy gooſt actu 20 • mā whoſe girdel ſhal ye iews bind thus ieruſalē ſhall delyuer ye hā de ye heythē whā herde yt place prayed wold go vp ieruſalē anſwered paule ſayd ye wepynge puttynge harte diſtreſſe actu 20 ci onely ready boūde ieruſalē name ye lord ieſus alſo dye whan coulde perſuade hym ceaſſed ſayenge math 6 b lordes wyll done beynge ready theſe dayes wente vp ieruſalem ſome diſciples ceſarea came wyth v bryngynge wyth thē one mnaſon cypers olde diſciple wyth whome myght lodge whan came ieruſalem brethrē receaued v gladly nexte daye wente paule wyth v vnto iames elder aſſembled whyche whā ſaluted ſhewed order thynges god done amonge heythen hys miniſtracion whan herde magnifyed god ſayd vnto hym brother thou ſeyſt many thouſandes amonge iewes haue beleued al zelous ouer lawe haue herde thou doeſt teach thoſe iewes departynge moſes amonge heythen ſayenge theyr chyldren nedynge circumciſed nother walke accordynge coſtume therfore multitude verely muſte come together ſhall heare come thys therfore ſaye vnto haue foure men hauynge num 6 b actu 18 b vowe vpō theſe beynge takē ſanctifye thyſelfe wyth coſt vpon thē ſhaue theyr heades euery man ſhal knowe yt thinges yt haue herde yt falſe thou alſo walkeſt kepyng ye law vnto heythen haue beleued haue actu 15 wrytten geuynge ſentence abſteyne themſelues offered vnto idol bloude ſtranguled fornicacion actu 24 b paule mē taken hym beynge purifyed nexte daye entred wyth temple ſhewynge fulfyllynge dayes vntyll ther offered oblacion euery one thē whan ſeuen dayes fulfylled whan iewes aſia ſawe hym temple moued people layde handes hym cryenge ye men iſrael helpe thys mā whych teachynge men euery agaynſte thys people lawe place hath alſo moreouer brought heythen mē temple defyled thys holy place hadde ſene actu 20 • 2 tim 2 • trophimus epheſian wt hym cytie whome ſuppoſed paule brought temple al cytie moued ther made runnynge together people takynge paule drue hym oute temple ſtrayghtwaye dores ſhut whan ſought kyll hym ſhewed vnto captayne company al ieruſalē moued forthwyth ſouldyers taken wyth hym captaynes ouer hundreth ranne downe whych whan ſene captayne ſouldyours ceaſſed beat paule captayne cōmynge neare toke hym commaūded hym accu 21 b bounde wyth two cheynes axed done cryed one thynge ſome another thynge amonge people whan coulde knowe certaynte vproure commaū ded hym led caſtell whan come ſteppes fortuned borne vp ſouldyours becauſe violence people multytude people followed cryenge luce 23 bhaue hym awaye whan beganne broughte caſtell paule ſayd vnto ye captayne maye ſpeake ſomethynge vnto ſayd vnto hym canſt thou greke arte thou egipcian afore theſe dayes haſte rayſed vproure haſt brought ye wylderneſſe foure thouſande pryue murtherers paule ſayde vnto hym verely iewe fre cyteſin actu 9 b 22 tharſus cilicia cytie vnknowen praye let ſpeake vnto people whā permytted hym paule ſtandynge vpon ſteppes beckened wyth hande vnto people whan ther made great ſilence ſpake hebrue tūge ſayenge xxii chapter ye men brother father hear myne anſwere make vnto whā herde ſpake vnto hebrue tunge kepte ſilence ſayde actu 9 b • 1 c iewe borne tharſus cilicia noryſhed thys cytie taught truth ye lawe ye father ye fete actu 5 e gamaliel feruent louer lawe ye thys daye actu 9 26 b 1 corī 15 c gala 1 b whych haue perſecuted thys lawe vntyll death byndynge delyuerynge towardes men wemē chefe preſte doth beare recorde auncient men whome alſo receauynge letter went damaſcus vnto ye brother ſhuld brynge thence bounde vnto ieruſalem myghte punyſhed fortuned wente approched vnto damaſcus mydde day ſodēly dyd great lyght ſhyne rounde aboute heauen fallynge downe grounde herde voyce ſayenge vnto saule saule doeſt thou perſecute anſwered arte thou lorde ſayde vnto ieſus nazareth whome thou perſecuteſt dani 3 • 10 b wyth ſawe lyghte dede ye voyce hym ſpake wyth dyd heare ſayde ſhall lorde lorde ſayde vnto aryſynge go damaſcus ſhall tolde behoueth whan ſawe bryghtneſſe lyghte beynge ledde hāde companion came damaſcus actu 9 b one ananias deuoute man hauynge good reporte ye lawe al iewes dwell wyth hym commynge ſtandynge ſayd vnto brother saule loke vp loked vpon hym ſame houre ſayde god father hath ordyned afore thou ſhuldeſt knowe hys wyll ſhuldeſt ſe ryghteous ſhuldeſt heare voyce hys mouth thou ſhalte hys wytneſſe vnto al mē thoſe thynges thou haſt ſene herde nowe doeſt thou tary aryſe baptyſed waſh away thy ſynnes rom 10 b name beyng called vpon happened vnto returnynge ieruſalē prayenge temple become traūce ſe hym ſayenge vnto make hayſt math 10 b actu 9 go quyckely ieruſalem ſhall receaue thy wytneſſe ſaid lorde knowe ſhuttyng vp preſon beatynge thorowe ſynagoges dyd beleue actu 7 g 8 whan bloude steuē thy wytneſſe ſhed ſtode conſented kepte clothes ſlewe hym ſayde vnto go thy waye actu 13 gala 1 c epheſi • ſhall ſende amonge nacions farre herde hym vntyl thys word lyfte vp theyr voyce ſayenge haue away earth ſuch one becommeth hym lyue whan cryed caſt theyr clothes dyd throwe duſt ye ayre captayne cōmaunded hym brought caſtell beaten wyth ſcourges racke hym myght knowe cauſe dyd ſo crye hym whan bounde hym wyth thonges paule ſayd vnto centurio ſtode hym lawful ſcourge romane cō demned whyche beynge herde centurio wente captayne ſhewed hym ſayeng wylt thou thys man cyteſin rome captayne cōmynge hym ſayd arte thou romane ſayd yee captayne anſwered haue wyth great ſūme mony optayned thys fredome paule ſayde alſo borne romane therfore departed ſtrayght waye frō hym ſhulde haue racked hym captayne alſo feared knew cyteſin rome bounde hym nexte daye wyllynge knowe diligently cauſe accuſed iewes dyd lowſe hym cōmaunded preſtes come together councell act 2 • dbryngynge forth paule ſet amonge xxiii chapter paule beholdynge coū cell ſayd ye men brethrē actu 24 • haue ben conuerſaunt god wyth good conſcience vntyll thys daye hygh preſte ananias commaunded ſtode hym iere 20 ioh 18 ſmyte hym mouth thā ſaid paule vnto hym god ſhall ſmyte thou whyted wall deut 17 • ſyttynge iudgeſt thou lawe cōmaū deſt ſmytten contrary ye lawe ſtode ſayde doeſt thou curſe hygh preſte god paule ſayd knewe brother hygh preſte wrytten exodi 22 thou ſhalt curſe ruler thy people paule knowynge one part saduces phariſes cryed councell ye men brother phariſe ſonne phariſe actu 4 26 28 c philip 3 hope reſurreccion ye dead iudged whan ſayd thoſe thynges ther aroſe diſſenciō amonge phariſes saduces multitude broken vp math 22 c marc 12 b luce 20 dfor saduces ſaye ther reſurreccion deade nother angell ſprete phariſes graunte ther happened great crye ſome phariſes ryſynge vp dyd ſtryue ſayenge fynde euell thys man actu 12 yf ſprete angell hath ſpoken vnto hym whan ther ryſen great diſcencion captayne fearynge leſt paule torne thē cōmaunded ſouldyours go downe take hym myddes brynge hym caſtell actu 16 b 1 • lorde ſtandynge hym ye next nyght ſayd conſtaunte thou haſte teſtifyed ieruſalem ephe 3 • tim 1 b ſo muſt thou • eſtify rome alſo whā become day ſome ye iewes gathered themſelues together boūde themſelues wyth vowe ſayenge ſhulde nother eate drynke vntyl ſlayne paul forty men made thys conſpiracion whych wente vnto hygh preſte elder ſayd haue boūde ſelues wt vowe eat nothynge tyl haue kylled paule therfore ye wyth coūcell geue knowlege vnto ye captayne brynge hym forthe vnto though • ye wolde knowe ſome certaynte hym ready kyll hym afore come neare vnto whan paules ſyſters ſōne herde layenge wayte came entred caſtell ſhewed paule paule callynge one centuriōs vnto hym ſayd brynge thys yonge man vnto ye captayne hath ſome thynge ſhewe hym truly takynge hym brought hym captayne ſayd preſoner paule callynge dyd praye bryng thys yōge man vnto hauynge ſomethynge ſaye vnto captayne takynge hys honde wente aſyde wyth hym waye axed hym thou haſt ſhewe ſayde iewes agreed deſyre thou brynge forth paule morow councell thoughe wolde knowe ſome certaynte hym thou beleue thē fortye men laye wayte hym whyche haue bounde themſelues wyth vowe nother eat drynke vntyll ſlayē hym euē ready waytynge thy promyſe captayne therfore let yonge man go cōmaūdyng hym ſhulde tell vnto noman ſhewed theſe thynges two centuriōs beynge called ſaid vnto make readye two hundreth ſouldyours maye go vntyll ceſarea thre ſcore ten horſemen two hundreth ſpeare men thyrde houre ye nyght make ready beaſtes ſettynge paule thereon myght bryng hym ſafe vnto felix debite dyd feare leſt happely iewes ſhulde take hym away kyl hym afterwarde ſhulde blamed though ſhulde take mony wrytyng hym letter conteynyng theſe wordes claudius lyſias ſendeth gretynge vnto ryght good debite felix actu 21 thys man beynge taken iewes begynnynge ſlayne haue cōmynge vpō wt army reſcued knowynge romane wyllynge knowe cauſe dyd laye agaynſt hym actu 22 c brought hym theyr councell whome dyd fynde accuſed queſtions theyr lawe hauynge faute worthy death bandes whā ſhewed layeng wayte layde hym haue ſente hym vnto commaundynge ye accuſers alſo ſaye fare well ſouldyours commaunded takynge paule brought hym nyght antipatras nexte daye leauynge ye horſemen ſhuld go wyth hym returned caſtell whych whan came ceſarea taken letter vnto debite ſet paule alſo hym whā red hadde axed prouince knowynge cilicia ſayd deut 17 wyll heare whan thyne accuſers come commaunded hym kepte herodes iudgement houſe xxiiii chapter fyue dayes cam downe actu 2 • 25 • ananias ye hygh preſt wyth ſome elder one tertullus oratour whych went vnto debite agaynſt paule paule beynge called tertullus begāne accuſe ſayenge seynge lyue greate reſt many thynges redreſſed thy wyſedome alowe alwaye euery ryghte good felix wyth thankeſgeuyng leſt tary longe praye thy goodneſſe brefly heare v haue foūde thys peſtiferous man rayſynge vp ſedicion vnto iewes thorow al world author ſedicion nazarees ſecte whych alſo actu 21 hath vndertaken defyle temple whome beynge taken wold haue iudged hym lawe lyſias captayne commynge vpon v wyth great violence toke hym oure handes commaundynge hys accuſers come vnto tryeng thou thyſelfe mayeſt haue knowlege theſe thynges wherof accuſe hym iewes dyd alſo affirme ſaye theſe thynges ſo paule debite beckenyng vnto hym ſpeake anſwered knowynge haue bene iudge vnto people many yeares ſence ſhall wyth good corage anſwere myſelfe thou mayeſt knowe ther nomore ſaue twelfe dayes paſt vnto ſence came vp praye ieruſalem actu 2 • nother dyd fynde diſputynge temple makyng ony gatheryng people nother ſynagoges cytie nother proue thynges vnto wherof accuſe thys math 10 marc 8 c luce 12 c cōfeſſe vnto accordynge ye ſecte whyche call hereſye ſo ſerue father god beleuynge thynges wrytten lawe prophetes hauynge hope godwarde exod 3 math 22 c reſurreccion ye dead whych theſe themſelues alſo loke iuſte vniuſte actu 23 therfore myne endeuoure alſo alwaye haue conſcience wythout offendynge towarde god mē rom 15 2 corī 9 many yeares came almeſſe vpon peoyle offerynges vowes actu 21 cwherein dyd fynde beynge purifyed tēple great cōpany wt rumoure toke cryenge ſayeng auoyde enemye ſome iewes aſia whō behoued preſēt wt accuſe yf ought agaynſt let theſe thēſelues ſpeake yf haue foūde ony wyckedneſſe ſeyng ſtād ye coūcel wtout one voyce wt ye cryed ſtādyng amōge thē actu 29 thys day iudged ye reſurrecciō ye dead felix differred thē knowyng certaynly thys waye ſayeng whan lyſias captayne ſhalbe come downe ſhall heare iere • 9 c actu 2 • •• cōmaūded cēturion kepe hym haue reſte nother forbyd ony hys miniſter vnto hym certayne dayes felix cōmynge wt druſilla hys wyfe whych iewyſh called paule herde hym fayth ieſus chriſt reaſoned ryghteouſneſſe chaſtite iudgement come felix beynge afea • ed anſwered thys tyme go thy waye conueniente tyme wyll call hopynge alſo mony ſhulde haue ben geuē hym paule ye cauſe alſo callynge hym ofte▪ communed wt hym two yeares beynge fynyſhed felix gat ſucceſſor porcius feſtus felix wyllynge iewes pleaſure act 25 clefte paule bounde xxv chapter whan feſtus therfore come ye prouince thre dayes went vp ieruſalē frō ceſarea ye hygh preſtes principall ye iewes wēt agaynſt paule beſought hym deſyrynge fauoure agaynſt yt wold cōmaūde hī brought ieruſalē layeng wayt yt myght kyl ye way feſtus anſwered paule kept ceſarea hīſelfe ſhuld ſpedelyer go way whoſo therfor amōge ſayeth able commyng together accuſe hym yf ther ony faute ye man hauyng taryed amōge thē nomore ſaue viii ten dayes wente downe ceſarea nexte daye dyd ſyt vppon iudgement ſeate commaunded paule broughte hym whā brought iewes ieruſalem ſtode hym layeng agaynſt hym many greuous cauſes whyche coulde proue paule geuynge anſwere actu 24 b 28 c haue ſynned nought nother agaynſt lawe ye iewes temple emperoure feſtus wyllynge iewes pleaſure anſweryng vnto paule ſayd wylt thou go vp ieruſalem iudged theſe thynges paul ſayd ſtande emperours iudgement ſeate muſte iudged haue hurt ye iewes yu knoweſt beſt yf haue done hurte ought worthy death refuſe dye yf ther none thoſe whereof accuſe man geue vnto appeale vnto emperoure feſtus hauynge ſpoken wyth ye coū ſell anſwered thou haſt appealed vnto emperoure vnto emperoure ſhalte thou go whan certayne dayes paſte kynge agrippa bernice came downe ceſarea welcome feſtus whan▪ dyd abyde many dayes feſtus dydde ſhewe kynge paule ſayeng actu 24 c ther man lefte bounde felix actu 24 whome hygh preſtes elder iewes came vnto deſyrynge ſentence agaynſte hym vnto whome made anſwer deut 17 athat romanes vſe cō dēne man yt accuſed haue hys accuſers preſente receaue place defēdyng cleare hymſelfe fautes layde agaynſte hym whan therfore come together wythoute ony delaye ſyttynge vpon iudgemente ſeate nexte daye commaunded man broughte forthe actu •• • whome whan accuſers ſtode broughte cauſe dyd myſdeme ony euell certayne queſtions theyr ſuperſticion agaynſt hym one ieſus deade paule dyd affirme lyue doutynge ſame queſtion ſayd whether wolde go ieruſalem iudged theſe thynges paule appealyng myght kepte vnto ye emperours knowlege haue commaunded kepte vntyll ſende hym vnto emperoure agrippa ſayd vnto feſtus alſo wolde haue herd man tomorowe ſayde ſhalt thou heare hym nexte daye whan agrippa bernice come wyth great pompe entred commune hall wyth captaynes principall men cytie whan feſtus dyd commaunde paule broughte forth feſtus ſaid kynge agrippa al ye men v ye ſe thys man whome al multitude iewes haue intreated ieruſalem deſyrynge cryenge ought lyue longer fande actu 23 b 26 c haue done nothynge worthy death ſame appealynge emperoure haue iudged ſende hym whome haue certaynte maye wryte vnto lorde wherfore brought hym vnto chefly vnto kynge agrippa examinacion maye haue wryte ſemeth vnto wythout reaſon ſende preſoner ſhew hys cauſes xxvi chapter bvt agrippa ſayde vnto paule permytted vnto ſpeake thy ſelfe paule ye hāde ſtretched beganne ſpeake counte myſelfe happy kynge agrippa ſeynge ſhall defende myſelf daye thynges whyche accuſed iewes ſpecially becauſe thou knoweſt coſtumes queſtions amonge iewes wherfore beſeke y• thou wylt heare paciently truly lyfe frō youth yt whych begynnynge amonge nacion ieruſalem iewes knowe knowynge begynnynge yf wyll teſtifye mooſt ſureſte ſecte oure religion lyued phariſe ac • u 23 philip 3 ſtande ſubiecte iudgemente hope gene • c 12 c deut 8 c pſal 15 bpromyſe made god father vnto whych xii tribe hope come ſeruyng god daye nyght hope kynge accuſed iewes iudged incredible wt iohā 11 cthat god rayſeth deade verely dyd thynke behoued many thynges agaynſt name ieſus nazareth actu 8 9 22 wych dyd alſo ieruſalē ſhut many ſayntes preſon hauyng receaued authorite hygh preſtes whā put death brought ye ſentence punyſhynge thē ofte thorow ſynagoges cōpelled thē blaſpheme beynge mad agaynſt perſued thē vntyl ſtraunge cyties aboute ye whych went damaſcus wt authorite lycēce hygh preſtes mydde day kynge ſawe waye lyghte heauen haue ſhyned aboute together wyth paſſynge bryghtneſſe sonne whan al fallen downe groūde herde voyce ſpeakynge vnto hebrue tunge saule saule perſecuteſt thou hard kycke agaynſt pricke ſayde art thou lorde lorde ſayde ieſus whome thou perſecuteſt ryſe vp ſtande vpō thy fete thereto haue appeared vnto maye orden miniſter wytneſſe thoſe thynges thou haſt ſene thoſe thynges ſhall appeare vnto delyuerynge people nacions amonge whych nowe ſende ye open theyr eye yt turne darkneſſe vnto eſa •• • lyght frō deuels power vnto god receaue forgeueneſſe ſynnes enheritaunce amonge ſayntes thorow fayth wherfore kynge agrippa vnbeleuynge vnto heauenly viſion fyrſt vnto damaſcus ieruſalem region iewry heythen dyd ſhewe ſhulde actu 2 3 c • 7 e repent turned vnto god doynge workes worthy repentaunce thys cauſe iewes hauynge taken whan temple wente aboute kyll beynge holpen ye ayde god ſtande vntyll thys daye teſtifyenge vnto leeſte mooſt ſayeng nothinge beſyde thoſe prophetes haue ſpoken cōmynge moſes chriſte ſhulde ſuffre fyrſte reſurreccion dead lyght ſhalbe ſhewed vnto ye people heythen ſpake theſe thynges layd hymſelfe feſtus ſayd wyth loude voyce thou arte madde paule much learnynge turneth yt madneſſe paule ſayd madde good feſtus ſpeake wordes truth ſoberneſſe kynge knoweth vnto whome ſpeake boldly thynke none theſe thynges vnknowē vnto hym iohā 18 c none theſe thynges done corner doeſt yu kynge agrippa beleue ye prophetes knowe thou beleueſt agrippa ſayd vnto paule thou perſuadeſt lytle become chriſtiā paule ſayd wolde god lytle great alſo heare thys daye become ſuch alſo except theſe bandes kynge roſe vp debite bernice yt ſat whan gone aſyde ſpake eche ſayenge actu 23 b 25 thys man hath done thynge worthy death bandes agrippa ſayde vnto feſtus thys man myghte haue ben letten lowſe appealed vnto emperoure xxvii chapter bvt whan iudged yt ſhulde ſayle italy paule wyth preſoners ſhulde taken vnto centurion ye emperours company name iulius goynge vp ſhippe adramittis begynnynge ſayle coaſtes aſia launched co • l 4 • ariſtarchus macedonian theſſalia continuynge v ye next daye came sidon iulius intreatynge paule courteouſlye actu 24 c 28 bſuffred hym go vnto hys frendes refr • ſh hymſelfe whan launched thence ſayled neare cypers becauſe ye windes contrary ſaylynge ouer ſee cilicia pamphilia came lyſtra whych cytie lycia cēturio fyndynge ſhippe alexandria ſaylynge italye ſet v ouer therein whan ſayled ſlowly many dayes ſcarce come agaynſt gnidus wynde forbyddynge v ſayled candy nye vnto salmo ſcarcely ſaylynge came vnto place called goodhauen nye vnto cytie thalaſſa whan muche tyme ſpente ſaylynge yeopardous becauſe faſtynge paſt paule comforted ſayenge vnto ye men ſe thys ſaylynge begynneth wyth daūger greate dāmage ladynge ſhippe alſo lyues centurio gaue credence vnto gouernoure mayſter ſhippe thoſe thynges ſpokē paule whan hauen conuenient wynter many counſelled ſayle thence yf myght commynge phenice wynter whych hauē candy towarde ye ſouthweſt northweſt wynde whā ye ſouth wynde blewe thynkynge haue optained theyr purpoſe whā lowſed frō aſſon ſayled candy longe roſe againſt tēpeſteous winde called northeaſt whā ye ſhippe caught coulde wythſtande wynde ſhyppe beynge cōmytted wynde dyd dryue rū nyng certayn ile called clauda coulde ſcarce get bote whyche beynge taken vp vſed helpe byndynge ſhyppe fearyng leſt ſhuld fall ye sirtes parlous ſā dy place ſee aboute coaſtes africa sirtes veſſell let downe ſo caryed ben toſſed wt great tempeſt made caſt nexte daye thyrde day thrue away tacklynges ſhippe wt theyr owne handes whan nother sōne ſtarres appeared many dayes ſmall tempeſt laye vpon v hope oure ſauegarde taken awaye whan ther ben longe faſtynge dyd paule ſtandynge myddeſt ſaye ye ought ye men hearynge haue lowſed candy get thys harme loſſe exhorte good chere ther ſhalbe loſſe ony man lyfe v ſaue ſhippe angell god whoſe whome ſerue ſtode thys nyghte ſayenge feare paule actu 25 b thou muſte brought act 25 b emperoure beholde god hath geuen yt ſayle wyth wherfore ye men good chere truſt god ſhal ſo ſayde vnto actu 28 muſt come certayne ile fourtenth nyghte come ſayled adria aboute mydnyght dyd ſhypmē deme ſome region appeare vnto whych alſo caſtynge ou • leade fande twēty feddōs gone lytle frō thēce fande fyfty feddōs fearynge leſt ſhulde fal rough place caſting foure ankers ye ſterne wyſhed become daye whā ſhypmē ſought flye ſhyppe letten downe bote ſee vnder ye pretēce yf wolde caſte ankers foreparte ſhyppe paule ſayd vnto centurio ſouldyours wythout theſe abyde ſhyppe ye ſaued cut ſouldyours rope bote inſū der let fall whan began become lyght paule prayed take breade ſayenge thys daye fourtenth daye yt ye waytynge abyde faſtynge takyng nothynge wherfore praye take meate youre health math 10 luce 12 none youre heade ſhall one heere peryſh whan ſayd thys marc 6 c 8 ioh 6 1 tim 4 atakynge breade thanked god preſence whan broken beganne eate beynge good chere began alſo take breade al ſoules ſhyppe two hundreth thre ſcore ſyxtene beyng ſatiſfyed wyth meate lyghtened ſhyppe caſtynge wheat ſee whā day knew lande ſpyed hauē hauynge banke whych thought thruſt ſhyppe yf coulde whan taken vp ankers commytted themſelues ſee lowſynge rudderbandes mayne ſayle huſſed vp wynde drue lande whan fallen place hauynge ſee ſydes thruſt ſhyppe therein foreparte dede abode vnmoueable ſterne lowſed violence ſee ſouldyours counſell kyll preſoners leſt whan ony ſuymmed ſhuld eſcape cēturio wyllynge ſaue paule forbad done commaunded coulde ſwymme caſt thēſelues fyrſt eſcape go lande caryed vpon table ſome vpon thoſe thynges ſhyp thus came paſſe al ſoules eſcaped lande xxviii chapter whā eſcaped dyd knowe ye ile actu 27 c called melite romanes called al naciōs barbarous romanes grekes barbarous people ſhewed v ſmall kyndneſſe fyre kyndled refreſhed v becauſe rayne laye vppon v colde whan paule gathered lytle bōdel ſtyckes layed vpon fyre whan vyper came heate ſhe lepte vpon hande whan barbarous people ſawe beaſte hangynge hys hande ſayd ech surely thys mā man ſlayer whome though haue eſcaped ſee vengeaunce ſuffreth lyue truely ſhakynge beaſte fyre luce 10 • ſuffered harme thought ſhulde haue ſwollen ſodenly fallen dyed waytynge longe ſeynge euell happen hym turnynge themſelues actu 14 • ſayde hym god thoſe quarter landes ruler ile name publius whyche lodgyng v intreated v curteouſly thre dayes fortuned ye father publius lye diſeaſed math 8 b feuers bloudy fluxe vnto paule went whan hadde prayed layde hys handes vpō hym healed hym beynge done ile diſeaſes came hym healed whych alſo endued v wyth greate honoure laded v ſaylynge wyth thynges neceſſary thre monethes ſailed ſhippe alexandria whych wyntred ile whoſe badge caſtor pollux whan cā syracuſa abode thre dayes thence ſaylynge aboute came rhegium one daye ſouthwynde blowynge came puteolis ye ſecōde daye brother beyng foūde prayed abyde wyth thē ſeuen dayes ſo came rome whan brother thence herde v actu 15 met v vntyll forum appii thre tauerns whych whan paule ſene thankynge god gat corage whan came rome centurio toke preſoners vnto ye chefe captayne hooſt actu 24 c • 7 graunted vnto paule abyde hymſelfe wt ſouldyour kepynge hym thyrde daye dyd paule call chefe iewes whan come ſayde vnto ye men brother actu 24 b 25 b doynge nothynge agaynſt people coſtume ye father actu 23 c delyuered bounde ieruſalem ye handes romanes whan examined wolde haue let go becauſe ther cauſe death ye iewes gaynſayenge compelled appeale vnto emperoure hauynge ought accuſe people thys cauſe therfore deſyred ſe ſpeake wyth actu 23▪ • 26 hope iſrael ame bounde aboute wyth thys cheyne ſayd vnto hym haue nother receaued letter iewry nother dyd ony brother commynge ſhewe ſpeake ony euell praye heare thyſelfe thou thynkeſt knowe thys ſecte euery luce • • gaynſayde whan appoynted hym daye ther came many hym hys lodgynge vnto whome wytneſſynge expouned kyngdome god perſuadynge ieſu gene 3 • moſes ye prophetes frō ye mornynge vntyll euenynge actu 17 ſome beleued thoſe thynges ſpoken ſome beleued whan agreynge together ſtroue paule ſayeng one worde holy gooſte hath well ſpoken prophete eſaye vnto oure father ſayenge go vnto thys people ſaye eſay 6 b mat 1 • b marc 4 luce 8 b iohā 12 e rom 1 • • wyth eare ſhall ye heare ye ſhall vnderſtande ſeynge ſhall ye ſe perceaue thys people harte waxē groſſe wyth theyr eares haue herde hardely theyr eye haue cloſed leſt happely ſe theyr eyen heare wyth theyr eares vnderſtande wyth harte turned heale therfore knowen vnto vnto heythen thys ſaluacion god ſente ſhall heare whā ſayd theſe thynges iewes wente hym queſteonynge much amōge themſelues abode two whole yeare hys hyred lodgynge receaued al came hym preachynge kyngdome god teachynge thynges ye lorde ieſus chriſt wyth al boldneſſe wythout forbyddynge ¶the ende actes apoſtles epiſtle apoſtle paule romaynes fyrſt chapter ✚ paule ſeruaūte ieſus chriſte called apoſtle actu 1 • put aparte ye goſpel god deut 18 c actu 2 • promyſed befor hys prophetes ye holy ſcriptures hys ſonne whych becam vnto hym math 1 2 tim 2 ſede dauid ye fleſh whych declared ſōne god power ye ſprete hallowynge frō reſurrecciō ye deade ieſu chriſt lorde whō actu 9 c haue receaued grace apoſtleſhippe obediēt vnto fayth amōg al naciōs hys name whō ye alſo called ieſu chriſt ⊢to al yt beloued god rome called ſayntes 1 cori 1 gala • • grace vnto peace god ye father lord ieſu chriſt fyrſt al truly geue thankes god thorow ieſus chriſt al becauſe fayth publyſhed al worlde god ioh 4 c 2 tim 4 • whō ſerue ſprete ye goſpel ſonne wytneſſe vnto yt wythout ceaſſynge make mēcion alway prayer philip 1 • colloſ 1 iere 10 beſechynge yf ony meanes may ſomtyme ye laſte haue proſperous yourney philip 1 • colloſ 1 iere 10 wyl god act 28 c come vnto lōge ſe yt may beſtowe vpon ſome ſpirituall grace cōfirme haue conſolacion together ye fayth myne whych amonge v wyll ye ignoraūt brother ye oftymes haue purpoſed come vnto bē actu 16 let therto yt myghte haue ſome frute lyke heythen alſo detter grekes ye barbarous wyſe ye vnwyſe yt ther readyneſſe preach ye goſpell vnto alſo whych rome eccli 41 c 2 tim 1 b aſhamed goſpell why▪ • cori 1 c power god ſaluacion euery beleuer ye iewe firſt ye greke ye ryghteouſneſſe god declared fayth fayth wrytten • bac 2 gala 3 heb 1 • ryghteous ſhall lyue fayth wrath god declared frō heauē vpō al vngodlyneſſe vnryghteouſneſſe thoſe men wtholde ye truth god vnryghteouſneſſe ye thynge god whych knowē manifeſt actu 14 cfor god hath ſhewed thē heb 11 ye inuiſible thinges hym yt vnderſtōd pſal 18 aare beholden creature ye world thoſe thynges made yee euen hys euerlaſtynge power godheade ſo yt excuſed whan knewe god glorifyed hym god gaue thā kes became vayne theyr thoughtes deut 28 c theyr foolyſh hart darkened ſayenge themſelues wyſe became foolyſh pſal 105 c iere 2 chaūged alſo ye glory ye vncorruptible god ſimilitude ymage corruptible man fethred foules fourefooted beaſtes bel ſerpentes 2 reg 24 ezech 14 wherfore god gaue ouer luſtes theyr hart euen vnclēneſſe myght ſhame theyr bodyes thēſelues becauſe altered ye truth god leſynge worſhipped ſerued ye creature rather thā maker whych bleſſed euer amē therfore god gaue thē ouer ſhameful luſtes leui 18 cfor theyr wemē chaūged ye vſe nature ye vſe agaynſt nature lykewyſe alſo ye mē ye naturall vſe ye wemē beyng left burned luſtes amōg themſelues mē vpō mē workyng fylthyneſſe receauyng thēſelues yt due rewarde theyr erroure prou 1 c actu • e regarded haue god knowlege god gaue thē ouer lewde mynde yt myght thoſe thynges whyche cōueniēt beyng fylled wt iniquite malyce fornicacion couetouſneſſe wyckedneſſe ful enuye mā ſlaughters cōtēcion gyle frowardneſſe preuy accuſers bakbyters hat ful vnto god doer wrōge proud hye mynded bryngers vp euell thynges obediēt father mother vnwyſe vnmanerly wtout loue wtout conuenaūt without mercy mē whā knowē ryghteouſnes god vnderſtode yt whych ſuch thynges worthy death onely yt thē alſo y• oſ • c 7 cōſent ye doer ii chapter wherfore yu art excuſed yu man whoſoeuer yu yt math 7 iudgeſt yt 2 reg 12 b yu iudgeſt another yu condemneſt thy ſelfe thou thyſelfe iudgeſt doeſt euen ye ſame thynges knowe ye iudgemēt god accordynge truth agaynſt thoſe ſuche thynges thynkeſt thou thys thou euery man iudgeſt thē whych ſuch thynges doeſt ye ſame thyſelfe yt yu ſhalt eſcape ye iudgement god diſpyſeſt yu rich goodnes pacience longe ſufferynge eſa • 30 c actu 1 • • knoweſt yu yt louyng kyndneſſe god leadeth repentaūce yu thy ſtubburneſſe impenitent hart hordeſt vp wrath vnto thyſelfe ye daye wrath declarynge ye ryghteous iudgement god pſal 61 b whych ſhall rewarde euery man accordynge hys workes euē glorye honoure incorrupcion ſuch truely accordynge pacience good doynge ſeke euerlaſtynge lyfe vnto ſuch contēcion 2 teſſa 1 b agre vnto truth beleue vnryghteouſneſſe ſhal come wrath indignaciō trouble anguyſh agaynſt euery ſoule man doynge euell iewe fyrſt greke glory honoure peace vnto euery one doynge good iewe fyrſt ye greke actu • 0 ephe 6 gala 2 ther accepting perſones wt god whoſoeuer haue ſynned wtout lawe ſhal peryſh wtout lawe ſoeuer haue ſinned ye law ſhalbe iudged ye law math 7 c luce 6 • iacob 1 • ye hearer ye law righteous wt god ye doer ye lawe ſhalbe made ryghteous whā heythē yt haue lawe naturally thoſe thynges yt belonge lawe ſame hauynge lawe law vnto thēſelues declare worke ye law wrytten theyr harte theyr cōſcience bearyng wytneſſe vnto thē thoughtes accuſynge excuſynge amonge ſelues daye mat 25 c whan god ſhall iudge ſecretes men ieſus chriſt accordynge goſpell yf iohā 8 c yu named iew reſteſt lawe makeſt thy boaſt god knoweſt hys wyll beynge inſtructe lawe aloweſt thynges profitable beleueſt thyſelfe leader blynde lyght thē darkneſſe inſtructour vnwyſe mayſter yonge babe hauynge enſample knowlege truth lawe thou therfore ye teacheſt another teacheſt thyſelf math • • thou preacheſt ſteale ſtealeſt thy ſelfe thou ſayeſt mē ſhulde breake wedlocke breadeſt wedlocke thyſelfe thou abhorreſt idol cōmitteſt ſacrilege thou makeſt boaſt ye lawe tranſgreſſion lawe diſhonoureſt god thorowe name god blaſphemed amōg heythen eſa 52 ezech 36 wrytten circumciſion truly auayleth yf thou obſerue lawe yf thou trāſgreſſoure lawe thy circumciſion become vncircūciſion yf vncircumciſion therfore kepe ryghteouſneſſes lawe ſhal hys vncircumciſion reputed circumciſion nature vncircumciſion perfourmynge ye lawe ſhal iudge thorow lettre circumciſion arte tranſgreſſour lawe iewe whych outwarde nother circumciſion outwardly fleſh iohā 8 rom 9 iew whych ſecrete coll 2 b circū ciſion harte ſprete ye letter whoſe prayſe mē god iii chapter thā hath ye iew profyte circumciſion much euery waye fyrſt truly rom 9 becauſe ſpeches god commytted vnto thē • tim 2 yf ſome beleued hath theyr vnbelefe made promyſe god voyde god forbyd ioh 3▪ • god true pſal 115 euery man lyar wrytten pſal 50 yu mayeſt made ryghteous thy wordes ouercome whan thou art iudged yf iniquite prayſe ryghteouſneſſe god ſhal ſaye god vnryghteous yt ſendeth wrath ſpeake maner man god forbyd el ſhall god iudge thys worlde yf truth god hath lye ben plenteous hys glory yet alſo iudged ſinner blaſphemed ſome reporte ſhulde ſaye let v euell good maye come whoſe damnacion iuſte excell haue proued iewes grekes vnder ſynne wrytten pſal 13 15 ther one ryghteous ther one vnderſtandynge ther one ſekynge god gone aſyde together become vnprofytable ther one doth good ther ſo muche one pſal 5 dtheyr throte opē ſepulchre wyth theyr tunges haue dealte deceatfully poyſon pſal 19 • adder vnder theyr lyppes pſal 9 • whoſe mouth full curſynge bytterneſſe prou 1 theyr fete ſwyfte ſhedde bloude eſa 59 sorowe vnhappyneſſe theyr wayes waye peace haue knowen pſal 35 feare god theyr eye ✚ know thynges ſo euer lawe doth ſpeake ſpeaketh vnto lawe euery mouthe may ſtopped worlde maye ſubdued vnto god gala • • becauſe dedes lawe euery fleſh ſhall iuſtifyed hym heb 7 • lawe knowlege ſynne wythout lawe ryghteouſneſſe god declared hauynge wytneſſe lawe prophetes ryghteouſneſſe god cō meth throughe faythe ieſus chriſte vpon beleue hym ther difference haue ſynned lacke glorye god eſay 53 c iuſtifyed frely hys grace thorow redempcion chriſt ieſu whome god hath ſet forth hebr 5 optayner mercy fayth hys bloude declarynge hys ryghteouſneſſe remiſſion ſynnes goynge ſufferynge god declarynge hys ryghteouſneſſe thys tyme may ryghteous iuſtifyer hym whych ye fayth ieſus chriſt thy reioycyng excluded law dedes ye lawe fayth gala 2 c holde man iuſtifyed fayth wythout workes ye lawe god god iewes alſo god ye heythen yet ye heythen alſo certainly one god iuſtifyeth circunciſiō fayth vncircumciſion fayth therfore deſtroye lawe fayth god forbyd maynteyne lawe iiii chapter ſhall ſhall ſay thā abrahā eſa 51 oure father foūde fleſh yf abrahā iuſtifyed workes lawe hath glory wyth god ſayeth ſcripture gene 15 b gala 3 iaco 2 c abraham beleued god counted vnto hym ryghteouſneſſe vnto hym yt worketh ye rewarde rekened fauoure deuty howbeit vnto hym ye worketh beleueth hym iuſtifyeth vngodly hys fayth counted vnto ryghteouſneſſe accordynge purpoſe grace god dauid alſo ſayeth bleſſedneſſe ye man god imputeth ryghteouſneſſe wythout workes pſal 31 bleſſed whoſe iniquity geuē whoſe ſynnes couered bleſſed man vnto lorde hath imputed ſynne doth thys bleſſedneſſe therfore remayne ye circūciſiō vncircumciſion alſo ſaye fayth counted vnto abraham ryghteouſneſſe counted circumciſion vncircumciſion gene 15 b circumciſion vncircumciſiō gene 17 dhe receaued alſo token circū ciſion ſeale ryghteouſnes fayth whych vncircumciſion ſhulde father al beleuers thorow vncircūciſion vnto alſo myght counted ryghteouſneſſe myght father circūciſion vnto whych circumciſion vnto followe footeſteppes faythe whyche vncircumciſion father abraham law promyſe made vnto abraham hys ſede ſhuld heyre worlde ye ryghteouſnes fayth gala 3 • yf lawe • e heyres fayth vayne promyſe wyped lawe worketh wrath law ther trāſgreſſion therfore promyſe made fayth ye accordyng vnto grace myght ſure vnto al ye ſede vnto ye law alſo vnto hym ye fayth abraham eſay 5 • luce 13 b 19 iohā 8 c gala 3 whych father v wrytten gen 17 haue made father many nacions god whō thou haſte beleued quickeneth deade calleth thynges euen thoſe whych contrarye hope beleued vpon hope ſhulde father many nacions accordynge vnto ſayde vnto hym gene 15 euen ſo ſhal thy ſede ſtarres heauen ſonde ſee faynte fayth nother cōſydered hys owne body dead already whā almooſt hundreth yeare olde deade wombe sara moreouer douted promyſe god thorowe vnbelefe ſtrengthed thorow fayth geuyng glory vnto god knowynge mooſte perfectly pſal 114 thynges ſoeuer god hath promyſed able alſo perfourme therfore counted vnto hym alſo ryghteouſneſſe rom 15 neuertheles written hym counted vnto hym ryghteouſneſſe alſo v vnto whome ſhalbe reputed beleuynge hym rayſed vp ieſus chriſt lorde frō dead 1 tim 2 gala 1 whych delyuered oure ſynnes roſe vp agayne oure iuſtifyenge v chapter therfore beynge eſay 26 chriſt vngodly whan yet weake accordynge tyme ſcace doth ony man dye ryghteous peraduenture good mā durſt one dye ✚ iohā • c 1 petri • c 1 iohā 4 b hebr 9 • god ſetteth forth hys loue v yf chriſte dyed v whan yet ſynners accordynge tyme much therfore beynge iuſtifyed hys bloude ſhalbe ſafe wrath hym yf whā enemyes reconcyled vnto god death hys ſōne much beynge reconciled ſhalbe ſafe lyfe reioyce alſo god lorde ieſus chriſte whō haue receaued attonement gene 3 • wherfor lyke one mā ſynne entred thys worlde death ſynne euen ſo alſo wente death thorowe men haue ſynned vntyll lawe ſynne worlde ſynne imputed whā ther lawe neuertheleſſe death reygned frō adā vntyl moſes yee euen thē ye ſynned ye ſimilitude ye trāſgreſſion adā whych ymage come ye gyft alſo ye treſpaſſe yf many dead thorow ye treſpaſe one much hath grace gyft god ben plenteous many fauoure one mā ieſus chriſt iohā 4 • gyfte alſo ſo one ſynne iudgemēt cam one condemnacion grace came iuſtificacion fro many treſpaſſes yf treſpaſſe one death reygned one muche receauynge aboundaūce grace pardon ryghteouſneſſe ſhal reygne lyfe one ieſus chriſt lykewyſe therfore ye treſpaſſe one men condemnacion euen ſo alſo ryghteouſneſſe one men iuſtifyenge lyfe lyke diſobedience one mā many made ſynners euen ſo alſo obedience one many ſhalbe made ryghteous gala 3 c lawe entred ye ſynne ſhulde increace luce 7 c ſynne abounded grace alſo plenteous lyke ſynne raygned death euen ſo grace alſo myghte raygne thorowe ryghteouſneſſe euerlaſtynge lyfe ieſus chriſt lord ⊢ vi chapter ſhal ſay therfore ſhal remayne ſynne grace maye plenteous god forbyd ſhal dead frō ſynne lyue yet ✚ gala 3 • collo 2 b • petri 3 c knowe ye brother ſo euer baptyſed chriſte ieſu baptyſed hys death buryed together wyth hym thorowe baptyme death lyke chriſte roſe deade thorowe glory father epheſ 4 c collo 3 hebre 9 c euen ſo alſo ſhulde walke newneſſe lyfe yf grafted vnto ſimilitude hys death ſhal belonge ye reſurreccion alſo knowyng thys moreouer yt olde mā crucifyed yt bodye ſynne maye deſtroyed yt frō hēceforth ſhuld ſerue ſyn 1 pet 4 afor yt deade made ryghteous frō ſynne 2 petri 2 b yf deade wt chriſt beleue yt ſhall alſo lyue together wt hym knowyng apoc 1 yt chriſt ryſyng agayne frō ye dead dyeth death ſhall haue dominion ouer hym ony touchynge dyed dyed ſynne touchynge lyueth lyueth vnto god euē ſo ye alſo thynke ſelues drade ſynne lyuynge vnto god chriſt ieſu ⊢ let ſynne therfore reygne mortall body yt ye ſhuld obey vnto ye luſtes nother geue ye ouer youre membres weapens iniquite vnto ſynne geue ouer ſelues vnto god deade lyuynge membres weapens ryghteouſneſſe vnto god ſynne ſhal haue dominiō ye vnder law vnder grace shal ſynne becauſe vnder lawe vnder grace ✚ ioh 8 c 2 petri • • knowe ye whome ye geue ouer ſelues ſeruaūtes obeye hys ſeruaūtes ye ye obeye whether ſynne vnto death obediēce vnto ryghteouſneſſe god thanked ye ſeruaūtes ſynne haue harte obeyed vnto faſhion doctrine wherein ye ye beynge delyuered ſynne become ſeruauntes ryghteouſnes ⊢ ✚ ſpeake maner mē becauſe ye infirmite fleſhe lyke ye haue geuen ouer membres ſerue vnclennes iniquite iniquite euē ſo nowe geue ouer mēbres ryghteouſneſſe hallowynge whan ye ſeruauntes ſynne ye voyde ryghteouſneſſe frute therfore ye thoſe thynges wherein ye aſhamed ende thē death ye beyng delyuered ſynne become ſeruauntes vnto god haue frute hallowynge ende euerlaſtynge lyfe gene 2 c rom 5 b death ye wage ſinne▪ euerlaſtynge lyfe grace god chriſt ieſu lorde ⊢ vii chapter ✚ knowe ye brother ſpeake ſuch know lawe ye lawe hath dominion mā lōge lyueth 1 cori 7 woman whych vnder huſbande bounde vnto lawe huſbande lyuynge yf hyr huſbande dye ſhe lowſed lawe huſbande therfore whyle man lyueth ſhe ſhalbe called wedlocke breaker math 5 dyf ſhe wyth another huſbande yf hir huſbande dye ſhe delyuered lawe huſband ſo ſhe wedlockbreaker yf ſhe wyth another huſbande ſo brother ye alſo dead vnto lawe body chriſt yt ye ſhulde another man whych ryſen agayne dead ye maye brynge forth frute vnto god whan ye fleſh luſtes ſynnes whych lawe wrought membres ſhulde brynge forth frute vnto death lowſed lawe death wherein holdē ſo yt ſhuld ſerue ye newneſſe ſprete ye oldneſſe letter ſhal ſaye therfore law ſynne god forbyd neuertheleſſe knewe ſynne lawe knewe luſt yf law ſayd exo •• c deut 5 c thou ſhalte luſt whan occaſion taken commaundement ſynne wroughte concupiſcence wythout lawe ſynne deade lyued wythoute lawe ſometyme neuertheleſſe whan commaundemente come ſynne reuyued ame deade ſame commaundemente whych dwell yf ony man haue ſprete chriſt ye ſame hys yf chriſt bodye truely deade becauſe ſynne ſprete lyueth ryghteouſneſſe ſake yf ſo ye ſprete hym whych rayſed vp ieſus frō ye deade dwel euen rayſed vp ieſus chriſt deade ſhall alſo quycken youre mortall bodyes becauſe hys ſprete dwellyng ✚ therfore brother detters vnto fleſhe ſhulde lyue fleſhe yf ye lyue fleſh ye ſhal dye yf ye mortifye dedes fleſh thorow ſprete ye ſhal lyue yt led ye ſprete god theſame chyldren god gala 4 2 tim 1 • ye haue receaued ye ſprete bondage agayne feare ye haue receaued ſprete adopciō chyldren god crye abba father 2 chyldren promyſe counted ſede thys worde promyſe gen • 18 b thys tyme wyll come sara ſhall haue ſonne onely ſhe gene 25 c rebecca alſo hauynge one lyenge iſaac oure father whan yet borne done ony thynge good euell purpoſe god myghte abyde accordynge eleccion workes ye caller ſayd vnto ye greater ſhal ſerue ye leſſe wryttē mala 1 • haue loued iacob eſau haue hated ſhal ſay therfore ther vnryghteouſneſſe wyth god god forbyd ſayeth vnto moſes exodi 33 b wyll haue mercy whō haue mercy haue cōpaſſion wyl haue cōpaſſion therfore wyller nother runner god ſhewer mercy exod 9 cfor ſc • ipture ſayeth vnto pharao thys ſame thyng haue ſteared vp maye ſhewe power name may declared whole earth therfore hath mercy whome wyll whome wyll hardeneth thou ſayeſt therfore vnto ſought yet eſa •• b 64 • doth wythſtande hys wyll man arte thou anſwereſt vnto god sayeth worke hym made haſt thou made thus iere 18 eccli 33 b 2 tim 2 c hath potter power claye make ſame lompe ſome veſſell truly vnto honoure ſome diſhonoure yf ſo god wyllynge ſhewe wrath declare hys power▪ ſuffred much pacience veſſels wrath mete deſtruccion myght declare ryches hys glory veſſels mercy whyche hath prepared vnto glory alſo hath called v iewes alſo heythen ſayeth oſee oſee 1 b 2 1 petri 2 b wyll call people people beloued beloued hyr hath optayned mercy haue optayned mercy ſhall come paſſe place hath bene ſayd vnto ye people euen ſhall called ye chyldren lyuynge god eſay cryeth iſrael eſay 10 11 c amos 9 b zach • 3 b yf nombre chyldren iſ • aell ye ſonde ſee remnaunt ſhalbe ſafe fyniſhynge ſhortenynge worde ryghteouſneſſe ſhortened worde ſhall lord brynge paſſe vpon earth eſaye ſayde e •• 1 b excepte lorde sabaoth lefte v ſede hadde ben made sodoma ſhulde haue bene lyke gomorra ſhall ſaye therfore ye heythen whych followed ryghteouſneſſe haue ouertaken ryghteouſnes ryghteouſneſſe whyche fayth iſrael followynge lawe ryghteouſneſſe attayned vnto law ryghteouſneſſe ſo becauſe fayth workes haue ſtombled vpon ſtomblyng ſtone wrytten eſa 28 • beholde laye sion ſtone ſtomblynge rocke offendynge euery one beleueth hym ſhall confounded x chapter ✚ brethrē harte deſyre truly prayer vnto god vnto ſaluaciō beare recorde rom 9 gala 4 b haue dede zele god accordynge knowlege knowynge ryghteouſneſſe god ſekynge ſet vp theyr owne ar ſubdued vnto god ryghteouſnes math 5 b ende lawe chriſte vnto ſaluaciō euery beleuer moſes hath wrytten leui 13 gala 3 b man whych doth ye ryghteouſneſſe lawe ſhall lyue ryghteouſneſſe whyche fayth ſayeth thus deut 30 c thou ſaye thyne harte ſhall go vp heauen brynge downe chriſt ſhal go downe ye depth call vp chriſte agayne deade ſayeth ye ſcripture worde nye thy mouth thy harte thys worde fayth preache yf thou knowlege ye lord ieſus thy mouthe beleueſt thy harte god hath rayſed hym vp deade thou ſhalt ſafe ⊢ ✚ wyth harte beleued vnto ryghteouſneſſe wyth mouth knowleged vnto ſaluacion ye ſcripture ſayeth eſay 28 c euery one ye beleueth hym ſhall confoūded ther differēce ye iewe greke one lord ryche vnto ye call vpon hym ioel • f actu • b 22 b euery one whoſoeuer calleth ye name ye lord ſhalbe ſafe therfore ſhall cal hym haue beleued howe ſhall beleue hym whome haue herde howe ſhall heare wyth preacher ſhal peach except ſent wrytten eſa 52 bhow bewtyful ye fete ye preach peace thē preach good thynges al mē obey ye goſpel eſaye ſayeth eſa 53 ioh 12 c lorde hath beleued oure hearynge fayth therfore cōmeth hearynge hearynge cōmeth ye worde chriſte ſaye haue herde pſal 18 • theyr ſoūde truly went alſo euery cōtry theyr wordes coaſtes cōpaſſe earth ⊢ ſaye hath iſrael knowē fyrſt moſes ſayeth deut 32 c wyl bryng gelouſy agaynſt thē yt people wyl ſende wrath agaynſt foolyſh people eſay bolde ſayeth eſay 52 c 65 foūde ſought haue opēly appeared vnto axed vnto iſrael ſayeth eſa 65 daye longe haue holden handes people beleuyng ſpeakyng agaynſt xi chapter saye therfore iere 31 f hath god thruſt oute hys people farre alſo iſraelite ye ſede abraham trybe ben iamin god hath thruſt hys people whome knewe wote ye ye ſcripture ſayeth elia maketh interceſſion vnto god agaynſt iſrael 3 reg 19 c lorde haue ſlayne thy prophetes haue dygged downe thyne altares lefte alone ſeke lyfe ſayeth ye anſwere god vnto hym • reg 19 haue reſerued vnto ſeuen thouſande men haue bowed ye knee baal euē ſo therfore thys tyme alſo remnaunt ſaued eleccion ye grace god deut 9 yf grace workes el grace grace therfore iſrael hath attayned vnto whych ſoughte election hath optayned blynded wrytten eſai 6 b • tu 7 g god hath geuen ſprete vnquietneſſe eye ſhuld ſe • are ſhulde heare vntyll thys daye dauid ſayeth pſal 68 let theyr table ſnare takynge occaſion fallynge rewarde let theyr eye darkened yt ſe bowe thou downe theyr backe alwaye ſaye therfore haue ſo ſtombled ſhulde fall farre theyr fal health happened vnto ye heythen maye followe yf theyr ſynne ryches worlde theyr myniſhynge ryches heythē much theyr fulneſſe ſaye vnto heythen longe truly rom 1 • 1 tim 2 2 tim 1 • apoſtle heythen ſhal prayſe ſeruice yf ony meanes may prouoke fleſh zele ſaue ſome yf theyr loſſe reconciliacion worlde receauynge ſaue ye lyfe deade yf layenge leuen good lompe alſo eſa 65 yf roote holy braunches alſo yf ſome braunches broken thou whan thou wereſt wylde olyue tre arte grafte among become partener roote fatneſſe ye iere • 1 • olyue tre auaunce thyſelfe agaynſt ye braunches yf thou doeſt boaſt thou beareſt roote roote thou ſayeſt therfor braunches broken maye grafted well broken becauſe vnbelefe thou ſtā deſt fayth eccles 7 • hygh wyſe feare yf god hath ſpared naturall braunches leſte ſpare alſo beholde therfore goodneſſe rygoure god thē truly fallē rygoure goodneſſe god yf thou ſhalt abyde goodneſſe el ſhalte yu • ſo fall awaye 2 cori 3 c alſo yf ſhal remayne vnbelefe ſhalbe grafted god able graft thē agayn yf thou alſo arte fallen away naturall wylde olyue tre cōtrary nature art grafted good olyue tre much ſhal nature grafted theyr olyue tre wolde haue ignoraūt brethrē thys myſtery ye wyſe ſelues ye blyndneſſe partly happened iſrael luce 21 c vntyl ye fulneſſe heythen ſhuld come ſo iſrael ſhulde ſaued wrytten pſal 1 • eſa 59 c ſhall come sion draweth turneth waye wyckedneſſe iacob thys ſhalbe teſtamente vnto whan ſhall haue takē awaye theyr ſynnes goſpel truly enemyes ſakes eleccion mooſt beloued father ſakes gyftes callynge god wythout repentynge ye alſo ſometyme dyd beleue god haue optayned mercy becauſe theyr vnbelefe euen ſo haue theſe alſo beleued youre mercy maye optayne mercy god incloſed vp thynges vnbelefe maye haue mercy depeneſſe ryches wyſedom knowlege god sapi 17 incomprehenſible hys iudgemētes hys wayes vnſearcheable sapi 9 b eſay 4 b 1 cor 2 b hath knowē lordes minde hath ben hys counſeller hath geuen hym fyrſt ſhalbe geuen hym agayne eſa 44▪ c hym hym hym thynges rom 16 c vnto hym prayſe euer euer amen xii chapter ✚ beſeke therfore bre • hren mercy god ye geue ouer bodyes phili 4 c ſacrifice lyuynge holy acceptable vnto god whych reaſonable ſeruice lyke faſhioned thys worlde refourmed newneſſe wytte ye proue epheſ 5 b 2 teſſ 4 whyche ye good wel pleaſynge perfecte wyll god ſaye vnto al amonge grace geuen ecclī 3 c nomore wyſe behoueth wyſe rom 14 2 cori 8 wyſe vnto ſobernes vnto euery one god hath geuen meaſure fayth 2 cor 12 b epheſ 4 b ✚ lyke haue many membres one body mēbres haue one maner operacion euen ſo ar many one body vnto chriſt ⊢ euery one membres hauynge gyftes differrynge accordynge grace geuen v whether 1 cor 14 prophecye accordynge ſtente fayth whether 1 petri 4 b ſeruyce myniſtrynge whether teacheth doctrine exhorteth exhortynge actu 2 • geueth ſyngleneſſe ecclī 32 beareth rule carefulneſſe deut 15 b amos 5 b ſheweth mercy chearefulneſſe let loue vnfayned hatynge euel clyuynge good louynge together loue brotherheade 1 petri 2 b preuentynge ech wyth honoure eccli 31 cnot ſlouthfull carynge feruente ſprete wepe wyth wepynge philip 2 abe lyke mynded amonge yourſelues pro 3 eſay 5 c beynge hygh wyſe beynge wyſe wyth ye lower ſorte ⊢ ✚ wyſe ourſelues pro 20 c 1 petri 3 b rendrynge vnto noman euell euell 2 cor 8 c prouydyng good thynges god alſo men hebr 12 c yf maye muche lyeth hauynge peace wyth al men defendynge youre ſelues dearly beloued geue rowme vnto wrath wrytten deut 32 e vnto vengeaunce ſhal rewarde ſayeth lorde pro 25 yf thyne enemy doth hōger geue hym meate yf thyrſte geue hym drynke doynge thys thou ſhalt gather cole fyre vpon hys heade ouer come euell ouercome euell good ⊢ xiii chapter ✚ let euery ſoule ſubmytted vnto ye hygher power 1 pet 2 b sap 6 ther power god ordined god therfore reſyſteth ye power reſyſteth ordinaunce god reſyſte get themſelues dā nacion ruler feared good worke euel wylt thou fear power good thou ſhalt haue prayſe myniſter god vnto good yf thou doeſt euell feare beareth ſwearde nought ye myniſter god auēger ye wrath vnto hym doth euell therfore coſtume coſtume vnto whō feare feare vnto whome honoure honoure ✚ owe noman oughte ſaue ye loue ech gala 6 1 timo 1 b whoſo loueth hys neghboure hath fulfylled lawe exod 20 c deut 5 c thou ſhalte commytte aduoutrye thou ſhalt kyl thou ſhalte ſteale thou ſhalt beare falſe wytneſſe thou ſhalte luſt ſo euer commaū dement ther el reſtored thys worde leui 19 • mat 22 thou ſhalte loue thy neghboure thy ſelfe 1 cor 13 • loue neghboure worketh euell fulfyllyng ye lawe loue ⊢ ✚ knowynge thys tyme 1 teſſa 5 houre v ryſe ye ſlepe oure health nearer whā dyd beleue night paſt daye come neare collo 3 • let v therfore caſt away workes darkneſſe let v put armour lyght ſo may walke honeſtlye daye luce 21 banckettinges dronkenneſſes 1 cor 6 b ephe 5 chambrynges vnclēneſſes iacob 3 c ſtryuynge enuyenge put ieſus chriſt ⊢ gala 5 c 1 pet 2 c beſtowe care fleſhe pleaſures xiiii chapter take vnto hym weake fayth ſtryfes opinion one beleueth may eate thynges let hym ye weake eat herbes eateth let hym deſpyſe hym eateth eateth let hym iudge hym eateth god hath receaued hym iacob 4 b art thou iudgeſt another man ſeruaunte ſtandeth falleth vnto hys lorde ſhall ſtande god able make hym ſtāde ſome one iudgeth betwene daye daye another iudgeth euery daye lyke colloſ 2 c let euery man ful hys meanynge regardeth ye daye regardeth vnto lorde eateth eateth vnto lorde geueth thankes vnto god eateth eateth vnto lorde geueth thākes vnto god none v lyueth vnto hymſelfe noman dyeth vnto hymſelfe whether lyue therfore lyue vnto lorde whether dye dye vnto lorde therfore whether lyue whether dye lordes chriſt dyed therto roſe agayne may actu 2 phili 2 lorde ouer quick deade iudgeſt thou thy brother deſpyſeſt thou thy brother gala 6 • ſhall ſtande iudgemente ſeate chriſte wrytten eſay • 5 • phil 2 • lyue ſayeth lorde knee ſhalbe bowed vnto al tunge ſhall knowlege vnto god math •• • 2 cori 5▪ btherfore ſhal euery one v geue accōpte hymſelf vnto god let v therfore iudge eche iudge thys rather ye laye ſtomblynge blocke vnto brother offendicle 1 cor 8 ame ſure truſte lorde ieſus ther nothynge commune ſelfe ſaue vnto hym iudgeth commune vnto commune yf thy brother made ſorowfull meates ſake doeſt thou walke charite deſtroye thou hym wyth thy meate whome chriſte dyed let therfore oure good euell ſpoken kyngdome god meate drynke ryghteouſneſſe peace ioye holy gooſt whoſo ſerueth chriſt pleaſeth god approued men let v therfore followe vpon thoſe thynges belonge vnto peace let v kepe thynges together belonge vnto edifyeng deſtroye worke god cauſe meate tit • • thynges truely clene euell vnto man eateth wych offendicle 1 corin 8 • better eate fleſhe drynke wyne wherin thy brother ſtombleth offended made weake fayth thou haſt thyſelfe haue god happy iudgeth hymſelfe alloweth putteth difference yf ſhal eate damned becauſe fayth titū 1 c fayth ſynne xv chapter bvt gala 6 ſtronge ought ſuſtayne ye weakeneſſe ſtronge ſtande oure owne conceate let euery one pleaſe hys neghboure vnto good edifyenge chriſte pleaſed hymſelfe wrytten pſal 68 b rebuke rebukynge dyd fall vpon ✚ rom 4 thynges ſo euer wrytten wrytten oure doctrine pacience 1 mac 12 b conſolacion ſcriptures maye haue hope god pacience conſolacion geue vnderſtande one thyng one towardes another ieſus chriſte ye one mynded maye prayſe god one mouth father oure lorde ieſus chriſte wherfore receaue ye eche chriſte alſo hath receaued honour god ſaye ieſus chriſtus haue bene myniſter circumciſion truthe god confirme promyſes father heythen prayſe god vpon mercye wrytten • reg 21 g pſal 17 ſayeth eſaias eſay 1 • b ther ſhalbe roote ieſſe ſhall ryſe rule gentyles hym ſhall heythen truſte god hope fyll wyth ioye peace beleuynge ye maye ouerflowe hope power holy gooſt ⊢ myſelfe alſo ame heythen hallowynge goſpell god ther offerynge heythen acceptable ſanctifyed holy gooſte haue therfore prayſe vnto god chriſte ieſu darre ſpeake oughte thoſe thynges god actu 1 • 2 pet 1 • hath done obedience heythen wyth word dedes power token wonder power holye gooſt ſo muche ieruſalem rounde aboute vntyll illyricum haue fylled wyth goſpell chriſt haue ſo preached thys goſpell chriſte named leſt ſhulde buylde vppon another man fundamente wrytten eſay 52 c vnto ſhewed hym ſhall ſe haue herde hym ſhall vnderſtande whyche cauſe alſo greatly let come vnto forbydden hetherto nowe hauynge nomore rowme theſe quarter hauynge deſyre many yeares nowe paſte come vnto whan ſhall begynne yournye spayne truſte goynge ſhal ſe brought thyther yf ſhall haue fyrſt partly enioyed nowe therfore go ieruſalem miniſtre vnto ſaintes macedonia achia haue alowed make ſome actu 11 c 1 cori 16 2 cor 8 9 handreachynge vnto poore ſayntes ieruſalem hath pleaſed theyr detters 1 cor 9 gala 6 yf heythen become partaker theyr ſpirituall thynges oughte alſo miniſtre vnto carnall thynges whan therfore ſhal haue fynyſhed thys ſhal haue ſealed thys frute ſhall yourney spayne knowe commynge vnto ſhall come wyth abundaunce bleſſe goſpell chriſte praye therfore brother thorow lorde ieſus chriſte thorowe loue holy gooſt ye helpe prayer vnto god maye delyuered vnfaythfull iewrye offerynge wyllynge ſeruyce maye become accepacceptable vnto ſayntes ieruſalem wyth ioye maye come vnto wyll god maye refreſhed wyth god 1 cor • peace wyth amen xvi chapter cōmende vnto phebe ſyſter whyche miniſter congregacion cenchrea ye receaue lorde becōmeth ſayntes ye aſſyſte ſo euer buſyneſſe ſhe ſhall nede ſhe alſo hath holpen many myſelfe salute actu 18 • 2 tim 4 c priſca aquila helper chriſte ieſu whyche haue layde downe theyr neckes lyfe vnto whome geue thankes congregacions heythen alſo theyr houſholde congregacyon grete epenetus beloued vnto whych fyrſtlynge chriſte ieſu congregacion aſia grete mary hathe laboured muche amonge v grete andronicus iunia coſyns fellowpreſoners whych renowmed amonge apoſtles whyche alſo chriſte salute ampliatus mooſte beloued lorde salute vrbane oure helper chriſte ieſu grace vnto peace god father lorde ieſus chriſte ✚ thanke god alwaye ye grace god geuen chriſt ieſu al thynges ye made rych hym euery worde euery knowlege wytneſſe chriſte ſtablyſhed ſo nothynge wante vnto ony grace waytynge appearynge oure lorde ieſus chriſte whych alſo ſhal ſtablyſh wythout faute vntyll ende daye commynge lorde ieſus chriſte ⊢ num 23 c 2 cor 10 b • teſſa 5 c god faythfull whome ye called vnto fellowſhippe hys ſonne ieſus chriſte oure lorde beſeke brethrē name oure lorde ieſus chriſte rom 12 cthat ye ſpeake one thynge ther diuiſions ye perfecte one meanynge one ſentence god haue baptyſed none ſaue actu 18 acriſpus ro 16 c gaius leſt ony mā ſaye ye baptyſed name haue baptyſed alſo houſe • cor 16 cstephana el wote whether haue baptyſed ony chriſte ſente baptyſe prudente ſhall refuſe eſay 3 • • wyſe ſcribe diſputer thys worlde hath god made wyſedome thys worlde foolyſh becauſe worlde ye wyſedome god dyd knowe god hath pleaſed god ſaue beleuynge foolyſhneſſe power god colloſ 2 wyſedome god foolyſh god wyſer men weake god ſtonger men ye brother loke vpon callyng iohan 7 • many wyſe fleſhe many myghtye many noble thynges worlde foolyſhe hath god choſen maye confounde wyſe weake thynges ye worlde hath god choſen maye confounde ſtronge vyle deſpyſed thynges worlde hath god choſen oſee 2 c thoſe thynges worth ſhulde deſtroye thoſe thynges worth fleſhe lorde ii chapter whan come vnto brethrē came ſhewynge vnto ye wytneſſe chriſt ye heyght wordes wyſedome haue iudged knowe oughte amonge ſaue ieſus chriſt ye ſame crucifyed alſo wyth weakeneſſe feare greate tremblynge 1 teſſa 1 word preachynge perſuadynge wordes man wyſedome declarynge ſprete power fayth wyſedome men ye power god ſpeake wyſedome amonge perfecte wyſedome thys world ye ruler thys worlde whych • cori 15 c go nought ſpeake wyſedome god myſtery whych hyd whych god hathe predeſtinate vnto oure prayſe worlde whyche math 11 • none ruler thys worlde hath knowen iohā 15 c 16 actu 13 c yf knowen ſhulde neuer haue crucifyed lorde glorye wrytten eſay 64 eye hath ſene eare hath herde yet gone vp harte mā thynges god hath prepared vnto loue hym vnto v hath god ſhewed hys ſprete rom 8 b ſpret ſearcheth al thynges euen depeneſſes god alſo men knoweth belonge vnto man ſaue ye ſpret man hym euen ſo alſo thynges belōge vnto god hath noman knowē ſaue ye ſprete god haue receaued ye ſprete thys worlde ſprete god maye knowe thynges geuen v god whych thynges alſo ſpeake connynge wordes man wyſedome doctrine ye ſpret comparynge ſpirituall thynges ſpirituall naturall mā perceaueth thoſe thynges belonge ſprete god foolyſhneſſe vnto hym vnderſtande examined ſpiritually pro 2 • • ye ſpiritual iudgeth thynges hymſelfe iudged noman wrytten sap 9 b eſ • 4 • b rom 11 hath knowen mynde lorde hath inſtruct hym haue mynde chriſte iii chapter brother coulde ſpeake vnto ſpirituall carnall heb 5 • gaue mylke drinke vnto babe chriſt meate ye coulde yet nother truely ye ye yet carnall gala 5 • seyng ther amonge enuyenge ſtryfe ye carnall walke man whan ony man ſayeth 1 cor 1 b truly paule another apollo ye mē apollo therfore paule hys miniſters whome ye haue beleued vnto euery one god hath geuen haue planted apollo hath watered iohā 6 g actu 2 • god hath geuen ye increace therfore nother planteth oughte ye watereth god geueth increace planteth watereth one euery one ſhall receaue hys owne rewarde accordynge hys worke god helper ye god huſbādry epheſ 2 c ye god buyldynge accordynge grace god geuen haue lyke wyſe buylder layde foundacion another builded vpon let eueryone beware buylde vppon math 16 c nomā laye another fundamente layde whych chriſt ieſus yf ony man buylde vpon thys fundamente golde ſyluer precious ſtones woode hey ſtubble euery man worke ſhall manyfeſt eſa 28 c daye lorde ſhall declare ſhal diſcloſed fyre euery man worke ſhall 1 petri 1 b 4 fyre declare yf ony man worke yt hath buylded vpon abyde ſhall receaue rewarde yf ony man worke ſhall burne ſhal whyche ye proue 3 c let noman myſcary yf ony man amonge ſemeth wyſe let hym become foole thys worlde maye wyſe rom 1 c wyſedome thys worlde foolyſhneſſe wyth god wrytten iob 5 b wyl take wyſe theyr ſutteltye agayne pſa 93 b lorde knoweth thoughtes wyſe vayne let noman therfore reioyce men thynges whether paule whether apollo whether cephas whether worlde wheher lyfe whether death whether thynges preſente thynges come al thynges truly ye chriſtes chriſt god ✚ iiii chapter ✚ let man ſo eſteme v 2 cori 6 aminiſters chriſt diſpoſers deut 29 ſecretes god nowe requyred amonge diſpoſers ony foūde iere 23 • luce • 2 • 1 pet • 4 faythful coūte ye leeſt thynge iudged man daye nother iudge myſelfe know ſelfe gylty nothynge iohan 9 iuſtifyed iudgeth lord iudge therfore tyme vntyll ye lorde come whych alſo ſhall lyghten ye hyd thynges darkeneſſe ſhall make manyfeſt coūſels ye harte thā ſhal euery one haue prayſe god theſe thynges brethrē haue deſcribed apollo ſakes v ye may learne aboue yt wryttē one puft vp agaynſt another another man ſundereth iacob 1 haſt thou yt thou haſt receaued yf thou haſt receaued doeſt thou boaſte though yu haddeſt receaued ye ſatiſfyed nowe ye made ryche ye raygne wythout v wolde god ye dyd raygne alſo myghte raygne ſuppoſe god hath declared v laſt apoſtles pſal 43 c rom 8 e appoynted death becauſe become gaſynge ſtocke vnto worlde angel men fooles chriſtes ſake ye wyſe chriſte weake ye ſtronge ye reputacion reputacion vntyll thys houre honger thyrſte naked buffetted vnſatled actu 18 20 c laboure workynge wyth oure hādes curſed rom▪ 12 b bleſſe kyngdome god worde power wyll ye ſhall come vnto wyth rod wyth loue ſprete mekeneſſe v chapter ther wholy herde amōg fornication ſuch fornicaciō amōg heythen ſo leuit 18 one haue hys father wyfe ye pufte vp haue rather ſorowe taken awaye frō myddeſt hath done ye dede collo 2 truely beynge abſent body preſent ſprete haue iudged already preſente beynge gathered ſprete wyth power lorde ieſus wrytten vnto medle yf called brother among whoremonger couetous worſhipper idol rayler drōkarde extorcioner iere 16 dani 1 b wyth ſuch one take meate vnto iudge wythoute ye iudge wythin wythout ſhall god iudge deut 15 haue awaye euell amonge yourſelues vi chapter darre ony hauynge buſyneſſe agaynſt another iudged wycked ſayntes math 12 19 know ye ſaintes ſhall iudge ye worlde yf worlde ſhalbe iudged ye vnworthye ye iudged leeſt knowe ye ſhall iudge angel muche worldly matter yf ye ſhall haue therfore worldlye iudgementes vyler congregaciō theſe ordyne iudge ſay ſhame ther wyſe man amōg yt able iudge betwene hys brother ye brother ſtryueth wyth hys brother iudgement vnbeleuynge truely ther wholy faute among ye haue iudgementes amonge math 5 e ye rather ſuffre wronge ye wronge begyle vnto brother knowe ye wycked ſhall poſſeſſe kyngdome god erre gala 5 c epheſ 5 nother whoremonger worſhippers idol aduouterous weaklynges abuſers themſelues wyth mankynde theues couetous dronkardes curſed ſpeakers extorcioners extorcioners ſhall poſſeſſe kyngdome god theſe thynges truely haue ye bene ye waſhen ye ſanctifyed ye iuſtifyed name oure lorde ieſus chriſte ſprete oure god thynges wherof ye wrote vnto good vnto man touch woman becauſe fornicacion let euery one haue hys wyfe let euery one haue hyr huſbande let man rendre vnto wyfe due lykewyſe alſo wyfe vnto man woman hath power hyr body man lykewyſe alſo hath man power hys body woman tob 6 8 ioel 2 c wythdrawe yourſelues ech wythout happely conſente tyme ye maye geue prayer returne agayne ſame leſt satan tempte incōtinency ⊢ thys ſaye accordynge fauoure cōmaundemēt actu 26 cfor wolde haue myſelf euery one hath hys gift god ye one truly thus ye ſo ſaye vnto maryed wedowes good vnto thē yf ſhall ſo abyde alſo • tim 5 b yf ſo abſteyne themſelues let mary better mary burne vnto ioyned mariage commaunde lorde math 5 19 womā go awaye man yf ſhe go awaye abyde vnmaried reconciled vnto hyr huſbande let man leaue hys wyfe vnto reſt ſaye lorde yf ony brother haue vnfaythfull wyfe ſame agreeth dwell wyth hym let hym leaue ſame yf ony woman haue vnfaithfull man ſame conſenteth dwell wyth let leaue man vnfaythfull man hath called v peace 1 pet 3 whence knoweſt thou womā whether thou ſhalt ſaue man whence knoweſt thou mā whether thou ſhalte ſaue woman ſaue lord hath diſtributed vnto euery man ephe 4 god hath called euery man ſo let hym walke ſo teache congregacions ony man called circumciſed let hym bryng foreſkynne vpon hym ony mā called foreſkynne let hym circumciſed circumciſion nothynge foreſkynne nothynge kepynge commaundementes god ✚ let euery man callynge called continue ſame 1 timo 6 arte thou called ſeruaunt care yf thou mayeſt fre vſe rather whoſo called ſeruaūte lorde fre man ye lorde commaundemente lorde neuertheleſſe geue counſell hauynge optayned mercy lorde faythfull ſuppoſe good preſente neceſſite good man ſo arte thou bounde wyfe ſeke lowſynge arte thou lowſe wyfe ſeke wyfe 5 wythoute wyfe carefull thynges lordes maye pleaſe god wyth wyfe carefull thynges worlde howe maye pleaſe hys wyfe diuided woman vnmaryed virgine careth ye thynges lordes ſhe holy bodye ſprete ſhe maryed careth thynges worlde howe ſhe maye pleaſe hyr huſbande ouer thys ſaye youre profyte ſhuld caſt ſnare becauſe honeſte maye geue lyberte praye ye lorde wythout impediment yf ony man thynke hym eſtymed blameable virgin becauſe ſhe ouergrowen muſte ſo done let wyll ſynneth yf mary beynge ſure harte hath ſo purpoſed hauynge nede hauynge power hys wyll haue determyned hys harte namely kepe virgin doth wel therfore coupleth hys virgyne mariage doth well ioyneth doth better rom 7 woman bounde lawe longe hir huſbāde lyueth yf ſo hyr huſbande ſlepe ſhe fre let marye whome ſhe wyll lorde knowlege euery one ſome 1 cor 10 ye cōſcience idoll hetherto eate thynge offered vnto idoll theyr conſcience weake defyled meate doth forther v vnto god nother ſhall haue abundaunce yf eate nother ſhall wante yf eate beware leſte happely thys youre lyberte become ſtomblynge blocke vnto weake yf ſome man ſhall ſe hym hath knowlege ſyt eatynge idol meate ſhall hys conſcience whan weake ſtablyſhed offende brother wyl neuer eate fleſhe leſt offēde brother ix chapter actu 9 fre apoſtle 1 cor 11 b haue ſene ieſus chriſte oure lorde ye workemanſhippe lord though apoſtle vnto yet vnto ye ye ſeale myne apoſtleſhip ye lorde defence axe thys haue power eate drynke haue power leade aboute woman phili 4 ſyſter alſo apoſtles brother lorde math 8 b luc 4 cephas haue barnabas power doth euer warrefare vpon hys owne wage doth plāte vyne eateth hys frute fedeth flock eateth mylke flocke saye theſe thynges man sayeth law theſe thynges alſo wrytten moſes lawe deu 25 1 timo 5 c thou ſhalte moſell mouth
