man heade chriſte god euery man prayenge prophecyenge heade beynge couered doth ſhame hys heade euery woman prayeng prophecyeng heade beynge couered ſhameth hyr heade one though ſhe ſhauen yf woman couered let hyr heer cut deut 22 1 cori 14 c yf vncomly womā haue heere cut ſhauen let couer hyr head man truely ought couer hys heade epheſ 4 c ymage glory god woman glory man gen 2 man woman womā man man created woman woman man therfore ought woman haue couerynge vppon hyr heade becauſe angel neuertheleſſe nother ye mā wythout woman womā without man lorde woman man euen ſo alſo man woman thynges god iudge ye ſelues becōmeth woman praye god beynge couered doth nature teache man truely yf let hys heere grow ſhame vnto hym yf woman let hyr heere growe prayſe vnto ye heeres geuē coueryng • tim 6 c yf ony ſemeth contencious haue ſuche coſtume nother congregacion god thys commaunde prayſyng ye come together better worſe fyrſt heare ye come together congregacion ther diuiſions beleue partely math 18 • iohā 2 cfor ther muſt alſo ſectes among yt proued become manyfeſt amōge whā ye therfore come together eate lordes ſupper euery one taketh owne ſupper afore eate one truely hath honger dronke haue ye houſes eate drynke deſpyſe ye congregacion god ſhame thē haue ſhal ſaye vnto thys prayſe ✚for haue receaued lord whyche haue alſo delyuered vnto math 26 c marc 1 • c luce 22 b ye lord ieſus nyght betrayed toke ye breade geuyng thankes brake ſayd take ye eate thys body eſay 53 yt ſhalbe delyuered thys remembraunce lykewyſe alſo ye cup yt ſupped ſayeng thys cup ye new teſtamēt bloude thys oft ye ſhal drynke remembraunce oft ye ſhal eate thys breade drynke cuppe • p • tr • b ye ſhal ſhewe ye death lord vntyll actu • b come therfore whoſoeuer ſhall eate fleſhe drynke bloude lord vnworthely ſhalbe gylty body bloude lorde 2 cori 13 b let man examine hymſelfe let hym ſo eate breade drynke cuppe eateth drynketh vnworthely eateth drynketh iudgemente vnto ſelfe makynge difference bodye lorde ⊢ therfore ther many weake feble amonge many ſlepe eccli • 8 • yf dyd examine oureſelues verelye ſhulde iudged whan iudged chaſtened lorde iohan 2 c dāned wyth thys world therfore brethrē whā ye come together eate tarye one another yf ony mā doth honger let eate home ye come together vnto iudgement thynges ſhall ſet order whā ſhall come xii chapter bvt wyl haue ignoraunte brother ſpirituall thynges ✚ ye know whan ye gentyles ye goynge dōme idol ye led therfore ſhewe marc 9 noman ſpeakynge ſprete god doth defye ieſus noman ſaye lorde ieſus ſaue holy gooſt rom 12 ther verely diuerſities gyftes one ſprete ther diuerſities office one lorde ther diuerſities operacions ioh 5 b one god worketh al thynges epheſ 4 vnto euery mā declaryng ye ſprete geuen profyte vnto one truely geuen ſprete ye vtteraūce wyſedome vnto another ſame ſprete geuen vtteraunce knowlege vnto another fayth ye ſame ſprete vnto another grace healynges ſame ſprete vnto another ye workynge miracle vnto another prophecy vnto another • ioh 4 diſcernynge ſpretes vnto another diuerſities tunges vnto another interpretacion ſpeches theſe doth one ſame ſprete worke diuidyng vnto euery one wyll ⊢ rom 12 body oneephe 4 b hath many mē bres member body though ar many yet one body euen ſo chriſt alſo one ſprete baptyſed one body whether iewes gentyls whether bondman fre eſay 55 iohā 7 haue al dronke one ſprete body alſo one mēbre many yf foote ſhall ſaye hande body therfore body yf eare ſhall ſaye eye body therfore ye body yf ye body eye hearynge yf al hearyng ſmellyng hath god ſet ye mēbres body euery one thē hath pleaſed hym yf al ye membres one body truely ther many membres one body eye ſaye vnto hande haue nede thy helpe agayne heade vnto fete ye nedefull vnto much ye mēbers ye body ſeme febler neceſſarye mēbers ye body thynke vyler vpō thē put worſhippe thoſe partes oures diſhoneſt haue honeſty oure honeſt partes haue nede nothyng god hath tempered ye body geuyng worſhippe vnto dyd wante ther variaunce body yt mēbers carefull ech yf one membre ſuffer ought mēbers ſuffer wyth ether yf one membre reioyceth membres reioyce wyth ye body chriſte membres membre ſome truly hath god ordined congregacion fyrſt math 10 luce 9 epheſ 4 apoſtles ſecondarly prophetes thyrdly actu 13 teacher power thence forth grace healynge helpynges gouernaūces kyndes ſpeches interpretacions ſayenges apoſtles prophetes teacher al power haue grace healynges ſpeake wyth tunges interprete couet ye ye beſt gyftes yet ſhewe excellent waye xiii chapter ✚ yf ſhall ſpeake wyth tunges mē angel ſhall haue loue become ſoūdyng braſſe tynclynge bell math 7 b yf ſhall haue prophecye ſhall knowe myſteryes knowlege yf ſhal haue al fayth inſomuch luce 17 • ſhall remoue hylles ſhall haue charite nothynge yf ſhall diſtribute goodes meates vnto poore yf ſhal geue body ſo ſhall burne ſhal haue charite profyteth nothynge loue paciente ſhe curteous loue doth enuy ſhe doth wyckedly ſhe pufte vp ſhe couetous honoure phili 2 bſhe ſeketh thynges hyr owne ſhe prouoked anger ſhe thynketh euell ſhe reioyceth ouer wyckedneſſe rereioyceth wt truth ſhe ſuffreth al thinges ſhe beleueth al thynges ſhe hopeth al thynges ſhe beareth vp al thynges loue neuer falleth awaye whether prophecyes ſhalbe voyded whether ye tūges ſhal ceaſſe whether knowlege ſhalbe deſtroyed part know part prophecy whā yt perfecte ſhal come ſhall parte voyded whan chylde ſpake chylde vnderſtode chyld thought chylde whan become man dyd voyde thynges belonged chylde ſe nowe glaſſe euen darke ſpeakynge thā face face knowe parte thā ſhal knowe alſo knowē abide faith hope loue theſe thre greater theſe loue ⊢ xiiii chapter follow vpon loue couete ſpirituall thynges rather ye maye prophecye ſpeaketh wyth tunge ſpeaketh vnto men vnto god noman heareth ſprete ſpeaketh myſteries prophecyeth ſpeaketh vnto men vnto edifyenge exhortacion conſolacion ſpeaketh wyth tunge edifyeth hymſelfe ye prophecieth edifyeth congregacion god wyll haue ſpeake wyth tunges rather prophecye ye prophecyeth greater yt ſpeaketh wyth tūges wyth interprete ye cōgregacion may haue edifyenge brother yf ſhall come vnto ſpeakyng wyth tunges ſhall profyte wtout ſhall ſpeake vnto ether reuelaciō knowlege prophecy doctrine moreouer ye thynges geuyng ſoūde wythout lyfe whether pype harpe wythout geue diſtinccion ſoundes howe ſhall knowen pyped harped verely yf trompe geue vncertayne ſoūde ſhall make hymſelf ready battayle euen ſo ye alſo excepte ye geue manifeſt ſoūde wyth tunge ſhall knowen ſpoken ye ſhalbe ſpeakynge ayre many kyndes namely tunges ther world nothyng ther wythout voyce yf therfore ſhall knowe power ye voyce ſhalbe vnto hym whome ſpeake barbarous yt ſpeaketh barbarous vnto euen ſo ye alſo becauſe ye couetous ſpretes ſeke ye maye plenteous edifyenge congregacyon therfore ſpeaketh wyth tunge let hym praye maye alſo interprete yf praye tunge ſprete prayeth mynde wythoute frute therfore ſhall pray wyth ſprete ſhall praye wyth mynde ſhall ſynge wt ſpret ſhall ſynge wyth mynde moreouer yf thou ſhalte bleſſe ſprete ſhall yt ſupplyeth ye rowme ye laye ſaye amen vpō thy bleſſynge ſeynge knoweth yu doeſt ſaye thou dede thankeſt wel edifyed thāke god yt ſpeake wyth tunge euen ſo ye cō gregacion wolde leuer ſpeake fyue wordes wyth myne vnderſtandyng maye teach alſo thā ten thouſande wordes wyth tūge ephe 4 abrethren become chyldren vnderſtandynges wyckedneſſe chyldren perfect vnderſtādynges wryttē lawe eſay 28 b wyth tūges wyth lyppes wyl ſpeake vnto people ſhal ſo hear nother ſayeth ye lord actu 2 b therfore tunges token vnto faythful vnfaythfull prophecyes vnto ye vnfaythfull faythful yf ye whole cōgregaciō therfor come together ſpeake wt tunges ther ſhulde entre vnlearned vnbeleuyng ſhal ſaye yt ye mad yf al prophecye ther entre ony infydele vnlearned ouercome iudged hyd thynges hys harte become manifeſte ſo fallynge downe vpon face ſhall worſhippe god ſayeng god truth amonge brother whan ye come together euery one hath pſalme hath doctrine hath reuelacion hath tunge hath interpretacion let thynges done edifyenge yf ony man ſpeake ye tunge let done twayne mooſt thre partes let one interprete yf ther interpreter let hym kepe ſilence congregacion let hym ſpeake hymſelf god prophetes let two thre ſpeake 1 iohā 4 let iudge yf ſo ſhewed reuelacion vnto ſome ſyttynge let ye fyrſt holde hys peace ye maye al prophecye one yt al may learne maye exhorted ſpretes prophetes ſubiecte vnto prophetes god god diſſē ſion rom 15 peace teach congregacions ſayntes 1 cori 11 1 tim 2 blet wemen kepe ſilence ye cō gregacions permytted vnto ſpeake ſubiecte geneſ • c lawe alſo ſayeth yf wyll learne ought let axe theyr huſbandes home vncōly vnto woman ſpeake congregacion worde god come forth come vpon yf ony man ſemeth prophete ſpirituall let hym knowe thynges wryte vnto cō maūdementes ye lorde yf ony man knoweth ſhal knowen therfore brethrē couet prophecye forbyd ſpeake wyth tunges collo 2 • let al thynges done honeſtly order amonge xv chap ✚ gal 2 b wete brethrē ye goſpel yt whych haue preached vnto yt whych ye haue receaued yt alſo ye ſtāde ye alſo ye ſaued maner haue preached vnto yf ye kepe excepte ye haue beleued vayne fyrſt delyuerd vnto yt alſo receaued ye eſay 53 chriſt dyed ſynnes accordyng ſcriptures buried math 28 b ioh 20 roſe agayne thyrde daye accordynge ſcriptures luce 24 b ſene vnto cephas vnto eleuen ſene fyue hundreth brother together whyche ſome remayne yet hetherto ſome aſlepe ſene iames ye apoſtles laſt al ſene alſo one borne tyme ephe 5 b leeſt apoſtles worthy called apoſtle actu 8 9 haue perſecuted cōgregacion god grace god hys grace voyde ⊢ haue laboured plentyfully grace god whether whether haue preached thus ye haue thus beleued ✚ yf chriſt preached yt ryſen frō ye dead ſome amōge ſay yt ther reſurreccion frō ye dead yf ther reſurrectiō frō dead thā chriſt ryſē nother yf chriſt ryſē oure preachyng nought fayth alſo voyde foūde falſe wytneſſes god becauſe haue boren wytneſſe againſt god yt hath rayſed chriſte whome hath rayſed yf deade ryſe yf dead ryſe nother dyd chriſt ryſe agayn yf chriſt dyd ryſe agayn fayth vayne ye yet ſynnes therfor alſo yt fallē aſlepe chriſt peryſhed yf hopynge chriſte onely thys lyfe wretched men nowe chriſte ryſen deade colloſ 1 bfyrſt frutes ſlepynge man truely death man reſurreccion deade dye adam euen ſo ſhall made alyue chriſte euery one hys order ⊢ fyrſte frutes chriſte chriſtes whyche haue beleued hys commynge ſhalbe ende whan ſhall haue geuen kyngdome vnto god father whan ſhall haue voyded rule ſuperiorite power pſal 109 b hebr 1 b 2 bfor behoueth hym raygne vntyll put hys enemyes vnder hys fete laſt ſhal enemye death deſtroyed hath put thynges vnder hys fete whā ſayeth math 11 e luce 10 c iohā 3 e 13 phili 2 thynges put vnder hys fete wythout doute ſaue hym whych hath put thynges vnder hym whā al thynges ſhalbe put vnder thā ſhal ye ſonne hym ſelfe alſo ſubiect vnto hym hath made al thynges ſubiecte vnto hym god may el ſhall yt baptyſed ye deade yf ye dead ryſe intente baptyſed thē ſtande alſo yeopardy euery houre dye daylye cauſe reioycynge brother whych haue chriſt ieſu lorde yf haue foughten wyth beaſtes maner man • cori 16 b epheſus profyteth yf deade ryſe agayne eſay 22 b sapi 2 alet v eate drynke tomorowe ſhal dye deceaued euell cōmunicaciōs corruppe good manersmenāde • ▪ awaken ryghtfully ſynne ſome ignoraunt god ſpeake ſhame vnto ſome body wyll ſaye howe deade ryſe agayne wt body ſhall come thou foole ioha 12 cthat whych thou ſoweſt quickened wythout fyrſt dye ſoweſt thou thou ſoweſt body yt ſhalbe bare corne namely wheate ony ye god geueth bodye wyl vnto euery one ſedes hys owne body✚all fleſh one maner fleſhe ſome men ſome beaſtes ſome birdes ſome fyſhes ther heauenly bodyes earthy bodyes ther another glory truely heauēly another earthy math 13 • ther one clearneſſe sōne another moone another cleareneſſe ſtarres one ſtarre differreth frō another clearneſſe euen ſo ye reſurreccion deade ſowen corrupcion ſhal ryſe vncorrupcion ſowē vyleneſſe ſhall ryſe glory ſowen weakneſſe ſhal ryſe power ſowen naturall body ſhall ryſe ſpirituall yf ther natural body ther ſpiritual alſo wrytten gen 2 b fyrſte adam made lyuynge ſoule laſte adam quyckenynge ſprete ſpirituall fyrſt naturall ſpirituall ⊢ fyrſt man earth earthy ſeconde man heauen heauenly ye earthy ſuche earthy alſo heauenly ſuche heauēly alſo therfore haue boren ymage earthy ſo let v alſo beare image heauē ly ſaye brother becauſe fleſhe bloude poſſeſſe ye kyngdome god nother ſhall corrupcion poſſeſſe vncorrupcion beholde tell myſterye 1 teſſ 4 c ſhall ſlepe dede ſhall phil 3 c chaunged momente twynclynge eye laſt trompe trompe ſhall blowe deade ſhall ryſe rom 8 col 3 phili 3 c 1 ioh 3 vncorrupte ſhalbe chaunged thys corruptible muſt put vncorrupcion thys mortall muſt put immortalite whā thys mortall ſhall haue put immortalite ſhal ſayenge wryttē befall eſay 25 b death ſwalowed vp ye victory thy victory death oſee 13 c heb 2 adeath thy ſtynge ſtynge death ſynne power ſynne lawe thankes vnto god • iohā 5 whych hath geuen v victory thorowe oure lorde ieſus chriſte therfore beloued brethrē ſtedfaſt vnmouable beynge alway rych euery worke lord knowynge yt laboure vayne lorde xvi chapter bvt ye rom 15 1 cori 8 9 gatherynges yt made ye ſayntes haue ordined ye cō gregaciōs galatia euē ſo ye alſo vpon one sabbat let euery one laye aſyde hymſelfe layenge ſtore doth pleaſe hym well yt whan ſhall come ye gatherynge done whan ſhalbe preſent whome ye ſhal alowe letter thoſe ſhall ſende cary grace vnto ieruſalem yf ſo ſhalbe mete go ſhal go wt actu 19 • 2 cor 1 c wyll come vnto whan ſhal haue gone thorow macedonia ſhall go thorow macedonia ſhal perchaūce abyde wyth wynter alſo yt ye maye brynge ſoeuer ſhal go wyl ſe paſſynge truſt tary certayne ſeaſō yf god ſhal ſuffre actu 20 • wyl tary epheſus vntyl wytſontyde great euident dore opened vnto 1 cori 15 many aduerſaryes act 19 c yf timotheus ſhal come loke yt wtout feare wt worketh ye worke ye lord alſo let nomā therfore deſpyſe hym cōueye hym peace yt maye come vnto loke hym wt brethrē ye brother apollo certifye yt beſoughte much yt wold come vnto wt ye brethrē verely hys wyl yt ſhuld come ſhal come whā ſhalbe oportunite watch ye ſtāde ye faith quite like mē cōforted let al thynges loue brethrē beſek ye know ye houſe 1 cor 1 • stephana fortunatus achaicus yt ye fyrſt frutes achia haue ordined thēſelues vnto miniſtraciō ye ſayntes yt ye alſo ſubiect vnto ſuch vnto euery one workynge labourynge wyth reioyce preſence stephana fortunatus achaicus wantinge vnto haue ſupplyed haue refreſhed ſprete knowe therfore ſuch congregacions aſia ſalute aquila priſca grete much lorde wyth hys houſeholde congregacion wyth whome alſo lodged brother ſalute rom 16 b salute one another holy kyſſe ſalutacion paule gala 6 b wyth myne owne hande yf ony doth loue oure lorde ieſus chriſt ſame curſed vnto death anathe mamaranatha grace lorde ieſus chriſt wyth loue wyth chriſte ieſu amen ¶the ende fyrſt epiſtle paule ye apoſtle corinthian ſeconde epiſtle apoſtle paule corinthian fyrſt chapter paule apoſtle ieſus chriſt ye wyll god brother timotheus vnto congregacion god whych corinthus wyth al ſayntes achia gala 1 ephe 1 grace wyth peace god father lorde ieſus chriſte 1 petri 1 bleſſed god father oure lorde ieſus chriſt father mercyes god conſolacion whych comforteth v oure trouble able alſo comforte thē euery anguyſhe exhortacion wyth alſo exhorted god col 1 cfor ſufferynges chriſte plenteous v euen ſo alſo conſolacion plenteous thorowe chriſte whether troubled exhortacion ſaluacion whether comforted conſolacion whether exhorted admonicion health whyche doth worke ſufferaūce ye ſame grefes whych alſo ſuffre oure hope ſure knowynge ye partaker ſufferynges ſo ſhall ye alſo comforte wyll haue ignoraunte brother oure trouble actu 19 c whych happened aſia meaſure greued aboue power inſomuche lothed v alſo lyue anſwere death ourſelues yt truſtynge ourſelues 1 regū 2 b god whyche rayſeth deade whych hath delyuered ryd v ſo many parels whome truſt ſhall yet alſo delyuer v phil 2 yf helpe alſo youre prayer v 2 cori 4 c many perſons thankes maye geuen hym v gyfte v oure prayſe thys namely ye wytneſſe conſcience haue conuerſacion thys worlde ſyngleneſſe harte ſyncereneſſe god carnal wyſdome grace god moſt plentyfully warde wryte none thynges vnto ſaue ye haue red knowē truſt ye ſhall know v vntyll ende ye haue knowen v partely youre reioycynge daye oure lorde ieſus chriſt phili 2 b 1 teſſa 2 c ye alſo 1 cor 16 thys confidence wolde fyrſte haue come vnto ye myght haue ſeconde grace go macedonia come agayne macedonia brought iewry whan therfore thus mynded dyd vſe ony lyghtneſſe thynges yt mynde mynde fleſh math 5 iaco 5 c wyth yee naye god faythful worde whych yee naye hym yee hym ieſus chriſt ſonne god whych hath ben preached amonge v namely syluanus timotheus yee nay hym hym yee many promyſes god hym yee therfore ſaye amen vnto god hym vnto prayſe rom 8 b ſtablyſheth v wyth chriſte god whyche hath alſo anoynted v whyche hath ephe 4 c ſealed v hath geuen earneſt ſprete oure harte ✚as rom 9 take god recorde agaynſte ſoule fauourynge came nomore corinthus becauſe 1 pet 5 lordes ouer fayth helper youre ioye ye ſtande fayth ii chapter bvt haue determined thys myſelf leſt ſhuld come agayne vnto ſorowfulneſſe yf make ſory cā make glad ſaue made ſorowful thys ſame haue wrytten vnto haue ſorow whan ſhal come whome ought reioyce truſtyng ioye ioye wrote vnto great trouble anguyſhe hart wyth many teares ye ſory ye maye knowe loue haue moſt plentifully yf ony man hath made ſorowful hath made ſorowful partly charge 1 cor 5 • rebuke done many ſuffiſeth hym ſuche one ſo contrarywyſe ye rather forgeue comforted left ſuch one ſwalowed vp wyth ouer great heuyneſſe wherfore praye yt ye ſtablyſhe loue hym therfore haue wryttē vnto may knowe ye profe whether ye obedient al thynges whome ye haue forgeuen oughte hym forgeue alſo alſo haue forgeuen yf haue forgeuen oughte ſakes haue forgeuen ye perſone god begyled satan knowe thoughtes ⊢ whā come actu 16 b troada becauſe goſpel chriſt dore opened vnto lorde reſt ſpret becauſe dyd fynde titus brother byddinge thē farewell wente forth macedonia god thanked whych alwaye geueth v victorye chriſt ieſu colloſ 1 c maketh manifeſte odoure hys knowlege euery place thorowe v ye good ſauoure chriſte vnto ſaued vnto thē peryſh luce 2 cvnto ſome truely ſauoure death vnto death vnto ſome ſauoure lyfe vnto lyfe ſo mete vnto theſe thynges many counterfaytynge worde god ſpeake ſyncereneſſe god god chriſt iii chapter begynne 2 〈◊〉 5 • agayne praiſe ourſelues nede ſome letter cōmendacion vnto ye oure lettre wryttē harte whych knowen redde men beynge made knowen yt ye lettre chriſt myniſtred v wrytten wt ynke ſprete ye lyuyng god exod 34 c table ſtone iere 31 e fleſhy table harte ✚ haue ſuch truſte vnto god thorowe chriſte ſufficient thynke ought ſelues v phili 2 bbut ſufficiēcy god alſo hath made v mete 1 cori 4 2 cor 6 miniſters newe teſtamente ye letter ſprete ye lettre deute 5 c 10 kylleth ſprete quickeneth yf miniſtracion death wryttē wyth letter ye ſtones vnto glory exodi 34 inſomuch chyldrē iſrael coulde loke face moſes becauſe glory viſage yt whych made voyde ſhall actu 10 • miniſtracion ye ſpret glory yf miniſtracion damnacion vnto glory much doth ye miniſtryng ryghteouſneſſe excede glory ⊢ ſhynynge behalfe glorifyed nother becauſe excellent glory yf yt whych done awaye thorow glory much abydeth glorye hauynge therfore ſuch hope vſe greate confidēce moſes exod 3 • • dyd put couerynge vpon hys face chyldrē iſrael ſhulde loke hys face whyche done away theyr myndes eſay 6 b math 13 b made dull vntyll thys daye remayneth theſame couerynge vntakē awaye readynge olde teſtamente chriſte takē awaye vntyll thys daye whan moſes red couerynge put vpon theyr harte rom 11 cbut whan ſhalbe turned vnto lorde couerynge ſhalbe taken awaye ioh 4 cfor lorde ſprete ſprete lorde lybertye beholdyng glory lorde wyth open face chaunged ye ſame lykeneſſe cleareneſſe clearneſſe euen ye ſprete ye lord iiii chapter therfore hauynge thys miniſtracion accordynge haue optayned mercy faynte put awaye ſecretes diſhoneſty walkynge ſuttylty counterfaytyng worde god commendynge oure ſelues euery conſcience men vtterynge truth god ✚ yf goſpell alſo hyd hyd vnto peryſh amonge whō god thys worlde eſay 6 b ioh 1 • ehath blynded myndes ye vnfaythful lyghtenynge goſpell ye glory chriſt col 2 b whych ye ymage god ſhyne vnto preach ourſelues ieſus chriſt lorde v youre ſeruauntes thorowe ieſus chriſt god gene 1 dyd cōmaūde lyght ſhyne darkeneſſe ſame 2 petri 1 hath ſhyned oure harte ſhynynge clearneſſe knowlege god ye face chriſt ieſu haue thys treaſure 2 cori 5 aearthen veſſels excellēcy power god v ſuffre trouble place put diſtreſſe enpoueryſhed deſtituted ſuffre perſecuciō forſaken brought lowe brought confuſion thruſt downe peryſh gala 6 b bearynge alway dyenge ieſu chriſt body ye lyfe ieſus alſo made manifeſt bodyes ⊢ rom 8 c lyue alway delyuered death becauſe ieſus yt lyfe alſo ieſus may ſhewed mortal fleſh death therfore worketh v lyfe ✚ hauyng ye ſame ſprete fayth wryttē pſal 11 • • haue beleued wherfore haue ſpoken alſo beleue wherfore ſpeake alſo knowyng yt hath rayſed ieſus ſhal rayſe v alſo wt ieſus ſhal ſet v wt al thynges done ſakes yt 2 cor 1 b abundaūt grace may plenteous geuyng thākes many vnto glory god ye cauſe faynte though outward man corrūpe ye yt inward renewed daye daye pſal 29 rom 8 cfor trouble yt whyche tēporall lyghte worketh v weyght glorye ye heyght meaſure vnto v beholdynge ye thinges yt ſene yt ar ſene ye thinges yt ſene tēporal yt ſene eternal ⊢ v chapter know yf 2 cori 4 b erthy houſe dwellynge lowſed haue buyldyng god houſe made wyth handes euerlaſtynge ye heauens rom 8 c therfore ſygh deſyrynge clothed wyth habitacion heauen apo· 3 14 yf leeſt founde clothed naked alſo 2 petri 1 c thys tabernacle ſyghe beynge laden becauſe deſyre ſpoyled clothed vpon • mortall ſwalowed vp lyfe yt doth ordyne v therto god rom 8 b 2 cor 1 cwhych hath geuē v ye earneſt ye ſprete therfore alway bold knowynge yt longe body ar abſent frō ye lord wāder thorow fayth ſyght good harte haue good wyl rather abſent frō ye body preſēt wt ye lorde therfor endeuour ether beyng abſēte preſēt pleaſe hī math 25 c rom 14 b al muſt appeare ye iudgemēte ſeate chriſt yt euery man receaue deſeruinges ye body hath done ether good euel ✚ therfore knowyng ye fear god ſpeake fayre vnto mē vnto god ar manifeſt truſt yt manifeſt cōſciēces alſo 2 cori 3 ado agayn prayſe ourſelues geue occaſion reioyce v yt ye may haue anſwer thē yt reioyce ī ye face ye hart yf paſt mynde vnto god yf meaſurable ye loue chriſte doth ſo cōſtraine v thynkyng yt yf one dead al thā al dead 1 teſ 5 b chriſt dyed al alſo yt lyue liue vnto thēſelues vnto yt dyed thē ryſē agayn ⊢ therfore alſo henceforth knowe nomā ye fleſh though haue knowē chriſt ye fleſh tyme know yf ther therfor ony creature chriſt newe creature ye olde paſt eſa 43 c apo 21 behold al thynges become new al thynges god hath recō ciled v vnto himſelf thorow chriſt hath geuē vnto v ye office recō cilyng col 2 b god chriſt rom 3 c collo 1 b 1 iohā 4 b ſettyng ye worlde atone wt hymſelft imputyng thē theyr ſynnes hath put v worde recōcilynge go therfore embaſſage chriſt though god dyd exhorte v pray chriſts ſake recōciled vnto god eſay •• • hym yt knowē ſynne dyd make rom 8 hebre 9 c ſynne v ſhulde become ryghteouſneſſe god hym vi chapter ✚ bvt helping exhort yt ye receaue ye grace god vayne ſayeth eſay 49 b tyme acceptable haue herd ye day ſaluaciō haue holpen ye behold acceptable tyme daye health geuynge vnto mā ony occaſiō ſtōblyng yt office blamed thynges let v behaue ſelues 1 cori 4 2 cori 3 miniſters god much paciēce tribulaciōs neceſſittes anguiſhes ſtrypes priſōmētes vprours laboures watchinges faſtinges chaſtite knowlege lōge ſuffraūce kyndnes ye holy gooſt loue vnfayned ye word truth ye power god ye armoure ryghteouſneſſe ye ryghtſyde ye leftſyde glory vyleneſſe euel report good report deceauers yet true yt vnknowē yet knowē eſay 26 c dyenge behold lyue beynge chaſtened kylled ſory yet alwaye reioycynge hauyng nede yet making many rych hauyng nothyng poſſeſſynge al thynges ⊢ mouth open vnto ye corinthian hart enlarged ye ſtraytneſſe ſakes ye ſtraytneſſe inwarde mocion ſay vnto vnto chyldrē hauynge lyke reward set yourſelues large alſo deut 7 adraw yocke wt ye infidel partakyng hath ryghteouſneſſe wt wyckedneſſe fellowſhip hath lyght wt darkneſſe math 8 agremēt hath chriſt wyth belial part hath ye beleuyng wt ye vnbeleuyng cōſētynge hath ye tēple god wt idol • cori 3 b 6 c ye ye tē ple ye lyuyng god god ſayeth leui 26 b ezech▪ 37 wyll dwell thē wyll walke amōge thē ſhalbe theyr god ſhalbe people vnto eſay 52 b wherfore go ye frō ye myddes thē ſeparate ſayth ye lord touch vncleane thynge ſhal receaue ſhalbe father vnto ye ſhalbe ſōnes vnto doughters ſayeth lord almygty vii chapter let v therfore ye moſt beloued hauyng theſe promyſes clenſe v frō al fylthyneſſe ye fleſh ſprete fulfyllyng ye hallowyng ye feare god vnderſtāde ye v haue hurt nomā haue corrupte nomā haue begyled nomā ſay cō dēnacion haue ſaid afore ye oure harte dye lyue together haue greate boldneſſe warde haue much reioycynge youre behalfe fylled wyth comforte ouerflowynge wyth ioye trouble actu 16 b whan come mac • donia alſo ou •• fleſhe reſte ſuffred tribulacion outwardly fyghtynges inwardly feares ye 2 cor 1 • god yt comforteth lowly cōforted v alſo cōmynge titus onely hys cōmynge alſo ye cōſolacion wt cōforted ſhewynge v youre deſyre wepynge youre zele ſo reioyced though haue made ſory epiſtle repēteth though dyd repente glad ſeynge yt ſame letter hath made ſory although ſeaſon becauſe ye made ſory becauſe ye ar made ſory repētaūce ye made ſory god yt nothynge ye ſhulde ſuffre harme v 1 pet 2 cfor ye ſorowe yt god worketh ſtedfaſt repētaūce ſaluacion eccli • 0 c worldly ſorow worketh death behold ſame ſorowyng god carefulnes worketh nothynge defence diſpleaſure feare deſyre feruēte mynde punyſhmēt al thynges haue ye declared youreſelues vnblameable thys buſyneſſe therfore though wrote dyd becauſe hym yt dyd ye hurt becauſe yt ſuffred declare ye carefulneſſe yt haue befor god therfore alſo comforted cōſolaciō cōforted fullyer ouer ye ioye titus becauſe yt ſprete refreſhed yf haue made ony boaſt hym ame aſhamed haue ſpoken al thynges truth vnto euen ſo reioycyng towarde titus become truth hys inwarde affeccion plentifully towarde remēbryng obedience howe ye receaued hym wyth feare tremblynge glad thynges bolde youwarde viii chapter certifye brother grace god yt whych geuen cō gregacions macedonia abūdaūce theyr ioye much triall tribulacion theyr mooſt extreme pouerte dyd ouerflowe ye ryches theyr ſyngleneſſe beare recorde wyllynge accordynge theyr power aboue theyr power requyrynge v wyth great inſtaūce grace cōmunion actu 11 • rom 15 1 cori 16 1 cor 9 handereachynge done vnto ye ſayntes ſuppoſed yelded themſelues fyrſt vnto ye lorde vnto v wyll god inſomuch yt prayed titus dyd begynne thys grace amonge wolde ſo lykewiſe make ende ye plē teous thynges fayth hope worde knowlege carefulneſſe moreouer loue alſo v warde ye wyll ryfe thys grace alſo ſaye commaundynge carefulneſſe aſſayeng good nature alſo rom 10 b ye knowe liberalite lorde ieſus chriſte youre ſakes became poore whan rych hys pouerte ye myght rych geue counſell profytable vnto whych yeare ago haue begonne alſo wyll nowe accomplyſhe wyth dede alſo lyke wyllynge mynde readye ſo lykewyſe fulfyll petr 4 b prouer • b whych ye haue luce 2 • yf wyl ready accepte accordyng hath accordyng hath let abūdaūce ſo ſupplye theyr nede ſet large ye ſmarte equalite thys tyme let abundaūce ſupply theyr nede theyr abundaunce alſo ſupplyenge nede ther maye equalite wrytten exod 16 gathered much gathered lytle dyd wante geue thākes vnto god whych hath geuen ſame carefulneſſe harte titus toke ye admonicion dede whan carefull wente vnto hys owne wyll haue ſent wyth hym alſo brother whoſe prayſe goſpell thorowe congregacions alſo ordined congregacions companion yourney thys grace whych miniſtred v vnto glory lorde oure appoynted wyll beynge ware thys namely nomā blame v becauſe fulneſſe whyche miniſtred v vnto glory lord rom •• c prouyde good thynges god alſo mē haue ſente wyth thē brother alſo whome haue ofte proued many thinges careful muche carefull cauſe greate boldneſſe towarde whether titus whyche companion helper amonge brethrē ye apoſtles ye glorye congregacions chriſt shewe therfore vnto thē ye ſyght cōgregacions ye declarynge loue 1 teſſa 2 c reioycynge ix chapter wryte vnto rom 15 1 cori 16 2 cori 8 athe handreachynge done vnto ye ſayntes ſuperfluous knowe ready mynde whych boaſt macedonian ſayenge achaia alſo ready ſēce ye yeare laſt paſt feruent deſyre hath prouoked many haue ſent brother thyng wherof reioyce made voyde thys behalfe yt haue ſayd ye may ready leſt whā macedoniās ſhal come fynde ready wyl ſaye ye aſhamed thys ſubſtaunce thought therfore neceſſary deſyre brother yt come vnto prepare blyſſynge yt ready ſo though bleſſynge couetouſneſſe ✚ thys ſaye prou 11 c gal • ſoweth ſparyngly ſhal alſo reap ſparyngly yt ſoweth bleſſynges ſhal alſo reape bleſſynges euery mā hath purpoſed harte euell wyll compulſion exod 25 35 god loueth chearefull geuerecclī 35 god able make euery grace plenty hauynge alwaye ſufficiēcy ye maye plenteous euery good worke wrytten pſal 111 b hath ſparſed abrode hath geuen vnto poore hys righteouſneſſe abydeth euer yt geueth ſede vnto ye ſower ſhall alſo geue breade eate actu 14 e ſhal multiplye ſede ſhal augmente ye increaſes ye frutes ryghteouſneſſe ⊢ thynges beynge made rych ye maye plētous al ſyngleneſſe whych worketh geuynge thākes vnto god v ſeruice thys office doth ſupplye ye thynges ſayntes wante alſo abundaunt geuynge many thankes vnto lorde prayſynge god profe thys ſeruyce obedience knowlegyng goſpell chriſte ſyngleneſſe diſtributynge vnto thē men theyr prayer longynge becauſe abundaunte grace god thanke god hys vnoutſpeakeable gyfte x chapter myſelf paul beſeke thorowe mekeneſſe ſofteneſſe chriſte whyche beynge preſente amonge reputacion beynge abſente ame bolde towarde pray beynge preſente bolde wyth theſame boldneſſe ame ſuppoſed bolde agaynſt ſome thynke v walke ye fleſhe walkyng fleſh warre fleſh ephe 6 b weapens warre fleſhlye myghtye god deſtruccion ſtrōge holdes bryngynge nought counſels heyght auauncynge ſelfe agaynſt knowlege god bryngyng bondage vnderſtandynge vnto obedience chriſt beynge readye auenge diſobedience whan obedience ſhalbe fulfylled loke thynges vtter appearaūce yf ony mā truſteth hymſelfe chriſtes let hym thynke thys agayn hymſelf chriſtes ſo alſo though ſhulde boaſte myſelfe ſomewhat power 2 cor 13 • whych lorde hath geuen v edifienge deſtruccion wyl aſhamed leſt ſhulde ſuppoſed fraye wyth letter letter ſaye weyghty ſtronge ye preſence body weake ſpeche vnregarded let ſuche one thynke thys ſuche worde letter beynge abſent ſuch alſo dede beynge preſente dare interpryſe compare v ſome prayſe themſelues meaſurynge comparynge ourſelues oureſelues wyll reioyce ouer epheſ 4 meaſure accordynge ye meaſure rule wherewyth god hath appoynted vnto v rule reache vnto ſtretch oureſelues reachynge vnto come vntyl goſpell chriſt reioycynge meaſure men laboures hauynge hope increaſynge fayth ſhall become great accordynge oure rule ouer flowynge ſame intende alſo preache vnto thē yt beyonde myndynge reioyce laboures prepared another mās meaſure eſay 65 c iere 9 1 cor 1 reioyceth let hym reioyce lorde pro 27 • prayſeth himſelf alowed whome god prayſeth xi chapter wolde god ye wolde ſuffre lytle foolyſhneſſe forbeare alſo gelous ouer wyth godly gelouſy haue maryed vnto one man bryng chaſte virgine vnto chriſt feare left gene 3 • ſerpent dyd begyle eua wyth hys craftyneſſe euē ſo wyttes corrupte alſo fal awaye ſyngleneſſe chriſt ieſu gala▪ • yf cō meth preacheth another chriſt whō haue preached yf ye receaue another ſprete whome ye haue receaued another goſpell whyche ye haue receaued ye myght ryght well haue ſuffered ſuppoſe haue done nothynge leſſe hygh apoſtles though rude worde knowlege thynges manifeſt vnto haue ſynned hūblynge myſelfe yt ye ſhulde e • alted haue preached goſpell 〈1 paragraph〉 frely vnto haue ſpoyled congregacions takyng wage ſeruyce vnto actu 20 cand whā nede chargeable vnto nomā phil 4 c wantyng vnto dyd brother ſupplye came fro macedonia thynges kept ſelfe wythout charge wyll ſo kepe truely truth chriſt thys reioycynge ſhall diſanulled region achaia wherfore becauſe loue god knoweth ſhall maye cut awaye occaſion couet occaſion reioyce founde ſuch alſo ſuche falſe apoſtles deceatful worker trāſfigurynge themſelues meſſaungers chriſte maruayle satanas doth trāſfigure hymſelfe angell lyght therfore maruayle yf hys miniſters tranſfigured miniſters ryghteouſneſſe 2 petri 2 whoſe ende ſhal accordynge theyr workes agayne ſaye leſt ony mā thynke foole el take foole alſo maye boaſt lytle whyche ſpeake ſpeake god foolyſhneſſe thys reaſonynge boaſtynge becauſe many reioyce fleſh wyll reioyce alſo ✚ ye ſuffre fooles gladly inſomuche ye wyſe yourſelues ye ſuffre yf ony man brynge bondage yf ony man deuoure yf ony man robbe yf ony man auaunce hymſelfe yf ony man beate face ſaye rebuke though ben weake thys behalfe actu 22 phil 3 wherein ony dare bold ſpeake foolyſhneſſe dare bolde alſo hebrues alſo iſraelites alſo ſede abraham alſo 1 cori 4 miniſters chriſt alſo foole ſpeake many trauails preſonmentes abūdauntly ſtrypes aboue meaſure death ofte ye iewes haue receaued deut 25 fyue tymes forty ſtrypes one leſſe act 16 haue thryſe ben beaten wyth roddes actu 14 ci haue bene ſtoned act 27 c haue thryſe ſuffred ſhipwracke haue bē nyght daye depth ſee yournyes oft peryls floodes peryls murtherers peryls kynred peryls heythen peryls cytie peryls wylderneſſe peryls ſee peryls falſe brother laboure trauayle many watchynges honger thyrſte many faſtynges colde nakedneſſe beſyde thoſe thynges outwarde actu 20 dayly combraunce care congregacions 1 cori 812who weake weake offended burne yf muſt reioyce wyll reioyce thynges yt weakneſſe god father lord ieſus chriſt whych bleſſed euer gal 1 cknoweth lye actu 9 damaſcus dyd gouernoure people kynge aretas watche cytie damaſcenes myght take wyndow let downe baſket thorowe wall ſo eſcaped hys handes ⊢ xii chapter ✚ yf muſt boaſt truely nedeful wil come viſions reuelacions lorde knowe mā chriſt fourtene yeares ago whether body whether wythout body tell god knoweth theſame haue ben taken vp vntyll thyrde heauen know theſame man whether bodye whether wythout body tell god knoweth taken vp paradyſe herde ſecrete wordes whych leafull man ſpeake ſuch thynge wyl reioyce myſelf nothynge weakeneſſes although wold reioyce ſhall foolyſh ſhall tell truthe refrayne leſt ony man eſtyme aboue yt ſeyth heare ought ioh 1 b leſte greatneſſe reuelacions exalte ther geuen vnto ſtynge fleſhe meſſaunger satanas buffet ye whyche haue prayed lorde thryſe ſhulde departe fro ſayd vnto grace ſuffiſeth ſtrength made perfect weakneſſe wyll therfore gladly reioyce ſyckneſſes power chriſte maye dwell ⊢ whych cauſe contente ſyckneſſes rebuke nedes perſecucions anguyſhes chriſte whan anie weake anie ſtronge become foole ye haue compelled ought prayſed 1 cor 9 aſeynge haue done nothyng leſſe apoſtles meaſure although nothynge yet ar ye tokēs apoſtle wrought vpon pacience token wonder power ye haue leſſe congregacions ſaue myſelfe haue ben chargeable vnto forgeue thys wronge beholde thys thyrd tyme ready come vnto ſhal greuous vnto actu 20 c ſeke thynges nother ought ye chyldren gather treaſure vnto elder elder vnto chyldren wyll gladly beſtowe wyll myſelfe beſtowed ſoules though louynge ouermuch lytle loued agayne let ſo haue charged ſo much crafty toke wyth gyle haue begyled ony ſente vnto deſyred titus wyth hym ſente brother hath titus begyled haue walked one ſprete haue gone lyke footeſteppes ye thynke excuſe v ſpeake god chriſt thynges mooſt beloued done edifyenge feare leſt perchaunce whā ſhall come ſhall fynde ſuche wold founde ſuch one ye wolde gala 5 • leſt happely ther among ſtryfes enuyes hyghmyndes debate backbytynges whiſperinges ſwellinges vprours leſte whan ſhall come agayne god brynge lowe amōge bewayle many whych haue ſynned afore haue repēted ouer theyr • corin 5 vnclenneſſe whoredome fylthyneſſe haue commytted xiii chapter beholde thys thyrde tyme come vnto deut 19 c mat 18 b iohā 8 b heb 10 c mouthe two thre wytneſſes ſhal euery matter ſtande haue ſayd tell preſent nowe abſente vnto haue ſynned vnto reſt yf ſhall come agayne ſhall ſpare ye ſeke profe hym math 10 c ſpeaketh namely chriſte whyche weake amonge myghtye amonge though crucifyed thorowe weakneſſe yet lyueth ye power god alſo weake hym lyue wt hym power god 1 cor • • 1 proue ye youre ſelues whether ye fayth make ſearch ſelues knowe ye ſelues yt chriſte ieſus wythout happely ye caſtawayes truſt ye knowe caſtawayes praye god ye euell ſeme alowable ye good caſtawayes nothyng agaynſt ye truth wyth truth reioyce yt weake ye ſtronge thys alſo wiſh namely perfectneſſe therfore wryt theſe thynges beynge abſente beynge preſente vſe myſelfe hardlye accordynge power y• 2 cor 10 b lorde hath geuen edifyenge deſtruccion farthermore brother reioyce perfecte exhorte yourſelues one mynde haue peace ye god peace loue ſhalbe wyth rom 16 bsalute ech wt holy kyſſe ye ſayntes ſalute grace lorde ieſus chriſte loue god ye fellowſhip holy gooſt wyth amen ¶the ende ye ſecōde epiſtle paule ye apoſtle corinthian epiſtle apoſtle paule galathians fyrſt chapter paule apoſtle mē mā ieſus chriſte god ye father whych hath rayſed deade brother wyth vnto congregacions galatia 1 cor 1 ephe 1 1 pet 1 grace wyth peace god oure father oure lorde ieſus chriſte whych hath geuen ſelfe oure ſynnes ſhulde drawe v thys preſente euell worlde accordyng wyll god father vnto glory euer euer amen maruayl ye ſo ſoone turned frō hym whych hath called vnto ye grace chriſt vnto another goſpell whych nothyng el ſaue ther ſome trouble • tu 15 wyll turne goſpell chriſt though angell heauē preach ought vnto ſaue haue preached vnto theſame curſed 1 cori 15 haue ſayd ſo ſaye agayne yf ony mā preache ought vnto beſyde ye haue receaued theſame curſed ſpeak fayre vnto mē vnto god ſeke pleaſe men iohā 5 12 f iacob 4 yf dyd yet pleaſe men ſeruaunte chriſte ✚ 1 teſ 2 b certifye brother goſpell preached mā dyd receaue learned man reuelacion ieſus chriſte ye haue herde conuerſacion ſomtyme iewyſhip actu 8 • 22 • dyd perſecute congregacion god meaſure droue preuayled ye iewyſhyppe aboue many fellowes nacyō ph • l 3 beynge feruente louer tradicions father whan hadde pleaſed hym hadde ſundered fro mother wombe actu 9 b 22 b hadde called hys grace myght declare hys ſonne ſhulde preache hym amonge gentyles ſtrayght waye dyd graunt vnto math 16 c fleſh bloude nother dyd come ieruſalem vnto predeceſſours ye apoſtles wēt arabia come agayne damaſcus afterward thre yeare dyd come ieruſalem ſe peter abode wt hym fyftene dayes haue ſene none apoſtles ſaue iams ye brother lorde thinges wryte vnto beholde 2 cori 11 god knoweth lye dyd come partes syria cilicia face vnknowen congregacion iewry whyche chriſte neuertheleſſe herde dyd ſomtyme perſecute v doth nowe preach fayth whyche deſtroyed ſomtyme prayſed god ⊢ ii chapter ✚ fourtene yeare actu 15▪ • went vp ieruſalem agayne wyth barnabas titus alſo beynge taken wyth wente vp reuelacion dyd compare wyth thē goſpell preach among heythen ſpecially ſemed oughte leſte ſhulde runne runne vayne actu 16 1 cori 9 c neuertheleſſe nother titus whyche wyth heythen compelled circumciſed becauſe certayne falſe brother preuelye broughte whych came ſecretly ſpye oute lyberte whyche haue chriſte ieſu myght bryng v bondage vnto whome gaue rowme ye ſpace houre truth ye goſpell remayne wyth thē dyd ſeme ſomwhat haue ben ſomtyme maketh matter actu 10 rom 2 b epheſ 6 god doth accepte perſone mā yt ſemed ought auayled nothyng contrarywyſe whan ſene goſpel heythenſhippe cōmytted vnto vnto peter alſo circū ciſiō wrought peter goſpell circūciſiō wrought alſo amonge heythē whan iames cephas ihon whyche ſemed ſtayes dyd perceaue grace geuen actu 9 dthey gaue ryghthādes fellowſhippe vnto barnabas amonge heythen amonge circumciſion onely ſhulde myndefull ye poore actu 15 c • cori 9 athe whyche thynge alſo carefull whan peter came antioche wythſtode hym face blameable afore yt ſome dyd come iames dyd eate wyth heythen whan come wythdrew ſeparated hymſelfe fearyng thē circumciſion vnto hys diſſemblynge dyd reſte iewes conſente inſomuche barnabas alſo drawen ſame ſimulacion whā ſene yt dyd walke ryghtly ye truth ye goſpell ſayd ynto cephas yf thou whā thou art iewe doeſt lyue heithenyſhly iewiſhly doeſt yu cōpel ye heythē lyue ye iewes phili 3 awe iewes nature ſynners heythen rom 3 b knowynge yt man iuſtified workes lawe ſaue fayth ieſus chriſt alſo beleue ieſus chriſt may iuſtified ye fayth chriſt ye dedes ye lawe becauſe ye dedes lawe ſhall fleſh iuſtifyed yf ſekyng made ryghteous chriſt founde ſynners alſo chriſt ye miniſter ſynne farre yf buyld agayne ye thinges yt haue deſtroyed make myſelfe treſpaſſer rom 7 c ye law dead vnto ye lawe yt may lyue god wyth chriſt crucifyed lyue chriſte lyueth lyue nowe fleſhe lyue fayth ye ſonne god ephe 5 whych hath loued hath geuen hymſelfe caſt awaye grace god gal 5 bfor yf ryghteouſneſſe ye lawe dyed chriſt nought iii chapter ye wytleſſe galathians gala 5 hath bewitched obey truth whoſe eye chriſt ieſus deſpyſed amonge crucifyed wolde learne haue ye receaued ſprete workes lawe hearynge fayth ye ſo vnwyſe whā ye haue begon ye ſprete ye nowe ende ye fleſh haue ye ſuffred ſo great thynges vayne yf el vayne therfor yt gaue ye ſprete worketh miracle amōg doth ye dedes lawe hearynge fayth wrytten geneſ 15 b rom 4 iacob 2 c abraham dyd beleue god counted hym vnto ryghteouſneſſe knowe therfore fayth abraham chyldren ye ſcripture knowynge afore god iuſtifyeth heythen fayth ſhe tolde abraham gene 12 22 c ſhal nacions bleſſed therfore fayth ſhalbe bleſſed faythful abraham workes lawe vnder curſe wrytten • u • 17 c curſed euery one ſhall abyde thynges wrytten ye boke lawe noman iuſtifyed god lawe manifeſt abacuc 2 rom 1 b 10 ryghteous lyueth fayth law fayth leui 18 ſhall thē ſhall lyue rom 8 achriſt hath redimed v frō ye curſe lawe beynge become curſe v wrytten deut 21 curſed euery one hangeth tre amonge heythen bleſſynge abraham ſhulde chriſt ieſu maye receaue ye promyſe ſprete fayth brother ſpeake mā heb 9 c teſtament man beynge confirmed doth noman deſpyſe doth adde thervnto ✚ vnto abraham hys ſede promyſes graunted ſayeth ſedes many ſedes one thy ſede whych chriſt thys teſtamēt ſaye beynge confirmed god hath lawe exodi 12 f iudith 5 b actu 7 whych geuen foure hūdreth thyrty yeare made none effecte make promyſe voyde rom 4 c yf enheritaunce lawe promyſe vnto abraham hath god geuen promyſe doth lawe ſerue rom 5 c 7 b 8 cit ordyned becauſe tranſgreſſion vntyl ſede ſhulde come vnto whome promyſed beynge ordined angel hande mediator mediator one god one ye law agaynſt promyſes god farre yf ther bene geuen lawe coulde haue quickened ryghteouſneſſe ſhuld truely lawe rom 3 b ſcripture cloſed thynges vnder lawe promyſe faythe ieſus chriſt ſhuld geuen vnto faithfull ⊢ afore fayth dyd come kepte ſhut vnder lawe ſame fayth whyche diſcloſed therfore ye law ſcoolemayſter vnto chriſt iuſtified fayth whan fayth dyd come vnder ſcoolemayſter iohā 1 ye chyldren god fayth whych chriſt ieſu rom 6 13 b col 2 b ſo baptyſed chriſte ye haue put chriſt ther iew nother greke ther bondman nother fre ther mā womā ye ioh 17 c one chriſt ieſu ephe 1 b hebre 2 c yf ye chriſtes thā ye ſede abraham accordynge promyſe enheritours iiii chapter ✚ bvt ſaye longe ye heyre chylde differreth nothynge ſeruaunte though lorde vnder tutor gouernours vntyll tyme appoynted father euen ſo alſo whan chyldrē ſeruynge vnder tradicions worlde whā ge • e 49 b dani 9 fulneſſe ye tyme come god ſente hys ſōne borne woman mat 5 b put vnder lawe ſhulde redime yt vnder lawe might receaue adopcion chyldrē rom 8 b becauſe ye chyldren god god ſent ſprete ſōne youre harte cryenge abba father therfore nowe ſeruaunte ſonne yf ſonne heyre alſo thorow god thā truely knowyng god ye ſerued 1 cori 8 nature goddes ye haue knowen god yee ye knowē god collo 2 chow ye turne agayne ye weak beggerlye tradicions vnto whych ye wyll ſerue agayne ye obſerue dayes monethes tymes yeares feare leſt haue laboured vayne amōge ye brother praye alſo ye haue hurte nothyng ye know whyle ago dyd preach vnto goſpel thorow weakneſſe ye fleſh temptaciō fleſhe haue ye deſpyſed nother haue ye refuſed lyke mala 1 angell god dyd ye receaue yee chriſte ieſu therfore happyneſſe beare recorde yf ben poſſible ye put eyen geuen vnto therfor become enemy vnto tellynge truth gelous ouer amyſſe wyl ſhut ye gelous ouer couet ye alwaye good thynge feruently goodneſſe whan preſente wyth lytle chyldrē whome iohā 16 c trauayle 1 cor 4 c byrth agayne vntyll chriſt faſhioned wolde wyth alſo chaunge voyce ame aſhamed tell ye wyll vnder lawe haue ye red lawe ✚ ther wrytten abraham two chyldrē gene 16 one hādemayden gene 21 one fre rom 9 yt borne hādemaydē borne ye fleſh borne frewoman promiſe yt thynges ſpoken allegory theſe two teſtamētes one truely monte sina engendrynge vnto bondage y• whych agar sina mountayne arabia whych ioyned vnto ieruſalē bondage wt hyr chyldren apo •• ieruſalem hygh fre whych mother wryttē eſay 54 glad thou barē whych beareſt breake forth crye bryngeſt forth deſolate hath many mo chyldren ſhe hath huſbande v brother ye chyldrē promyſe iſaac ge • e 27 g thā borne ye fleſh dyd perſue hym borne ſprete euen ſo alſo ſayeth ſcripture gene 21 b caſt ye hande mayden hyr ſonne ſonne handemaydē ſhal heyre wyth ſonne frewoman therfore brethrē ye chyldren handemayden frewoman wyth whych fredome chriſt hath made v fre ⊢ v chapter stande faſte holden agayne wyth eſa 9 yocke bōdage beholde paule tell actu 15 yf ye circumcyſed chriſt ſhall profyte nothynge agayne teſtifye vnto euery man circumciſyng hymſelfe detter kepe ye whole lawe ye voyded chriſt whych made ryghteous lawe ye fallē grace ſprete fayth wayte hope ryghteouſneſſe gal 6 b chriſt ieſu doth nother circumciſiō auayle oughte foreſkynne fayth whyche 1 cori 13 worketh charite ye ranne well gal 3 hath let obey truth agre vnto noman thys perſuaſion hym doth calle 1 cor 5 lytle leuen ſowreth whole lompe dowe ✚ truſt lorde ye ſhall mynde none thynge troubleth ſhall beare hys iere 23 ezech 3 iudgement ſo euer yf brother yet preach circūciſion yet ſuffre perſecuciō thā ye ſklaūder ye croſſe voyded wolde god alſo cut away whych trouble ye brother called vnto lyberte geue rom 14 1 corin 8 liberte occaſion ye fleſh ſerue ech loue ſprete lawe fulfylled one worde leuit 19 math 19 c 22 rom 13 b thou ſhalt loue thy neghboure thy ſelfe yf ye byte eate one another take hede yt ye cō ſumed eche ⊢ ✚ ſaye chriſt walke ſprete ye ſhall fulfyll 1 pet 2 b luſtes fleſh ye fleſh luſteth agaynſt ye ſprete ſprete agaynſt fleſh theſe contrary ech yt thynges ye wyll ye theſame yf ſo ye led ſprete ye vnder lawe 1 tim 5 c dedes fleſh manifeſt whych fornicacion vnclenneſſe vnchaſtite lechery worſhippe idol wytchcrafte 2 cori 12 c debate ſtryfes hatredes wrathes chydynges diſſenſions ſectes enuyenges manſlaughters drō kenneſſes bankettynges ſuche lyke whych tell afore haue ſayd 1 cori 6 epheſ 5 apo 22 c ſuche ſhall optayne ye kyngdome heauē ephe 5 b frute ye ſprete loue ioye peace pacience gentlyneſſe goodneſſe lōgeſufferynge ſoftneſſe fayth mekeneſſe temperaūce chaſtite 1 tim 1 b agaynſt ſuche lawe ro • 13 b 1 pet 2 b chriſtes haue crucifyed theyr fleſh wyth vice concupiſcences ⊢ ✚ yf lyue ſprete let v alſo walke ſprete let v become deſyrous vayne glorye prouokynge one another enuyenge ech vi chapter brother yf mā ſhal ouertaken ony faute ye ſpiritual inſtruct ſuch one wyth ſoft ſpret conſyderynge thyſelfe thou tempted alſo ioh 13 b rom 15 beare ye ye burthen one another ſo ſhall ye fulfyll lawe chriſte yf ony man thynketh hymſelfe oughte whan nothynge deceaueth hymſelfe let euery man proue hys owne worke ſo ſhal reioyce hymſelfe another rom 14 bfor euery man ſhal beare owne burthen ⊢ rom 15 1 cori 9 b let hym inſtructe wyth worde miniſtre al hys goodes vnto hym doth inſtructe hym erre god mocked luce 16 thynges mā ſhall ſowe theſame ſhall reape alſo ſoweth hys fleſhe hys fleſh ſhal alſo reape corrupcion ſoweth ſprete ſprete alſo ſhall reape euerlaſtynge lyfe 2 teſ 3 b doynge good let v faynte hys tyme ſhall reape ceaſſynge whyle haue tyme therfore let v good vnto men 1 tim 5 mooſt vnto houſeholdes fayth beholde wyth letter haue wrytten vnto 1 cori 16 c wyth myne owne hande wyll pleaſe ye fleſh conſtrayne circumciſed ſuffre perſecucion croſſe chriſte nother yt circūciſed kepe lawe wyll haue circūciſed may reioyce fleſh farre fro reioyce ſaue croſſe oure lorde ieſus chriſt ye whyche worlde crucified vnto vnto world gal 5 chriſt ieſu doth nother circūciſion auaile ought vncircumciſion new creature pſal 124▪ whoſoeuer followe thys rule peace vnto mercy vpō iſrael god henceforth let nomā trouble 2 cori 4 b beare markes lorde ieſus body grace oure lorde ieſus chriſt ſprete brother amen ¶the ende epiſtle paule apoſtle galathians epiſtle paule apoſtle epheſians fyrſt chapter paule apoſtle ieſus chriſte wyl god vnto ye ſayntes epheſus faythfull chriſte ieſu 2 cori 4 gala 1 grace vnto peace frō god father lord ieſus chriſt 1 pet 1 ableſſed god father lorde ieſus chriſt whyche hath bleſſed v euery ſpiritual bleſſing heauēly thynges chriſt iohā 15 b 2 tim 1 b hath choſē v hym makynge ye world yt ſhuld holy vnſpotted hys ſyght loue hath predeſtinate v adopcion chyldren ieſus chriſt hymſelfe accordynge purpoſe hys wyll vnto prayſe ye glory hys grace ye whych hath made v accepted hys math • b 17 beloued ſonne coll 1 b heb 1 whome haue redempcion throughe hys bloude remiſſion ſynnes accordynge ryches hys grace whych hath ben exceadynge plenteous v wyſedome prudence coll 1 c myght declare vnto v myſtery hys wyll accordynge hys good pleaſure whych purpoſed ſelfe diſpenſacion gala 4 fulneſſe tymes ſet vp thynges chriſt thynges heauen earth euē hymſelfe whō alſo lykewyſe called lot rom 8 predeſtinate accordynge purpoſe hym whych worketh thynges counſell hys owne wyll maye vnto prayſe hys glory euen whych afore haue hoped chriſt alſo beleued whan ye herde worde truth ye goſpell ſaluacion alſo ye beleuynge rom 8 b 2 cor 1 c 5 ſealed wyth holy ſprete promyſe whych earneſt oure inheritaunce redempcion purchacynge vnto ye prayſe hys glory phili 1 b coll 1 2 teſ 1 b wherfore alſo hearynge fayth whych chriſt ieſu loue vnto ſayntes ceaſſe geuynge thankes makynge mēcyon prayer god glory ioh 6 • father lorde ieſu chriſt maye geue vnto ſprete wyſedome reuelacion ye knowlege hym eye youre harte beynge lyghtened yt ye may knowe whych hope hys callynge ryches glorye hys inheritaunce ſayntes whych exceadynge greatneſſe power toward v haue beleued accordynge workyng myght hys power hath wrought chriſte ieſu rayſynge hym vp deade pſal 109 ſettynge hym hys ryghthande heauenly thynges aboue dani 10 b rule power myght dominion euery name named thys worlde alſo ye worlde come pſal 8 • thynges hath ſubdued vnder hys fete made hym ephe 4 b 5 c col 1 b heade ouer congregacion whych hys body fulneſſe hym fylleth ii chapter colloſ 1 b 2 b hath quyckened whan ye deade thorowe treſpaſſes ſynnes whych ye walked ſomtyme accordynge ye courſe thys worlde ye prince power ayre ſprete worketh chyldrē vnbelefe coll 3 ye whych alſo haue led cōuerſacion ſomtyme luſtes fleſh doynge wyll fleſh thoughtes nature chyldren wrath euen aſwell god whych rych mercy exceadynge loues ſake wherwyth hath loued v whan deade alſo thorow ſynnes hath quyckened v chriſt eſa 25 b actu 15 b whoſe grace ye ſaued hath rayſed v vp wyth hym made v ſyt heauenly thynges chriſt ieſu tymes come myghte ſhewe abundaunte ryches grace goodneſſe vpō v chriſt ieſu grace ye ſaued thorowe fayth ſelues gyft god workes leſt ony man ſhuld reioyce hys workemāſhip created chriſt ieſu titū • b good workes whych god hath prepared ſhulde walke wherfore ye myndefull ſomtyme ye heythen ye fleſh whych called vncircumciſion called phili 3 collo 2 b circumciſion made wyth hande fleſhe whyche tyme wente aſtraye wythoute chriſte ſeparated conuerſacion iſraell ſtraungers teſtamētes hauynge rom 15 b hope promyſe wythoute god thys worlde chriſte ieſu ye ſomtyme went aſtraye afarre nowe made nye bloud chriſt▪ eſay 9 b col 1▪ b peace whych hath made one broken downe myd wall ye ſtoppe euen enimities hys fleſh puttynge awaye iudgementes ye law commaundementes hymſelfe myght make two one newe man makynge peace one bodye myghte reconcile vnto god thorowe croſſe kyllynge enemities hymſelfe commynge eſay 57 c luce 2 b hath preached peace vnto whyche afarre peace vnto nye hym haue intraūce one ſprete vnto father ✚ iohan 1 • • therfor ye geſtes ſtraungers ye cyteſens ſayntes houſeholde god buylded vpon 1 corin 3 b foundacion apoſtles prophetes 1 petri 2 • ieſus chriſte beynge hye corner ſtone euery buyldyng beynge made groweth holy temple lorde ye alſo buylded together habitacion god holy gooſt ⊢ iii chapter thys thynges ſake paule actu 11 b preſoner ieſu chriſt heythen yf ſo yet ye haue herde office grace god actu 1 • 22 b whyche geuen vnto amonge accordynge gala 1 • reuelacion myſtery declared vnto wrote afore fewe wordes lyke readynge may vnderſtande prudence ye miſtery chriſte whyche miſtery generacions hath ben knowen vnto chyldren men opened vnto hys holy apoſtles prophetes ye holy gooſt yt heythē lyke heyres ſame bodye lyke partaker hys promiſe chriſt ieſu thorow ye goſpell whereof made miniſter accordynge gyfte ye grace god whych geuē vnto ye workynge hys power vnto 1 cor 15 • leeſt ſayntes thys grace geuē preach amōge ye heythen vnſearcheable ryches chriſt make al mē ſe ye cōmiſſion coll 2 c myſtery hyd ſence worlde beganne god whych created thynges vnto ruler power heauenly thynges myght knowen congregacion manyfolde wyſedome god accordynge eternal purpoſe hath ſhewed chriſt ieſu lorde whome haue truſt intraunce boldeneſſe thorowe fayth hym ✚ phili 1 b 1 teſ 3 wherfore deſyre ye faynt trouble coll 1 c whych youre glorye thys thynges ſake bowe knee vnto father lorde ieſus chriſt whome al fatherhode hath name heauens earth accordynge ryches hys glorye maye geue vnto power ſtrengthed hys ſprete inwarde man chriſt maye dwell thorow fayth harte beynge rooted groū ded loue may comprehende wyth ſayntes bredth length heyght depth knowe alſo exceadynge loue knowlege chriſte ye maye fylled fulneſſe god hym whyche able thynges abundauntly deſyre vnderſtande according power worketh v hym glorye congregacion chriſte ieſu generacions worlde worldes ⊢ amen iiii chapter ✚ therfore preſoner ye lord beſeke gene 17 1 cori 7 b phil 1 coll 1 1 teſ 4▪ • ye walke worthely callynge wyth ye called wt humbleneſſe mekeneſſe pacience forbearyng one another loue beynge carefull kepe vnite ſprete ye bōde peace one body one ſprete ye called one hope youre callynge one lorde one fayth one baptyme one god father whyche aboue thorowe al v ⊢ ✚ rom 12 • 1 cori 12 vnto euery one v geuen grace ioh 3 c accordynge meaſure gyfte chriſt wherfore ſayeth pſal 67 c eſay 45 ahe goynge vp hye ledde awaye captiuite captiue gaue giftes vnto men wente vp alſo came downe fyrſt ye lower partes ye earth iohā 3 bhe came downe theſame alſo went vp aboue heauens myght fulfyll thynges 1 cor 12 c made ſome truly apoſtles ſome prophetes ſome euangeliſtes ſome shepeherdes teacher perfourmaunce ſayntes worke miniſtracion edifyenge body chriſt tyll al come vnite fayth knowlege ſonne god perfecte man meaſure age ye fulneſſe chriſt ⊢ 1 cori 14 c ſhulde nowe chyldren col 2 waueryng caryed aboute wyth euery wynde doctrine wyckednes mē ſutylte deceatfulnes erroure perfourmynge truth let v thynges growe hym ephe 1 c 5 c ye heade euē chriſt whome bodye beynge coupled knyt together thorowe euery ioynt rom 12 1 cori 1 • b ſubminiſtracion accordynge operacion meaſure euery mēbre maketh increace bodye edifyenge ſelfe loue ✚this ſaye therfore teſtifye lorde ye walke nowe rom 1 c 1 petr 4 heythen alſo walke vanite theyr owne mynde hauynge vnderſtandynge blynded darkneſſe beynge farre waye god thorow ignoraunce becauſe blyndneſſe theyr harte fallynge diſpayre haue geuen ouer themſelues vnclenneſſe workynge fylthyneſſe vnto gredyneſſe ye haue ſo learned chriſte yf ſo yet ye haue herde hym inſtructe hym truthe ieſu rom 6 coll 3 put ye olde conuerſacion olde man whyche corrupte accordyng luſtes erroure ⊢ ✚ ye renewed ſprete mynde put newe man whyche ſhapen god ryghteouſneſſe holyneſſe truth •• ch 8 c 1 pet 2 wherfore puttynge awaye lyenge ſpeake ye truth euery man wyth hys neghboure becauſe membres one another pſal 4 ye angrye ſynne let sōne go downe vpō wrath geue ye place ye deuel yt dyd ſteale let hym nowe ſteal rather • • ſſ • let hym labour workynge wyth hys handes whych good maye haue geue vnto hym ſuffreth nede ⊢ math 1 • ephe 5 • let euery euell cōmunicacion procede youre mouth yf ony good edifyenge fayth maye geue grace vnto hearer greue ye holy ſprete god ye 2 corin 1 c ſealed agaynſt daye redempcion let bytterneſſe wrath indignacion cōplaynynge blaſphemye remoued awaye wyth malyce col 3 bbut curteous one another mercyfull mat 6 b forgeuyng one another lyke god alſo hath forgeuen chriſt v chapter ✚ ye therfore mat 5 c ioh 13 b follower god moſt deare chyldren walke loue lyke chriſt alſo hath loued v gala 1 • ephe 5 c geuē ouer hymſelfe v oblacion ſacrifyce vnto god odoure ſwetneſſe fornicacion vnclenneſſe couetouſneſſe exod 23 b let named among becōmeth ſayntes ecclī 23 c fylthyneſſe foolyſh talkynge ieſtynge thynges pertayne matter rather geuing thankes 1 cori 6 b col 3 vnderſtandyng ye ſure thys yt euery fornicatour vnclene perſon couetous perſō whych ſeruice idol hath inheritaūce ye kyngdom chriſt god coll 2 • let noman deceaue wyth vayne wordes becauſe theſe thynges commeth wrath god vppon chyldren vnbelefe ye therfore partaker thē ye ſomtyme darkeneſſe • teſſa 5 nowe lyghte lorde walke ye chyldren lyght gala 5 cfor frute lyght goodneſſe ryghteouſneſſe truth ⊢ prouynge wel pleaſyng vnto god haue ye fellowſhippe wyth vnfrutefull workes darkneſſe rather reproue ſhame alſo ſpeake thynges done ſecrete iohā 3 c al thynges manifeſt rebuked lyght euery thynge yt manifeſt lyghte wherfore ſayeth eſay 60 rom 13 b vp thou ſlepeſt aryſe deade chriſt ſhall geue lyght ✚ coll 4 take hede therfore brethrē howe ye walke circūſpectly vnwyſe ye wyſe redeminge ye tyme dayes euel wherfore ye vnwyſe vnderſtandyng rom 12 1 teſſ 4 athe wyl god ecclī • 1 c ye drō ken wt wyne wherein voluptuouſneſſe ye actu 2 b fylled wyth holy gooſt col 3 • talkynge vnto ſelues pſalmes hymnes ſpiritual ſonges pſal 97 aſyngynge playenge youre harte vnto lord 1 teſſ 5 c geuynge thankes alway vnto god father al thynges ye name lord ieſu chriſt ſubmyttyng yourſelues one another ye feare chriſt coll 3 c 1 petri 3 alet ye wemē ſubiectiō theyr huſbādes ye lord 1 cor 11 ye huſbande heade womā chriſt ye head ye cōgregaciō ye ſauiour body lyke congregacyon ſubiecte vnto chriſt ſo let ye wemē alſo theyr huſbandes thynges ye men loue wyues chriſte alſo loued cōgregacion epheſ • 5 gala 1 gaue hym ſelfe myght ſāctifye titum 3 1 petri 3 cclenſynge wyth foūtayne water worde lyfe myght make vnto hymſelfe glorious cōgregacion hauynge blemyſh wrynkle ony ſuch thyng myght holy vndefyled euen ſo ought mē alſo loue theyr wyues theyr owne bodyes loueth hys wyfe loueth himſelfe nomā hath hated owne fleſh ony tyme doth noryſhe cheryſh euen chriſte doth alſo congregacion membres hys body hys fleſhe hys bone geneſ 2 math 19 marci 10 thys cauſe ſhal man leaue hys father mother cleue vnto hys wyfe ſhalbe two one fleſh thys greate myſtery ſay chriſt cōgregacion neuertheleſſe alſo let euery one loue hys wyfe hymſelfe let wyfe feare hir huſbande vi chapter ye coll • c chyldren obeye youre father mother ye lorde right exodi 20 bhonour thy father thy mother whych fyrſt cōmaū demente promyſe thou mayeſt proſpere lyue longe vpō earth ye father prouoke chyldrē vnto wrath exodi 11 deute 4 b 6 11 c pſal 77 • bryng vp nurtoure informacion lorde col 3 • titum 2 b 1 pet 2 c ye ſeruauntes obey bodely mayſters wyth feare tremblynge ſympleneſſe harte vnto chriſt ſeruynge vnto eye pleaſynge men ſeruaū te chriſt doynge ye wyll god mynde wyth good wyl doynge ſeruyce vnto lorde vnto men knowynge euery mā good thynge ſo euer doth ſhal receaue ſame lorde whether bonde fre eccli • 5 coll 3 c mayſters ye euen ſame vnto puttynge away threatenynges knowynge theyr lorde heauen actu 10 rom • 2 b colloſ 3 c • pet 5 b ther acceptynge perſonnes wyth god ✚ fynally brother ye ſtronge lorde power hys ſtrength put ye armour god ye maye ſtande agaynſt aſſaultes deuell wreſtle againſt fleſh bloude againſt ruler power agaynſt gouernours ye world theſe darkneſſes againſt ſpiritual thynges wickedneſſe heauēly thynges wherfore take ye ye armoure god ye maye reſyſt euell daye ſtōde perfect thynges exod 28 deut 23 b pſal 13 • eſay 11 sap 5 c 2 cori 10 stōde ye therfore beynge gyrded aboute loynes truth hauynge breſtplate ryghteouſneſſe youre fete ſhod preparynge goſpell peace thynges takynge ſhylde fayth wyth ye may quenche fyry dartes mooſt wicked take ye alſo helmete ſaluacion heb 4 c ſwearde ſprete whych worde god ⊢ luce 18 1 teſſ 5 c prayenge maner prayer ſupplicacion alwaye ye ſprete watchynge ſame al inſtaunce ſupplicacion al ſayntes collo 4 2 teſſ 3 worde may geuen openynge mouth boldneſſe declare myſtery goſpell ye whych meſſaunger thys cheyne ſo actu 4 c may bold ſpeake ought yt ye alſo may know thynges aboute tichicus ye mooſt deare brother faythful miniſter lorde ſhall ſhew haue ſente vnto ſame purpoſe ye maye knowe ye thynges aboute v maye comforte harte peace vnto brother loue wyth fayth god father lorde ieſus chriſt grace wyth loue lord ieſus chriſt ſyncerely amen ¶the ende epiſtle paule apoſtle epheſians epiſtle paule apoſtle philippian fyrſt chapter paule timothe ſeruaūtes ieſus chriſt vnto ſayntes chriſte ieſu ar • actu 16 bphilippis wyth byſhops actu 6 • miniſters 2 cor 1 grace vnto peace god oure father lorde ieſus chriſt ✚ coll 1 1 teſ 1 thanke god euery remembraunce makynge alwaye prayer inſtaunte prayer wyth ioye cō cernynge youre fellowſhippe goſpell chriſt fyrſt day hetherto truſtynge one hath begonne ioha 6 ye good worke ſhall fule • de vntyll day chriſte ieſu due vnto thynke becauſe haue partaker ioye harte bandes defence confirmacion goſpell god 1 teſſ 2 recorde longe euen frō harte roote ieſu chriſt ephe 1 c col 1 2 teſſ 1 b thys praye loue maye increace knowlege al vnderſtandynge ye maye alowe beſt ye may pure without offence againſt daye chriſt fylled wyth ye frut ryghteouſneſſe thorowe ieſus chriſt vnto glorye prayſe god ephe 3 b wolde haue wyte brother thynges aboute • ye profyte goſpell inſomuche bandes made manifeſte chriſt euery iudgement houſe place ſo many brother hauynge truſt lorde bandes bolde plentyfully wythout feare ſpeake ye worde god truely enuy ſtryfe ſome preache chriſte good wyll ſome loue knowynge yt ame layde defence goſpell ſome ſhew chriſte contencion ſyncerely ſuppoſynge rayſe perſecuciō vnto bōdes thā whan euery meane chriſt preached ether thorow occaſiō ye truth reioyce ſhall alſo reioyce know yt ſhal befal vnto ſaluacion 2 cor 1 b prayer miniſtraciō ye ſprete ieſus chriſt accordynge waytynge hope ſhalbe aſhamed nothynge wyth boldneſſe alway ſo ſhal alſo chriſt magnifyed body ether thorow lyfe death chriſt lyfe vnto death auaūtage yf lyue fleſh frute labour ſhall choſe alſo tel diſtreſſe two thinges 2 cor 5 hauynge deſyre lowſed wyth chriſt whych much better abyde ye fleſh neceſſary ſakes truſtynge thys knowe ſhall remayne continue wyth vnto ende profite reioycynge fayth youre reioycynge maye plenteous chriſt commynge agayne vnto neuertheles walke ephe 4 col • 1 1 teſſ 4 worthy goſpell chriſte whether ſhall come ſhall ſe beynge abſente ſhall heare ye ſtande ſtedfaſt one ſprete labourynge together one mynded fayth goſpell nothynge ye afrayde aduerſaryes vnto occaſion perdicion vnto ſaluaciō god vnto geuē chriſtes ſake onely ye ſhulde beleue hym ye alſo ſuffre hym hauynge lyke fyghte ye ſawe alſo heare ii chapter yf ther therfore ony cō ſolacion chriſt yf ther ony comforte loue yf ther ony fellowſhip ye ſprete yf ther ony entier mocion pytie fulfyll ioye rom 12 c ye mynde one thynge hauynge one loue one mynde meanynge one thynge let nothynge done thorow 2 cor 3 ſtryfe vayne glory humblyneſſe eſtymynge ech ſuperiores euery one conſyderynge thynges yt theyrs thynges ✚ 1 pet 2 c let mynde yt whych alſo chriſt ieſu whych whan ye ſhape god thought robbery equal god pſal 8 bbut made hymſelfe reputacion takynge vpon hym ſhape ſeruaunte hebr 5 made ye lykeneſſe men apparell founde man dyd humble himſelfe became obedient vntyl death euen death croſſe math 28 c heb 2 b yt whyche cauſe god dyd alſo exalte hym gaue hym name yt aboue euery name eſay 54 c dani 7 c rom 14 b ye name ieſus euery ane bowed thynges heauen thynges earth thynges vnder ye earth euery tūge knowlege lorde ieſus chriſt ye glory god father ⊢ therfore moſt beloued ye haue alway obeyed actu 16 b preſēce muche myne abſence worke health wt feare tremblyng deut 8 ezech 36 • 2 cor 3 hebr 13 god worketh wyll perfourme ye good wyll 1 pet 4 b ye al thynges wythout grudgynges doutynges yt ye wtout cōplaynt ſymple chyldrē god 1 pet 2 • wtout rebuke myddeſt ye euell peruerſe generacion math 5 b amōge yt whych ye ſhyne lyghtes ye worlde holdynge faſt word lyfe vnto 2 cor 1 c 1 teſſ 2 c reioycyng ye daye chriſte becauſe haue runne vayne nother haue laboured vayne col 1 c although offered vp vpon ye ſacrifice wyllynge ſeruyce fayth rom 1 • b ame glad reioyce wyth ye glad alſo theſame reioyce wt truſt lorde ieſus actu 16 ſende timotheus ſhortly vnto 1 teſſ • bthat alſo may good cōforte knowynge thynges yt aboute haue noman ſo one mynded whych carefull wyth ſyncere affeccion 1 cori 1 • • al ſeke thynges theyrs ieſus chriſtes ye knowe profe hym chylde vnto father ſo dyd ſerue wyth goſpel theſame therfore truſte ſende vnto ſoone ſhall ſe thynges aboute philip 1 • truſt lorde myſelfe alſo ſhall come ſhortly vnto neuertheleſſe thoughte expediente ſende brother epaphroditus fellowe workeman fellowſouldyer youre apoſtle ſeruaunt nede longed ſory becauſe ye herd hym haue ben ſycke ſycke vntyll death god hath mercy vpon hym vpon hym alſo leſt ſhulde haue ſorowe vpon ſorowe haue ſente hym therfore ſpedely whā ye haue ſene hym ye maye ioyfull agayne wythout heuyneſſe receaue hym therfore lorde wyth gladneſſe mat 10 rom 15 1 teſ 5 c haue ſuch honoure wente euen vntyll death becauſe worke chriſt geuyng ouer hys lyfe myght fulfil wantyng vnto towarde wyllynge ſeruyce iii chapter moreouer brother reioyce lorde wryte one thynge vnto truely grefe vnto neceſſary vnto eſa 56 c phili 1 bbeware dogges beware euel workman beware diuiſion rom 2 c col • 2 bfor circumciſion euen whych ſerue god iohā 4 c rom 1 ſprete reioyce chriſt ieſu hauynge cōfidence fleſh though alſo haue confidence fleſh 2 cor 12 yf ony man ſemeth haue cōfidence fleſh haue beynge circumciſed eyght daye naciō iſrael trybe beniamin hebrue hebrues lawe actu 23▪ 26 28 c phariſe feruētnes actu 9 c gala 1 bi perſecutyng congregacion god accordynge ryghteouſneſſe whyche lawe haue walked wythout blame math 13 f thynges auauntage vnto ſame haue counted loſſe chriſtes ſake neuertheleſſe counte thinges loſſe becauſe exceadyng iohan 17 col 2 knowlege ieſus chriſt lorde whoſe ſake haue coū ted thynges loſſe counte thē doūge may wynne chriſt foūde hauyng ryghteouſneſſe whiche law ſame fayth chriſte ieſu whych ryghteouſneſſe god fayth knowe hym power hys reſurreccion fellowſhippe hys paſſion rom 6 beynge lyke faſhioned wyth hys death yf ony meanes maye attayne vnto reſurreccion deade haue attayned vnto already yt perfecte followe vpō yf ony meane may cōprehende wherein cōprehēded chriſt ieſu brother ſuppoſe haue gotten holde one thynge forgettynge thynges truely behynde ſtretchyng myſelfe ye thynges afore preaſſe ye appoynted marke ye rewarde hygh callyng god chriſt ieſu let v therfore many perfecte thus mynded yf ye otherwyſe mynded god ſhall open thys vnto alſo neuertheleſſe vnto come yt one mynded continue one rule✚ 1 cor 4 c 10 dbe ye follower brother marke thē walke ſo ye haue enſample many walke whyche haue ofte tolde • ut alſo tell wepynge enemyes croſſe chriſt whoſe ende death r •• 16 bwhoſe god belly theyr glorye ſhame whyche mynde earthly thynges col 3 conuerſacion heauen whence alſo wayte ſaueoure lorde ieſus chriſt • cori 15 f whych ſhal reſtore oure vyle bodye beynge lyke faſhioned vnto hys cleare body accordynge workynge hys power whych alſo maye able ſubdue thynges vnto hym ſelfe ⊢ iiii chapter wherfore moſt beloued brother mooſt lōged ioye crowne ſtande ye ſo ſtil ye lorde ye mooſt beloued praye euodias beſeke syntiche mynde one thynge lorde praye germayne 1 cor 9 yockefellowe helpe thoſe womē whych haue laboured wyth goſpell wyth clement myne helper luce 10 b apo 17 bwhoſe name boke lyfe✚ 1 teſſ 5 creioyce ye ye lorde alwaye agayne ſaye reioyce let ſofteneſſe knowen vnto men lorde nye nothynge carefull euery prayer ſuplicacion let youre requeſtes knowen vnto god wyth thankeſgeuynge ioh 14 c rom 5 peace god whyche paſſeth vnderſtandynge kepe harte vnderſtā dynges chriſt ieſu ⊢ moreouer brother ſoeuer thynges true ſoeuer thynges ar honeſt whatſouer thynges • uſt whatſoeuer thynges holy whatſoeuer thynges louynge whatſoeuer thynges good reporte yf ther ony vertue yf ther ony prayſe learnynge theſe thynges myndefull thynges yt ye haue learned receaued haue herde haue ſene ſame god eſay 9 b peace ſhalbe wt reioyce greatlye lorde laſt ye floryſhynge agayne regarde ye regarded ye occupyed ſaye becauſe nede haue learned caſes yt • tim 6 • contente lowe full taught euery thynges ſatiſfyed hongry ouerflowynge ſuffre ſcarceneſſe thynges comforteth neuertheleſſe ye haue done well bearynge parte wyth tribulaciō ye philippian knowe alſo begynnynge goſpel whan wente fro macedonia congregacion bare parte wyth waye gyfte receate ſaue ye alone ye ſente twyſe vnto theſſalonica alſo behofe ſeke gyfte requyre plentyfull frute rekenyng haue full fylled whā receaued epaphroditus yt ye ſente vnto ſauoure ſwetneſſe rom 1 • hebr 1 • c acceptable offerynge pleaſynge vnto god god accō plyſh euery requeſt accordyng ryches glory chriſt ieſu vnto god father prayſe euer euer amen salute euery ſaynte chriſt ieſu brother wyth ſalute ſayntes ſalute ſpecially ceſars houſeholde grace lorde ieſus chriſte wyth youre ſprete amen ¶the ende epiſtle paule apoſtle philippian epiſtle apoſtle paule coloſſians fyrſt chapter paule apoſtle ieſus chriſte wyll god brother timothe vnto thoſe ſayntes faythfull brethrē chriſt ieſu coloſſa gal 1 • epheſ 1 grace vnto peace god oure fatherphil 1 • te • ſ 1 geue thankes vnto god father oure lorde ieſus chriſte prayeng alwaye hearynge fayth chriſte ieſu loue ye haue towardes ſayntes becauſe hope layde vp heauens whych ye haue herde ye worde truthe goſpell come vnto alſo ye whole world marci 4 bryngeth frute groweth doth alſo amonge ſence daye yt ye haue herde knowen grace god truth ye haue learned col • 4 b epaphras oure mooſt beloued fellow ſeruaūt whych miniſter chriſt ieſu alſo hath ſhewed vnto v youre loue ſprete ✚ ephe 1 c phil 1 b 2 teſſ 1 b therfore alſo ſence day herde ceaſſe prayenge axyng ye may fylled wyth knowlege 2 teſſ 4 hys wyll ſpirituall wyſedome vnderſtandyng ye may philip 1 walke worthely pleaſynge god al thynges ioh 15 • bryngynge forth frute euery good worke growynge knowlege god beyng ſtrengthed power accordynge ye myght hys loue pacience longſufferynge geuynge thankes vnto god father wyth ioye whyche hath made v worthy parte enheritaunce ſayntes lyghte ⊢whych hath drawen v power darkeneſſe hath tranſlated v kyngdome hys beloued ſōne epheſ 1 • whō haue redempcion remiſſion ſynnes 2 cor 4 • heb 1 awhich ye ymage 1 tim 9 c inuiſible god ye fyrſtborne euery creature pſal 32 heb 1 afor hym thynges made heauen earth viſible thynges inuiſible whether trones dominion rule power thynges created hym hym thynges abyde hym epheſ 1 c 4 b ye heade ye body namely cōgregacion apoc 1 whych begynnynge 1 co 15 cthe fyrſt begotten frō deade yt hauinge primacy al thinges hath pleaſed coll 2 b fulneſſe godheade dwell hym rom 3 c 1 cor 5 cto reconcyle thynges vnto hymſelfe ſettynge one bloude croſſe thynges ether earth heauē rom 5 epheſ 2 coll 2 b whan ye ſomtyme made ſtraunge enemyes wytte beynge geuen euell workes hath reconciled body hys fleſhe death myght make holy vnſpotted epheſ 5 c vnblameable hys ſyght yf ye abyde mat 16 c 1 cor 3 b grounded ſtedfaſt fayth vnmoueable hope goſpell whyche ye haue herde preached pſal 18 among euery creature vnder heauē whoſe miniſter paul become whych 2 cor 1 reioyce ſufferynges ephe 3 b phili 2 2 tim 2 fulfyll thynges wantynge paſſions chriſte fleſh bodyes ſake whych congregaciō 1 cor 4 awhoſe miniſter become accordynge diſpenſacion god whych geuen amōge fulfyll worde god epheſ 3 b myſtery hyd euerlaſtynge vnto generacions math 11 • ioh 6 c 2 cor 2 c eph •• 1 b made manifeſt vnto ſayntes vnto whome god wolde make knowen ryches glory thys ſecrete amonge heythen whyche thynge chriſte amonge hope glorye whome ſhewe rebukynge euery man teachynge euery man wyſedome may make euery mā perfecte chriſt ieſus wherein alſo laboure ſtryuyng accordynge hys workynge whyche worketh power ii chapter wold haue knowe carefulneſſe haue laodicia ſo euer haue ſene face ye fleſh theyr harte may comforted beynge inſtructe loue al ye ryches fulneſſe vnderſtandynge ioh 17 vnto knowlege myſtery god father chriſte ieſu 1 cor 1 whome hyd al treaſures wyſedome knowlege epheſ 5 thys ſaye noman deceaue ye heyght wordes 1 cori 5 afor though abſent body yet preſente wyth ſprete reioycynge ſeynge order ſtedfaſtneſſe fayth whyche chriſt ieſu gal 3 • ye haue therfore receaued ye lord ieſus chriſt walk hym beynge bothe rooted buylded hym beyng ſtablyſhed fayth ye haue alſo learned ſo ye plenteous geuynge thankes ✚ rom 16 b take hede leſt ony mā deceaue philoſophy vayne deceate accordynge tradicion men accordynge ordinaūces worlde chriſte 1 cori 5 c hym dwelleth ioh 1 b fulneſſe godheade bodely ye fylled hym whych heade al rule power whome alſo ye circumciſed rom • c philip • • wyth circumciſion made wyth handes robbynge ye body fleſh ye circūciſion chriſt rom 6 beynge buryed wyth baptyme whych ye ryſen alſo fayth god workynge whyche rayſed hym deade rom 5 ephe 2 col 1 b alſo whā ye deade ſynnes foreſkynne fleſhe hath quyckened wyth hym forgeuynge ſynnes ⊢ puttynge handewryttynge yt agaynſt v ye decre ye whyche contrary vnto v ſame alſo hath taken ye way faſtynge vpon croſſe gene 3 • luc • 11 c ioh 12 ſpoylynge rule power hath broughte forth boldely triumphynge thē hymſelfe let noman therfore iudge leuit 11 rom 14 meate drynke parte leui 23 holydaye ye new moone ſabbats heb 8 9 b 10 ſhadow thynges come body chriſtes mat 14 let nomā miſcarye wyllynge humblyneſſe math 22 c deuociō angel ye thynges hath ſene walkynge vayne beynge pufte vp ye meanynge hys fleſh holdyng heade whome whole body beynge noryſhed faſtened together knottes ioyntes dothe growe greatneſſe god gala 4 • yf ye therfore deade wyth chriſte ordinaūces worlde ye yet vſe decree lyuynge worlde touche ye nother tayſt ye nother handle ye whyche thynges hurte wyth vſe commaundementes doctrine men 1 tim 4 b whyche dede haue ſhyne wyſedome ſuperſticion humblyneſſe ſparing body countyng worthy ony honoure vnto ſufficiency fleſh iii chapter ✚ yf ye therfore ryſen wt chriſte ſeke thynges yt aboue chriſt ſyttynge epheſ • 1 • heb 1 10 b 12 ryghthande set youre myndes thoſe thynges aboue thoſe yt vpon earth ye deade 1 petri 1 aand lyfe hyd wyth chriſte god phili 3 c ioha 3 c whan chriſte youre lyfe ſhall appeare ſhall ye alſo appeare glory hym ⊢ 1 corin 6 b ephe 5 mortify therfore membres vpon earth fornicaciō deute 27 c vnclēneſſe vnnaturall luſt euel concupiſcence couetouſneſſe whych worſhippe idol gene 6 • 1 cor 10 • whych thinges wrath god doth come vpō chyldrē vnbelefe ephe 2 ye thynges ye walked ſomtyme whan ye dyd lyue rom 6 epheſ 4 c laye ye awaye thynges wrathe indignacion maliciouſneſſe blaſphemy fylthy cōmunicaciō mouth lye one another rom 1 • b robbynge yourſelues olde man wt hys dedes puttynge ye new mā renewed knowlege accordyng hys lykeneſſe hath ſhapē hym gala 6 b ther man womā heythē iewe circūciſiō foreſkynne barbarus scitian bond fre chriſte al ✚ ephe 4 put ye therfore electe god holy welbeloued entyer mercy kyndneſſe lowlynes ſoftneſſe pacience forbearynge eche forgeuynge amonge ſelues yf ony haue complaynte agaynſt another lorde hath forgeuen ſo ye alſo aboue theſe thynges haue math 22 b loue whych ye bande perfectiō ye peace chriſt reioyce harte vnto whyche alſo ye called one body thankefull let worde chriſt dwell plenteouſly al wyſedom epeſ 5 • teachynge exhortynge yourſelues pſalmes ſonges prayſe ſpirituall ſonges ſyngynge graciouſly vnto lorde harte 1 cor 10 dall ſoeuer ye worde dede thynges name lorde ieſus chriſt epheſ 5 c • petri 3 geuyng thankes vnto god father hym ⊢ ye wyues obedient vnto youre huſbandes due lorde ye huſbandes loue youre wyues bytter towarde epheſ 6 ye chyldren obeye youre father mother al thynges pleaſynge vnto lorde ye father prouoke chyldrē vnto anger waxe feble mynded epheſ 6 titum 2 b • pe • ri 2 c ye ſeruauntes obey bodyly mayſters thynges ſeruynge eye pleaſynge men fearynge lorde ſyngleneſſe harte ſoeuer ye hartelye vnto lorde men knowynge ye ſhall receaue lorde rewarde enheritaunce serue lorde chriſt rom • afor ſo doth wronge ſhall receaue hath done wrōge act 10 rom 2 b▪ ther reſpecte perſons wyth god iiii chapter ye epheſ 6 • teſſa • • mayſters geue vnto youre ſeruauntes iuſte equall beynge ſure ye alſo haue mayſter heauen continue prayer watchynge therin vnto thankeſgeuynge prayenge v alſo god open vnto v dore worde ſpeake myſtery chriſte whyche thynge alſo ame bounde vtter euen behoueth ſpeake eccli 27 b epheſ 5 b walke wyſely towarde wythoute redemynge tyme let youre ſpeche alwaye fauoure ſeaſoned wyth math 5 b marc 9 • ſalte ye maye know howe ye oughte anſwere euery man tychicus mooſte deare brother faythfull miniſter fellowſeruaunte lorde ſhall certifye thynges aboute whome ſente therfore vnto maye knowe thinges aboute maye comforte youre harte wyth ph ••• 1▪ b oneſimus oure mooſt beloued faythfull brother one whych ſhall certifye al thynges yt done act 27 aariſtarchus fellowpreſoner ſaluteth 2 tim 4 b marke barnabaſſes ſyſter ſōne whome ye haue receaued commaundementes yf come vnto receaue hym ieſus whych called iuſtus circumciſion theſe helper kyngdome god
