ieſus chriſt god father knowynge brother beloued god eleccion 1 cor 2 4 cfor goſpell vnto worde alſo power holy gooſt much fulneſſe 1 teſſ 2 aa ye knowe maner men haue ben amonge youre ſakes ye become follower lordes receauynge worde muche trouble wyth ioye holy gooſte inſomuche ye become enſample vnto beleuynge macedonia achaia worde lorde noyſed macedonia achaia fayth alſo whyche godwarde gone euery place ſo nedefull v ſpeake ought themſelues ſhewe v intraūce haue vnto ye turned vnto god ymages ſerue lyuynge true god wayte hys ſōne act 1 b ye heauens whō rayſed deade euen ieſus whyche hath drawen v oute ioh 3 • wrath come ii chapter ye brother alſo knowe intraunce vnto vayne hauing ſuffred many thynges afore actu 16 c ſhamefully intreated ye knowe philippos boldened oure god act 17 ſpeake vnto goſpell god great carefulneſſe exhortacion erroure vnclenneſſe deceate alowed god goſpell ſhulde commytted vnto v euen ſo ſpeake gal 1 b pleaſynge men god whyche tryeth oure harte neuer wente aboute wyth flatteryng wordes ye knowe wyth occaſion couetouſneſſe philip 1 b god recorde ſekyng prayſe men nother whan myghte haue bene chargeable vnto apoſtles chriſte become tender myddes yf norſe cheryſed hyr chyldren ſo lykewyſe deſyrynge hartely wolde delyuer goſpell god alſo lyues ye become mooſt beloued vnto vs✚for ye brother myndeful laboure weeryneſſe act 20 e 2 cor 4 b 2 teſſ 5 workynge nyght daye leſte ſhulde chargeable vnto ony man preached amonge goſpell god ye wytneſſes god holyly iuſtly wythout blame haue ben haue beleued ye know beſekynge euery one father hys chyldren comfortynge haue wytneſſed vnto 1 teſſ 4 • ye wold walke worthely vnto god whych hath called hys kyngdome glory therfore alſo geue thankes vnto god wythoute ceaſſynge becauſe whan ye receaued v ye worde preachynge god ye receaued worde men truely worde god whych worketh haue beleued ⊢ ye brother become follower heb 10 congregacions god iewry chriſt ieſu ye alſo haue ſuffred ſame thynges companion alſo iewes whyche haue kylled lorde ieſus prophetes haue perſued v pleaſe god contrary al mē act 17 b forbyddynge v ſpeake vnto heythen may ſaued maye alwaye fulfyll theyr ſynnes ye wrath god come vpō thē vntyll ye ende brother beynge wythdrawē frō ſpace houre frō ſyghte ye harte haiſted ſpedely ſe face wt great deſyre wold agayn haue come vnto verely paul dan 10 b ſatanas dyd let v whych hope 2 cor 2 b philip 2 bioye crowne glory ye orde ieſus chriſt hys cōmynge ye prayſe ioye iii chapter wherfore forbearing pleaſed v remayne alone act 17 c athens ſente timothe brother miniſter god goſpell chriſte ſtablyſh exhorte youre faythe epheſ 3 b noman moued theſe tribulacyons ioh 15 b 2 tim 3 b ye youreſelues knowe ordyned therto whā wyth ſhewed vnto ſhulde ſuffre tribulacions come paſſe alſo ye know wherfore alſo forbearynge ony longer haue ſente knowe youre fayth leſte happely tempteth haue tempted laboure become inuayne timotheus doth come vnto v ſheweth vnto v fayth charite ye haue alway good remembraunce v deſyrynge ſe v alſo therfor brethrē comforted oure nede tribulacion thorow youre fayth nowe lyue yf ye ſtande lorde thankeſgeuynge rendre vnto god ioye wyth reioyce god youre ſakes prayenge exceadynglye nyght daye maye ſe youre face fulfyll thynges wantyng vnto fayth god hymſelfe father lorde ieſus chriſt gyde iourney vnto lord increace make loue ouerflowe amonge ſelues towarde men alſo towarde ſtablyſh youre harte wythout blame holyneſſe god oure father vnto commynge oure lord ieſus chriſt wyth hys ſayntes amen iiii chapter ✚ farthermore therfore brother pray beſeke lorde ieſus ye haue receaued v ye ought philip 1 walke pleaſe god ye ſo walke ye maye plentyfullyer ye knowe cōmaundementes haue geuē lord ieſus thys rom 12 epheſ 5 b wyll god namely hallowynge ye abſtayne yourſelues frō fornicaciō yt tob 6 1 cor 7 euery one knowe howe poſſeſſe veſſell holyneſſe honoure ye luſt cōcupiſcēce rom 1 ca heythen alſo whych knowe god noman paſſe hys bondes nother begyle hys brother bargenynge lorde auenger theſe thynges haue ſayde vnto haue wytneſſed god hath called v vnto vnclenneſſe vnto hallowynge wherfore luce 10 b▪ deſpyſeth ony mās ✚ wyll haue ignoraūt brother ſlepynge yt ye ſorowful alſo sap • • ▪ whych haue hope yf beleue ieſus dyed roſe agayne ſo ſhall god brynge alſo wyth hym whych haue ſlepte thorow ieſus thys wyth commaundemente wyth voyce archangell wyth ye trompe god deade chriſte ſhall ryſe fyrſte lyue whyche lefte ouer ſhalbe caught vp together wyth ye ayre mete chriſt ayre ſo ſhal euer wyth lorde ſaye peace ſafety iere 1 • b ſhall ſoden deſtruccion come vpon euen payne greate wyth chylde ſhall eſcape ye brother darkeneſſe daye ſhulde ouertake thefe ✚ ye chyldren lyght chylderen daye nyght ye alſo ⊢ beſeke brother galat 6 2 tim 5 bthat ye knowe laboure amonge haue ouerſyghte lord exhorte ye loue becauſe theyr laboure haue peace wyth beſeke brother rebuke reſtleſſe comforte feble mynded cōuenient becauſe fayth increaſeth loue euery one plenteous towarde eche inſomuche ſelues alſo reioyce cōgregacions god pacience fayth perſecucions trouble whych ye ſuffre enſample ye iuſt iudgemēt ieſus heauen wyth angel hys power 2 pet 3 ye flame fyre geuynge vengeaūce vnto whyche haue knowen god rom • 2 obeye goſpell lorde ieſus chriſte sapi 5 ſhall ſuffre euerlaſtynge puniſhmente death eſay • bfrom ye face ye lord glory power whā ſhal come glorifyed hys ſaintes made wonderfull al thē yt haue beleued becauſe yt wytneſſe vpō beleued yt daye whyche thynge alſo coll 1 • praye alwaye yt god wyll wyte ſafe hys callynge yt fulfyll wyl hys goodneſſe worke fayth power▪ name lorde ieſus chriſt prayſed amonge ſame accordynge grace oure god lord ieſus chriſt ii chapter beſeke brother commynge oure lorde ieſus chriſte oure congregacion theſame ye quyckely moued youre meanynge afrayed nother ſprete worde nother epiſtle ſent v 2 petri • thoughe daye lorde hande let noman deceaue ony meanes lorde commeth excepte dan 9 • 1 tim 4 departynge come fyrſte ſynfull man diſcloſed chylde perdicion whyche luc 11 c wythſtandeth exalted aboue god worſhipped inſomuch ſyt 1 c • r 3 b 6 c temple god dan 11 • ſhewynge hym though god ye remembre ye whā yet wt tolde theſe thynges ye knowe doth wytholde may diſcloſed hys tyme • ioh 2 c myſterye iniquite doth worke already holdeth let hym holde vntyll taken awaye ſhall yt wycked diſcloſed iob 15 eſa • 1 dan 8 whome lord ieſus ſhall ſlaye wyth breth hys mouth ſhall deſtroye wyth appearaunce hys commynge hym whoſe commynge ioh 8 workyng satanas deut 13 mat 24 b al power token lyenge wonder deceatfulneſſe wyckedneſſe vnto peryſh becauſe haue receaued ye loue truth yt maye ſaued • acha 5 rom 1 therfore ſhall god ſende workynge erroure maye beleue lye al may iudged haue beleued truth oſe • 7 haue agreed vnto wickedneſſe ought geue god thākes alwaye brother beloued god god hath choſen fyrſt frutes vnto ſaluacion ye ſanctificacion brother walkyng inordinatly accordyng ordinaūce whych haue receaued v 1 cor 4 • ye yourſelues knowe howe ye ought followe v reſtleſſe amōge nother dyd eate breade ony man nought act 18 20 e 2 cor 11 1 teſſ 2 labouryng nyght day weeryneſſe leſt ſhulde charge ony mā though power yt ſhulde geue oure ſelues enſāples vnto followe v whan wt alſo warned ſo wyl worke let eat nother herde ſome walkyng amonge inordinatly workynge nothyng vſyng curioſite 1 teſſ 4 bbut thē yt ſuch cōmaūde beſeke lord ieſu yt labourynge eate theyr owne bread brother gal 6 • ioh 1 b ye faynte doynge well yf ther ony whyche ſome errynge turned vnto vayne ianglinge wyllinge teacher law vnderſtandynge nother thynges ſpokē wherof affirme ✚ rom 7 b knowe gal 5 c lawe good yf ony man vſe ſame lawfully knowynge thys lawe ordyned ryghteous vnto vnryghteous diſobedient vngodly ſynners ſynfull vncleane ſlayers father mother māſlayers whoremōgers rom 1 • miſuſynge themſelues wyth mankynde menſtealers lyars ſwearers ſoeuer thynge el doth wythſtande wholſome doctrine whych accordynge ye goſpell glory bleſſed god whyche commytted vnto thanke hym hath comforted chriſt ieſu oure lord becauſe hath counted faythfull ſayenge true al meanes worthy accepted math 9 b ioh 3 c chriſte ieſu dydde come thys world ſaue ſynners wherof chefe haue optayned mercy therfore namely chriſte ieſus ſhulde ſhewe pacience informaciō ſhall beleue hym vnto lyfe euerlaſtynge vnto euerlaſtynge kynge immortall coll 1 b inuiſible onely god honoure glorye euer euer amen ⊢ commaundemente commytte vnto ſonne timothe accordynge prophecyes tymes paſt thou fyghte good fyght hauynge fayth good conſcience whych ſome puttyng awaye haue ſuffred ſhipwrake concernynge fayth whyche • tim 2 bhymeneus 2 tim 4▪ b alexander 1 cor 5 whych haue delyuered vnto satanas yt learne blaſpheme ii chapter ✚ deſyre therfore inſtaūtly al thynges earneſt deſires praiers requeſtes thankeſgeuynges made men iere 29 b baruc 1 c kynges ordyned hygh degre yt may lyue quyete peaceable lyfe al godlyneſſe chaſtite yt good acceptable ye ſyght oure saueour god whych wyl haue mē become ſafe come vnto ye knowlege truth ioh 17 ther one god gal 3 c hebre 9 c one mediator god men namely man chriſt ieſus whych hath geuen hymſelfe redempcion men whoſe wytneſſe cōfirmed hys tymes wherein rom 1 ame ordyned preacher apoſtle tell truth • tim▪ 1 b lye teacher heythē fayth truth ⊢i wyll men therfore praye ioh 7 c euery place pſa 13 • • lyftynge vp eſa 1 b pure handes wythoute wrath diſputynge tit 2 1 petri • lykewyſe alſo wemen arayenge thēſelues comly apparel wyth ſhame faſtneſſe ſoberneſſe brayded heeres gold pearles precious cloth ye becōmeth wemē promyſynge godlyneſſe thorowe good workes 1 cor 14 clet wemē learne ſilēce wt ſubiection permytte woman teache gene • c epheſi 5 • vſe authorite ouer ye man ſtyll adam made fyrſt ye eua adā begyled ye womā begyled ye trāſgreſſion ſhe ſhalbe ſaued engendrynge chyldrē yf ſhe remayne fayth loue ſanctificacion wyth ſobreneſſe iii chapter thys faythful worde yf ony man deſyreth byſhopryke deſyreth good worke biſhop muſt vnrebukeable leuit 21 b eze 44 tit 1 b ye huſbande one wyfe ſobre wyſe manerlye chaſte harberous 2 tim 2 c teacher drō karde fyghter ſtyll ſtryuer couetous ruler hys houſe well hauynge chyldren obediente wyth chaſtite yf ony rule hys owne houſe howe ſhall diligente congregacion god newe ſcolar leſte beynge heaued vp pryde fall iudgement deuell muſte alſo haue good reporte wythout fall rebuke deuels ſnare act 6 miniſters muſte lykewyſe chaſte dubble tunged geuen muche wyne followynge fylthy lucre hauynge myſtery fayth pure conſcience let theſe alſo proued fyrſt let thē ſo miniſtre hauynge blame wemē lykewyſe chaſte backbytynge ſobre faythfull thynges let miniſters huſbādes one wyfe whych gouerne theyr chyldren wel theyr houſes mat 13 b 25 b c ſhall miniſtre well ſhall get themſelues good degre much boldeneſſe ye fayth whych chriſte ieſu theſe thynges wryte vnto ſonne timothe hopynge come vnto ſhortely yf ſhall tary longe thou mayeſt knowe thou muſt cōuerſaūt houſe god whych ye congregacion lyuynge god ſtaye math 16 c ſtablyſhmente truthe wythout naye greate myſtery godlyneſſe ioh 1 b whych ſhewed fleſhe iuſtifyed ye ſprete luce 2 b ephe 3 b dyd appeare vnto angel preached vnto gentyls beleued worlde philip 2 ai taken vp glory iiii chapter bvt ſprete ſayeth euidentlye • ▪ tim 3 2 petri 3 iude 1 c laſte dayes ſhall ſome 2 teſ 2 b departe fayth geuynge hede vnto ſpretes errour doctrine ye deuels ſpeakyng lye hypocriſy hauyng theyr cōſciēce marked wyth whote yrō forbyddynge mary abſtayne meates whych god hath created gen 1 taken beleuynge wyth mat 26 act 27 thā keſgeuynge thē haue knowen truth becauſe gene 1 eccli 39 f act 10 b euery creature god good nothynge refuſed receaued wt thankeſgeuynge hallowed thorowe worde god prayer puttynge forth thys vnto brother thou ſhalte good miniſter chriſte ieſus 2 tim 3 • beynge noryſhed wyth wordes fayth good doctrine whych thou haſte attained vnto 1 tim 1 2 tim 2 eſchue vncomly olde wyuyſh fable exercyſe thy ſelfe vnto godlyneſſe coll 2 c bodely exercyſe profitable vnto lytle godlyneſſe profytable thynges hauynge promyſe leuit 18 • ye lyfe come thys faythfull ſayenge worworthy receauynge therfore laboure curſed becauſe hope lyuynge god whych saueoure men ſpecially beleuynge cō maunde teache theſe thynges titum 2 blet nomā deſpyſe thy youth titu 2 • 1 pet 5 • enſample beleuynge worde conuerſacion loue fayth chaſtite geue hede vnto readynge exhortacion doctrine vntyl come deſpyſe grace whyche geuē vnto act 6 • 8 2 tim 1 •• prophecy layeng handes ye elder thinke vpon theſe thynges diligente theſe thynges thy profyte maye manifeſt vnto mē take hede vnto thyſelfe vnto teachynge diligent doyng thys thou ſhalte ſaue thyſelfe heare v chapter rebuke elder praye fatherleuit 19 g yonger men brother elder wemen mother yonger wemen ſyſters chaſtite honour wedowes wedowes truly yf ony wedowe hath chyldren chyldes chyldren let learne fyrſte rule theyr houſe eccli • b recompence vnto theyr parentes acceptable god luce 2 f • cori 7 ſhe truely wedowe forſaken let hope god continue prayer ſupplicacion nyght day ſhe hath pleaſures lyuynge ſhe deade commaunde thys namely vnblameable gal 6 bbut yf ony hath care ſpecially hys houſeholde theſame hath denyed fayth • petri 2 worſe thā infidele let wedowe choſē leſſe thre ſcore yeare whych hath ben wyfe one huſbande hauynge good reporte good workes yf ſhe hath brought vp chyldren • petr 4 b yf ſhe hath receaued lodgynge yf ſhe hath waſhen ſayntes fete yf ſhe hath miniſtred vnto ſuffre tribulacion yf ſhe hath followed vpon euery good worke eſchue yonger wedowes whā waxen wanton chriſte wyll mary hauynge damnaciō becauſe haue caſt away ye fyrſt fayth titu 2 beynge alſo ydle learne go aboute houſe houſe beynge ydle alſo full wordes buſy bodyes ſpeakynge thynges nede 1 cor 7 wyll yonger woman mary brynge forth chyldren houſe wyues geue occaſion vnto aduerſary ſpeake euell ſome turned backe already satan yf ony faythfull hath wedowes let hym miniſtre vnto ye congregacion charged yt whych true wedowes may haue ynough elder rule well let counted worthy dubble honoure ſpecially yt laboure worke doctrine ſcripture ſayeth deut 25 1 cori 9 b thou ſhalt moſell mouthe vnto oxe treadynge ye corne mat 10 labourer worthy hys wage deut 19 • receaue accuſaciō agaynſt elder ſaue vnder two thre wytneſſes ſynne rebuke preſence reſt alſo afrayed teſtifye god chriſt ieſu hys choſen angel thou kepe theſe thynges wtout fore iudgement doynge nothynge leanynge ye one party 1 tim 2 b laye handes haiſtely vppon ony man nother partener men ſynnes kepe thyſelfe chaiſt eccli 31 drynke nomore water vſe lytle wyne becauſe thy ſtomake thyne oftē ſyckneſſes men ſynnes gal 5 • manifeſt goynge afore iudgement ſynnes ſome followe alſo lykewyſe alſo good dedes manyfeſt otherwiſe hydde vi chapter whatſoeuer 1 cor 7 c epheſ 6 1 petri 2 c ſeruaūtes vnder yocke let eſtyme theyr mayſters worthy al honoure left name doctrine lord euel ſpokē haue faythfull mayſters let deſpyſe becauſe brethrē ſerue rather becauſe faythfull beloued partaker benefytes teach exhorte theſe thynges gal 1 byf ony man teacheth otherwyſe agreeth vnto wholſome wordes lorde ieſus chriſte vnto doctrine whych accordyng godlyneſſe proud knowyng nothyng ſoūde aboute queſtions ſtryfes wordes 1 tim 1 tit 3 b ye ſprynge enuyes contencions blaſphemyes euel ſurmyſynges diſputynges men corrupt mynded • teſſ 2 b robbed truth ſuppoſyng godlyneſſe lucre truely godlyneſſe pro 15 b hebr 1 • c wyth ſufficience greate vaūtage iob 1 c brought nothyng thys worlde doute cary nothynge awaye eccli 29 hauynge foode wherwyth may clothed let v cōtent thē pro 23 mat 13 cfor wyll become ryche fal temptacion ſnare deuell many vnprofytable hurtefull luſtes ye whych drowne man vnto death perdicion roote euel couetouſneſſe whych ſome luſtynge haue erred truth haue tangled themſelues many grefes 1 teſſ 2▪ cbut thou man god flye theſe thynges follow ryghteouſnes godlynes faith loue paciēce mekenes fyght good fyght fayth laye holde vpō eternal lyfe vnto yu arte called haſt knowleged good knowlege many wytneſſes commaūde god whych 1 reg 2 b act 17 • quyckeneth thynges chriſt ieſu wytneſſed good wytneſſe pōtius pilate hat thou kepe commaundement without ſpot vnblameable vntyll commynge lorde ieſus chriſt whome ſhall ſhewe hys ſeaſons bleſſed myghty apoca 17 • 19 c kynge kynges lorde lordes whych hath immortalite dwelleth lyght approcheable ioh 1 b 1 ioh 4 b whome noman dyd euer ſe nother ſe vnto whome honoure empyre euerlaſtynge amen vnto rych world cōmaunde mynde hyghly nother truſt vncertaynte ye ryches well lyuyng god whych geueth v thynges plētyfully enioye become rich good workes geue good wyll diſtribute mat 6 c gather themſelues treaſure good fundament tyme come may laye holde vpon ye true lyfe timothe kepe ye whych cōmytted vnto eſchuynge vngooſtlye newneſſes wordes oppoſicions falſe name knowlege ye whyche ſome promyſed fallen awaye cō cernynge fayth grace wyth amen ¶the ende fyrſte epiſtle apoſtle paule timothe ſeconde epiſtle paule apoſtle timothe fyrſt chapter paule apoſtle ieſus chriſt wyll god accordyng promiſe lyfe whych chriſt ieſu vnto timothe mooſt deare ſōne 1 cori 1 gal 1 grace mercy peace god father chriſte ieſu oure lorde thanke god act 22 philip 3 ſerue fro elder rom 1 pure conſcience wythout ceaſſynge make mē cion prayer deſyrynge nyght daye ſe beynge aduyſed thy teares maye fylled wyth ioye callynge mynde fayth whych vnfayned whych dwelte fyrſt lois thy graundmother eunice thy mother aſſured alſo whyche cauſe exhorte thou rayſe agayne grace god whych ye layeng handes rom 8 b god hath geuen v ſprete feare power loue ſoberneſſe rom 1 b therfore aſhamed ye wytneſſe lord ephe 3 hys preſoner laboure wyth goſpel accordyng power god whych epheſ 1 titum 3 hath delyuered v called wyth holy callynge accordynge oure workes accordynge hys purpoſe grace geuē v chriſt ieſu euerlaſtynge tymes nowe made manifeſt lyghtenynge ſaueour ieſus chriſt1 cor 15 • heb 2 c truly hath deſtroyed death hath lyghtened lyfe vncorrupcion goſpell rom 1 1 tim 2 vnto ordyned preacher apoſtle teacher heythen whyche cauſe alſo ſuffre theſe thynges aſhamed knowe whō haue beleued ſure able kepe haue cōmytted vnto hym vntyll ye daye 2 tim 3 b haue thou enſample wholſome wordes whyche thou haſte herde fayth loue chriſte ieſu kepe good thyng cōmytted vnto thorow ye holy gooſt whych dwelleth v thys thou knoweſt turned fro whych aſia whoſe ſorte phygelus hermogenes god geue mercy vnto houſe 2 tim 4 c oneſiphorus hath ofte refreſhed aſhamed cheine whā come rome mat 25 c ſought diligētly dyd fynde lord graūt fynd mercy god ye day much hath ſerued epheſus knoweſt thou beſt ii chapter ✚ thou therfore ſtronge ſōne ye grace whych chriſt ieſu thynges thou haſte herde many wytneſſes titū 1 • ye ſame commytte vnto faythfull men whych ſhalbe mete alſo teach laboure good ſouldyour chriſte ieſu noman warrynge vnto god tangleth hymſelfe wyth worldly buſyneſſes yt may pleaſe hym whych hath alowed hym alſo ſtryueth mayſtrye ſhall crowned wythout ſtryue lawfully 1 cor 9 b labourynge huſbandman muſt fyrſt receaue ye frutes marke ſaye god ſhall geue vnderſtandynge al thynges ⊢ remembre lorde ieſus chriſte rom 1 ſede dauid ryſen frō deade accordyng goſpell whyche laboure vnto bandes doynge euel worde god boūde act 20 c epheſ 3 coll 1 c therfore ſuffre thynges choſens ſake alſo optayne ſaluacion whyche chriſte ieſu wyth heauenly glory thys true ſayengerom 6 b yf deade hym ſhal alſo lyue wyth hym rom 8 b yf ſhall haue pacience ſhal alſo raygne wyth luc 12 ayf ſhall denye hym ſhal alſo denye v nu 23 c rom 3 yf beleue abydeth faythfull deny hymſelfe admonyſh theſe thynges teſtifyeng ye lord stryue wt wordes yt profytable nothynge ſaue ye ſubuertynge hearer study ſhew thyſelfe alowable vnto god mat 24 workmā beynge aſhamed treatynge ye worde god aryght • tim 1 4 6 2 tim 2 c vnholy vaine talkynges yu eſchue auail much vnto vngodlines theyr word fretteth cāker ye whych ſorte • tim 1 c hymeneus philetus whyche fallē awaye frō truth ſayeng reſurreccion paſt already haue ouerthrowē ye fayth ſome ſure foundamente god doth ſtāde hauyng thys ſeale ioh 10 b lorde knovveth hys euery one calleth vpon name lorde departeth vvyckedneſſe rom 9 c great houſe veſſels onely golde ſyluer alſo woode earth ſome truely vnto honour ſome vnto diſhonoure yf ony mā therfore ſhal clenſe hymſelfe frō theſe ſhalbe veſſel vnto honour beynge hallowed mete ye lorde ready vnto euery good worke 1 tim 6 cflye ye luſtes youth followe ryghteouſneſſe faythe hope loue peace wyth yt cal vpon ye lorde wt pure harte 1 tim 1 4 6 2 tim 2 b tit • 3 b eſchue foolyſh queſtions wythout doctrine knowynge engender ſtryfes ſeruaunte lorde behoueth ſtryue gentle toward al mē 1 tim 3 apte teach paciente gala 6 wyth ſoftneſſe rebukyng yt wythſtāde truth yf god ony tyme wyll geue repentaunce knowe truth repent ſnares deuell whō holdē captiue vnto wyl iii chapter bvt ſure thys yt 1 tim 4 2 petri 3 iude 1 c ye laſte dayes ſhall perylous dayes hāde mē ſhalbe louyng thēſelues couetous hyghmynded proude curſed ſpeakers obeyeng father mother vnkynde wycked wtout affeccion wtout peace accuſers lecherous vnmercyfull wtout kyndneſſe traytours malepart puft vp louers pleaſures god hauynge truly ſhyne godlyneſſe denyenge power eſchue titum 1 c go thorow houſe houſe leade ye woman ladē wt ſynnes captiue whych led wt ſūdery luſtes euer learnynge neuer attaynynge vnto ye knowlege truth exod 7 b iamnes mambres wythſtode moſes euen ſo alſo reſyſte truthe men beynge corrupte mynde lewde cōcernyng fayth farther ſhal profit theyr foly ſhalbe manyfeſt vnto mē theyrs yu haſt attayned vnto doctrine faſhiō purpoſe ſaith longe ſufferynge loue pacience perſecucions ſufferynges ſuch happened vnto act 13 c 14 2 cor 1 b antioche iconium lyſtris maner perſecucions haue ſuffred thē hath lorde delyuered pſal 33 c eccli 2 aand wyll lyue godly chriſt ieſu ſhal ſuffre perſecuciō wycked men miſcariers ſhall waxe worſe worſe errynge bringynge erroure 2 tim 1 c abyde yu thoſe thynges yt thou haſt learned cōmytted vnto knowynge whome thou haſt learned thou haſt knowen holy ſcriptures fro thy youth whych able inſtructe vnto ſaluacion thorow faith chriſt ieſu 2 petri 1 ſcrypture beynge inſpired frō heauē profitable teach rebuke correcke enfourme ryghteouſneſſe man god perfecte taught vnto euery good worke iiii chapter teſtifye god ieſus chriſte whych ſhal iudge ye quycke deade cōmyng kyngdome preach ye worde earneſt ſeaſō ſeaſō reproue beſeke rebuke wt al paciēce doctrine tyme ſhall come whan ſhall ſuffre wholſome doctrine ſhall heape mayſters vnto accordynge theyr deſyres whoſe eares ſhall ytch truth truely ſhall wende theyr hearynge ſhalbe turned vnto fable watch thou laboure al thynges accōplyſhe worke preacher fulfyll thy ſeruyce ſobre 2 petri 1 cfor offred ye tyme myne vnlowſynge hande haue foghten good fyght ioh 17 haue fulfylled courſe haue kept fayth moreouer ther layed vp 1 cor 9 1 petri 5 crowne righteouſneſſe whyche lorde ryghteous iudge ſhall geue daye vnto alſo thē loue hys cōmynge make hayſt come ſoone vnto coll 4 b philip 1 c demas hath lefte louynge thys worlde gone theſſalonica creſcēs galatia titus dalmatia lucas wt take coll 1 • marke brynge hym wt profytable vnto ye ſeruice tychicus haue ſente epheſus cloke yt haue lefte troas wyth carpus cōmynge brynge wt bokes ſpecially ye parchemē te 1 tim • • alexāder ye copperſmyth hath ſhewed much euell ye lord ſhall reſtore hym accordynge hys workes whome thou alſo eſchue dyd greatly wythſtande wordes fyrſt anſwerynge dyd nomā aſſiſte forſoke praye layed theyr charge lorde ſtode comforted preachynge fulfylled al nacions maye heare delyuered lion mouth lorde ſhall delyuer frō euery euell worke ſhall make ſafe hys heauēly kyngdome vnto whō glory euer euer amen grete act 18 rom 16 priſcilla aquila ye houſe oneſiphorus rom 16 c eraſtus dyd remayne corinthus act 21 trophimus haue lefte ſycke miletus make haiſt come wynter eubulus pudens linus claudia brother ſalute lorde ieſus chriſte thy ſprete grace wyth amen ¶the ende ſecōde epiſtle paule apoſtle timothe epiſtle apoſtle paule titus fyrſt chapter paule ſeruaunt god apoſtle ieſus chriſt accordynge • tim 1 b fayth ye electe god knowlege ye truth accordyng godlineſſe hope euerlaſtyng lyfe whych rom • god ye doth lye hath promyſed ye euerlaſtynge tymes hath ſhewed hys ſeaſons word ye preachynge whych cōmitted vnto accordynge commaundement god saueour vnto 2 cor 8 c titus deare ſōne ye cōmune fayth grace peace frō epeſ 1 philip 1 god father chriſt ieſu saueoure thynges ſake haue lefte ye creta thynges yt lackyng thou ſhuldeſt redreſſe thou ordyne elder thorow cyties alſo haue appointed yf ony wythout blame huſbande one wyfe hauynge faythful chyldrē accuſed ryote ſubiecte 1 tim 3 byſhop muſt blameleſſe mat 24 1 cor 4 ſteward god proude angry dronkarde fyghter leuit 10 c epheſ 5 • deſyrous fylthy lucre harberous gentle wyſe ſobre ryghteous holy tēperate 2 eſ • 4 c enbracynge faythfull worde whych accordynge doctrine maye able admonyſh wholſome doctrine improue alſo gaynſaye act 15 2 cor 11 c ther many diſobediente vayne • angler deceauers ſpecially circumſion whyche ought haue ben rebuked 2 tim 3 whyche ſubuerte whole houſes teachynge thynges oughte becauſe fylthy lucre one theyr owne prophetes ſayde cretians alwaye lyers euell beaſtesepimenides ſlowe bellyes wytneſſe true wherfore rebuke thē ſharpely maye ſounde ye fayth geuynge hede iewyſh fable commaundementes men turnynge fayth math 12 23 c thynges cleane vnto cleane ro 14 c vnto vncleane vnbeleuynge nothynge cleane theyr mynde conſcience defyled confeſſe knowe god wyth dedes denye hym ſeynge abhominable vnbeleuynge vnmete vnto euery good worke ii chapter bvt ſpeake thou ye thynges yt become wholſome learnynge elder mē ſobre chaſt wyſe ſounde fayth loue pacience 1 tim 2 bthe elder wemen lykewyſe yt vſe holy apparell 1 tim 5 b accuſers geuen much wyne teachynge well maye teache wyſedome yonger wemē loue theyr huſbandes loue theyr chyldren wyſe chaſte ſobre carynge theyr houſe gentle gen • ▪ • obediente vnto theyr huſbandes ye worde god euell ſpoken exhorte yonge men lykewyſe ſobre thynges ſhewe thyſelfe 1 tim 4 b • petri 5 enſample good workes learnynge vpryghteneſſe grauite wholſome worde vnreprouable 1 petri 2 b 3 b yt wythſtandeth may aſhamed hauynge euel thyng ſaye v epheſ 6 coll 3 c ſeruaūtes obediente vnto theyr mayſters pleaſynge thynges anſwerynge agayne pyckynge ſhewynge good faythfulneſſe al thinges garnyſh doctryne god oure saueoure thynges ✚ grace god oure saueoure hath appeared vnto men teachynge v denyenge vngodlyneſſe 1 ioh 2 c worldly luſtes maye lyue ſoberly ryghteouſly godly thys world waytyng bleſſed math 25 c hope commynge ye glory great god oure saueoure ieſus chriſte rom 8 gal 3 bwhich gaue hymſelfe v ſhulde redyme v wyckedneſſe act 15 b epheſ 5 • ſhulde clenſe vnto hymſelf acceptable people follower epheſ 2 b good workes speake theſe thinges exhorte ⊢ rebuke wyth earneſt 1 tim 4 b let noman deſpyſe iii chapter admoniſh rom 13 1 pet 2 c obediente vnto prynces power obeye commaundemente ready vnto euery good worke rom 1 • b c ſpeake euell noman ſtryuers ſofte ſhewynge gentlyneſſe towarde men ourſelues alſo ſometyme foolyſhe vnbeleuynge goynge aſtraye ſeruynge dyuerſe deſyres pleaſures lyuynge malyce enuye hatefull hatynge ech other✚ 2 tim 1 b whā kyndneſſe gentlyneſſe oure saueoure god appeared workes ryghteouſneſſe haue done accordynge hys mercy hath rom 8 c ſaued v thorowe ioh 3 • epheſ 6 fountayne newe byrth renewynge ye holy gooſt whō hath poured forth vpō v plē tyfully thorow ieſus chriſt saueoure beynge made ryghteous act 15 b epheſ 2 hys grace may heyres accordynge hope euerlaſtynge lyfe ⊢ faythful worde theſe wolde haue ſtrengthē thē whych beleue god maye ſtudy excel good workes theſe thynges good profytable vnto men 1 tim 1 6 2 tim 1 c eſchue foolyſhe queſtions genealogy contention ſtryfes wordes vnprofitable vayne math 18 b • teſſ 3 rom 16 beſchue man geuē ſectes fyrſt ſeconde admonicion knowyng ſuch one peruerted ſynneth ſeyng condemned hys owne iudgemente whan ſhall haue ſent artemas vnto ye tychicus make haiſt come vnto nicopolis haue purpoſed wynter sende zenas lawer act 1 • c 1 cor 1 b • 16 b apollo diligently afore nothynge wantynge vnto let learne excell good workes vnto neceſſarye vſes fruteleſſe ſalute salute loue v fayth grace god wyth amen ¶the ende epiſtle paule apoſtle titus epiſtle paule apoſtle philemon fyrſt chapter paule preſoner chriſte ieſu brother timothe vnto philemon beloued oure helper vnto apphia mooſt beloued ſyſter col 4 b archippus oure fellowſouldyour vnto cōgregacion thy houſe 1 cor 1 2 cor 1 gal 1 • grace vnto peace frō god father lord ieſus chriſte thanke god makynge alwaye remembraunce ye prayer hearynge thy loue fayth thou haſt lorde ieſus vnto al ſaintes fellowſhip thy fayth euident knowlege euery good worke chriſt ieſu great ioye conſolaciō thy loue becauſe entrayles ſayntes brother dyd reſte thorow whyche cauſe beynge bolde cōmaunde chriſt ieſu thyng maketh matter becauſe loue requyre ſeynge ſuch one namely paule aged alſo ye preſouer ieſu chriſt beſeke coll 4 • oneſimus ſōne haue begotten bandes ſomtyme vnprofytable vnto profytable vnto vnto ye haue ſent agayne vnto receaue thou hym myn entrayles wold haue kept wyth myght haue miniſtred vnto bandes goſpell ſteade wold nothynge wythout thy counſell good thou doeſt cōpulſion wyth good wyll happely therfore went frō ſeaſon thou myghteſt receaue hym foreuer nowe ſeruaunt ſteade ſeruaunte faythfull brother ſpecially vnto much vnto fleſh ye lord yf thou holdeſt therfore cō paniō receaue yf hath hurte oweth ought vnto laye charge paule haue wrytten wyth myne owne hande wyll reſtore ſo ſaye vnto yt thou doeſt owe thyſelfe alſo vnto thus brother ſhall enioye lorde refreſh yu myne entrayles chriſt haue wrytten vnto truſtynge thyne obedience knowynge thou wilt aboue ſay make redy alſo lodgyng truſte reſtored vnto thorowe youre prayer coll 1 • 4 b epaphras fellowpreſoner ſaluteth chriſt ieſu marke ariſtarchus demas luke helper grace oure lorde ieſus chriſt wyth ſprete amen ¶the ende epiſtle apoſtle paule vnto philemon epiſtle paule apoſtle hebrues fyrſt chapter god ſpeakynge tymes paſte diuerſly many wayes vnto father prophetes laſt hath ſpokē theſe dayes vnto v hys ſōne math • 8 c whome hath made heyre al thynges alſo hath made world whych ſeynge sap 7 2 cor 4 coll 1 bryghtneſſe glory fygure hys ſubſtaunce bearynge vp al thynges worde hys power epheſ 1 • makynge clenſynge ſynnes ſytteth ryghthāde maieſte ye heyght beynge become ſo much better thā angel math 1 c luce 2 philip 2 • hath optayned heretage excellente name thā vnto whome ye angel ſaid ony time pſal 2 act 13 thou arte ſonne thys daye haue begotten agayne 2 reg 7 c ſhalbe father vnto hym ſhalbe ſonne vnto whan bryngeth fyrſt begottē ſonne agayne cōpaſſe ye worlde ſayeth pſal 96 let angel god worſhippe hym vnto ye angel truly ſayeth pſal 103 whych maketh hys angel ſpretes hys miniſters flame fyre vnto ſōne pſal 44 b thy ſeat god euer euer rodde thy kyngdome rod ryghteouſnes thou haſt loued ryghteouſneſſe haſt hated wyckednes therfore hath god euen thy god anoynted wt oyle gladneſſe aboue thy companion pſal 10 • thou lord dyddeſt create earth begynnynge heauens workes thy handes pſal 101 eſai 51 b 2 petri 3 b ſhall peryſh thou ſhalt endure ſhall waxe olde garmente cloth ſhalte thou chaunge ſhalbe chaunged thou arte euen ſame thy yeares ſhall fayle ⊢ vnto whome angel ſayd ony tyme pſal 109 syt thou ryghthande vntyll lay thyne enemyes foote ſtoole thy fete miniſtrynge ſpretes ſente miniſtracion becauſe thē receaue heretage ſaluacion ii chapter oughte therfore earneſtly marke ye thinges haue herde leſt happely flowe thorow yf worde gen 18 c 19 c ſpoken angel became ſure euery tranſgreſſion diſobediēce dyd receaue due recompence rewarde howe ſhall eſcape yf ſhall deſpyſe ſo greate ſaluacion marc 1 b began fyrſte preached lord thē herde marci 16 c confyrmed vppon v god bearynge wytneſſe act 15 b wt token wonder dyuerſe miracle gyftes ye holy gooſt accordynge hys owne wyll god hath ſubdued worde come whereof ſpeake vnto angel one teſtifyeth place ſayenge pſal 8 man thou arte myndeful hym ſōne man becauſe yu doeſt viſite hym thou haſte made hym lytle leſſe angel thou haſt crowned hym wyth honoure glory haſt ſet hym aboue workes thy hā de thynges haſt thou put ſubieccion vnder hys fete 1 cor 15 c hath put thynges vnder hym hath lefte nothynge yt put vnder hym neuertheleſſe yet ſe thynges put vnder made lytle leſſe thā angel namely ieſus ſe pilip 2 crowned wyth glorye honoure reaſon ſufferynge death grace god 1 cor 15 f ſhuld taiſte death men became hym whoſe ſake thynges whome thynges whych brought many chyldrē vnto glory author theyr ſaluacion made perfecte thorow ſufferynge ſanctifyeth ſanctifyed one whyche cauſe aſhamed call brother ſayenge pſal 21 c ſhal ſhewe thy name vnto brother myddes cōgregacion wyl prayſe agayne pſal 17 eſai 12 ſhalbe truſtyng hym agayne eſay 8 beholde chyldren whyche god hath geuen becauſe therfore chyldren haue taken parte wyth fleſh bloude pilipi 2 • lykewyſe hath alſo takē parte wyth thē oſee 13 c 1 cor 15 • 2 tim 1 b death myghte deſtroye hym whych rule death deuell myghte delyuer bondage theyr lyfe tyme reaſon ye feare death taketh angel vpon hym ſede abraham taketh vpon hym wherfore oughte •• llip • lyke vnto brethrē thynges myght become mercyful faythful byſhoppe god myght fauourable vnto people ſynnes heb 5 afor thynge wherein ſuffred proued able helpe alſo tempted iii chapter wherfore ye holy brother partaker heauenly callynge conſydre apoſtle byſhop oure acknowlegynge namely ieſus whyche 1 cor 4 faythfull vnto hym hath ordyned hym euen nu 12 moſes alſo hys houſe thys man counted worthy greater glory moſes hath prayſe buyldeth houſe thā houſe ſelfe euery houſe builded ſome body gen 1 abut created thynges god moſes truly faithful al houſe lyke ſeruaunte deut 18 c wytneſſe thoſe thynges ſpokē chriſte lyke chylde hys owne houſe • cor 3 b 6 c whyche houſe yf ſhall kepe ſtedfaſt confidence reioycynge rom 5 hope vnto ende wherfore ſayeth holy gooſt pſal 94 b day yf ye ſhal hear hys voyce harden ye youre harte exod 17 prouokynge anger accordyng daye temptaciō wylderneſſe youre father dyd tēpte proued deut 11 • ſawe workes forty yeare wherfore wroth wyth thys generaciō ſayd theſe euer erre wyth theyr harte dyd knowe wayes vnto whō dyd ſweare myne anger yt ſhall entre reſte take hede brethrē leſt ther euel vnbeleuynge harte ony departe lyuynge god exhorte yourſelues euery daye ſo lōge called hebre 13 b daye none hardened wyth deceatfulneſſe ſynne become partaker chriſte mat 10 c 24 yf leeſt kepe ſure begynnynge hys ſubſtaunce vnto ende vntyl ſayde pſal 94 b daye yf ye ſhal hear hys voyce harden harte prouokynge anger ſome herde dyd prouoke anger wente oute egipte moſes wyth whome angry fortye yeares wyth dyd ſynne whoſe bodyes ouerthrowen deſerte num 14 • vnto whome dyd ſweare entre hys reſte▪ ſaue vnto vnbelyuynge ſe coulde entre hys reſte becauſe vnbelefe iiii chapter let v therfore feare leſte happely promiſe entrynge hys reſte beynge left ony v ſuppoſed wantyng ſhewed vnto v alſo vnto eſay 7 b rom 2 b worde preachynge dyd auayle beynge myxte wyth fayth herde haue beleued ſhall entre hys reſt hath ſayde haue ſworen wrath ſhall entre reſt truly yt ſpake whā ye workes frō creacion ye worlde fynyſhed ſayde certayne place ſeuēth day wyſe gen 2 god reſted ſeuenth daye frō workes place pſal 94 b ſhal entre reſt becauſe followeth ſome entre therin fyrſt ſhewed dyd entre becauſe myſbelefe appoynted agayne certayne daye namely day ſayeng dauid ſo lōge ſeaſō rehearſed aboue pſal 94 b day yf ye ſhal heare voyce harden harte yf ieſus naue geuē reſt ſhulde neuer ſpeake another day afterward therfore reſtynge lefte vnto ye people god yt entred hys reſt ſame hath reſted frō workes gen 2 god alſo frō let v therfor make haiſt entre ye reſt yt nomā fal theſame enſāple vnbelefe ye worde god quycke myghty goynge thorow thā two edged eſa 49 ephe 6 b ſwearde ecclī 12 c reachynge vntyll ye partynge ye ſoule ſprete ioyntes maryes diſcerner thoughtes intentes harte e • cli 15 c ther creature inuiſible hys ſyghte thynges bare open vnto hys eyen vnto whome ſpeake therfore hauynge heb • 6 c 8 9 b great hygh preſt whych hath paſſed thorow heauēs euen ieſus ſōne god let v holde faſt knowlege hope haue hygh preſte yt able haue cōpaſſiō wt weakeneſſes yt tēpted ouer enſāple eſa 5 • b rom 8 • cor 5 c wythout ſynne let v therfore wt boldneſſe go vnto rom • • ſeate grace may optayne mercy fynde grace conueniente helpynge tyme v chapter ✚ euery hygh preſt takē men ordyned mē thoſe thynges yt pertayne vnto god yt leuit 9 b offer vp gyftes ſacrifices ſynnes whych may able haue cō paſſion thē yt ignoraunt waye becauſe yt alſo clothed wt infirmite therfor ought ye people ſo offer ſelfe alſo ye ſynnes nother dothe ony man take honoure vpō called god exod •• num 1 • lyke aaron alſo euen ſo dyd chriſte glorifye hymſelfe ſhulde become hyghe preſte ſpake vnto hym pſal 2 thou arte ſonne thys daye haue begottē like ſayeth alſo another place pſal 109 thou arte preſte foreuer order melchiſedek ⊢ luc 23 c ioh 17 whyche offerynge vp prayer ſupplicaciōs ye dayes fleſhe vnto hym whych able ſaue hym death wyth greate crye teares herde accordyng hys honoure pilip 2 truely whan god ſōne learned obedience thoſe thynges yt ſuffred beyng made perfect became vnto al yt obeye ye cauſe euerlaſtyng ſaluacion called god hygh preſt ye order melchiſedek wherof haue greate matter interpretable ſpeake ye become weake heare 1 cor 3 ye oughte mayſters reaſō ye tyme ye nede agayne taught ye principle ye begynnyng ye wordes god become ſuch haue nede mylke ſtrōge meate euery one yt partaker ye mylke partner ye worde ryghteouſneſſe babe ſtrōge meate belō geth vnto thē yt perfect thoſe yt reaſō ye vſe haue exerciſed wyttes iudgement good euell vi chapter wherfor leauing ye doctrine ye begynnyng chriſt let v procede vnto perfecte thynges layenge agayne ye fūdamēt repētaūce frō deade workes fayth vnto god baptiſynges doctrine laieng alſo hādes reſurrecciō deade euerlaſtynge iudgement thys ſhall act 18 c iacob 4 b yf god ſhall permytte heb 10 c impoſſible haue ben lyghtened haue alſo tayſted heauenly gyft become partaker holy gooſte haue neuertheleſſe • petri 2 tayſted good worde god power worlde come fallē away renewed agayn vnto repentaunce crucifyenge vnto themſelues ſonne god agayn makynge mocke hym earth drynkynge dew doth fal oft vpō bryngynge forth graſſe cōuenient vnto thē whome dreſſed receaueth bleſſynge god bryngyng forth thornes thyſtles euel nexte vnto curſynge whoſe ende vnto burnynge truſt better thynges nearer ſaluacion moſt beloued although ſpeak ſo math 25 dfor god vniuſt yt forget worke loue whych ye haue ſhewed hys name whyche haue miniſtred vnto ye ſayntes miniſtre deſyre euery one ſhewe ſame carefulneſſe fulfyllynge ye hope vntyll ende yt ye become ſlouthfull theyr follower whyche ſhall enherete promyſes fayth pacience god promyſynge vnto abraham becauſe noman greater whome myght ſweare gen 2 • c dyd ſweare hymſelfe ſayenge wythout bleſſynge ſhall bleſſe multyenge ſhall multiplye ſo hauynge pacience longe ſeaſon gat promyſe men ſweare one greater ſelues exod 22 b othe ende confyrme theyr controuerſy whych thynge god wyllynge plentyfullyer ſhew vnto ye heyres promyſes ye ſtableneſſe hys coūſell put oth betwene two vnmouable thynges vnpoſſible god lye maye haue mooſt ſure cōforte yt flye laye holde hope ſet afore v whych haue ſure ſtedfaſt anker oure ſoule entrynge vntyll inmooſt vayle forerunner ieſus gone v beyng made high preſt euer order melchiſedek vii chapter thys melchiſedek gen 14 kynge salem preſt mooſt hyghe god whych met abrahā beynge returned ſlaughter kynges bleſſed hym▪ vnto dyd abraham alſo deale tythes thynges fyrſt truely called kynge ryghteouſneſſe afterwarde kynge salem whych ſaye kynge peace wythout father wythout mother wt kynne hauynge nother begynnynge dayes ende lyfe lykened vnto ſonne god remayneth preſt euer behold great vnto abraham patriarke alſo gaue tythes ye chefeſt num 18 • par 31 b verely chyldrē leui receaue ye preſthode haue commaundemente take tythes accordynge lawe theyr brother althoughe alſo come loynes abraham whoſe kynred coūted amonge toke tythes abraham bleſſed hym yt ye promyſes wythout gaynſayenge bleſte better whych leſſe truly mē dye receaue tythes doth wytneſſe lyueth maye ſo ſayde leui alſo whych receaueth tythes tythed abraham yet hys father loynes whan melchiſedek met hym rom • b gal 2 c yf perfeccion therfore preſthode leui people receaued lawe vnder ſame nede yet ryſe another preſte order melchiſedek called order aaron mala 2 bfor preſthode beynge tranſlated neceſſary ther alſo tranſlacion lawe whome theſe thynges ſpoken trybe whych man ſerued altare euidente mat 1 b lorde ſprōge trybe iuda whyche tribe moſes hath ſpoken nothynge preſtes yet manifeſt yf accordynge lykenes melchiſedek ryſe onother preſt whych made lawe carnall commaundemente power vnlowſeable lyfe wytneſſeth pſ • l 109 thou arte preſte foreuer order melchiſedek truely diſanullynge fyrſt commaundemente happened becauſe weakneſſe vnprofitableneſſe rom 3 b 8 gal 3 b c 4 afor lawe brought nothynge perfectneſſe introduccion better hope ye whych approche vnto god forſomuch wythout othe truely made preſtes wythout othe theſame wyth othe hym whyche ſayde vnto hym pſal 109 lorde hath ſworne ſhall repente hym thou art preſt euer ſo much ieſus become ſtablyſher better teſtament many become preſtes becauſe death forbyddē remayne theſame becauſe doth abyde euer hath euerlaſtynge preſthode wherfore euer able ſaue yt cōmyng vnto god hym lyuynge alway 1 tim 2 1 ioh 2 make interceſſiō v ſuch one ſemed hygh preſt vnto v holy innocent vndefyled ſundered frō ſynners beynge made hygher thā heauens whych hath nede dayly leui 9 ba hygh preſts offer vp ſacrifices fyrſt hys ſynnes people yt hath done offerynge hymſelfe heb 5 b ye lawe maketh men preſtes hauyng weakneſſe ye worde ye othe whyche ye law ſonne beynge perfecte euer viii chapter chef ye thynges yt ſpokē hebre 3 6 c 9 b haue ſuch hygh preſt whych ſet epheſ 1 c pſal 109 1 petri 3 c ye righthāde ye ſeat ye greatnes ye heauēs miniſter ye ſayntes true tabernacle yt whych god hath pyghte • man euery hygh preſt ordyned offer vp gyftes ſacrifices wherfore neceſſary ſame alſo haue yt may offre vp yf therfor vpō earth nother preſt ſeyng ther ye offer vp gyftes accordynge ye law heb 10 ſerue vnto ye example ſhadow heauenly thynges anſwered vnto moſes whā fynyſhed tabernacle exod 25 act 7 f se ſayeth thou thynges accordynge enſample ſhewed ye vpon mounte hath optayned better office alſo mediatour better teſtamēt whych ordyned better promyſes yf fyrſt bene blameable verely ther ſhulde place ſecōde ben ſought ſettynge noughte ſayeth iere 31 • beholde dayes ſhal come ſayeth lorde ſhall fynyſh new teſtamente vpon houſe iſraell vpon houſe iuda accordynge teſtamēt made vnto theyr father ye daye whan toke theyr hande yt myght leade lāde egipt act 7 • dyd abyde teſtamente haue regarded thē ſayeth lorde eſai 51 b iere 31 f thys ye teſtament ſhal ordyne vnto ye houſe iſrael thoſe dayes ſayeth ye lord wyl geue lawes theyr mynde theyr harte wyll wryte zacha 8 b apoc 21 b ſhalbe god vnto ſhalbe people vnto euery one ſhal teach hys neghboure euery one hys brother ſayenge knowe lorde ſhall knowe frō ye leeſt vnto ye moſt thē ſhalbe mercyful vnto theyr wyckedneſſes ſhal nowe remembre theyr ſynnes ſayeng ye new weareth yt afore yt worne waxeth old neare ye peryſhing ix chapter ✚ fyrſt verely alſo iuſtifyenges worſhippe temporall holyneſſe exod 25 afor fyrſt tabernacle made whych candelſtickes table leuit 24 b yt ſhewe breades whyche called holy behynde vayle ye ſeconde tabernacle whych called mooſt holy hauynge golden cenſoure exod 25 b arke conuenaunte ouerlayde euery ſyde wyth golde wherein exod 16 f golden pot hauyng manna rodde aarō num 17 whych floryſhed exod 40 c table teſtamente aboue theſame cherubins glory ouerſhadowyng ye mercy ſeate wherof nowe ſpeak particularly num 28 whā ye thynges thus dreſſed fyrſt tabernacle truely entred alwaye ye preſtes fulfyllynge office ſacrifices exod 30 b leuit 16 g luce 1 ſeconde ye hygh preſt yeare wythout bloude whych ſhulde offre hys people ignoraunce holy gooſt meanynge thys iohan 10 14 waye holyneſſes yet vttered fyrſt tabernacle hauyng yet hys beynge whyche ſimilitude preſent tyme accordynge whych gyftes ſacrifices offred whyche make perfecte concernynge ye cō ſcience ſeruer meates drynkes ſundry waſhynges ryghteouſneſſes fleſhe ſet vntyll tyme correccion ⊢ ✚ hebre 5 c 6 8 chriſt cōmynge hygh preſt good thynges come gone holy place larger perfecter eſaie 33 c 2 cori 5 tabernacle made wyth handes yt thys makynge nother ye bloude goates calues 1 iohā 1 b 1 petri 1 c apoc 1 hys owne bloude hauynge foūde eternall redemcion leui 9 b 16 b yf ye bloude goates ox nu 19 b aſhes cowe ſprenkled ſanctifyeth vncleane vnto clenſynge fleſh much hath ye bloude chriſt ephe 1 coloſſ 1 b 2 corin 5 c whych thorowe holy gooſt hath offered hymſelfe vnſpotted vnto god clenſed conſciēce deade workes rom 6 1 petr 4 ſerue lyuynge god therfor gala 3 c 1 tim 2 mediatoure new teſtament meane death called maye receaue promyſe eternall heretage redēpcion thoſe tranſgreſſions vnder fyrſt teſtament ⊢for ther teſtament neceſſarye ye death teſtament maker paſſe gal 3 • teſtament confyrmed deade el yet value ſo lōge yt maketh teſtament lyueth wherfore nother ye fyrſt teſtament ordyned without bloude whā euery cōmaundement ye lawe red moſes vnto al people takynge ye bloude calues goates wt water purple woll yſope ſprēkled ye boke ye people ſayenge exod 24 b thys ye bloud teſtamēt ye whych god hath cōmaūded vnto tabernacle alſo ye veſſels ye ſeruice ſprenkled wyth bloude lykewyſe nearehād al thynges clēſed wyth bloude lawe wythout ſheddynge bloude ther remyſſion therfore neceſſarye truly ye ſimilitudes heauēly thynges clēſed wt theſe ye heauē ly thynges thēſelues better ſacrifices theſe ieſus entred holy place act 7 f 17 made wyth handes enſamples true heauen 1 iohā 2 maye appeare vnto ſyght god v nother offre hymſelfe ofte lyke leuit 16 g hygh preſt entreth euery yeare holy place wt ſtraunge bloude orels behoued hym ofte ſuffr • begynnynge world nowe ye fyniſhynge tymes hath appeared hys owne offerynge vnto puttynge awaye ſynne ordined men dye ſhalbe iudgemēt rom 5 1 petri 3 c euē ſo chriſt offered take awaye ſynnes many ſeconde tyme ſhall appeare wythout ſynne vnto al yt wayt hym vnto ſaluacion x chapter lawe colloſſ 2 c hauynge ſhadowe good thynges come faſhion thynges cā neuer make cōmers vnto perfecte wyth ſame ſacrifices whych offer wythout ceaſſynge euery yeare orels ceaſſed offered becauſe worſhippers clenſed ſhuld haue conſcience ſynne thē euery yeare made remēbraunce ſynnes leuit 16 c impoſſible ſynnes taken away wt bloude ox goates therfore entryng worlde ſayeth eſaye 50 b pſal 39 b sacrifice offerynge woldeſt thou haue thou haſt prepared body vnto burntofferynges ſynne offerynges pleaſed ſayde lo come begynnynge boke ther wrytten ſhulde thy wyll god sayenge aboue sacrifice offerynges burntofferinges ſynne offerynges thou woldeſt nother thynges pleaſynge vnto yt offered ye lawe ſayd lo come maye thy wyll god taketh awaye fyrſt yt may ordyne enſuynge whych wyll hallowed offerynge body ieſus chriſt euery preſt truely ready miniſtryng dayly offeryng oft ſame offeringes whych take away ye ſynnes thys mā offeryng one ſacrifice ſynnes ſytteth euer ye right hande god waytynge henceforth pſal 109 avntyll hys enemyes ſet ſtoole hys fete wyth one offerynge hath made perfecte foreuer ſanctifyed ye holy gooſt beareth recorde wyth v yt ſayd iere 31 • thys teſtament ſhall make wyth thoſe dayes ſaieth lord wyll geue lawes theyr harte theyr myndes wyll wryte wyl nomore remēbre theyr ſynnes wyckedneſſes ſeynge remiſſion theſe thā ther nowe nomore offerynge ſynne hauynge therfore brother iohā 10 14 rom 5 heb 9 b boldneſſe entraunce holy thynges bloude chriſt ye whych new waye lyuynge hath prepared vnto v thorow vaile hys fleſh hygh preſt ouer houſe god let v come neare wyth true harte fulneſſe fayth heb 9 c 1 petri 1 hauynge harte ſprenkled euell conſcience hauynge body waſhen wyth cleane water let v holde faſt knowlegynge fayth wauerynge faythfull hath promyſed let v conſydre ech prouokynge charite good workes leauynge handreachynge ſome haue coſtume comfortyng ſomuch rom 13 b ye ſhall ſe daye approchynge nu 15 c hebr 6 vnto v ſynnynge wyllingly knowlege truth receaued ther lefte nowe ſacrifice ſynnes fearfull waytynge iudgemēt heate fyre whych ſhall conſume aduerſaryes deut 17 b 19 c yf ony maketh lawe moſes voyde dyeth wtoute mercy vnder two thre wytneſſes howe muche worſe punyſhmente ſuppoſe ye hym deſerue whyche treadeth ſonne god vnder foote counteth bloude conuenaunte wherein ſanctifyed defyled thynge doth iniury vnto ſprete grace know yt ſayd deut 32 • rom 12 c yelde vnto vengeaunce ſhal recōpence agayne deu 32 e god ſhall iudge hys people dredefull thynge fall handes lyuynge god call mynde ye dayes paſt whych beyng lyghtened ye ſuffred great ſtryfe ſufferynges one parte truely ye become gaſynge ſtocke wyth ſhames trouble parte ye become companion ſo cōuerſaūt math 25 c 2 tim 1 cfor ye haue ſuffred wyth thē preſoners toke wyth ioye ſpoylynge goodes knowynge haue better durynge ſubſtaunce loſe therfore confidence whyche hath great reward hebre 12 paciēce nedefull vnto doynge wyll god ye maye receaue promyſe abac 2 yet ſhorte lytle whyle commynge ſhall come ſhall tary rom 1 b galat 3 b ryghteous ſhall lyue fayth yf ſo ſhall wythdrawe hymſelfe ſhall pleaſe vnto ſoule chyldren wythdrawynge vnto perdiciō fayth vnto purchaſynge ſoule xi chapter fayth ſubſtaunce thynges hoped euidence thīges ye rom 1 8 c coloſſ 1 b appeare ye ſame haue ye elder optayned report fayth vnderſtāde gene 1 a▪ worlde haue ben ordyned ye worde god yt inuiſible thynges myght become viſible gene 4 fayth dyd abell offre plentyfull ſacrifice vnto god cain whych optayned reporte ryghteous gyftes bearynge wytneſſe vnto god beynge deade ſpeaketh yet theſame geneſ 5 c sapi 4 b eccl 44 b 49 cby fayth enoch tranſlated leſte ſhulde ſe death founde becauſe god tranſlated hym tranſlatynge reporte yt pleaſed god wythout fayth impoſſible pleaſe god yt cōmynge vnto god muſt beleue recompēſer vnto yt ſeke hym gen 6 eccli 41 b fayth noe receaued anſwer fearyng thoſe thinges yet ſene dreſſed arke ſauegard hys houſe whych math 12 condē ned world made heyre ye ryghteouſneſſe fayth gen 12 13 fayth called abrahā obeyed go ye place receaue heretage wente knowynge whether went fayth dwelled lande promyſe ſtraunge lande dwellynge tentes wyth iſaac iacob heyres wyth hym lyke promyſe wayted cytie hauynge fūdaciōs whoſe workeman buylder god fayth gen 21 sara alſo herſelfe beynge baren receaued ſtrength cōceauyng ſede yee beſyde ye tyme hyr age ſhe beleued god faythful whych promyſed therfor alſo one theſame deade ſprōge ſo many multitude gene 15 ſtarres ſkye ſande ſee ſhore innumerable accordynge fayth dyed theſe hauyng receaued promyſes ioh 8 c ſeynge afarre ſalutynge gen· 47 confeſſynge ſtraungers geſtes vpon earth yt ſaye theſe thynges ſhewe ſeke natural contry truly yf ben myndeful yt wēt verely leaſure ynough returne deſyre better yt heauenly exod • • math 22 therfore god aſhamed called theyr god hath prepared cytie vnto thē fayth dyd gen 22 c eccli 44 c abraham offre vp iſaac whan proued offered hys begottē ſōne receaued promyſes vnto whō ſayd iſaac ſhall ye ſede called vnto thynkynge yt god able alſo rayſe frō deade whereby alſo receaued hym enſāple gene 17 dby fayth alſo dyd iſaac bleſſe iacob eſau thynges come gen 48 cby fayth dyd iacob dyenge bleſſe euery one ye chyldrē ioſeph worſhipped toppe hys rodde gene 50 • fayth dyd ioſeph dyeng remē bre ye departynge ye chyldren iſrael cōmaunded cōcernynge hys bone exod 2 • faith moſes beyng borē hyd elder thre monethes becauſe ſaw hym proper chyld feared ye kynges cōmaū demēt exod 2 b fayth dyd moſes beyng waxē great deny hym ye ſōne pharaos doughter choſyng rather puniſhed wt ye people god thā haue ye pleaſur tēporal ſynne eſtymyng ye rebuke chriſte greater ryches thā ye treaſures ye egipciās loked vnto ye reward exod 12 fby fayth left egipte beyng afrayed kynges moode wayted ye inuiſible ſeyng exod 12 bby fayth kept eaſter effuſion bloude leſt yt wayſted fyrſtborne ſhulde touch thē exod 14 c fayth paſſed reed ſee thorow drye lande whyche egipcians hauyng aſſayed drowned ioſue 6 c fayth dyd ye walles iericho fall cōpaſſynge ſeuen dayes ioſue 2 6 iudic 7 fayth dyd raab harlot peryſh wt vnbeleuynge receauyng ye ſpyes peace ſhall ſaye tyme ſhal fayle treatyng ioſue 2 6 iudic 7 gedeon iudi 4 barach iudi 14 b sampſon iudic 11 f hiepte 1 r • 17 f dauid 1 ro 12 samuel prophetes✚ whyche thorowe fayth haue ouercome kyngdomes haue wrought ryghteouſneſſe haue gotten ye promyſes dan 6 14 g haue ſtopped mouthes liōs dan 3 haue quēched ye violēce ye fyre 3 19 haue eſcaped ye edge ye ſweard eſa • 8 b recouered theyr ſycknes iudi 515 1 para 12 become ſtrōge battail 1 142 pa 1420 haue ouerthrowē tētes ye aleaūtes 3 17 c 4 reg 4 wemen haue receaued theyr dead agayn frō ye reſurrecciō iere 20 ſome wer racked acceptyng ye delyueraūce yt myght fynde ye better reſurreccion haue proued mockynges ſtrokes beſydes thys alſo bādes preſonementes • reg 21 b ſtoned hewē aſunder tempted ſlayē ye death ſwearde • reg 1 b math 3 went ſhepes ſkynnes gotes ſkynnes nedynge diſtreſſe vexed whereof ye worlde worthy wandryng wylderneſſes mountaynes dennes caues earth al theſe beyng alowed ye wytneſſe fayth receaued promyſe god prouydynge ſome better thyng v ſhulde made perfecte wythout v ⊢ xii chapter therfore hauynge ſo greate cloude wytneſſes layde vpon v ephe 4 c col • 3 1 petri • layenge away weyght ſynne ſtandeth v let v runne pacience vnto ſtryfe ſet afore v lokynge vpon author fynyſher fayth ieſus philip 2 whyche ioye beynge ſet afore hym ſuffered croſſe ſhame deſpyſed hebre 1 10 b ſytteth ryghthande ſeate god remembre hym ſuffred ſuche ſpeakynge agaynſt hymſelfe ſynners yt ye weery waxynge faynte myndes ye haue yet reſyſted vntyl bloude ſtryuyng agaynſt ſynne haue forgottē ye cōſolacion whyche ſpeaketh vnto vnto chyldren ſayeng prouer 3 b ſōne deſpyſe nourtoure ye lord nother faynt whan yu art rebuked hym apoc • b ye lord loueth doth chaſtē ſcourgeth euery ſōne receaueth remayne ye chaſtenyng god offereth hymſelfe vnto vnto chyldren chyld whō father doth chaſtē yf ſo ye wtout correccion wherof haue al bē parteners thā ye baſtardes chyldrē moreouer haue truly father fleſh teacher feared thē ſhall muche obey ye father ſprets lyue truely ye ſpace fewe dayes enfourmed v accordynge theyr wyll thys vnto yt profytable receaue hys holyneſſe euery chaſtenyng preſēt tyme ſemeth ioye ſorowe afterwarde ſhal geue yt exercyſed theſame mooſt quyet frute ryghteouſneſſe yt whych cauſe eſa 35 lyfte vp ye ſlacked hādes ye lowſed knee make ſtrayght pathes vnto fete yt nomā haltynge go aſtraye rather healed rom 12 c follow vpon peace wt al men holyneſſe wtout ye nomā ſhal ſe god takyng hede yt nomā deſtitute ye grace god leſt ony roote bytterneſſe ſpryngynge vpwarde let ſame many ſtayned ther whoremonger vncleane perſone eſau gen 25 ſolde byrthryghte one meate ſure yt afterwardes alſo deſyryng enheret refuſed gene • 7 f f • de place repētaūce though ſought wt teares ye ar come moū tayne yt handled exod 20 c fyre yt cā approched myſte darkneſſe tempeſt ſoūde ye trōpe voyce wordes whych yt dyd heare dyd excuſe thēſelues yt worde ſhuld happē vnto thē coulde beare yt ſpoken exod 19 b yf beaſt ſhall touch moū tayne ſhalbe ſtoned ſo terrible yt ſene moſes dyd ſay afrayed quake ye come vnto ye moūte sion ye cytie ye lyuynge god apoc 2 • b ye celeſtial ieruſalem multitude many thouſād angel ye cōgregaciō fyrſtborne wrytten heauens god iudge ſpretes iuſte perfect ieſus mediatour newe teſtamente 1 petr • 1 • heb 9 c 10 cſprenklynge bloude ſpeakynge better thā gene 4 b abel se ye refuſe hym yt ſpeaketh yf eſcaped refuſynge hym yt ſpake vpon earth much yt refuſe hym ye ſpeaketh vnto v frō heauens whoſe voyce dyd ſhake earth ye tyme promyſeth ſayeng agg •• 2 b yet agayne ſhal ſhake earth alſo heauen ſayeth yet declareth chaungynge mouable done thoſe thynges vnmouable maye remayne receauynge therfore vnmoueable kyngdō haue grace 1 petri 2 ye may ſerue pleaſing god wt feare reuerence deut 4 god cōſumynge fyre xiii chapter let ye loue brotherheade cōtinue gene 18 19 rom 12 b 1 petr 4 b forget hoſpitalite ſame ſome acceptable receauynge angel lodgynge math 25 c heb 10 dremembre bounde boūde wt thē payne ye yourſelues abydyng alſo ye body let wedlocke honourable al thinges ye bed vndefiled god ſhal iudge ye whoremōgers aduouterers let maners wtout couetouſneſſe eccli 29 beyng cōtent wt thynges yt ye haue already ſaid deut 31 b ioſ • e 1 wil leaue forſake y• ſo yt may boldly ſay pſal 55 117 lorde helper ſhal afrayd mā vnto remembre haue ye ouerſyght haue ſpoken worde god vnto beholdynge ende whoſe cōuerſacion followe theyr fayth ieſus chriſt yeſterdaye hebre 3 b daye abydeth foreuer miſcaried ſūdry ſtraūge doctrine rom 14 c coloſſ 2 c titum 3 c beſt ſtaye harte wt grace ioh 6 f wt meates dyd auayle thē dyd walke thē haue altare wherof haue power eate yt ſerue tabernacle exod 29 b leuit 4 c num 19 thoſe beaſtes yt bloud brought ye holy place ye high preſt ſynne bodyes thē burnt wt tentes whych cauſe ieſus alſo yt myght hallowe ye people hys bloude iohā 19 b dyd ſuffre wtout gate let v therfore go forth vnto hym wythout tentes bearyng hys rebuke pilip 3 c haue abydynge cytie ſeke one come pſal 91 let v therfore alwaye offer ſacrifice prayſe vnto god thorow hym yt ye frute lyppes knowlegynge vnto hys name forget doyng wel 1 cori 16 handreachynge pilip 4 c wyth ſuche ſacrifyces god made fauourable ✚ obeye youre ouerſeers obediente vnto watche though ſhal geue accompte may wyth ioye ſyghynge ye doth become act 4 c 1 • epheſ 6 c praye v truſt haue good conſcience wyllynge thynges conuerſaūt well beſeke ye ſame yet yt maye reſtored vnto ye ſpedely god peace whyche hath brought lorde ieſus chriſt dead ezec 34 b ioh 10 1 petri 5 great ſhepeherd ſhepe thorowe bloude eternall teſtamente deut 8 2 cori 5 pilip 2 b make mete goodneſſe ye maye hys wyll workynge amonge maye pleaſe ſyght thorow ieſus chriſt vnto glorye euer euer amen ⊢ beſeke brother ye ſuffre ye worde ſolace haue wrytten vnto wyth wordes know brother timothe lettē go wyth whome yf ſhall come ſpedely wyll ſe grete al ouer ſeers ſayntes brother italy ſalute grace wyth amen ¶the ende epiſtle paule apoſtle hebrues catholyke epiſtle apoſtle iames fyrſt chapter iames ſeruaunte god oure lord ieſus chriſt ſendeth gretynge vnto twelfe tribe whych actu 8 • ſcattred ✚ counte full ioye brother whan ye fall ſundry temptacions beyng ſure rom 5 prouyng fayth worketh pacience1 petri 1 b zach 13 b let pacience haue perfecte workynge ye maye perfecte ſounde faydyng nothynge prouer 2 ioh 16 c yf ony nedeth wyſedome let hym requyre god whyche geueth plentyfully vnto euery man vpbraydeth ſhalbe geuen marc 11 c let requyre ī fayth doutynge douteth lyke vnto ye wawe ye ſee whych ſteared wynde toſſed aboute let therfore mā ſuppoſe ſhall receaue ought ye lorde man doutfull vnſtable hys wayes let ye brother lowe degre reioyce hys exaltacion rych hys humbleneſſe floure graſſe ſhal paſſe awaye eccli 14 eſa 40 1 petri 1 sonne aroſe wyth heate dryed ye graſſe hys floure fell downe bewty hys ſyghte peryſhed euen ſo ſhall ryche alſo fayde hys wayes iob 5 b happy man ſuffereth tentacion whan ſhalbe proued ſhall receaue crowne lyfe whych god hath promyſed loue hym ⊢let noman whan tempted ſaye tempted god god tē ter euell tempteth noman euery one tempted beynge drawen entyſed owne cōcupiſcence afterwarde whan rom 6 cō cupiſcence hath conceaued ſhe engē dreth ſynne ſynne whan fynyſhed engēdreth death erre therfore mooſt beloued brother ✚ prouer 2 ioh 3 euery beſt gyfte euery perfecte gyfte aboue cōmynge downe father lyghtes ther chaūge courſe ouerſhadowynge iohā 1 3 1 cori 4 wyllyngly hath engendred v wyth ye worde truth ſome begynnynge hys creature ye knowe mooſt beloued brethrē prou 17 eccli 5 b let euery mā ſwyft heare ſlowe ſpeake ſlow wrath wrath man worketh ryghteouſnes god rom 13 b coloſſ 3 caſtyng awaye therfore vnclenneſſe abundaunce malyce receaue grafted word gētlyneſſe able ſaue ſoules ⊢ ✚ rom 2 b ye doer word hearer deceauynge yourſelues luc 6 c yf ony man hearer ye worde doer theſame ſhall lykened vnto man beholdynge vyſage hys byrthe glaſſe dyd beholde hymſelfe went forthwith dyd forget faſhiō math 5 b yt ſhal loke law perfecte lyberte ſhall remayne theſame beynge become forgetfull hearer accomplyſher worke theſame ſhalbe happy dede yf ony man thynketh hym deuoute refraynyng hys 1 petri 3 iacob 3 tunge myſcaryenge hys harte thys man deuocion vayne pure vnſpotted deuocion god father thys vyſyte fatherleſſe motherleſſe wedowes theyr trouble kepe hymſelfe vndefyled thys 1 iohā 2 c worlde ⊢ ii chapter brother haue fayth lorde glory ieſus chriſte wyth leuit 19 regarde perſons yf ther entre congregaciō man hauynge golden rynge goodly apparell ther ſhall alſo entre poore man vyle rayment ye loke vpon hym clothed wyth gaye raymente ſhall ſaye vnto hym syt thou well poore ye ſhall ſaye stande thou ſyt downe vnder foote ſtoole fete ye iudge yourſelues become iudges euell thoughtes math 5 aherken mooſt beloued brethrē hath god choſen poore thys worlde rych fayth heyres kyngdome whych god hath promyſed loue hym ye haue diſhonoured poore ryche oppreſſe myghte drawe iudgemente blaſpheme good name called vpon yf ye leeſt fulfyl ye royal lawe accordyng ſcriptures leuit 19 c thou ſhalt loue thy neghboure thyſelf ye well yf ye regarde perſone ye ſynne beynge rebuked lawe tranſgreſſours ezech 18 b ſo euer kepeth whole lawe offendeth one become gylty hath ſayde exod 20 cthou ſhalt commytte aduoutry hath ſayde alſo thou ſhalte kyl yf yu ſhalte commyt aduoutry ſhalt ſlaye thou arte become tranſgreſſoure lawe speake ye ſo ſo begynninge iudged lawe lyberte math 18 • iudgemente wythout mercy ſhalbe vnto hym yt ſheweth mercy mercy exalteth iudgemēt ⊢ math 7 • doth auayle brother yf ony mā ſay hym haue fayth hath workes fayth ſaue hym 1 ioh 3 c yf brother ſyſter naked nede dayly foode ony ſaye vnto go peace warmed ſatiſfyed ye ſhall geue ye thinges neceſſary body ſhall auayle euen ſo faythe alſo yf ſhe hath workes deade herſelfe ſome body wyl ſaye thou haſt faith haue workes ſhew thy fayth wythout workes ſhal ſhewe faith dedes beleueſt thou ther one god thou doeſt well mat 8 marc 1 cthe deuels alſo beleue tremble wylte thou know thou vayne man fayth wythout workes deade abraham oure father iuſtifyed workes offerynge iſaac hys ſonne vpon altare seyſt thou fayth wrought wyth hys workes workes fayth made perfecte ſcripture fulfylled ſayenge gen 15 c rom 4 b gal 3 abraham beleued god counted hym vnto ryghteouſneſſe called frende god se ye man iuſtifyed workes fayth lyke wyſe alſo ioſ 2 6 c raab harlot ſhe iuſtifyed receauyng meſſaūgers ſending thē another way ye body wythout ye ſprete deade euē ſo fayth alſo wtout workes deade iii chapter brethrē become many math 23 mayſters knowyng ye receaue iudgemente al offende many thynges eccli 14 19 c 25 b offēdeth worde ye ſame perfecte mā able alſo lead ye whole body wt brydle yf put brydles horſes mouthes leade theyr bodyes aboute conſent vnto v behold ſhyppes whyle great led greate wyndes wyth lytle helme turned aboute ye violence gouernoure wyll euē ſo alſo tunge lytle mēbre truely exalteth greate thynges beholde maner fyre great woode burneth tunge fyre multytude wyckedneſſe tunge ſet oure membres whyche defyleth whole body enflameth ye whyle natiuite beynge enflamed hell euery nature beaſtes byrdes ſerpentes tamed made meke ye nature man tunge noman tame reſtleſſe euell ful deadly poyſō ſame bleſſe god father ye ſame curſe men whych gen 1 created ymage ſimilitude god ye ſame mouth commeth forth bleſſynge curſynge ought done ſo brother doth fountayne flowe one hole ſwete bytter water fygge tre brother brynge forth grape vyne fygges euen ſo nother ſalt water geue ſwete wyſe learned amonge let hym coloſſ 4 epheſ 5 b ſhew workynge hys good conuerſacion mekeneſſe wyſedome yf ſo ye haue rom 1 • b bytter hatred ther contencions youre harte reioyce lyars agaynſte truth thys wyſedome cōmynge downe frō aboue father lightes earthly beaſtly deuelyſh enuy contencion inconſtancy euery euell worke ye wyſedome aboue fyrſte truely sap 6 bchayſte peaceable meke perſuadynge conſentynge vnto good thynges full mercy good frutes iudgynge wythout ſimulacion ye frute ryghteouſneſſe ſowē peace vnto thē ye worke peace iiii chapter frō whence ther warres ſtryfes amonge cōcupiſcēces whych ſtryue membres ye deſyre haue ye ſlaye enuye get ye ſtryue warre haue becauſe ye axed ye axe receaue becauſe ye axe well ye may beſtow vpō cōcupiſcēces ye aduouterers knowe ye gal 1 b 1 ioh • c frendſhippe thys worlde enemye vnto god whoſoeuer therfore wyl frende thys worlde made enemy god thynke ye ſcripture ſayeth nought rom 8 gal 5 c ſprete abideth deſyreth vnto enuy pro 3 b geueth grace wherfore ſayeth god 1 petri 5 b reſyſteth proude geueth grace vnto ye lowly ſubiecte vnto god therfore reſyſt ye deuel ſhal flye drawe nye vnto god ſhall draw nye clēſe handes ye ſynners pourge harte ye dubble harted ye myſerable ſorowe wepe let youre laughter turned wepynge ioye heuyneſſe 1 petri 5 lowly preſence lord ſhall exalte backbyte one another brother ye bacbiteth brother iudgeth hys brother bacbyteth lawe iudgeth lawe yf thou iudgeſt lawe thou arte doer law iudge ther one lawgeuer iudge cā deſtroye deliuer rom 14 art thou iudgeſt thy neghboure eze 18 luce 12 bbeholde ye ſaye daye morowe ſhal go cytie continue truely yeare ſhall occupye gayne whyche knowe ſhalbe tomorowe youre lyfe vapoure appearynge lytle ſhal vanyſh ye ſaye act • 8 hebre 6 yf lorde wyl yf lyue ſhall thys yt ye reioyce prydes euery ſuch reioycynge wycked luce 12 dto hym therfore good doynge ſynne vnto v chapter go • •• 6 b ye rich wepe howlynge youre wretchedneſſes ye whych ſhall come ryches corrupte clothes eatē mothes golde ſyluer ruſted theyr ruſt ſhalbe wytneſſe agaynſt ſhall eate youre fleſh fyre ye haue heaped wrath laſt dayes leuit 19 c deut • 4 c tobi 4 c beholde ye wage labourer whych haue reaped downe landes ye whych defrauded doth crye theyr crye entred eares lorde ſabaoth luce 16 c ye haue ben mery vpon earth haue noryſhed harte vnmeaſurableneſſes ye haue brought ryghteous day ſlaughter haue ſlayne hym dyd wythſtāde ✚be ye paciēt therfore brethrē vntyll commynge lord beholde huſbandman wayteth preciouſe frute earth takynge pacience vntyll receaue early latter rayne ye pacient therfore alſo ſatle youre harte commynge lord approched sygh one agaynſt another brother ye iudged beholde ye iudge ſtādeth ye dore take brethrē ye prophetes enſāple euell ende longe ſufferynge workynge pacience whych haue ſpoken name ye lord ⊢ behold mat 5 coūte thē happy haue ſuffered ye haue herde iob 1 c 2 b paciēce iob haue ſene ende lord ye lorde mercyfull pyteous al thynges brethrē math 5 2 cori 1 c ſwear nother heauen earth ony ſoeuer oth el let oth yee yee nay nay ye fall vnder iudgement yf ony ſory let hym praye yf mery let hym alſo ſynge pſalmes yf ony amōg ſycke let hym brynge elder congregacion let pray ouer hym marc 6 b anoyntynge hym wyth oyle name lorde prayer fayth ſhal ſaue ſycke lorde ſhall rayſe hym vp yf ſynnes ſhalbe forgeuē hym knowlege ſynnes therfore one another praye ech ye maye ſaued inſtaūte prayer ryghteous much worth • reg 17 luc 4 c elia mortall mā lyke vnto v prayer prayed ſhuld rayne vpon earth rayned thre yeare ſyxe monethes • reg 18 aand prayed agayne ye ſkye gaue rayne earth gaue hyr frute brother yf ony ſhal erre truth ony mā ſhall conuerte hym muſte knowe cauſeth ſynner conuerte erroure hys waye ſhal ſaue hys ſoule death ſhall couer multitude ſynnes ¶the ende ye canonicall epiſtle apoſtle iames fyrſt canonicall epiſtle peter apoſtle fyrſt chapter peter apoſtle ieſus chriſt ye choſen ſtraungers ac • • ▪ • ſcatterynge abrode pontus galatia cappadocia aſia bithinia accordyng ye foreknowlege god father vnto ye ſanctificion ye ſprete ye obedience heb 9 b 10 c ſprenklynge bloude ieſu chriſt 2 cor 1 epheſ 1 b grace peace multiplyed vnto 2 pet 1 bleſſed god father oure lorde ieſus chriſte whyche accordynge hys great mercy hath begottē v agayne lyuely hope 1 cor 15 • ryſynge agayne ieſus chriſt ye deade rom 8 heretage vncorruptible vndefyled faydynge colo 3 kepte heauen whych power god kept fayth vnto ſaluacion whych ready ſhewed laſt tyme whych ye ſhall reioyce yf ye muſt lytle ſory dyuerſe temptaciōs iob 23 • ia • ob 1 tryenge faith foūde much precious gold proued fyre vnto prayſe math 25 c glory honoure reuelacion ieſus chriſt ioh 20 whome whyle ye haue ſene ye loue hym whome nowe alſo though ye ſeynge hym ye beleue beleuynge ye ſhall reioyce wyth vnoutſpeakeable ioye glorious bearynge awaye ende youre fayth ſaluacion ſoules whych ſaluacion gen 49 b daniel 2 g • gge 2 b • ach 6 b ye prophetes haue ſearched ſought whych prophecyed ye grace yt come amonge ſearchynge whych maner tyme ye ſprete god ſhulde ſignify ſhewynge afore ſufferynges chriſte ieſu gloryes come vnto whome opened declared vnto ſelues made manyfeſte thoſe thynges whych ſhewed vnto thē whych preached vnto act • ye holy gooſt beinge ſente heauē luc 2 b vpon whome angel deſyre loke wherfore luce 12 dthe loynes mynde beynge gyrded vp ye ſobre hope perfectly grace yt offered vnto ſhewynge ieſus chriſte chyldren obedience beyng lyke faſhioned vnto ye luſtes fore ignoraunce vnto holy whych hath called ye alſo holy youre conuerſacion wrytten leuit 11 g 19 ye ſhalbe holy holy yf ye cal vpon father whyche math • 5 c iudgeth accordynge euery man worke wythout reſpecte perſons walke feare tyme indwellyng ✚ • corin 6 c 7 c knowynge yt ye bought wt corruptible ſyluer golde frō vayne cōuerſaciō ye fatherly tradicionheb 9 1 ioh 1 b apoc 1 wt precious bloude vnſpotted vndefyled lambe chriſt beyng knowen truely ye creacions ye worlde beynge made manyfeſt ye laſt tymes eſa • b luce • b ſakes whych hym faythfull god whych hath rayſed hym deade philip 2 hath geuen hym glorye youre fayth hope ſhulde god clenſynge youre ſoules ye obedience loue ſyngle loue brotherheade loue ech earneſtly frō ye harte beynge borne agayne corruptible ſede vncorruptible worde lyuynge god abydynge foreuer eſa 4 • eccli 17 b iacob 1 b fleſhe graſſe hys glory ye floure graſſe graſſe wythered hys floure fel vvorde god abydeth euer ⊢ worde deut 30 c whyche preached amonge ii chap ✚ layenge epheſ 4 coloſſ 3 hebre 12 awaye therfore al malyce al gyle diſſemblynge enuyes backbytynges mat 18 newe borne babe reaſonable wythoute gyle couet ye milke yt therin ye may growe vnto ſaluacion pſal • 5 yf ye aſſaye leeſt yt lorde ſwete vnto whome cōmynge neare epheſ • c quycke ſtone men truely refuſed choſen god glorifyed ye alſo buylded vpon quicke ſtones ye ſpiritual houſe eſa 66 holy preſthode offerynge ro 12 heb 1 • c ſpiritual ſacrifices acceptable vnto god thorow ieſus chriſt wherfore ye ſcripture cōtayneth alſo eſay • • 8 c math 21 • act 4 beholde laye sion heade ſtone corner ſtone alowed choſē precious yt ſhal beleue hym ſhal aſhamed vnto therfore yt beleuynge prayſe vnto yt beleuyng ſtone pſal 117 • buylders refuſed theſame become heade ye corner eſay 8 c ſtone ſtomblynge rocke offēdicle vnto thē offende worde nother beleue wheron alſo ſet exod 19 ye choſen kynred kyngly preſthode deu 17 holy nacion people purchaſynge eſa 40 ye ſhewe ye power hym hath called hys wonderful lyght darkeneſſes oſe • 2 c rom 9 c whych ſomtyme people god people god hauynge optayned mercy haue optayned mercy ⊢ ✚ ye moſt beloued beſeke ſtraū gers pylgrymes rom 13 b galat 5 c abſtayne carnall deſyres whyche warre agaynſt ſoule math 5 b hauynge conuerſacion good amōge heythen 1 petri 3 b yt backbyte euel doer conſyderyng good workes may prayſe god ye day viſitaciō rom 13 titum 3 ye therfore ſubiecte vnto euery creature man becauſe god ether vnto ye kynge ye mooſt excellente ether vnto chefe officer ſent frō hym ye puniſhmēt eueldoers ye prayſe good ⊢ ſo wyll god doyng well ye maye cauſe ignoraunce foolyſh men ſtyll beynge fre hauynge cloke wyckedneſſe vnto lyberte ſeruauntes god rom 12 b honoure al men loue brotherheade feare god mat 22 chonoure kynge ephe 6 coloſſ 3 c titum 2 b ye ſeruaū te obediēte vnto mayſters wyth feare onely good gentle alſo frowarde 2 cor 7 bfor grace yf ony man cōſciēce ſake god ſuffre heuyneſſes ſufferyng vnworthely thankes yf ye ſynnyg beynge buffetted ſuffre math 5 1 petri 3 • yf ye doynge well beare paciētly yt grace wt god ther ye called ✚ chriſt alſo ſuffred v leauynge ioh 1 • b philip 2 • enſāple yt ye followe hys footeſteppes whiche dyd ſynne nother ther gyle foūd hys mouth math 27 c iohā 18 c whā euel ſpokē curſed whā ſuffred threatened deliuered hymſelfe vnto hym yt iudged vnryghteouſly eſa 53 eccli 34 luce 15 • hath borne ſynnes hymſelfe body vpō ye tre yt beyng dead ſynne may lyue vnto ryghteouſneſſe whoſe ſtrypes ye healed ye ſhepe goynge aſtraye ye turned ye ſhepherde byſhop ſoules ⊢ iii chap lykewyſe alſo 1 cori 11 • epheſ 5 c coloſſ 3 c wemē let thē obediente vnto theyr huſbādes yt alſo obey ye word may wonne conuerſacion wemen wythout worde beholdynge holy cōuerſacion fear whoſe apparell 1 tim 1 b outwarde wt broydyng heere puttyng golde puttyng apparell ye inwarde man yt hyd harte quiete meke ſpret whych rych ſyght god ſo dyd holy wemē alſo truſtyng god tyer themſelues beynge obediente vnto theyr owne huſbandes sara dyd obeye abrahā geneſ 18 b callynge hym lorde whoſe doughters ye doynge well fearyng ony perturbacion lykewyſe ye mē dwellynge wyth accordyng knowlege 1 teſſ 4 geuynge woman honoure vnto weaker veſſell vnto lyke heyres alſo grace lyfe youre prayer let ✚ concluſion ye onemynded ſufferynge together louers brotherheade mercyful ſoft lowly prou 20 c math 5 • rom 12 c rendrynge euel euel curſe curſe cōtrarywyſe bleſſyng therfore ye called gen 12 math 25 c ye poſſeſſe bleſſe heretage pſa 33 b yt wyll loue lyfe ſe good dayes let hym refrayne tūge frō euel lippes yt ſpeak gile let hym eſchue euell good let hym ſeke peace followe eye ye lord vpō ye ryghteous hys eares theyr prayer ye ſyght ye lord vpō thē euels yt ſhall hurte yf ye follower god mat 5 yee yf ye ſuffre ought ryghteouſnes ſake bleſſed ar ye eſa 8 c math 10 fear ye theyr threatenynge ye troubled iob 1 c ſāctifye ye lord chriſt harte ⊢ pſa 118 f actū 4 beynge euer redy ye ſatiſfyeng euery mā requyryng accōpte yt fayth hope wt mekeneſſe feare hauyng good cōſciēce titum 1 • petri 2 b yt ye backbyt maye aſhamed ſpeake euel cōuerſacion chriſt 1 petri 2 c math 5 better doynge well yf wyll god ſuffre doynge euell rom 5 heb 9 c chriſte alſo dyed oure ſynnes ryghteous vnryghteous myght offer v vp vnto god beynge ſlayne truely fleſh quyckened ſprete ye whych alſo commynge preached vnto ſpretes preſō whych geneſ 6 mat 24 luc 17 c ſomtyme vnbelyuyng whan wayted pacience god dayes noe whan ye arke made gene 7 • whyche eyght ſoules ſaued water whych rom • • baptyme beynge lyke faſhion dothe ſaue layenge away ye fylthyneſſe fleſh ye demaū dynge good conſcience towarde god ryſynge agayne ieſus chriſt whych ryghthād god ſwalowynge vp death myght become heyres euerlaſtynge lyfe beynge gone heauē hebre 1 b 2 b cthe angel myghty power beynge ſubiecte vnto hym iiii chapter therfore chriſte hauynge ſuffered fleſh ye alſo armed wyth lyke meanynge rom 6 • ſuffered fleſh left ſynnes lyue reſydue tyme reſteth fleſh 1 ioha 2 c luſtes men wyll god eph 4 ynough tyme paſt ſpente fulfyllynge wyll heythen vnto haue walked wā tonneſſes luſtes dronkenneſſes bāckettynges vnmeaſurable eatynges drynkynges vnlawfull worſhippynges idol whyche maruayled ye ranne vnto lyke confuſion exceſſe ſpeakyng euel whych ſhall geue accompt vnto hym whyche ready iudge quycke dead 1 pe • ri 3 cfor becauſe thys alſo goſpell preached vnto deade ioh 5 c truely maye iudged accordynge man fleſhe lyue god ſprete ye ende thynges ſhall come neare ✚ mat 24 ye therfore wyſe watch prayer thynges hauynge continual loue towarde ech amonge yourſelues proue 10 b loue couereth multitude ſynnes hebr 13 harbarous towarde ech wythout grudgyng 2 cor 8 euery one miniſtrynge grace vnto another hath receaued theſame good ſtewardes manyfolde grace god ie •• 23 • yf ony man ſpeaketh let hym ſpeake wordes god rom 12 byf ony man miniſtreth let done power whych god doth miniſtre al thinges god maye prayſed thorowe ieſus chriſt ⊢ vnto whome glorye empyre euer euer amen dearly beloued let ſtraūge vnto luce 12 f 1 cor 3 c 1 petri 1 b heate whych happeneth ye tryeng though ſome ſtraunge thynge happen vnto takynge parte wyth paſſions chriſt • tim 2 b reioyce beynge mery ye alſo may reioyce ye reuelacion hys glorye marc 5 yf ye reuyled name chriſte ye ſhalbe happye concernynge vnto honoure glorye power god ye ſprete hys doth reſt vpon 1 petri 2 c 3 c let nomā ſuffre manſlayer thefe curſed ſpeaker deſyrer men goodes yf ſuffre chriſtē man let hym aſhamed let hym prayſe god thys behalfe iere 25 40 b ezech 9 • tyme iudgemente begynne ye houſe god yf begynne fyrſt v ſhalbe ende luce 10 • yt beleue goſpell god pro 11 yf
